entries.title: Lost in Translation
entries.description:
After your plane crashes you end up in a strange town. Can you figure out their strange language starting with no knowledge about it? No translations, no dictionaries, just people talking.

Carefully read what the villagers are saying. Look for repeating words and how and when they are used.

It's recommended you use a noteblock of some sort to write down the words you learn along the way.

Played with arrow keys, and spacebar/enter.

![lit1.PNG](///raw/d21/z/28aec.png)

![lit2.png](///raw/d21/z/28aee.png)

![lit3.png](///raw/d21/z/28af0.png)

entries.title: World Collector
entries.description:
![ld45_screen.png](///raw/385/z/26aef.png)

Start with nothing. Collect the world. Find a friend.

**Some Mac users have an issue with the drag & drop which prevents the game being played entirely. I'm looking into this. Appologies!**

**CONTROLS**

* DRAG & DROP worlds
* CLICK to delete a world
* F to fullscreen

* [twitch.tv/joecreates](http://twitch.tv/joecreates)

entries.title: MINUTES TO SHIP
entries.description:
## Hey intern. Your art is...better than nothing. You're hired!

**Get hired to a game studio in disarray. They need assets for their upcoming titles.
First batch is due in...about 11 minutes.**

**Some parts of the game require a microphone.**
(though a mic isn't required to play through)

Play here: https://hydezeke.itch.io/minute-to-ship

Features 5 games with writing/drawings/recordings by you.

Keyboard/mouse/spacebar/*press O to skip games if they break*.

Good luck!

*Game by me (Michael Savage-Benoist) and my dad (Tom Benoist).*

entries.title: Unlock Everything
entries.description:
DDRKirby(ISQ) proudly presents **"Unlock Everything"** -- a love letter to Mega Man, with a twist!

**Start with nothing** in this 2D platformer...not even the main menu, or the ability to move!

![gif_title.gif](///raw/b57/z/269d1.gif)

Take control of Libra on a quest to rediscover not only her powers but also her memory!

![gif_3.gif](///raw/b57/z/26a90.gif)

I've packed as much as I possibly could into this game...

![gif_2.gif](///raw/b57/z/26a8a.gif)

**WebGL (Post-Compo, v2.00 -- see notes): https://ddrkirby.com/games/unlock-everything/unlock-everything.html**

**Windows (Post-Compo, v2.00): https://ddrkirby.com/games/unlock-everything/unlock_everything_v2_00_win.zip**

**OSX (Post-Compo, v2.00): https://ddrkirby.com/games/unlock-everything/unlock_everything_v2_00_osx.zip**

**Linux (Post-Compo, v2.00): https://ddrkirby.com/games/unlock-everything/unlock_everything_v2_00_linux.zip**

**Compo Version (v1.11 -- all platforms): https://ddrkirby.com/games/unlock-everything/compo-version/unlock-everything-compo.html**

**Soundtrack download: https://ddrkirbyisq.bandcamp.com/album/unlock-everything-original-soundtrack**

**Please note:** We've had reports that the WebGL build occasionally softlocks with a black screen after death.  I've put in some logic to hopefully fix this, but you may want to stick to the downloadable builds as a precaution.  There's also an intermittent loading issue with Godot WebGL builds -- if it fails to start properly, try refreshing one or more times and retrying, or (better yet) use one of the downloadable builds.  Sorry about that!

```
Controls:
Move - Left Arrow and Right Arrow
Jump - Shift, X, or Up Arrow
Shoot - Z or Spacebar
Confirm - [Jump] or [Shoot]

Controls (alternate):
Move - A and D
Jump - Shift or Period
Shoot - Slash or Spacebar
Confirm - [Jump] or [Shoot]
```

(Gamepad/AZERTY theoretically also supported, but untested)

=====

Credits:

- Some characters referenced from Capcom's "Mega Man" series
- Level 3 stage theme remixed from "Metal Man Stage" [Mega Man 2]
- Credits theme remixed from "Pass Word" [Mega Man 2]

In case you're wondering, these are all derivative works in line with [the rules](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/rules).  None of the actual source assets were directly utilized in the creation of the derivatives.

**Known Issues:**

- (Sometimes) Issues with respawning that lead to a softlock black screen (WebGL only?)
- WebGL build sometimes fails to initialize
- A few enemy patterns don't line up as intended (not a big deal at all)
- Linux binary is missing the execute bit

=====

Changelog:

```
v2.00 (Post-Compo)
- Decreased the health of cannons from 10 to 6
- Decreased the health of the path-based enemies from 5 to 4
- Added a different "tink" sound effect when shooting invincible spike traps
- Implemented a terminal falling velocity limit
- Add commonly-suggested "You unlocked the door" joke for level 2
- Unlocks are now saved across game sessions
- Added a "Reset Game Data" option if you want to unlock everything again
- Added new "Time Attack" mode for speedrunners:
  Time Attack mode skips all cutscenes and popups and enables an in-game timer display
  The timer ticks on each physics frame and pauses on screen/level transitions
  The current set of splits and total time will be displayed after each level
- Added some "cheat codes" for speedrunners:
  Left + Right + Tab + 'T' on main menu unlocks Time Attack mode
  Left + Right + Tab + 'R' during Time Attack instantly exits to Time Attack menu

v1.11 (Compo)
- Switch binding for spacebar to be shoot instead of jump
- Slight tweaks to a screen in level 3

v1.10
- Added additional keybindings
- Fix dropped shoot inputs before picking up autofire

v1.09
- Fixed a silly export mistake that caused level 2 to start on the wrong screen

v1.08
- Added some additional checks to try and prevent soft-locks
- Adjust a screen in level 1 so you won't die immediately if you hold right on respawn
- Fixed a bug where you can trigger the level 1 end multiple times
- Delete a few pixels from the boss doors to indicate they're unlocked
- Fix rare single pixel camera hitch on screen transition
- Fix very minor tileset issues

v1.07
- Added some checks to try and prevent a rare soft-lock on death

v1.06
- Fixed a bug where sawblades would keep moving during transitions (and kill you)
- Disable printing to stdout and stderr
- Slightly adjusted metal blade speeds

v1.05
- Added song titles and liner notes to the jukebox screen
- Use highlighted text to indicate what song is playing on the jukebox screen
- Very minor tweak to one screen in level 3
- Toggled a setting that should make pixels slightly sharper on retina screens

v1.04
- Added a fix for screen transitions sometimes not triggering during screen shakes

v1.03
- Rebalanced the Metal Man fight a bunch to make it more forgiving but still
  not just brute-forcable

v1.02
- Fixed a funny bug where Metal Man's spinning blade could be left over

v1.01
- Removed a duplicated object that accidentally got left in
- Added version number in the corner of the menu screen
- Fixed being able to spam certain menu commands

v1.00
- First release!
```

entries.title: Terra Nil - Reclaim the Wasteland
entries.description:
Terra Nil is a relaxing city builder about ecosystem reconstruction.

My take on the theme was that starting with nothing was just a barren wasteland that you need to rejuvenate.

The 6 buildings I managed to create form a nice circular dependency so expansion is always a little difficult.

![1QRHYqBygf.gif](///raw/4a2/21/z/267f0.gif)

Some protips :P 
- Start with a turbine
- Order of building matters (e.g. you need to place the greenhouse after the scrubber)
- Pay attention to the overlays and tooltips
- The procedural generation can technically create an unwinnable state, but I don't think this should happen and if it does, just restart

 ![HZ3ILJSZEU.gif](///raw/4a2/21/z/267f5.gif)

Controls:
- Left click to select
- Right click to deselect
- Mouse wheel to zoom
- Arrows to pan
- R to rotate
- Esc to bring up the menu

![Unity_K4vA4hOyLd.png](///raw/4a2/21/z/267f4.png)

Tools:
- Unity
- PyxelEdit
- WolframTones
- Audacity
- Bfxr
- JuiceFX

entries.title: Fanfare Fantasy
entries.description:
![fanfare_fantasy_logox2.png](///raw/3a1/42/z/27822.png)


You got thrown out of the Music Club for not being funky enough. Starting from the bottom, gather a crew of musicians around the town and show them who's the boss in this fanfare management/rhythm game.

Recruit various musicians for your fanfare by impressing them with your conducting skills in a fun rhythm game !

- A dynamic soundtrack that evolves with your fanfare
- Many sprites
- Randomly generated musicians
- One epic boss fight
- 3 levels of difficulty, from Beginner to Pro
- Incredible 320p cutscenes
- A metric ton of spaghetti code

entries.title: Sabotage
entries.description:
![banner.png](///raw/bb2/1/z/28b20.png)
## [Play now](https://deepnight.net/games/sabotage/) (web version)
## [Download](http://deepnight.net/files/games/ld45-sabotage/sabotage.win.zip) (Windows)



# About

_You are Colonel Jean-François Hubert from the French army. As the most badass colonel ever, you take on your missions naked, without any weapon._

_Improvise, adapt, overcome._

# CREDITS

Music by David Whittaker, from the game _Leatherneck_ (Atari ST version)

# HOW TO PLAY

You start with absolutely nothing: use the environment to kill enemies. 

Play using keyboard or a compatible game pad (Xbox controller recommended).

## Keyboard

    ARROWS – move around
    F – grab an enemy or an item
    SPACE – punch (if your hands are free)
    SPACE – use item in your hands
    R – restart current level

## Gamepad (xbox controller)

    LEFT STICK – move around
    A – grab an enemy or an item
    X – punch (if your hands are free)
    X – use item in your hands
    SELECT – restart current level

entries.title: Words With Foes: Quest for the Lexinomicon
entries.description:
![WWF_banner_transparent.png](///raw/c23/2/z/27e85.png)

Fight monsters, get loot, and defeat the biggest bosses around!

Type scrabble-approved words in order to defeat monsters and gain their letters. But watch out! They'll attack you back, making you lose those precious letters.

Keep your tray full, in this endless typing expedition into the depths!


NOTES:
- You can attack with any single letter, so you can dump useless letters for the cost of getting hit.
- You progress to tougher bosses as you collect letters.
- Once you defeat the final bosses and the credits, you can play endlessly.
- ESC key quits the game instantly.

For a SPECIAL CHALLENGE, see how many tiles you can have in your deck when you reach the end of the credits.

![WWF_screen1.jpg](///raw/c23/2/z/27eab.jpg)
![WWF_screen3_RDescription.jpg](///raw/c23/2/z/27ec0.jpg)


CREDITS:

Writing - @hyperscope

Sound - @julianbeutel

Code - @KaiClavier

Art - @graebor

Code - @MattWoelk

entries.title: lotor
entries.description:
![ld45-6ccc.gif](///raw/916/z/269db.gif)

there is no level. or is there?

start with nothing, build a stage, and get to the end. but what are you even placing?


**== controls ==**

**escape** to pause

### editing
> **click** to place objects  
> **enter/space** to begin playing

### playing
> **wasd/arrow keys** to move  
> **w/up/space** to jump  
> **r** to reset  


you start with 3 retries. if you cannot beat a level, hit escape and click "retry level"  
you lose when you run out of retries. see how far you can get! 

------

entries.title: Nothing
entries.description:
This is my first Ludum Dare I decided to keep things as simple as possible. Here is my game "NOTHING" a short platformer where you start with nothing. Including controls.

About 10 - 15 minutes to complete. Emphasis on humor and artstyle. 


UPDATE: Added some post jam versions - obviously for a true judgement please only make scores on the original, however the new downloads offer an easier version with the stomping machine things not killing you if you walk into the side of them, as well as some minor bug fixes and clarifying some glaring issues I hadn't noticed in both versions of the post jam files.

I still need to find whats causing the notorious elevator glitch - it's on the list. And after finding out people are mad enough to collect all the upgrades I'll be working on an alertnate ending.

**HTML5 Version now available** However **It uses post jam fixes** please judge the original exe if possible

Thanks for everyones positive responses so far, I genuinely appreciate it.


screenshot:
https://i.imgur.com/GSn5yTW.gif

Everything except the music was made by myself.
The music however is from:

8bittunes8pack - Twitter/Tumblr/Gmail - thecactusbear
and: The Girl From Ipanema (found here at: www.youtube.com/watch?v=IG77RgUwq8c)

entries.title: Soulbound
entries.description:
![Soulbound-Cover.png](///raw/e74/82/z/2843f.png)
![Screen 3.PNG](///raw/693/2/z/28383.png)
![Game Gif.gif](///raw/693/2/z/2903b.gif)

Soulbound is a roguelike top-down shooter in a dark, metaphysical setting. Starting with nothing and as nothing, you select from 4 playable spirits to fight your way through purgatory. Move your soul with WASD and aim projectiles with the mouse. Attacks are fired along a timeline, which can be used to rearrange new projectiles to create unique attack combinations. With original artwork and music composed by Team Ghost members Skawly and Conduit, Soulbound leaves the player with an eerie atmosphere in an otherworldly realm.

Move: WASD
Aim Projectiles: Mouse
Interact: Left Click

Through the passage of time, your attacks will be initiated.
You can rearrange attacks along the attack line by clicking and dragging them.
Along your journey, you will find items that grant you new attacks and abilities.
You can equip a new item by placing it in your inventory to the right.
Or cast them aside to the bottom right. Take note, discarded items cannot be retrieved.




Ghost in the Toast: Avery Ruth (programmer, pixel artist) | Kelly McDermott (digital artist, graphic designer) | Tyler Byers (music and sound design)

entries.title: 0 to 100
entries.description:
sadly my team mate got sick right before the jam, so here is my first solo entry:

## Show of your math skills in this fast paced dungeon crawler

In 0 to 100 you fight numbers and other mathematical operators. 

Make them join your party, if they increase your score and chase them away otherwise.

![balls.gif](///raw/a6f/31/z/26101.gif)

Battles take place in short minigames that test your skills with the mouse and your mind.

**The goal? Reaching 100 of course!**

![zero2.gif](///raw/a6f/31/z/260d8.gif)

So, what are you waiting for? I'm looking forward to your feedback!

Have fun! *~Moonrise*

entries.title: S.W.N
entries.description:
![ld45-day-1.gif](///raw/6c4/1/z/260fe.gif)
**S.W.N** is a platformer with a **level editor** where you start as a total zero, not even able to jump. Touch other numbers, gain and spend their powers to perform normal platforming actions. Be mindful, as performing a jump or dash reduces your number until you're back at zero. Touch flag to win!

As mentioned, the game comes with a level editor. Literally start with nothing and build your own cool level. I'd love to see what you come up with so if you make a level, **please share it!** You should find your created level in the folder **\AppData\Local\LD45_SWN** under the name "saved_room.sav".

I suggest playing the tutorial first to get a grasp of the mechanics before getting into the editor.

:rotating_light: **Post Jam Update 1: Checkpoint Added!**

-

:rotating_light:**User created levels** (replace the saved_room.sav file)

By @herman-chau 

https://www.dropbox.com/s/ell83x8lt723ivz/saved_room.sav?dl=0
https://www.dropbox.com/s/8rp3ashmo85y00g/two.sav?dl=0


### Controls Keyboard (You can play with gamepad too)
 
**Platforming**

Move: WASD 

Jump: Space or (J) 

Dash (8 directions): (K)

**Level Editor** (Mouse only)

Select and place objects :L-click

Remove objects: R-click

Placed objects can be dragged around.

entries.title: Nothing to Say
entries.description:
![dog shorter.gif](///raw/a93/1/z/279f2.gif)

**You're on a date with a cute girl, but you're feeling tongue-tied...** Can you puzzle out how to confess your feelings?

In this dating sim, your dialogue options are limited by what letters you've unlocked. Make note of what you'd like to say - as you explore the conversation with Zoe, you earn hearts you can use to unlock more letters.

**Play in your browser, including mobile, [here](https://celia14.itch.io/nothing-to-say).**

An unofficial sequel to [Nod](http://ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-26/?action=preview&uid=7352) from LD26.

- UI and art by [Rose](https://ldjam.com/users/rose).
- Code and writing by [celia14](https://ldjam.com/users/celia14).
- Made with [Ink](https://www.inklestudios.com/ink/).

entries.title: Ammodillo
entries.description:
![banner_7.png](///raw/aba/3/z/28e55.png)

# A bullet hell where you start with no bullets.

The king seeks a worthy opponent. Play as Gunther, an aspiring gladiator, and fight your way through his trials to prove your worth to the kingdom.

Victory won't be easy, of course. Due to a clerical error, all combatants *except you* were provided weapons. You'll have to do your best with just your wit and armadillo-like reflexes.

![ezgif.com-optimize_lossy.gif](///raw/aba/3/z/28e53.gif)

## Controls
![controls.png](///raw/aba/3/z/26b9d.png)

## About

I used the following tools:

- **Programming**: Python, Pygame, Pyinstaller, Pyracy library
- **Art**: Paint.NET
- **Music**: Sibelius
- **SFX**: SFXR and Audacity

entries.title: Palely
entries.description:
Atmospheric watercolor game in a moebius-esque world.
![intro.gif](///raw/b1b/91/z/28d20.gif)

Search for letters to make words and create objects.
![intro02.gif](///raw/b1b/91/z/28d39.gif)

But you cannot undo objects you haven't learned
![intro03.gif](///raw/b1b/91/z/28d3c.gif)

Have FUN
![intro04.gif](///raw/b1b/91/z/28d3f.gif)

# <!> This game requires a decent GPU to run ! <!>

## Minimum recommended GPU : Nvidia Geforce GTX 5xx
### Palely will also start in Vulkan if available. (On Windows)

Our technique and artstyle requires a lot of GPU load, like many other games out there. Don't try running it on a toaster ! Thank you !

# Controls

## Mouse/Keyboard :
- WASD/ZQSD : Movements
- Mouse : Camera movements
- Left Click : Pick up
- Right Click (Short) : Throw
- Right Click (Hold) : Destroy

## Controller (X360/One) :
- Left Stick : Movements
- Right Stick : Camera movements
- Right Trigger : Pick up
- Left Trigger (Short) : Throw
- Left Trigger (Hold) : Destroy

entries.title: Draw Your Own Adventure!
entries.description:
![gif2.gif](///raw/a20/d/z/28865.gif)




Hey kid! Get your tablet out! Or prepare your mouse. Because you are about to embark on a magical adventure in the land of your imagination! But don't worry, you will not be alone. Narrator Ben would guide you in your journey. So what are you waiting for, kid? Press start and get ready to draw your adventure from scratch.




![s4.png](///raw/a20/d/z/2886b.png)

entries.title: Island of the Coconut Spirit
entries.description:
You are the Coconut Spirit. You have awoken after a thousand year slumber to find your home has sunk beneath the ocean.

Bring glory back to your island. Raise the land. Plant trees. Build homes for natives. Have them worship you and build great things in your name!

entries.title: There was something here
entries.description:
There is nothing here!
There used to be something here!
This won't do!

I must rip open the void
![thumbnail_therewassomethinghere.png](///raw/af9/a/z/26287.png)

**What is this?**

This game was made in 48 hours for Ludum Dare 45. It is an idle game about rebuilding the world from scratch. This game is a sequel to another game I made: there is nothing here. (links on the itch page)

**Controls**

This game can be played only by clicking/tapping things, but later you will also be able to move with WASD/arrow keys or interact with spacebar. This game is mobile-compatible!

**GMS2 Source code is available on the itch page**

**Due to time constraints, some of the music at the end was taken from "there is nothing here", therefore I have chosen not to be rated in audio**

entries.title: The Dolphin of Sooth
entries.description:
**HOW TO PLAY:**
- Arrow keys to move
- Z to interact
- X to run (only in Post JAM version)

**The game might close itself at some point. It's normal behaviour, just reopen the game.**

Every story has a starting line.

"Once upon a time",  "In the beginning",  "Long time ago"...

This story has no start.

It has nothing to begin with.

The story, like everyone of us, is just here, waiting for someone to follow the line.

![dolphin2.gif](///raw/1a6/1/z/27ecd.gif)

This is my submission to the Ludum Dare 45, first time doing a story-driven game. 
I hope you like it!

entries.title: Flubby Farm
entries.description:
![Snap 2019-10-07 at 23.27.56.png](///raw/512/12/z/27e89.png)

You find yourself in an underwater seascape, starting with nothing but a hand full of cards. They have strange creatures called "Flubbies" on them. Play the cards to create a Flubby.

Likewise, the Flubby starts with nothing - it can't swim very well, has no mouth, no shell, no Flubby-Friends. With more cards you can change that! Grow your Flubbies to their full potential and create your Flubby Farm!

Beware though, as you are not alone with your Flubbies... A rivaling swarm of aggressive Gronkas is already on their way! How long can you maintain your Flubby Farm against the ever-growing Gronka group?


## Controls

* Drag cards with the left mouse button onto the screen.
* Drag cards back into your hand or right click while dragging if you change your mind.


## Credits

*Flubby Farm was made withing two days for Ludum Dare 45.*

**Jonas Tyroller** - Programming, Balancing, Game Design

**Timo Falcke** - Character Art, Animation, Game Design

**Caspar Schirdewahn** - Programming, UI, Game Design

**Yannick Pawils** - Environment Art, Sound Design, Music, VFX, Game Design

-------------------------------------------------

**Updates**
*2019/10/11 - fixed bug that overwrites highscore with lower score*

### *Thank you for playing!!!*

entries.title: LEGION
entries.description:
Somewhere in the depths of a high-security base, a 4th dimensional being escapes and takes control of the nearest body. It isn't enough - it wants more.

Speed your way through the base collecting bodies. 
Dodge bullets with inhuman reflexes.
If you get hit, a body will drop, but you have plenty to spare.

![legion gif.gif](///raw/61d/72/z/2686e.gif)

The concept of an incorporeal being who collects bodies was intended to tie in with the theme of 'start with nothing', although it's a bit shaky I know.

The game is currently Windows only, but I plan to port a html5 browser version after I fix a couple bugs.

The game will restart if you die, and at the moment is score-based. If you have fun please post your best score in the comments.


This game was created in Gamemaker Studio 1.4.

I have included the project folder to the game.

Software used:

- Gamemaker Studio 1.4
- Beepbox (sounds and music)
- GraphicsGale (sprites)
- paint.net (additional sprites)

This game was created by Drasnus/CrunchyKingCobra for Ludum Dare 45.

Please do not use the assets for unrelated projects or commercial reasons.

Please feel free to use the project for learning or for creating derivative non-commercial projects.

entries.title: Orudo Taima
entries.description:
*Yagijima is a forsaken island. Everyone except one person; an elderly man, has fled. He has been stubborn and doesn't want to abandon his home and life there.*

Guide the old man through levels to gather materials to fix the boat. 
Every material is a weapon of its own.
Bring materials to the truck to bring them back home.
Find maps to unlock new areas.

**CONTROLS**

Move and jump : WASD or Arrows.
Attack : Space
Item special attack : CTRL.
Interact : E

Controller is supported.

**ABOUT**


Made in 72h by Thomas Olsson and Gutty Kreum.

Special thanks to Akane Kawai Olsson and Skeleton Crew Studio.

Twitter : https://twitter.com/VegaMukiwa and https://twitter.com/GuttyKreum

entries.title: SOMtHINGa from NoThINGa
entries.description:
![title_full_alpha.png](///raw/dd3/z/265bf.png)

Use fission and fusion to make SOMtHINGa from NoThINGa.

Links
* **HTML5(WebGL)**: [dashingstrike.com/LudumDare/LD45](http://www.dashingstrike.com/LudumDare/LD45/#D=COMPO) **Phone/Touch-friendly!**
* **Source Code**: [Jimbly/LD45-somethinga-from-nothinga](https://github.com/Jimbly/LD45-somethinga-from-nothinga)

Simple arithmetic becomes incredibly interesting when constrained by space!  Everything should be self-explanatory, or described in the tutorial/hints.  You can safely go back to previous levels or look ahead without losing your progress.

Screenshots:

![ss1.png](///raw/dd3/z/265a4.png)

![ss2.png](///raw/dd3/z/265a6.png)

![ss3.png](///raw/dd3/z/265a7.png)

![ss5.png](///raw/dd3/z/266be.png)

There's a secret "bonus level" if you beat all other levels.  I have, after the compo ended, verified that it is, in fact, solvable, though I wasn't sure at the time of adding it =).

My take on the theme is incredibly literal, perhaps adding an implied pair of quotes around "nothing".  I learned that there is a very limited set of words that can be crafted using the periodic table, and very few languages' word for "nothing" fit that, so I had to get a bit creative.

--

***Development Notes***

Tools Used
* Custom Engine: [GLOV.js](https://github.com/Jimbly/glovjs)
* Mtn Dew
* Photoshop
* Bosca Ceoil
* Element colors from [CPK Coloring](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CPK_coloring)
* Fonts: [Shadows Into Light](https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Shadows+Into+Light), [Oswald](https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Oswald), [Palanquin](https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Palanquin)

This Ludum Dare I had a simple idea, and had a completely functional prototype [about 3 hours after the competition started](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/45/$168529/ive-got-a-game).  Before implementing it, I thought it would be too simplistic, and planned on allowing for varying pipe sizes in each direction to get 1:2 or 1:3 ratios instead of just 1:1, but it turned out that it was already a bit tricky to see what was going on, and amazingly more interesting and challenging than I thought it would be, given how simple the core idea was, so I left it alone, and just spent lots of time on polish, and even got to sound and music! 

Post-compo bug fixes
* Fixed one of the hints being shown on the level after where it was useful

entries.title: Ultra Quest
entries.description:
## This is a rather short game

Rumors are spreading about treasure unimaginable. Everyone is too afraid to enter the dragon's domain... that is, everybody except for you of course! Unfortunately, you didn't prepare for this and brought nothing with you. Maybe we can use the environment to our benefit.

## Controls:

W A S D: Walking

Spacebar: Jump

F: Interact.
______________________________________________

Are you beefy enough to defeat some average and mostly harmless enemies? How about a queen of pure evil with minimal battle skills? I'm sure the dragon has been training his whole life to fight someone. That's a thing dragons do, right?



![Site_1.png](///raw/b02/2/z/26572.png)

![Site_2.png](///raw/b02/2/z/26573.png)

![Site_3.png](///raw/b02/2/z/26574.png)



All comments are greatly appreciated! If you have any feedback at all, I would love to hear it.

### I've fixed the softlock, though i'll keep it separate from my initial submission.

entries.title: Tabula Rasa
entries.description:
A simple but challenging platformer with photo-based "point 'n' click" -segments.

![Tabula Rasa 2.jpg](///raw/e4c/2/z/26968.jpg)

#### ♦ CONTROLS: ♦
```
Arrows: MOVE ♦
Space : BOOST

R: Reset (counts as death)
Q: Quit

Enter/L.Mouse: Advance the story segments
```


Your goal is to gather all the shards and return them to the mask.

Some players may need a little adjusting to the unusual control-scheme of the game. 

![cut4.gif](///raw/e4c/2/z/29504.gif)

You'll be better off by TAPPING the keys, instead of holding them.

Also by pressing down you can both fall down faster, and slow down your momentum when knocking upwards from the ground.

It gets a lot easier if you get the hang of it. :)

![28f59.gif](///raw/e4c/2/z/29509.gif)

Hope you like it!

----

Software I utilized to develop this game:

OS: [Ubuntu-Studio](https://ubuntustudio.org/) / [lubuntu](https://lubuntu.net/) & [Android](https://www.android.com/)

Development: [Clickteam/Multimedia Fusion 2.5](https://www.clickteam.com/clickteam-fusion-2-5) (using [Wine](https://www.winehq.org/))

Graphics: [GIMP](https://www.gimp.org/)

Sound & Music: [Audacity](https://www.audacityteam.org/),  [SooperLooper](http://essej.net/sooperlooper/), [Calf-Plugins](https://calf-studio-gear.org/) (Ubuntu) / [Loopify-BETA](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.zuidsoft.looper&hl=fi), [Voice Recorder](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.media.bestrecorder.audiorecorder&hl=en_US) (Android), [Leshy SFMaker](https://www.leshylabs.com/apps/sfMaker/) (Browser)

----

And here's most of the Hardware/Equipment that helped in bringing this project to life:

![Equipment.png](///raw/e4c/2/z/298cb.png)

----
[Elysia Griffin](https://ldjam.com/users/elysiagriffin/) and [Tech Valley Game Space](http://techvalleygamespace.com/) were cool and featured my game in their respective streams.



Here are the links with timestamps:

#### [Intro and some gameplay with commentary](https://www.twitch.tv/videos/494941552?t=3h27m36s) by ElysiaGriffin (10 minutes)

#### [Full playthrough and commentary](https://tinyurl.com/rlvpkao) by TechValleyGameSpace (40 minutes)

entries.title: Paint Rush
entries.description:
![cover_paintrush.jpg](///raw/db1/z/28c07.jpg)

## Welcome in Paint Rush.


### In this homage to good ol' arcade games, you'll start with nothing, and will struggle understanding where you stand or where to go.
Crush devilish ennemies against grounds and doors to paint your way through the game, and understand the contours of this world that seems hidden to your eyes!
Jump, climb walls, hit and explode your opponents with powerful finish moves to stay alive until the end.

Be brave, warriors!
    
    
.

:video_game: __Pad Controls:__ :video_game: 

* Move : Left Stick
* Jump : A
* Hit : X
* Grab : Y
* Orient finish : Left Stick
* Finish Move : X/Y

.

:mouse_three_button: __Keyboard Controls:__ :mouse_three_button: 

* Move : Q/D
* Jump : SPACE
* Hit : Mouse Left Click
* Grab : Mouse Right Click
* Orient finish move : Mouse Cursor
* Finish Move : Left or Right Click

.

_This game is brought to you by:_ 

* _Louis Denizet ( [DenizetLouis](https://twitter.com/DenizetLouis) ) - Game Design/Code_
* _Romain Rope ( [RomainRope](https://twitter.com/RomainRope) ) - Sound Design/Music/Pixel Art support_

entries.title: Armistice
entries.description:
Captain, your mandatory assistance is requested to quash the rebels. Build your ship and own the skies. Command will provide you with whatever parts it deems necessary to complete the mission. You'll start with nothing and assemble yourself. **All parts are expendable but the cockpit.** You've been warned.

**How to beat the first puzzle:**
!> Put the thruster above the cockpit so that your cockpit doesn't get destroyed

-------

Controls:

Build mode:  
(**Compo edition**): Select your part from the right. Click `place` and drag it to the desired spot (or click the spot directly if it's empty). Click an occupied spot and then use the remove or rotate buttons at the top left as desired. Once your ship has a cockpit, click `to combat` to proceed to the battle!  
(**Post-Compo edition**): Select your part from the right. Left click an open slot to place it. Left click an occupied slot to rotate the part, or right click to remove it. Once your ship has a cockpit, click `to combat` to proceed to the battle!


Combat mode:
- WASD: strafe
- QE: rotate
- Space: attack

------

Tips:
- This game is half physics sandbox, half puzzle, and half arcade. Different levels exercise different halves and require different approaches.
- Every thruster only fires in one direction. Plan out your thrusters relative to the center of gravity for best control. For example: putting your forward thrusters along the center of mass will allow you to move forward without rotating.
- The only thrusters that can rotate are those that are facing sideways. Put these far from the center of mass for maximum effectiveness
- More parts means more mass. More mass means more thrusters required for the same acceleration!
- Don't be afraid to press the "give up" button! Sometimes all you need is a little tweak :wink:
- You got this! :smiley: 

------

Post Compo Changelog:
* Simplified ship builder - removed buttons, drag/drop and use left/right click instead
* Added particles for projectile hit effect
* Partially fixed UI scaling
* (**Post-Compo Easy Mode build only**) Modified the thrusters so that they can fire in any direction, giving much greater control over the ship's movement and greatly reducing the difficulty of the game's puzzles. Play this mode if you can't beat the normal mode!

![UI screen.png](///raw/169/z/28842.png)

![preview.png](///raw/169/z/28846.png)

entries.title: Barterin' Buckaroo
entries.description:
You're the rootin-est tootin-est cowboy known to Swamp Gulch... that is until you gambled away all your cowboy-ly possessions in a night of cards and drinking. 

Make your way through town. Reclaim your stuff. Become the cowboy you know you are.


Barterin' Buckaroo is a point and click puzzle game reminiscent of the point and clicks from the 1990s and early 2000s. Part logic, part absolute nonsense, we hope you enjoy this rootin' tootin' romp around the dusty town of Swamp Gultch and trading with its colorful cast of denizens.

![Screen Shot 2019-10-07 at 12.54.13 AM.png](///raw/7fc/61/z/26e14.png)![Screen Shot 2019-10-07 at 12.54.38 AM.png](///raw/7fc/61/z/26e15.png)

entries.title: Blank Slate
entries.description:
![ss1.png](///raw/ef3/f1/z/26845.png)A puzzle game of observation and hidden information. The data is in plain sight; you must learn how to see it. Acquire knowledge and ascend!

Headphones/Speakers are recommended -- there are some audio-only cues (like when you enter an incorrect code).

entries.title: Warp Trash Flotilla
entries.description:
![WarpTrashFlotilla_img0A.png](///raw/cc3/92/z/2727d.png)

### It's just not your day...

The steward on your space liner assured you that its warp core was perfectly safe and stable. They were wrong, and now you're stuck in a deep space debris cloud without a control console, a manoeuvring thruster, or indeed much of anything. Not to worry - time to take matters into your own hands and build your own warp-capable ship out of the flotsam. How hard can it be, anyway?

### Controls:

**Left-click** to crawl around on your "ship"

**Any key** to assign that key to nearby unbound components

**Ctrl-R** to restart

![WarpTrashFlotilla_img1.png](///raw/cc3/92/z/270e2.png)

entries.title: RGB Zero
entries.description:
**-- GAMEPLAY**

A puzzle platformer. You can only touch things that share a RBG color with you. You start black. You can touch nothing.

Try to pick as many coins as you can. The boss wants your coins.

You start with nothing: no coins, no colors, no collision.

---

**-- CONTROLS**

**Arrow keys** to **move**

**Z/X** to **jump**

**Enter** to **pause/menu** (restart game in this menu)

---

**-- BOSS**

You don't need to attack the boss, just evade his attacks. His HP decrases with each attack.

---

**-- BUG FIXES**

- Fixed a minor visual bug when getting hit by a shot.
- Fixed the boss doing 50 attacks even if you didn't collect 50 coins.

---

Mysterious experience in a no man's land filled with jolly creatures and intriguing characters. Damn i just don't want to spoil you ! The game is great, play it :) I made ALL the Assets in the JAM (not the music of course... :) )

entries.title: Trelet ~ The Land of Words
entries.description:
![result.gif](///raw/0d8/z/26116.gif)

## About the Game ##
*Trelet* is a puzzle-platformer in which you place letters onto others to form new words which act as platforms on your way to the goal.  

It was made for the Compo using these Tools:  
- [LÖVE](https://love2d.org/)​​ as the game's framework
- [LMMS](https://lmms.io/)​ and [Bosca Ceoil](https://boscaceoil.net/)​ for music
- [BFXR](https://www.bfxr.net/)​ ​for sound effects
- The Lua libraries [bump.lua](https://github.com/kikito/bump.lua)​, [classic.lua](https://github.com/rxi/classic)​, [easing.lua](https://github.com/EmmanuelOga/easing/blob/master/lib/easing.lua)​, and [lovebird.lua​](https://github.com/rxi/lovebird)

## Some Hints ##
- You can enter Edit Mode mid-jump
- There are a lot of short words
- Long words (5+ letters) give you extra letters

## How to Play ##
In *Trelet*, your goal is to reach the flag at the end of the level (yes, there's only one level, I didn't have enough time for more!) You do so by placing letters onto others to create new words that act as platforms to pave your way forward.

Keep in mind that only real words will work, and that all neighboring letters (read top-to-bottom or left-to-right) need to form ones!

Can you collect all nine Star Coins?

## Controls ##
### Platform Mode ###
**Move** - *Arrow Keys* or *WASD*  
**Jump** - *W*, *space*, or the *Up Arrow*  
**Reset** - *R*  
**Edit Mode** - *Enter*  

### Edit Mode ###
**Place Block** - *Left Click*  
**Change Selected Block** - *Mouse wheel*, *W/S*, or the *Up* and *Down Arrows*  
**Platform Mode** - *Enter*

entries.title: God of the Elements
entries.description:
![gote_banner.png](///raw/1fd/c/z/26d29.png)

God of the Elements is a mouse-only light puzzle game with relaxing atmosphere. You start as a god of a Barren Realm, match **Elements** and fully develop all your **Sectors**.

![gameplay.gif](///raw/1fd/c/z/26d21.gif)

https://youtu.be/eDRfQ7bI3B8


💻**HOW TO PLAY** 

- 🖱️ Drag & Drop Elements to Elements to combine (not all will combine)
- 🖱️ Drag & Drop  Elements to Sectors to advance
- ⌨️ (Optional) Press F12 to get all the Elements, if you feel stuck or want to mess around

There are **15 Elements** and **15 Sectors**. Can you find them all? Sometimes you might have to raze things down to advance..

Post-Mortem: https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/45/god-of-the-elements/post-mortem-god-of-the-elements-combo

**Theme:** "Start with nothing"

**Engine:** Unity (2019.1.9f1) C#

**Graphics:** Autodesk Maya 2019, Photoshop

**Audio:** Mouth & Zoom H1n, Audacity, FMOD, bfxr.net, audiotool.com

:bird: https://twitter.com/antti_koponen


**KNOWN PROBLEMS**

- WebGL Version: Mouse Drag & Drop refuses to work in some versions of Microsoft Edge. Use another browser or download the Windows version.


**FEEDBACK QUESTIONNAIRE** (Optional, but much appreciated!)
- What made you play the game in the first place?
- How would you describe the game to a friend with one sentence?
- What was the most memorable thing you encountered?
- What did you find lacking or would add in the game?

entries.title: Big Bang Trainee Program
entries.description:
![InGame.png](///raw/458/22/z/25f98.png)

# Welcome Candidate

Tired of your job?
Want to see ~~the galaxy~~  a completely new galaxy?

Why not join our prestigious Big Bang Trainee Program?
Plenty of benefits and a high degree of personal freedom all in a casual and relaxed environment.

Just sign the papers and of you go!

This job promises only the most epic of explosions.

![Recording.gif](///raw/458/22/z/25ff6.gif)

## Instructions
Push button, pull levers, press knobs.
All to balance the amount of matter in the right ratio.
But you have to do it fast enough or the total mass wont be sufficient.
If you don't follow the instructions the singularity will explode too early, we don't want that right?

Now stop reading this and start making big bangs already.

entries.title: Doodle Ball
entries.description:
You don’t start with nothing, but you start with just a tiny drop of ink left in your ink container. Draw lines to progress forward. The more distance you reach the more ink you will have available in your next run. While progressing make use of the power ups and try to use the rubber bands in your advantage. They might backfire! Oh, and avoid the inkblots. Sell your ink for a little boost at the start or unlock new balls with different behaviours.This was our first Ludum Dare. Even though we had some struggle finding a suitable game concept for the theme “start with nothing” we decided to go with our best idea after a good amount of uneventful brainstorming.![screenshot1.png](///raw/03f/82/z/2760b.png)
Edit: I want to make sure you know that you can draw while the ball is moving :D

entries.title: Fragmented Reality
entries.description:
### Embark on a journey through an unknown world. How did you get there? What are you doing there? Can you find out?

Fragmented Reality is a 2D story based platformer with puzzle elements.

### FEATURES
- An adaptive soundtrack - find 5 hidden music notes to get more instruments!
- A story that makes sense in some aspects
- Platforming!
- Puzzles!
- Puzzle Platforming!

### CONTROLS
- Arrow Keys / WASD: Move
- Space: Jump
- R (hold): Reset level

### SCREENSHOTS
![where.png](///raw/513/z/266a0.png)

![friendly.png](///raw/513/z/266ab.png)

![friendly.png](///raw/513/z/266bb.png)

### CHANGELOG
#### 1.0.0
- Initial Upload
- Probably added some bugs

#### 1.0.1
- Fixed a bug where pressing up would crash the game. Whoops

#### Every version after this was uploaded after the compo time. No content was added or altered, only bugfixes were applied.

#### 1.0.2
- Fixed a bug where music would not work correctly after one game
- You can now hold R to reset a level

#### 1.0.3
- Actually fixed the bug where music would not work correctly after one game
- Going out of view now shows an indicator of your position
- Reduced time you have to hold R to reset from 2 seconds to 1 second


#### IMPORTANT: I can't provide a HTML5 version this time because the game makes heavy use of Gamemaker Studio's audio sync group feature which is not supported on the HTML5 target platform. Sorry about that.

entries.title: Fairytiles
entries.description:
![009.png](///raw/686/02/z/27ed3.png)

# Fairytiles

Fairytiles is the love child of a "Choose your own Adventure" book :blue_book: and a game of Scrabble :a: -- choose your words wisely! Armed with only a handful of letter tiles, take a bold adventurer :dancer: through the journey of her lifetime!

#### Play in browser [here](http://kodobolt.com/games/2019_LD45_Fairytiles/)

## Features

- Start with nothing, end with... a cat :cat:? Dragons :dragon_face:?
- Complete with 120 creative chapters and 26 alphabetized achievements.

## How to play
- Scroll to go through the story
- Type to enter words
- BACKSPACE to correct
- ENTER to commit
- ESCAPE or DELETE to undo
- SPACE to shuffle (hold space for clearer hints).
- ? for help

![fairytiles_preview.gif](///raw/686/02/z/28295.gif)

## Thanks for playing! :thumbsup:

entries.title: Entanglement
entries.description:
![entanglement-title.png](///raw/4c1/91/z/26a3b.png)

**Synopsis**

In quantum physics, a particle and anti-particle can be created from nothing (sort of).

In this game, the goal is to cover every goal space with a pawn. You can create a pawn from nothing, but you'll have to create an anti-pawn too, which moves backwards and annihilates pawns that it touches! However, anti-pawns can also cover goal spaces.

Use the pawns and anti-pawns together to progress through the game and solve tricky puzzles!

![real1.png](///raw/4c1/91/z/26a59.png)

**Controls**

* *Mouse click*: Create pawn/antipawn pair
* *Arrow keys*: Move pawns
* *Z*: Undo last move
* *R*: Reset level
* *H*: Review all previous help text

![real4.png](///raw/4c1/91/z/26a7a.png)

**Tools used**

* *Graphics*: Aseprite
* *Game engine*: vanilla js + html5 canvas
* *Sound effects*: Pxtone Collage

![real2.png](///raw/4c1/91/z/26a5d.png)

Enjoy!

*[Post-submission change: fixed a bug where attempting to advance text by pressing a key rather than clicking would skip any remaining text boxes rather than moving to the next one.]*

entries.title: Bob
entries.description:
![logo.png](///raw/64d/z/27941.png)

### Bobbing on the surface of the sea isn't an easy lifestyle choice. Build a fancy raft, salvage the ocean's treasures, and attract beautiful mermaids!

# 🎮 [➡ PLAY BOB](http://www.mostlyoriginal.net/play-bob/) (HTML5)

![screen1.png](///raw/64d/z/283b9.png)

---

### :joystick: Controls/How To Play
* **WASD** or **CURSOR KEYS** for movement.
* **SPACE** or **SHIFT** to dive/pickup/drop/eat.
* Don't want music? Just drop the radio in the ocean!
* Pick up driftwood to **expand your raft**.
* **Dive down** where you see underwater silhouettes and salvage sunken treasure or other useful items.
* Being in the water **depletes your endurance**. **Rest on your raft** or have a **bite to eat** to regenerate your energy.
* Miss your wife cause you've been out at sea? No worries, build your raft big enough and surely you'll **attract a beautiful mermaid!**


---

entries.title: Ball of Duty: Special Drops
entries.description:
# Links
---

- ** [HTML5/WebGL](https://lando.systems/games/ld45-ballofduty) **
- ** [Desktop/Java](https://lando.systems/games/ld45-ballofduty/ld45-ballofduty.jar) **
- ** [Source](https://github.com/bploeckelman/LudumDare45) **

** This can push your graphics card pretty hard in the browser.  If you have trouble running on the web, please download the jar **

Create your own Pachinko empire in "Ball of Duty: Special Drops" 

Earn Money on your pachinko machine to upgrade your machine to earn more money to upgrade....

![ld45-ballofduty-gif-small.gif](///raw/103/z/286b8.gif)

# Controls:
---
- ** Left click ** on the buttons. 

![menu.png](///raw/503/z/282d4.png)
![graph.png](///raw/503/z/282e1.png)

# Game:
---

You'll earn money for each ball that goes through the machine, and extra money for hitting the objects.
Upgrade all aspects of the game from the art and sounds to cash multipliers and more objects to put into the machine.
- Pegs will just bounce the balls
- Bumpers bounce the balls back faster
- Spinners send the balls flying

General flow of the game
- Run the machine to get money
- Buy upgrades
- Edit the machine to increase the action and earn more money
- Repeat

![atari.png](///raw/503/z/282e8.png)
![flat.png](///raw/503/z/282d1.png)


# About the Team:
---

[LandoSystems](https://lando.systems) is a group of jammers from Madison, Wisconsin that varies in size from 2 to 12 people. This is the team's 20th Ludum Dare game!! :grinning:

![flashy.png](///raw/503/z/282e0.png)

- Brian Rossman

entries.title: Start with nothing
entries.description:
Game made for **Ludum Dare 45: Start with nothing.**

![Unity_2019-10-06_21-55-44.png](///raw/1b7/6/z/263ff.png)

**Play in your browser by clicking [here](https://rubyleehs.itch.io/startwithnothing)!**

**Controls: **

- Hold Left Mouse Button to drag

- Nothing else

**More info:**

- Your goal is to grasp "victory"

- BGM only plays when you have created a music-related word.

- Likewise, you can mute the BGM by creating a synonym to "silent"

- Bonus points if you figure out the minimum amount of words needed to win. How about losing?

- Update on 8/10/2019: Improved word detection - should be very accurate now. Now also ignores letters if they are overlapping/too close to each other.


**Credits:**

- Sprites: Half is from helpful voluteers from various Game-Dev discords; 

- BGM: [Entorevolution](http://acutic.net/ACAL-0007/) by AcuticNotes

You are Dr. Deckenstein's famously incredible cerebellum, and you've just escaped from out of a jar in Dr. Brainia's laboratory. Using your massive intellect (and literally nothing else), can you escape from Castle Brainia!  

INSTRUCTIONS

WASD (or arrows) to Move.  
SPACE to Jump.  
Left-Click / Left Control to Attack...once you are "armed".
Right-Click / Left Shift to Dash...when you have the "stomach" for it.

(Need to cheat?  SHIFT-B picks up the body part from the level and SHIFT-E exits the level.)

entries.title: Never Ending Entropy
entries.description:
#### Developed by [Infinia Entertainment](https://discord.gg/7DerY2B)
![Poster.png](///raw/76c/31/z/29c9a.png)



### Description:
A game where you start,  well... from nothing. What is nothing you ask? In true nothingness there's no space, no time, and most importantly - no Chaos.

You start as a small singularity, with yet no complex parts to yourself, but as you gather more and more components of reality, you gain various abilities with which you continue your journey, *gradually declining into disorder...*

The path may be difficult, but we encourage you to fight your way through to the truth!

### Controls:

*Movement:  WASD*

*Shooting: Hold Left Mouse Button*

*Aim: Cursor*

*Black-Hole: Click Right Mouse Button*

*Dialogue: Space/LMB/RMB* (Some dialogues are important, and you can only read them once!)

### Stats (Important!)

*Complexity:* Heath, Speed, Fire-Rate, Damage, Bullet Speed, Regen Rate, Black-Hole Recharge Rate are increased for every 100 complexity you gain!

*Stability:* You start with 100%, each time you die it decreases, if it reaches 0% game restarts!

### Screenshots:

![unknown.png](///raw/76c/31/z/29e31.png)

![unknown (1).png](///raw/76c/31/z/29e32.png)

![unknown (2).png](///raw/76c/31/z/29e33.png)

### Tools used:

Except fonts everything in-game was made by us. 

We used: Unity, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Premier Pro, Audacity, FL Studio, Git.


### Badass trailer:
https://youtu.be/IF2vFuDwVMw


### Who worked on the game?
*Stephan Dvoryanchikov (Codekoto) - Programmer, Boss and Enemy AI*

*Emir Akbashev (Anion-Z) - *VFX*, Programmer, Animator, Story*

*Timucin (Wolf-Neon) - 2D Artist, Audio Engineer, Level Design*

*Ilya (TheBlackAchilles)* - Additional Programmer, UI*


### Developer Comments:
Codekoto: "Some people think "Why do people do this to themselves, don't they want to have a weekend off?". Yeah we sure do, having fun with your friends while making a game, sleeping over and even cooking food. These are the experiences i will treasure in my life and Ludum Dare has been a great contribution to this. I am grateful to have such wonderful friends and i am happy to be able to spend this time with them doing what i love.

It wasn't easy, but the challenge is what i am here for, learning new things and improving oneself is what i consider being a core of a human being, and events such as this are very helpful. Compared to the last Ludum Dare, i realized that we have done much more in 2 days than we have done in 3 days last Jam, and every time, our projects are getting better, step by step we are going to achieve our dream of making games"

Anion_Z - "We had to sacrifice some parts of the game and the game feel overall to finish such huge project, even with 3 programmers it was hell of a task. Story came last so it may not be the best. But I'm very proud of ourselfs since we put our best effort into the project. I believe for a ludum dare game this is a huge success, I can definitely see our improvement in every aspect of game development, and this was our goal from the beginning!"
![221fe.png](///raw/0ea/31/z/240fd.png)



### Join our Infinia Entertainment discord server to talk with us and other members.

## [**Discord Server**](https://discord.gg/Jd3zBzT)

[![Discord-Logo-Color.png](///raw/0ea/31/z/24a03.png)](https://discord.gg/Jd3zBzT)

**Fixes:**

- [1.0.1] 
  - The door to the boss room opens properly instead of halfway
- [1.0.2] 
  - More lights are added for player to navigate easily
- [1.0.3] 
  - Game doesnt crash anymore after player's death
  - Enemie's size adjusted to it's complexity in a more appropriate manner
  - Player's speed increased, enemie's decreased
- [1.0.4]
  - Ending scene doesn't glitch anymore
  - Music in boss room isn't too loud, and overall sounds were balanced
- [1.0.5]
  - Better optimization, but still may lag on older devices, or when lots of enemies surround you
- [1.0.6]
  - We really wanted players to see the full game, so the overall difficulty of enemies was drastically decreased and 
    overall scene is not as dark for easier navigation, and visibility range was slightly increased!
- [1.0.7] 
  - Dialogues are easier to understand now, Fixed an exploit where the boss could be killed from range
- [1.0.8]
  - Fixed a bug where after finishing a dialogue it opened again, changed color of lights in one of the rooms to green so that player subconciously knows its a safe route 
 - Many people wanted harder boss so I just increased his lifes and size of bullet.
 - People really wanted particles when enemies die, so I added something simple, however, you dont have to take specifically these particles into account
 - Black-Hole was hard to see during boss fight, its now much easier to see it.
 - You can only listen to dialogue once, since its an action game and not a narrative (but story is pretty good too xD)

entries.title: Amnesiac Adventurer
entries.description:
![Capture0.PNG](///raw/1fe/1/z/2602f.png)

=====================================================

Our brave adventurer has made it to the final floor of the dungeon, and the Final Treasure is within his grasp... but wait, how did he get here in the first place? Help our forgetful friend recall how he cleared every previous dungeon floor, working backwards to jog his memory! One thing he's sure of, though... **He started each floor with no items whatsoever!**

=====================================================

Amnesiac Adventurer is a dungeon puzzle with a twist; start from the end, and make your way to the beginning! The only rule is that your adventurer started out the floor with no items! Think backwards in time, and try not to end up in impossible situations! Of course, you can take the easy way out... Maybe your Amnesiac Adventurer didn't open every single chest and kill every single zombie. But then... who did?

=====================================================

HOW TO PLAY
- WASD to move
- Use the Mouse to click buttons when prompted on the top left of the screen
- Click on Retry to refresh the level and start from the end
- You can only hold one of each type of item (helmet and sword)
- Your goal is to make your way to the entrance of the dungeon WITHOUT any items on you (helmet or sword)
- Interact with all possible objects to get the full score and good ending!

=====================================================

Gah, this was a hell of a project to do... I've made games solo before, and I've worked on Unity games before, but this is my first solo Unity project! Whiiiiich is why the polish is severely lacking, and the UI sucks even more than usual. Plus, I just bought Playmaker two days before the jam started, so suffice to say I was learning how things worked the hard way. Using a brand new engine for game jams is the best way to get caught up with what you need to know, in my opinion!

If time permits, I'd love to polish up this game, maybe add a few more levels, a few more objects to interact with... Consider this a short preview of what could be! Music, sound effects, particles, maybe a mobile build, the whole shebang. In the meantime, though, enjoy the game, and don't forget to give me your opinion so I know whose game to play next!

Also, if anyone is planning on recording a playthrough, I'm mighty curious how the game would look when you play the video backwards. Hope I got the backwards logic right!

=====================================================

Programs used:
- Unity (Playmaker)
- Magicavoxel

=====================================================

entries.title: little BEETLE bottle BATTLE
entries.description:
![2019-10-07--16-05-14.png](///raw/d51/a2/z/27af5.png)

Instructions:

Step 1: prepare your BOTTLE for BATTLE (click and drag to swap tiles and make matches).

Step 2: Recruit BEETLES for BATTLE (use the recruit menu on the left). You must recruit new BEETLES for each BATTLE since you START with...fewer resources than before. 

Step 3: Repeat

Credits:

- I'm AP Thomson! I made this game for Ludum Dare 45. Click on my website (http://apthomson.com) or observe me on the internet (https://twitter.com/bad_tetris)

- Fonts are by Chevy Ray and you can buy them here: https://chevyray.itch.io/pixel-fonts

Tips: 

Prepare your terrain carefully. BEETLES have a hard time moving across MOUNTAIN and, as dictated by scripture, no BEETLE may walk on WATER. 

The BEETLES you can recruit are: 

1. Farmers: Will gather FOOD from FIELD

2. Soldiers: Will engage in BEETLE BATTLE

3. Miners: Will gather ROCK from MOUNTAIN

4. Lumberjacks: Will gather WOOD from FOREST

5. Archers: Will engage in BEETLE BATTLE from a SAFE distance.

When you are relatively safe, prioritize gathering RESOURCE.

entries.title: All I Got For My Birthday Was This Terrible Curse
entries.description:
It's your 13th birthday and you have been cursed by a wizard! Every year, all of your belongings turn to ash and everyone forgets you exist. How awful!

Start as a homeless orphan and work your way up to the top, every single year! Maybe you'll be able to cure that ridiculous curse before it's too late...

* Shopping
* Slimes
* Practical Conversation Tips
* A Horse
* Several endings
* Nine achievements to score

Have fun, and don't die of exposure!

entries.title: The Defective Detective
entries.description:
![3.PNG](///raw/46f/72/z/26e44.png)
** You're a hard boiled, no-good, loose canon Detective trying to solve a murder at a local Motel. **


** You have NOTHING to go on so you'll have to make good use of all the tools **
** Like the Internet Browser & Police Database in your fully intractable PC.**

** Use your mastery of the Point-And-Click-Examine Skill**
** To solve and send the case-changing E-mail to your chief.**
![4.PNG](///raw/46f/72/z/26e37.png)
![1.gif](///raw/46f/72/z/26e2a.gif)
                              ** Just don't get to distracted with the intractable objects.. **
![4.gif](///raw/46f/72/z/26e2f.gif)

** Controls: **
> 1. WASD To move
> 2. Right Click to Go to Point & Click mode
> 3. Left Click to Interact with UI and Objects
> 4. F to pick items up, T to Throw them and G to drop them at your feet

** Good to Know: **
> 1. Have Low Expectations.
> 2. Look at the White board. Alot. It's useful.
> 3. Mute. The. Radio. It's only there because of a way overdone and far to long joke.
> 4. Yes this is my first ever game, and yes it was fun to make. And No I don't have high expectations.

** So all that awkwardly said and listed I hope you enjoy it at-least a little bit! **

**Changelog:**

Win & Mac & Linux: 
1. Added drop buttons to the Pickup prompt
2. Added arrow over your car to signal where to go to.

entries.title: Spirit Path
entries.description:
Hi all. This is my first jam and finally the first ever game that I've finished.

So let me present you Spirit Path, an adventure game, where you are playing as a flame spirit, liberating and guiding imprisoned flames, while trying to find the way to the door of eternity in the unsteady labyrinth of the void.



![Cover3 16-9.png](///raw/1be/81/z/29378.png)



In this game I used the "Start with nothing" theme as a concept of the map. You start the journey on a single block, and as you begin to move forward, the map, too, begins to reveal itself more and more to your eyes. 



![LilFlames1.gif](///raw/1be/81/z/28e58.gif)

There are overall 16 little flames waiting for you to free (they will follow you till you arive to a cresset). If you reach the end, an end screen will pop up, with your stats about the collectibles found. Tell me how many flames you've discovered!:) 

𝐍𝐨𝐭𝐞: The audio volume can be low compared to other games. You may try increasing browser volume if you can't hear sounds.




Programs used:
- Unity, (VS)
- MagicaVoxel
- FlStudio
- AudaCity

The game was fully made from scratch for the compo.


𝐁𝐮𝐭𝐭𝐨𝐧𝐬: I intentionally didn't add any instructions, but they should be pretty self-evident, I hope. 
If you are still feeling lost, try spamming "𝐞" key or 𝐬𝐩𝐚𝐜𝐞 at boxes.


ChangeLog:
- Update#1: The checkpoint bug is fixed! You can now respawn correctly.
- Update#2: Fixed the issues with ghost navigations (stucking in one place).
- 𝗣𝗼𝘀𝘁-𝗝𝗮𝗺 𝗨𝗽𝗱𝗮𝘁𝗲::
𝗔𝗱𝗱𝗲𝗱 𝗮 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗴𝗮𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗱𝗲 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗿𝗮𝗹 𝗺𝗮𝗽 𝗴𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻. 𝗡𝗼𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗼𝗼 𝘀𝗽𝗲𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝘁𝗵𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵, 𝗷𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗳𝘂𝗻.

entries.title: Calibal's Curse
entries.description:
![Calibals Curse Screen 2.png](///raw/68a/1/z/28368.png)

DEV NOTE: Please play 0.1.3, it's a post jam version BUT it addresses 2 typos that meant the music in stage 2 overlaps. It's frustrating as hell it slipped through, but no new code was really added save for a minor health tweak to some enemies, and fixes an additional glitch about overflowing weapon levels. THIS ALSO fixes an issue with some seeds crashing the game, softlocks where the game won't progress past a boss, and stat typos that meant Swords, Daggers, Spears and Axes weren't obtaining the right statistics. Enjoy~


SUMMARY:

Explore an uncharted world in this bizarre hybrid of Galaga and Minesweeper! Find treasures, upgrade your equipment and try to uncover the riddle behind Calibal's Curse! Everyone's stuff is missing!

CONTROLS

Arrow Keys - Move
C - Swap Weapon, or randomly generate seed on title screen
X - Search Adjacent Tiles (friendly tiles adjacent or ontop of you will show as green numbers, enemy tiles will show up as red)

Try to upgrade your equipment, find the boss and fight them to progress!


![Calibals Curse Screen 3.png](///raw/68a/1/z/28321.png)

NOTES:

Phew, this was a huge crunch to get this to a playable state. I BELIEVE this should run without any hitches or issues, but I definitely had to work incredibly hard and certain assets couldn't be finished properly (for example, the intro cutscene is missing music).

![Calibals Curse Screen 4.png](///raw/68a/1/z/2836e.png)

It's been a LONG time since I submitted something solo for Ludum Dare. I tend to try and aim to build as complete a game package as possible. So far, this runs without any bugs, and seems like a reasonably complete game esp. considering the time limit, I'm pretty proud of this lil thing. It definitely needs a lot more polish and a lot more love, but I'd love to get people's thoughts!

P.S: The dialogue is deliberately a shonky, just aiming for that "old unknown NES game" vibe, complete with mistranslations and weird grammar galore! 

![Calibals Curse Screen.png](///raw/68a/1/z/2831a.png)

If there are any crucially breaking bugs, lemme know and I'll try to get up a fix. The game runs fine to the end on GMS2 my side, so I'd like to ensure everyone can get a good go at it! Balance might be a bit buggered of course due to the nature of making a game in 72 hours. Hope you guys have fun :D.

entries.title: The Song of Calirum
entries.description:
**Environment**

You are a traveller passing by the Calirum Desert. One night, you found a merchant that invited you to play the Song of Calirum, the most famous card game on the entire Desert. The night is calm and you decide to give that stranger a chance. But be careful, the Calirish have a very strange sense of humour.

![the-merchant.png](///raw/8e5/c/z/28449.png)

**The Theme**

You start with nothing on a long journey of awareness. The player won't have any resource at the start but as time goes on he starts getting more and more resources to a point when they do more harm than help.

**Game Objective**

The objective of the game is to find a path and complete the challenges requested by this path. How do you find a path, you ask? Well, that is up to you to figure out.
![1st-ilustration-set.jpg](///raw/8e5/c/z/28018.jpg)


**Gameplay and General Rules**

This is a game of choices. The player is presented with an event and a series of possible choices. The player will pick the most advantageous option regarding his/her strategy. This is also a game about managing a finite pool of resources and we are not only talking about physical resources (like gold or food), but also about psychological resources (like sanity or charisma). 

In this representation of the board, you can see various game elements.
![ludum-UI.png](///raw/8e5/c/z/2802e.png)
A: the event
B: the choices: selecting these choices is the only action the player can do.
C: your capacity: these pebbles show you how much inventory space you have left.
D: your resources: you can see here all the resources you gathered in your adventure.
E: The rule book: if you have any doubt during the game.


Credits:
Programmer
@blizary
Artist
@pedro-rosa
Sound www.youtube.com/watch?v=rPK_QQuwKDI

I thought the theme of "start with nothing" described most games already, so I decided to take the theme very literally (as in you don't even have a character to start with).

entries.title: White Starts With Nothing
entries.description:
Game is played by the usual chess rules, but White start without any pieces. 

![screenshot.png](///raw/3f0/6/z/2614e.png)

Instead, each turn you drop one piece (starting with White King) on any empty square of white half of the board. Pawns can't be dropped on the first row. 

Dropping pieces is the only thing that you can do, because all other moves for both sides are made automatically by AI.

Goal is, naturally, for White to win, preferably fast.

There are several scenarios, differing by starting position and how dropped pieces are selected.

Based on https://github.com/douglasbagnall/p4wn chess engine.

Also, there is kind of post mortem about this game here: https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/45/white-starts-with-nothing/so-i-just-applied-ld-theme-to-chess

PS: 
1. If AI falls into infinite cycle of repeating moves, treat it as a draw.
2. If you want, you can add/change modes (i.e. starting position, pieces order and whether it is randomised) by editing "modes" variable at the beginning of display.js.

Update: ![screen-mobile.png](///raw/3f0/6/z/29933.png)
Post-compo version was rewritten completely. It supports undos, saves, playable on mobile. Gameplay is still the same so far, except AI is slightly tweaked to play more conservatively.

entries.title: Seedvilization
entries.description:
![avatar.jpg](///raw/30e/82/z/2787f.jpg)

# Start with Nothing.

In a world where humanity has collapsed, only ruins of a devastated
world are left.

Arid rocks, tempestuous winds and sterile goo have almost destroyed all
life on earth.

But a new cycle of life is beginning. Seed by seed, the most resistant
plants are reflourishing the land.

Help to create a new biosphere by building fragile and intricated
vegetal contraptions that will help the earth to blossom again.

# Gameplay

Drag and drop seeds and use their different  characteristics to construct awesome vegetal structures. 

Avoid obstacles and reach all fertile islands with your structures to bring life back on them.

entries.description:
![MB.jpg](///raw/35c/72/z/26308.jpg)
## What a mysterious box! Is it hiding something inside?

In this game you should **_try_** to open an odd box that contains some puzzles and ciphers inside. Perhaps, the box itself signifies mystic storytelling behind it. **__Start without any solutions__** and try to guess all the secrets. Enjoy it!

***Controls:***
- *Arrows←↑↓→*
- *Mouse Swipes*

![eJT4Po6di78.jpg](///raw/35c/72/z/26284.jpg)
![QkuuqA6GAZQ.jpg](///raw/35c/72/z/26e75.jpg)
![gtC50q89wms.jpg](///raw/35c/72/z/26286.jpg) 

***Hints(read if you are completely desperate :с):***
- *A digit on the door must be first. Do question marks look the same?*
- *Red, Green, Blue and Yellow colors are encoded by their first letter*
- *Don't recode ciphers too many times*

entries.title: Pot Luck
entries.description:
A game about starting with nothing, and sharing everything.

Entertain your friends at a pot luck, which always begins with nothing on the table. As your friends arrive, you can pick which of their special recipes they bring to your table. Make sure everyone finds something good to eat, or they'll leave and take their dish with them! Make your friends happy enough to invite you to their parties, and you win.

entries.title: Nothing To The Moon
entries.description:
Learn how important nothing is to you in this adventure that takes you to the moon.

This is my entry for the Ludum Dare 45. It's my first ever entry, so let me know what you think.

Everything was created by me in 48 hours.
Only the Windows build was tested, everything else is a mystery.

Controls
Movement - WASD or Arrow Keys
Computer Controls - 1234567
Push - Left Click
Pull - Right Click
Sprint - Left Shift

There are a few minor bugs, mainly involving walking sound, but nothing gamebreaking as far as I know.

entries.title: Space Tales
entries.description:
A sole survivor of a planet far away seeks help in an abandoned space station.  But soon enough, he will discover that he is not alone and that there are dark riddles and mysteries lying ahead. And a strange voice that comes from everywhere and nowehere.  
[It is important to play this game with sound!]

![doit.png](///raw/659/e1/z/28f4b.png)

We developed the game with Unity, using Blender and Paint.net for graphics. We had a very small sound studio to create music and voice.  

We are four guys, two developers (one did the graphics), one sound engineer and one genius speaker.  

Update 1.1: 
Fixed falling in spots where you can't leave 
Fixed speech timing (speech was to slow) 
Fixed loud music 

Windows Build will be available soon.

entries.title: VELOCE
entries.description:
---
WAY BACK IN THE TWENTIETH CENTURY, as we reached for the starts, we came across an offensive entiry, known as the PESTE NERA. This entity attacked our planet years ago, outnumbering any defenses we had.

But now it's our time to fight back.

We are VELOCE, the elite galactic defense force. Equipped with the most agile fighters in the world, the enemy won't know what hit them!

We're glad you're working for us now!

## PILOT BASICS
- **STEER YOUR CRAFT.** The fighter responds directly to your mouse.
- **UPGRADE YOUR FIGHTER** with better weapons by collecting powerups.
- **GET IN CLOSE.** The gun turrets shoot automatically, but have a limited range.
- **ENDURE** for as long as you can, pilot!

We're counting on you!
----------------------------------------------------------------

entries.title: Naked in the snow
entries.description:
![logo3.png](///raw/194/3/z/26afc.png)

You find yourself and some others naked in the snow. You start with literally no clothes and have to get dressed to avoid freezing to death. There are limited clothes available and it is getting colder by the minute. Grab and steal clothes until you are the last one alive.

Each time the temperature drops, everyone not wearing the clothing displayed will freeze to death. Try not to be one of them.

CONTROLS: Arrow keys to move.

![screen0.png](///raw/194/3/z/26b06.png)

![screen1.png](///raw/194/3/z/26b09.png)

EDIT: Added the game logo AFTER submission (did not change any code) as I typically do that in the morning on the way to work. Didn't realize this time it is going to be to late (Western Australia).

entries.title: ZERMATT: ZERO
entries.description:
Zermatt: Zero is a PC-98 inspired adventure game in which you must escape the clutches of an unknown monstrosity using your wits and items you can scavenge from the ship.

![idle2.gif](///raw/91/z/289e9.gif)

## Controls
Best played with a mouse, keyboard arrow keys can be used in a pinch.

### Help I'm stuck
The most important part of this game is knowing where the monster is, and staying away from it. The scanner (which can be found in the starting room if you missed it) will tell you what the monster is up to. This can be invaluable in determining whether you're safe. Similarly, your team will call out certain events, so pay attention to the dialogue! Lastly, the elevator is a safe space, so retreat there if you find yourself in a bad situation.

![1.png](///raw/91/z/280c7.png)

### Credits
- Code / Writing: @FireSlash
- Art / Direction: @kiririn51
- Music / SFX: @Juneji

entries.description:

**Controls**:

Editor mode (Active on Level load)
- **left mouse** to place a scribble.
- **right mouse** to delete them.

Feel free to share your experience with us in the comments as feedback is very welcome! We would also love to see how you solved a level if you are recording it!!

entries.title: Neon Void

entries.title: Aphantasia
entries.description:
# Aphantasia

## [n]. The inability to form mental images of objects that are not present.

![Screen Shot 2019-10-06 at 6.17.54 PM.png](///raw/2d1/f1/z/26862.png)

You're working with a local psychiatrist on a new therapy to lessen the negative effects that aphantasia has on those who suffer from it.

Because they cannot form their own mental images, you've volunteered to help them create physical representations of their purely verbal thoughts.

![Screen Shot 2019-10-06 at 6.20.14 PM.png](///raw/2d1/f1/z/2686d.png)

In other words, you're painting their memories.

https://kristinamay.itch.io/aphantasia

## How to play

You can play by download love2d's super simple game engine thing. OR you can use the Windows or Mac versions I've created (which are tested and work on multiple devices!). I might try to work on a port that can play in the web but it doesn't seem well-supported so none of us should hold our breaths.

Otherwise, directions are in the game.

## Known issues

- Windows build trips up antivirus software. I have no idea how to fix that, but trying it a few times allows it through. 
-  [fixed] Title isn't appearing on window.
- [fixed] Scoring isn't working for the second or third levels.
- [fixed]One sound effect later in the game is looping when it shouldn't be.

UPDATE: Fixed the issues above at around +1 hour after submission hour, you can look at github for the record of changes if you're curious.
 

## Misc

This is my first game using love2d, and my third LD! I had the most fun creating all the assets for this game, and I hope y'all have as much fun as I did messing around with the art.

entries.title: Absorb
entries.description:
This time, you are a slime with nothing. 

No weapons, no jumping skills, no sense of touch, no sound, and even no sight. 

Luckily, you can ABSORB other creatures and STEAL their skills. Can you take the advantages of that and grow step by step? You begin from zero, but where will your end be? 

Well, here goes “nothing”.

You will move on a large map, and there will be no evil “levels” to take away or reset your abilities. All you have to do is to make the most of what you have and keep looking for the next skill. 

You will encounter: 

9 completely different creatures that can be your prey (Which means 9 distinct abilities!)

3 exciting and interesting boss battles

Good luck, slime with nothing! 

![Sprite-0001.gif](///raw/016/91/z/272c0.gif)

entries.title: Epoch

Play at Itch.io: https://cosmicadventuresquad.itch.io/epoch

#### 🌞 Summary

In EPOCH, you play through the major phases of the creation of the universe. In the beginning there was nothing, then there was a big bang and you come to life as a tiny quark. Quickly amass matter until you become a supermassive black hole.

* Collect all matter in the universe
* Boost into matter larger than you 
* Boosting will cause you to eject some mass

#### :video_game: Controls
Mouse: 
* Point to move
* Click to boost

#### :bulb: Credits

- Rose Peng - Art :paintbrush: (@rosypenguin)
- Johan Soriao - Music :musical_keyboard: (@tenlki)

entries.title: Missing Entry
entries.description:
# MISSING ENTRY [LD45]

![sUQiNXQ.png](///raw/ae3/d1/z/25e18.png)

Created in 48h for the 45th Ludum Dare

Missing entry is a story written by you and others that started with nothing and can do in any direction.
