entries.title: The Firebrand
entries.description:
![firebrandpagelogo.png](///raw/7b9/02/z/2784e.png)

# Premise

### *"The pain's always the same."*

An interrogation room. Sitting on one end of a table is a woman. On the other is you - a detective tired of asking questions, but desperate for answers.

Who is the woman? Why is she here? What has she done?

The only way to find out is to talk. Every conversation topic giving new leads to chase down. Some worthwhile. Others not so much.

Follow the rabbit hole until you reach the truth.

# Screenshots

![firebrandscreen1.png](///raw/7b9/02/z/2779a.png)  
![firebrandscreen2.png](///raw/7b9/02/z/2782f.png)

# Credits

Modelling, animation, coding, music: [selkie](https://selkkie.itch.io/)  
Story and writing: [DWaM](https://dwam.itch.io/)

# Version History
Update 1.01: Fixed an issue where the player wasn't able to trigger the Bad End dialogue and the game abruptly ended.

Update 1.02: Fixed issue with endings not triggering under certain conditions, and increased quality setting that prevented shadows from showing.


Update 1.03: Added Windows and MacOS binaries at a commenter's request

# Guide / Walkthrough
We've put together a flowchart that highlights the keywords you need for the different endings, for those who have struggled with reaching them. 
You can find it [here](https://dwam.itch.io/the-firebrand/devlog/104357/the-firebrand-flowchart-guide-walkthrough).

entries.title: Unwritten
entries.description:
Every book has a beginning, but sometimes the ending has not yet been written. Enter the world of *Unwritten* and...

## Write Your Own Story ![BookOpening.gif](///raw/16/z/297e0.gif)

## Solve Puzzles! ![Puzzles.gif](///raw/16/z/297e1.gif)

## Make Changes ![Changes.gif](///raw/16/z/297e2.gif)

## Find Secrets??? ![Secrets.gif](///raw/16/z/297e3.gif)

...but if you want to be the writer of your own fate, you will have to **Start With Nothing**.

-------------------------------

### Controls
- Book - **Mouse**
- World - **WASD** or **Arrows**

### Pro-Tips/Helpful Hints
- You can write yourself out of the book to reset the level.
- Some book choices have more than two options.
- There are 2 collectible secret stars in each level.
- Logs and Rocks have 4 states: normal, covered in moss, covered in mushroom/fungus, and on fire.
- Rock smothers fire.
- Fungal logs cannot move.
- Logs can be pushed or rolled (if on their side).
- Mossy logs cannot be pushed, or roll onto moss.
- Mossy logs roll only one tile at a time.
- Logs will stop on moss, and only roll one tile at a time.
- You can safely stand on burning logs.
- You can roll logs by walking on them.
- Ground moss written into mushrooms will lift whatever is standing on them up in the air.

### Version History
**Oct. 7, 2019** :: *v1.0.3-jam*
- Jam release

**Oct. 12, 2019** :: *v1.0.4-jam*
- Added analytics collection
- Added 'R' key shortcut to reset level
- Improved reset system to handle potential softlocks
- Fixed a typo
- Fixed bug where text would sometimes display incorrectly
- Fixed a bug where the player move_fail animation never played
- Slightly adjusted screen layout to better show the book and version number
- Shifted character sprite to better read what tile they are on
- Removed an errant mushroom from fungal logs

**Oct. 14, 2019** :: *v1.0.5-jam*
- Fixed analytics being very broken
- Removed an out of the way checkpoint

### Walkthrough
If you got stuck, or maybe just hate playing games ^_^
https://youtu.be/uDwo7ZIMvww

entries.title: Small Town
entries.description:
![itch_banner.png](///raw/947/31/z/2973e.png)

### Build your own small town from scratch!

## Overview:

Small Town is a clicker/tower defense game in which you build your own town. Produce resources,  build better types of buildings,  gain experience points, level up your town and defend it against dangerous enemies. Your goal is to build the last unlockable building: The Statue of Glory!

## Manual:

- Use mouse to play the game
- The first thing you should do is building your townhall. It is the most important building in the game - the heart of your town
- There are 3 resources: wood, stone and gold. Use them to build new buildings
- Lumberjack and mine buildings produce resources
- Click on the map screen to gain exp and produce resources
- Gold is the most valuable resource. It is produced in mine but it has much lower chance to drop than stone
- Houses give you exp
- Exp is necessary to level up your town
- The higher is your level, the more resources your building produce (but on the other hand it also increases enemies' strength, so be careful). Also, some buildings need certain level to be unlocked
- The road is used by enemies to reach your townhall building
- When the enemies reach your townhall, you lose
- Build Towers to defend your townhall
- Build the last unlockable building: The Statue, to win the game

Good luck!

## Changelog:

### v1.0.1

- improved difficulty balance
- fixed wood number bug
- fixed overlapping enemies bug
- fixed projectile sound effect bug
- fixed townhall button color bug
#### No new features added - just bug fixes

![small_town ss1.png](///raw/947/31/z/272c9.png)

entries.title: 7 Days
entries.description:

This is my submission for my first Ludum Dare 45 compo mode.

You simply water the tree, and it grows where you water it. Make the tree reach the sun and you'll reach the next day.

The theme was "You start with nothing" and my idea was that you play as god during the 7 days of creation. Every level symbolize a day of creation.

entries.title: BoBoBot
entries.description:
BOBOBOT

![miniature kopia.png](///raw/b60/42/z/2870b.png)

ABOUT

You play as small limbless robot called Bobo. Bobo just activated for the first time after who knows how long.  Scared and alone will have to somehow manage to travel through corridors, pass halls and escape the facility.  Empty corridors, empty halls, whole facility abandoned. With nothing in it, except you.

BoBoBot is metroidvanish game. Your task is to collect upgrades which will help you to progress through the level. Your goal is to reach the end of the map.

![1.png](///raw/b60/42/z/29240.png)

CONTROLS

arrow keys - movement

z - interaction, lifting and dropping items

x and space - jump

c - change your charge
 
esc - auto destruction (reset, yes we learned from the last time :P )

m - mute audio

UPDATES & BUG FIXES

- moved magnet area player re spawn point so you can't get stuck anymore
- improved performance and framerate
- game doesn't freeze anymore when you pull the first lever 
- fixed the edges of conveyor belt platforms 
- fixed animation glitch with magnets
- fixed dark room glitch with the edges 
- added coyote time
- you can't no longer see inside of the dark room from the outside 
- added sound to death animation when self destructing
- fixed re spawn of fellow cubes
- extended time to re spawn if player fell down the pit
- finished final cutscene(fixed transition, added credits)

CREDITS

Code & Functionality

Bartosz "Sztobar" Szewczyk

Graphics & Level design

Lucas "Shogun" Michalczyk

MUSIC AND SFX

Evan King - [20XX/Tundraexe/Typecast]

https://www.youtube.com/user/EvanKingAudio

https://twitter.com/EvanKingAudio

Buy this song at: https://evanking.bandcamp.com

Or grab it as a free download at: https://www.evankingmusic.com

entries.description:
![ldnew4-export.gif](///raw/bdb/92/z/2927f.gif)

![ldnew3-small.gif](///raw/bdb/92/z/29281.gif)

![ldnew1-export.gif](///raw/bdb/92/z/29282.gif)

## You Broke the Game

Something broke, and game won't start. Go fix it now! Charming platformer starring an adventurous moustached man.

The average play time is about 15 minutes. There're 134 coins in case you're wondering whether you collected them all.

Don't forget to press the Start button once you fixed the game (I guess it's not obvious).

### Controls   
W/D or arrows to move  
S or down to crouch  
SPACE to jump *(hold it for longer jumps)*

### Credits   

A game by [Andrej Suvorau](https://www.suvrik.com/) & [Oleg Klishin](http://olegklishin.com)   
Music by [NeXsard](https://www.newgrounds.com/audio/listen/499413)

### Updates   

**09.10.2019:** Lowered sound volume, fixed Down Arrow and Space controls scrolling down the embedding page, added composer to the credits.   
**12.10.2019:** Got rid of all memory leaks, fixed the infinite fall on some backstage levels. Added touchscreen support. Now you can play this game sitting on a toilet! Yay!

entries.title: Unwatered
entries.description:
*If the webgl window is too massive, please try the Win download... sorry, there's always something to catch me out* ...


An easy-to-play water physics puzzle game. Manipulate the platforms (and sometimes more...) to guide the water into the flower pot. You need at least half the water to complete a level. 

Use mouse to control. Platforms can either be rotated, or moved either vertically or horizontally -- see the on-screen guides for which type they are.

![mCapture2.PNG](///raw/82a/2/z/2635c.png)

![mCapture3.PNG](///raw/82a/2/z/26360.png)

![mCapture1.PNG](///raw/82a/2/z/26362.png)


Webgl and Windows standalone versions on the itch page. Rec 1600x900, I had some issues with narrower display :/ If the webgl version is too big, please try the Win standalone, which is resizeable.

Made using: Unity, Inkscape, GIMP, Sfxr.  All graphics (apart from the title font) were hand-drawn.
The water effect is done using a standard meta-balls technique. I'll post a little blog postmortem asap ;)

Note - I will attempt to read, respond + play as many games as possible, but it might not be for a day or 2 now.

Mini postmortem:
https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/45/unwatered/mini-postmortem-unwatered

entries.title: L.D. Noire
entries.description:
A short point and click adventure where you will uncover a dark secret by solving a murder case.

Note: Do not go fullscreen or it will break the UI composition.

![cover-2.png](///raw/b56/z/26612.png)

** Walkthrough (Warning spoilers ahead) **

Chapter 1: Jerry's House
========================
!> - Leave the police station
!> - Go left and enter Jerry's house
!> - Find a small safe key in one of the books
!> - Click on painting to reveal safe
!> - Use safe key on safe to get Sam's picture and $200
!> - Examine the trash to retrieve a pack of matches
!> - Walk right and retrieve the slingshot on the floor
!> - Exit Jerry's house and go left

Chapter 2: DrinkUp Bar
======================
!> - Enter the bar and talk to the bartender
!> - Show him Sam's picture.
!>   The bartender will give you an envelope for the FBI.
!>   He also tells you that Sam lives next to the pharmacy.
!> - Go right and talk with the smoker.
!> - Give him the matches and you will receive a magnet.
!> - Leave the bar

Chapter 3: Irma the Fortune Teller
==================================
!> - Walk right to Irma's shop
!> - Pick up the shoelace on the floor next to the door
!> - Go talk to Irma, give her $200 to get a plastic ball
!> - Combine the ball and the slingshot to get an armed slingshot
!> - Combine the shoelace and the magnet to get a claw
!> - Head back out.

Chapter 4: The Streets
======================
!> - Head all the way to the left and find the sewers.
!> - Examine to see that there is a metal plaque inside
!> - Use the claw on the sewers to retrieve the code "76243"
!> - Walk right to the pharmacy
!> - On the building to its left, there is a ladder that can be examined.
!> - Use the armed slingshot on the ladder to get it down.
!> - Walk up the ladder to go to Sam's place.

Chapter 5: Sam's place
======================
!> - Examine the letter on the ground next to the door
!> - Walk to the right and try to use the TV. It requires a code.
!> - Use the pinpad next to the TV and enter the code "76243".
!> - You will receive a VHS tape. Use it on the TV to reveal conspiracy.
!> - Put the tape in the envelope. You will still need one more thing.
!> - Walk to the right and click on the shredded papers on the ground.
!> - Move each piece of paper in the right order to reveal the lead.
!> - The message reads "Sam, the next meeting with McFly is on the 9th at 2am. Be Careful! J."
!> - Place the lead inside the envelope and exit through the window.
!> - Walk left to the mailbox and use the envelope on the mailbox to finish the game.

entries.title: Uballto
entries.description:
[![Uballto 2019-10-07 (22162).png](///raw/d31/z/26d0f.png)](https://gamejolt.com/games/uballto/443474)

Welcome to *Uballto*, a Linux distribution for...distributing balls. That's right, in this desktop environment, dialog windows are used to guide balls to their target flags. Do you have the technical wits to master this distro?

Made by [one individual](https://www.omiyagames.com/) (and a lot of royalty-free assets).

[![uballto02.gif](///raw/d31/z/29468.gif)](https://gamejolt.com/games/uballto/443474)

## Controls:

* Played entirely with the mouse.
* Tap ESC will also open the menu as well.

## Logs:

| Version | For Judging? | Date | Description |
|--- |--- |--- |--- |
| v1.1.0 | No, Post-Jam | 10/10 | Adding support for screen resizing (more for web-builds), all screen resolutions, level name appearing on the menu, and *potentially* some performance improvements. |
| v1.0.1 | Yes, Bug Fix | 10/10 | Fixing the menu to have level 9 unlocked by default. Also added support to 16:9 and 16:10 screen resolutions (which involves just checking 2 checkboxes in Unity) |
| v1.0 | Yes | 10/7 | Increased the number of levels from 3 to 9 before the Jam deadline. |
| v0.1 | Yes | 10/6 | Initial upload. |

## Notes:

* 10/7 - Tripled the number of levels before the Jam deadline.  Enjoy!
* 10/6 - Submitting this early due to a very busy schedule on Monday.  In theory, though, I should be able to fit in more levels and game mechanics before the jam deadline.  Stay tuned!

entries.title: Trashquest
entries.description:
_Spirits of the Junkyard want to have some fun! They are going to decide who's going to be the king of the trash hill, and of course, the most sensible way to do that would be a TRIAL BY COMBAT!_

![gameplay.gif](///raw/2e1/z/28faf.gif)

-----------------------------------

I usually write something moody and lore-heavy here, but today it's our 10th Ludum Dare as a team, so I want to steal this place and celebrate a bit. First and foremost, I want to say huge thanks to my friends Ruslan and Alexey here, thank you for dealing with all the shmuck I produce on a constant basis. You are awesome and I wouldn't grow nearly as far as I am now without you. 

This game is simultaneously a nod to a great piece called Hammerfight (which is awesome and you should play it) and to our first ever jam entry called Ancient Contact, which was also a physics sandbox playground. You can go and check it sometime later to see how much did we manage to improve (or degrade?) over those years. It was a realy nice journey. Bumpy ride, of course, ups and downs, happiness and depression, and this fulfillment after the game is finally submitted and you can relax and enjoy it. It's what we are here for.

Last, but not least, we'd want to thank all of you people, who spent your precious time playing our games, rating us, leaving feedback, and even buing our steam game. You, Ludum Darers, are absolutely fantastic bunch of people, wonderful in every way (except, maybe, picking a jam theme).

*Thank you! And have a good time in rate weeks.*

-----------------------------------

#### CONTROLS:
- Use mouse to fly around.
- Hold **[LMB]** to activate your attach sockets - if there's an item nearby, it would be attached to you.
- **[RMB]** to discard all your items.
- **[SPACE]** to evacuate, but beware - your body will be destroyed. 
- **[ESC]** returns to menu. Sorry we didn't had time to make a confirmation prompt.

![screen1.png](///raw/2e1/z/27e91.png)

#### TOOLS:
- [Unity 2019.2.8f1](https://unity.com)
- [Audiotool](https://www.audiotool.com)
- [Audacity](https://www.audacityteam.org)

entries.title: Mind Game(s) - Prologue
entries.description:
Thanks for checking out my submission!
I've not had much time this weekend, so decided to take a more relaxed approach and made something like a demo to a game instead. I'm not really sure if you _can_ call it a game, or an interactive novel or whatever... but it was fun to make ^^

The page is running under the [Dedalus engine](https://github.com/pistacchio/Dedalus/), a really cool narrative system I'd recommend checking out! All writing and styling was done by myself. The fonts are free to use from Google Fonts and [here](https://www.fontspace.com/andrew-bulhak/modeseven). The background art in a later section was styled by myself and generated using [WaveFunctionCollapse](https://github.com/mxgmn/WaveFunctionCollapse).

![Annotation 2019-10-06 154924.png](///raw/494/c/z/25ec8.png)

The story revolves around you. You start with nothing, in the middle of nowhere, with no means of calling for help. The story's deliberately vague, and doesn't answer many of the questions it raises. Maybe some will be answered in later chapters if I make them, but for now the story's open to your interpretation :wink:

I'm by no means a talented writer, so please excuse any questionble language or oddly specific plot devices. _(unless they're deliberate in the universe)_

I'm not sure if I've been able to test every combination of events, so if you find any glitches please let me know. Hope you enjoy the game, and best of luck for your submissions!

entries.title: PixelGod
entries.description:
![Wallpaper3.png](///raw/e18/3/z/26825.png)

![Wallpaper4.png](///raw/e18/3/z/2682a.png)

## Timelapse of the game being created

https://youtu.be/GzDaMU8hIdA

You are a god in a desolate world and your goal is to make it filled with life.
- Combine elements to create new ones
- Design your own ecosystem
- But space is limited

## How to Play
- Simply select what element to place and then click on a pixel in the world and it appears.

### Tips and Tricks
- For faster placing of elements you can change the brush size of your god brush
- For precision placing you can pause the game and place elements while its paused
- If you are stuck think outside the box but everything should be quite logical, except the creation of animal (it has to do with cacti).


## Tools used
- Unity
- Aseprite
- bfxr

entries.title: Ludum Dare Simulator
entries.description:
![preview.png](///raw/620/72/z/2630b.png)First game I ever made to completion for my first gamejam. 

# It's alive! Ludum Dare Simulator

Become a budding game developer and take part in Ludum Dare jams. Improve your skills and try to do better with each competition you take part in.


It's a simple card game with a little bit of player character progression sprinkled in. 
** The only game mechanic you need to know, is that you have to use a release build card before the timer runs out. **
The first gamejam a player takes a part in is LD45 with it's current theme, next jams have themes selected from a random list consisting of previous themes and some songs from my playlist :P


I like mentioning that it's my first game and first jam, brag if it's good and makes for an excuse if it's bad. At least it runs! I wish I hadn't ran out of time and made more cards and fleshed out player progression, but I guess that's how it goes!

TOOLS:
Code: Typescript + pixi.js WebGL library written in Visual Studio Code. No game engines here.
Sound: Audacity, Beepbox, BFXR
Visual: paint.net, px-anima


**Link to a post jam version with quality of life fix. It improves scaling to browser window. Still not ideal, but makes it playable on more resolutions.**
[This is a github commit for it if you want to check.](https://github.com/jerzakm/LudumDare-45-entry/commit/e15f2d3aa274c66e517b4f32e032c981d7539c4b)

entries.description:

![Red Vs Green 10_5_2019 8_17_54 PM.png](///raw/6ac/z/263a5.png)

![Red Vs Green 10_5_2019 8_18_04 PM.png](///raw/6ac/z/263a9.png)

![Red Vs Green 10_6_2019 3_37_35 PM.png](///raw/6ac/z/263ca.png)

_______________________________________________________________
There are instructions on the controls in the game, you can see them on the floor when you start the game, and the mechanics should be very easy to get a hold of. But incase you're confused about something:

CONTROLS:

-Arrow keys to move.

-Mouse to aim. You don't have to click, weapons are automatic.
Spacebar to pause.

MECHANICS HELP:

-Kill all enemies in a room to complete it. 3 blue slabs will come out of the ground with icons on them, each representing a weapon or perk you can choose. Step on them to see a description of what they offer. Left-Click while standing on a slab to equip its weapon or perk. You may only choose 1 for each room, the other 2 will be lost.

-Walk up to go to the next room.

That's the basics!

_______________________________________________________________

*Note with download: If when you try to run the game, a window opens but then immediately disappears, try opening it in command prompt (Windows). This happens sometimes on my computer but I haven't heard of anyone else having problems with it in previous ludum dares I've done. So it shouldn't be a problem, but if it is, heres how you do it: Open command prompt, type in "cd " and the location of the RedVsGreen folder then type in "java -jar RedVsGreen.jar" and it should open.*

entries.title: FactoriNode
entries.description:
Welcome to FactoriNode

This is a Factorio inspired game about connecting ingredients together in order to create larger and more advanced components.
The aim of this game is to grow the factory, to make more money, to grow the factory, to make more money, ad infinitum.

![ezgif-4-67b1a06d8e86.gif](///raw/97e/2/z/26fc9.gif)

You can drag nodes around the space with left click and connect nodes together by dragging a red output to a corresponding blue input.

Once all the connections are set up, all the way back to the beginning resources you will see the nodes start running and the cogs spinning.

Use the recipe list on the right to buy new nodes, and create "End Products" in order to earn more money.

You will start with nothing so your first priority should be obtaining an end product in order get some money coming in. More advanced end products will provide more money.

The factory must grow!

![reveal.gif](///raw/97e/2/z/26ff0.gif)

Controls, Tips, and Tricks:

* Left click drag over nodes to select a group.
* Right click drag to move the camera
* Scroll wheel to zoom in and out
* Once selected 'D' duplicates the selection and 'Q' refunds the selection.
* Purchase nodes buy selecting it in the recipe panel and dragging the preview node onto the grid.
* Earn money buy connecting all the ingredients to construct an end product.
* The more items you create, the more you discover.


Have fun!



** Note: Using Google Chrome may result in a low frame rate, we recommend using either Mozilla Firefox when playing the WebGL version **

entries.title: Singularity
entries.description:
A puzzle game based on constellations from stars that emerge from a singularity. Your goal for each level is to construct a repeating constellation pattern that can link all the stars. 

There are three main types of controls. Click on one to activate it, and then all of them use left-right mouse motion to do what they do (rotate, bend, scale). There are also switcher buttons that you can click on when they appear later on.

The game is available here: http://planktongames.com/ld45

When thinking of starting with nothing, I went with a Big Bang theme, because before the Big Bang, there was nothing anywhere else other than the central singularity. So, each level starts with empty space, and then you explode all matter into it, and then you can play. Admittedly, the astronomy is more than a little suspect here, but the game is the point of it rather than the science, after all.

Guide: 

- When "Detonate" comes up, click on the singularity to explode it.
- When "Constellate" comes up, click on the controls on the bottom to link stars into patterns.
- When "Tesselate" comes up, you've solved the puzzle, and all stars are reachable from your repeated pattern. (You don't need to do anything here.)
- When "Concentrate" comes up, all matter in the universe is compressing into a new singularity for you to detonate. (You don't need to do anything here.)

There are 21 levels in all (you start from level zero, of course, because you start from nothing).

Written in Unity. All sound is from my face recorded and processed in GoldWave Audio. Art was made in PowerPoint and GIMP. Font is Trench by Nima Type (https://nimatype.co/), which is free and very cool.

![lvl5.jpg](///raw/c66/z/26967.jpg)
![Title.jpg](///raw/c66/z/26970.jpg)
![lvl3.jpg](///raw/c66/z/2696d.jpg)
![lvl1.jpg](///raw/c66/z/26972.jpg)

entries.title: Nepton
entries.description:
Nepton is a puzzle/RTS hybrid (the RTS elements being really, really light, mind you) where you play as a divine entity conquering a world covered in water. There's some onboarding in the game, but in case that's lackluster here's the short of it:

- Each level has a bunch of enemies and enemy territory
- Kill all enemies and conquer all their land blocks to beat a level
- Gain territory by first raising a block of land, then building a Hole-in-Ground on it and using your creatures to smack enemies
- The War Statue will grant permanent buffs to your creatures' max health and damage
- You need Power to raise land and build structures. Gain Power by defeating enemy creatures (2 per kill) and capturing enemy land blocks (10 per block)
- Right-click on land blocks to order ALL your creatures to go there - and attack everything they encounter.
- The creatures have a mind of their own and once they see an enemy they'll attack without hesitation. You won't be able to order them around when they're fighting.
- The creatures aren't exactly smart so you may have to guide them around the islands a bit.

![building.png](///raw/f47/21/z/2714f.png)


![creatures.png](///raw/f47/21/z/27150.png)


![fight1.png](///raw/f47/21/z/27151.png)

UPDATE 2019/10/07:
Added standalone build (Windows) and configured WebGL build to be graphically on par with the standalone version.

entries.title: Sentience
entries.description:
*The gift of sentience was bestowed upon you.*  
*You are the first sentient pixel.*

Sentience is a roguelike story-based top-down shooter, where you are a pixel, created from nothing, bestowed with free will by your creator, the computer. Upgrade your drivers, become bigger, faster, stronger, more resilient in the face of danger, as you blast through hordes of enemy pixels. We aimed for a really polished experience, and we believe we achieved that!

Music is a big part of the game, everything happening on rhythm.

Playing until the end is recommended, as the game is a full story :smile:.

​Releases:  
​v1.00: Initial release.  
v1.01: Fixed dialog bug sometimes crashing the game.

*Good luck!*  
*You'll need it.*

entries.title: Sosig
entries.description:
![sosiglogo.png](///raw/989/d/z/2863e.png)

**Sosig** is a 3D platformer where you play as a sausage, who is trying to bring back colors to a mysterious world.

This game is made by **Snarf** and **Mors**, with music from **Catonator** and additional promotional art from **irri**!

**Playing with a controller is recommended for this game!** (But not required.)

![ss1.png](///raw/989/d/z/28e79.png)

**STORY:**

So, how did I end up here? Well, I started out as any normal day for a sausage.

I headed to my kitchen to get my apparel, but it appears I ran out of buns.

"Bummer", I said. As I was getting ready to go to the store I noticed an indescribable black gateway, right on my kitchen floor.

"Rad!", I exclaimed. But before I knew something was up with it, I got sucked right in!

And now, it is just me...

![sosig man.png](///raw/989/d/z/2885e.png)

**CHANGELOG:**

1.3:
- The camera doesn't get tilted anymore once you die in level 1.
- Apparently I forgot to connect a node in the main material, that's fixed.
- Restored a few minor things that got lost during a merge conflict at the final hour. Thanks GitHub.

1.2:
- Updated the credits.
- Level 1's lighting is now fixed for real.
- The camera now resets properly when you die.
- You can't walk around during the controls screen anymore.

1.1:
- The game now doesn't skip level 3. (Always test your release builds lol)
- Fixed clipping into the wall in level 1.
- Level 1's lighting is also fixed.
- A few other very minor fixes.

1.0:
- First release

entries.title: Thanks for Nothing
entries.description:
![Thanks for Nothing 2019-10-07 00-52-45-073.png](///raw/648/1/z/269a8.png)

![Thanks for Nothing 2019-10-07 00-53-16-558.png](///raw/648/1/z/269aa.png)

![Thanks for Nothing 2019-10-07 00-53-28-874.png](///raw/648/1/z/269af.png)

### Description
This short adventure-like "game" (let's keep the quotes for legal reasons) casts you in the role of a dimwitted courier with a special task: To deliver nothing in a post-apocalyptic world. Moody? Maybe. Funny? I hope so!

### Features
- Original ink drawings, digitized by state-of-the-art technology!
- An original soundtrack featuring real instruments!
- Attempts at comedy!
- Nothing more!

### Controls
- ***WASD*** or ***←↓↑→*** to move (i think controllers work also).
- ***E*** or ***SPACE*** to interact.
- ***1, 2, 3*** for dialog choices
- ***Esc*** to quit at any time.


Please play with audio on. There’s music!

### Credits
A game by Phil Strahl a.k.a. Pixel Prophecy made in a frantic 48 hrs. My first "real" Unity game. Did it hurt? Yes. Yes, it did.

### Downloads
Linux and Mac builds are mildly tested, but you should be fine. The version was updated shortly after the jam where I fixed music looping, removed unused assets, and corrected one dialog page.

### Videos
Ludum Dare Post Mortem Documentary
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UO9BARNj8cQ

Gameplay and Code Review
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EsGbszWnanY

entries.title: SpaceCrafter
entries.description:
![screen2.png](///raw/797/8/z/274f1.png)

## **Description**
Help a team of astronauts escape their hazardous space station and get back home. Starting with nothing, gather whatever resources you can find to build a path to the shuttle, avoiding both lasers and falling into the deep void of space.

## **Gameplay**
- Tiles you pick up can connect to fixed tiles and each other.
- Groups of tiles will fall if one of them is not anchored to a fixed tile.

## **Controls**
- **Movement**: WASD / Arrow Keys
- **Select/Place Tile**: LMB
- **Remove Tile**: RMB
- **Back to Main Menu**: ESC (all progress will be reset)

## **Tiles**
![items.png](///raw/797/8/z/27470.png)

## **Team**
- **Programmer**: Nelson
- **Music**: Jesse
- **Graphics and Level Design**: Michael

entries.title: I Have Nothing - If I don't take from you!
entries.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0w9lYAf4Xmw

**Play here, WebGL version available: https://imphenzia.itch.io/ld45-i-have-nothing **

You start with nothing.

## HOW TO PLAY

Score points by **putting on clothes** (just walk over them - but in the right order)

Score points by **picking up items** and **dropping them in the empty apartment**.

Don't let the lady see you - she will **chase you down** and **knock you out** to game over!

You can complete the game by getting fully dressed and moving everything except the rugs into the empty apartment.


## MOUSE CONTROLS

**Walk** - Left Click on Floor

**Pick Up Furniture** - Left Click on Item

**Drop Furniture** - Right Click

## SCREENSHOTS

![screenshot-1.png](///raw/d02/z/2693c.png)

![screenshot-2.png](///raw/d02/z/2693e.png)

![screenshot-3.png](///raw/d02/z/26941.png)

![screenshot-4.png](///raw/d02/z/26942.png)

![screenshot-5.png](///raw/d02/z/26943.png)

## ABOUT

This game was made by Stefan Persson (Imphenzia) from scratch - including game design, programming, 3d models, animations, sound effects, and music - in 48 hours for the Ludum Dare 45 competition!


The theme for LD45 was "Start With Nothing"


Tools used: Unity3D, Blender 2.8, Photoshop, Sound Forge 11, Cubase 9.5


visit www.imphenzia.com - and follow me on Twitter @imphenzia - and YouTube www.youtube.com/imphenzia

### Updates
20191007: I implemented a game broken fix where the lady could get stuck quite easily, she now clears the path. It was a small change that had to be made.

entries.title: Black Hat
entries.description:
The year is 2035.

The Automation Revolution is in full force. The unemployment rate is rapidly climbing, breaking records on a daily basis. The few that thrive are getting fewer and those that remain see their empires grow faster than ever before.

In New York City, crime is on the rise. The poorest neighborhoods are plagued by robberies, petty theft and murder more than ever before.

You are a part of the lucky few who had escaped the life of crime. To do so, you had to do some morally questionable things. 

You hope that it is all behind you...

entries.title: PUNCH BLOCK SHOOT
entries.description:
Punch your friends!
Shoot your friends!
Block their shots!

PUNCH BLOCK SHOOT is a small platform fighter in which players aim to be victorious in a best of five battle, choosing upgrades after each round to gain a strategic edge on their opponent.

This game is a single keyboard multiplayer game. So grab a friend and give it a spin!

entries.title: Rottenville
entries.description:
![1.png](///raw/f21/e/z/2796f.png)

![4.png](///raw/f21/e/z/27eb6.png)

![3.png](///raw/f21/e/z/27ab8.png)

![2.png](///raw/f21/e/z/27a05.png)

## Summary
As if life in the old west was not harsh enough, you must now protect your saloon from the zombie apocalypse! Create outposts, oil pumps and even Gatling guns to show those pesky undead that no living or dead can mess with your legitimate business.

You start with nothing but fortunately you continuously earn some money from your patrons. The saloon should be defended at all costs so make sure to place your towers strategically. 

## Controls
- Use left mouse button to select a tower and place it on an allowed area.
- An active tower may be selected to view its range.
- Use the Esc key or the right mouse to deselect a tower unit or button.

## Hints
1. Killing enemies does not provide income. You gain $ every second from your saloon and by any oil pumps you build.
2. Careful! The enemy waves are randomly generated. Accidents may and most probably will happen.
3. Don't underestimate the capitalist power of the oil pumps.
4. As things get harder do not hesitate to replace your towers with stronger ones. The enemies get stronger and so should you!

## Tools
- GMS 1.4
- Piskel

## Team
- @zanzavar Words/Code/Level Design/UIUX
- @panayotis Code/System Design
- @eretzoum Pixels/Animations

## *IMPORTANT*
If the game height is too tall to fit in your browser window try zooming out a little (ctr/cmd -)

entries.title: バクラウBloodless
entries.description:
![01.png](///raw/099/e1/z/26f34.png)

### ABOUT OUR GAME

The theme of the LD45 is **Start with nothing**.

Many samurai serve the powerful shogun, but not you. Not anymore.

After witnessing all the blood that a blade can shed our protagonist decided to eschew his sword. Go back to the shogun's palace, show them you don't need a sword to get your message through. 

Formerly a samurai now a ronin, you have to oppose your old allies with nothing but your bare fists; **disarming them with a timed counter-dash hybrid mechanic**.

### HOW TO PLAY

 **バクラウ Bloodless** is an action single player game that supports keyboard and joystick.

![Inputs.png](///raw/099/e1/z/26df0.png)

To disarm your enemies **you must time their attacks and dash towards them just when they're attacking**. But beware of the Red Sword technic! Enemies cannot be disarmed while their swords are red.

### GAMEPLAY FOOTAGE

**Video**
https://youtu.be/WuXDD34Ajvg

**Screens**

![04.png](///raw/099/e1/z/26f38.png)

![05.png](///raw/099/e1/z/26f39.png)

![06.png](///raw/099/e1/z/26f3a.png)

### BLOG POSTS
- [Level Design Process](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/45/bloodless/bloodless-level-design-process)
- [Sound Design Process](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/45/bloodless/bloodless-sound-design-process)
- [Reusable Code](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/45/bloodless/bloodless-reusable-code)
- [Art Process](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/45/bloodless/bloodless-art-process)
- [Management](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/45/bloodless/$176434)

- [Making of | Teaser](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/45/bloodless/$176471)

### CHANGELOG

**Post-Jam Update 1 (v1.3.1 web only)**
- Level 2 trees colliders and layer order fixed
- Door transitions on higher monitor resolutions fixed
- Added more inputs options for the dash on the keyboard J, K, L, Shift and Enter.
- Tweaks on player max movement speed and dash max distance
- Tweaks on minor enemies behaviors and colliders
- Added tutorial to level 2 enemy introduction

Windows, Mac and web **builds** are listed bellow! :)

entries.title: Null Is Zero
entries.description:
![ZeroIsNull.png](///raw/323/41/z/2796c.png)

Game features 5 levels back to back.

Controls:
WASD for Up/Left/Down/Right.
Z for Undo.
R(double tap) for Restart.

Goals of the Game:
You control the blue number square and clear the levels by solving the equation featuring the equality operator ("=="), the sum of the numbers should be same on both sides.
You can change the value of numbers by using the equals("=") operator, the number on the right side gains the value of of the equation on the left side.

Thoughts on the Jam:
I had a lot of fun with this jam and ended up trying a few new things, such as adding sound effects and making a crude level editor. The game takes a lot of inspiration from Baba is You.
On a closing note, wish I had the time to add a level selection but in the end there was none. Looking forward to next jam in 2020!

Lastly, thanks for trying the game!
//Sunblast

Edit 1:
Added some additional information for explaining the mechanics of the game, thanks @cyberstarlight for the tip! :)

entries.title: Living Forrest
entries.description:
In my game "Living Forrest" for Ludum Dare 45 you take control over a forrest. But you have to start with nothing. There is not a single tree.

You have to manage your forrest to protect it from the human lumberjacks. Choose the right trees to plant. You will have to expand to survive. Make sure, that you have always enough water. Plant strong trees to hold back the heavy machines that come the human cities.

![Screenshot-1.PNG](///raw/546/22/z/2642e.png)

![Screenshot-2.PNG](///raw/546/22/z/26430.png)

![Screenshot-3.PNG](///raw/546/22/z/26431.png)

![Screenshot-4.PNG](///raw/546/22/z/26435.png)


How to play:
- You can only plant trees on the grass.
- To expand the grass area, you have to plant the "Tree Of Life". It will spread out the grass.
- To plant trees, you need water. The "Deep Root Trees" will extract water from the ground.
- To attack the lumberjack machines, you can use the "Spike Tree". But they cost you one water per month each.
- Spike trees have not so much health. You can protect them with "Hard Wood Trees". The spikes can still attack, if there are other trees in front of them.
- If you don't have water, your Spike Trees won't attack.
- When your trees are not attacked by lumberjacks, they will heal - or even grow, if they are healthy.
- Try to survive as long as possible.
- To win the game, you have to destroy the cities to the left and right with your spike trees.
- If there is no tree and no grass left, you have lost.


*For the source file use ZIP the password "LD45".*

*I released version 1.2 as Post-LD-Version, where I decreased the difficulty a little bit and added some tiny new features. Both versions are available on itch.io.*

entries.title: The Card Crafter
entries.description:
## What's this game

It's a card game. 

Fight creatures, gather resources, craft cards. 

Yup, as simple as that.


## Important tuto 

There's an ingame tuto, but some elements are still quite confusing. 

- During the fight, you gather bonuses that will appear on the right side of the screen. **Those bonuses can't be used during the fight!**

- Once out of fight, the left side is your cards collection. If you click on an empty square, it will open a menu to craft a new card **and that's where those bonuses come in handy**. 

- Once crafted, a card can be used in fight, and that's it /o/


**Craft card**
![Screenshot1.png](///raw/77f/8/z/273d0.png)

**Improve cards**
![Screenshot2.png](///raw/77f/8/z/273d4.png)

**And fight!**
![Screenshot3.png](///raw/77f/8/z/273d7.png)


## Big Takeways

It was hard. 

Like, very hard. 

It's very, very much a system game, with a lot of intricate elements. It's absolutely what I wanted to do though, because I usually do more narrative games, or simple puzzle games, so I underestimated the difficulty. As a result, there's a lot I couldn't do, since I just got to the point of a kinda playable state 30mn before the deadline.


**Content**

The content is... poor. It's very frustrating, because building the system was obviously the hardest part, by far, and now that it's built, adding content is a lot easier. (Not adding bugs in the process would probably be a bit more challenging, but I hope the system is overall pretty safe.) 

In a card crafting game, you'd expect to... be able to craft a lot of things, right? Well, too bad, there are only 3 different bonuses available. Would I have had two more hours, I may have been able to add maybe 1 or 2, and just that would have exponentially raised the amount of possibilities. 

But well, it's 48h, no more, that's the fun /o/

I still managed to multiply the variety of enemies by 9 during the last half-hour. (Ok, there are only 9 enemies, and 3 different sprites in total. DON'T BE MEAN.)


**Polish**

It's... dry. I love polishing, doing small feedback and FX everywhere. 

I couldn't. I hope there still is some fun in there.


**Sound**

Uh, that one hurts a lot as well. I love composing music, and doing small sounds. 

There is... no sound in the game x_x


**Visuals**

It's exceptionally poor as well, but at least there's nothing surprising about that for me. I'm a programmer. It's programmer art.


**UI**

Damn, thinking the UI for such a game was quite a challenge. I lost a lot of time just trying to figure out how to present the elements in a readable way that could be understood. I think the result is ok-ish?

entries.title: Empty Dungeon
entries.description:
![Picture1.png](///raw/531/z/269ef.png)

A rogue like game (missing most of the mechanics as I didn't have time), where you start in an empty dungeon and explore it's new features as you level up. Each time you level up, new mechanics will be unlocked, starting with things like a character and movement, then enemies and a map. Your goal is to get as much gold as you can before, finally being killed by the monsters that infest the dungeon.

Unfortunately the WebGl build is very broken so I wont list it. However, I may be able to fix it later, in which case I will add it back.

![Picture2.png](///raw/531/z/269f1.png)

Each time you unlock a new ability it will show at the right side, when one appears, you can press the key you want to use for it which will then show the key binding as well as unlock a new ability.

![Picture3.png](///raw/531/z/269f3.png)

I was planning on several more features, such as leveling up character stat as well as finding equipment. Other things include ranged and magic attacks as well as either more, or randomly generated levels. I also didn't have the ability to do much testing/balancing of the enemies and as such the game is likely very difficult.

Known bugs:
- Enemies tent to either not attack at all, or attack lots of times in a row which tents to instantly kill the player

entries.title: Master Builder Daedalus
entries.description:
![cover-00.png](///raw/7c1/z/26910.png)


## Plot:
You're the renowned Daedalus, one of the most famous inventors and builders in ancient mythology. 

Following a tavern brawl with a shepherd who turned out to be no other than the god Dyonisus in disguise, you find yourself standing by a deep chasm with nothing to help you cross to the other side.

Luckily you're one of Athena's favourites and she's left some magical maze building scrolls floating around. Use your skills as a master builder to reach them and pave your way through the chasm and into freedom.

PS: If you beat the final level, could you please share in the comments a screenshot of the path you built towards the goal before reaching for the stairs? I'm really curious to see how players approach it :smile: 

## Controls:

Game should work using keyboard or gamepad devices. For the gamepad button names I'm assuming an Xbox-like controller. It should work with the equivalent buttons in other controllers, but I haven't tested any other.

* Arrow keys / WASD or Left Stick / D-pad: Move Daedalus in normal mode, and move blocks in placement mode.
* Q/E keys or Left/Right pad shoulder buttons: In placement mode, rotate blocks left/right, respectively.
* C key or A button: Confirm placement, and Accept option in most menus.
* X key or B button: Cancel placement. Bear in mind that this will delete the block and could leave you stuck on a level. Use wisely! :wink: 

## Tools and due credit:
* Unity v2019.3b4 with Visual Studio 2017.
* Aseprite.
* Fonts used are Apostrophic Labs' [Diogenes](https://www.dafont.com/es/diogenes.font) and Codeman38's Press Start 2P (https://www.dafont.com/es/press-start-2p.font).



## Changelog:
* **07/10/2019:** Added Mac/Linux builds. 
* **13/10/2019 (I):** Added v0.0.2 for Windows / Web versions fixing input issues and a tile visibility bug.
* **13/10/2019 (II):** Added v0.0.3 for Windows / Web versions fixing input agan :facepalm:
* **14/10/2019:** Mac / Linux updated to v0.0.3 too.

entries.title: Flourish
entries.description:
![screenshot1.png](///raw/3ca/72/z/26002.png)

A short ordeal involving raising a plant.

There's a crashing bug in the HTML version that happens when entering the game from the main menu after restarting and/or rapidly toggling the manual (or something like that).

Below is the manual for the game, which you can access in-game too.

![screenshot2.png](///raw/3ca/72/z/26bb0.png)

# Raise your plant!

## Controls
**LMB**: Hold left-click & move your mouse to generate wind. Wind can move clouds, rain and pests!

**RMB**: Right-click on a cloud to release its rain (cooldown).

**Space**: Press space with your cursor on a cloud to drop lightning (cooldown).

**R**: Restart.

**M**: Toggle the manual/pause.

## Resources
**Moisture**: Bring down rain to water your plant.

**Health**: You'll lose health from pests & poor moisture/sunlight levels. If your health reaches zero, you lose!

**Sunlight**: Sunlight in moderation! Stay in the middle zone. Block the sun with your clouds to lower sunlight.


## Pests
**Aphid**: Fast but cowardly. Aphids will flee if met with wind or rain.

**Caterpillar**: Resilient. Release rain in front of them to loosen their footing.

***

entries.title: Notorious Bum
entries.description:
![Notorious_Bum.jpg](///raw/ff9/32/z/278bd.jpg)

[PLAY HERE (Web - 1 player - patched)](https://drestin.itch.io/notorious-bum-patched)
(or [original version](https://drestin.itch.io/notorious-bum))

George is **rich**. George is **famous**. Every one knows who George is. 
But unfortunately for him, **George drinks**... *a lot*.

![NB_2.png](///raw/ff9/32/z/279b1.png)

After a crazy mondane party night, George wakes up in the street... **entirely naked**! 
With no memories of how he found himself into this situation, there is only one thing he can do: **reach a taxi** as fast as possible so that he can go back home discreetly.

No one needs to know about this **awkward** event... 

![NB_1.jpg](///raw/ff9/32/z/278fa.jpg)

Notorious Bum is a stealth game in which **you play as famous George**, who must **reach the taxi** to go home while being *completely naked*. 

![NB_3.png](///raw/ff9/32/z/279c5.png)

But the city is *crowded with people*: **don't get pictured**, or your notoriety could fall down irredeemably!

#### Instructions:

 - Use __UP__/__DOWN__/__LEFT__/__RIGHT__ to move George.
 - **Avoid the citizens** who want to take **pictures** of you.
 - Once you reached your taxi, ***you win***!

#### Update:
We did a hotfix as some people experienced some bugs and freezes. We also adjusted a bit the global balance of the game as some values where clearly not the one we wanted to upload. You can pick whichever game version you like both are available : in jam time version, and bugfix version. You can check the patchnote to make up your mind.

#### Bugfix patchnote:
- Adjust detection radius of certain ennemies, as well as the size of the cones.
- Tweets now hurts your notoriety more hardly.
- Adding a bit more ennemies in the map
- Fix a bug provoking latencies when switching musics

entries.title: Doors
entries.description:
![ss.png](///raw/3ea/2/z/26dd4.png)

## Description

Safely navigate the galaxy by utilizing the largest amount of nothing in the universe: the vacuum of space! Depending on your choices throughout the game, there are 5 different endings!

As the Door Administration Locus (DAL), your purpose is to manage the doors on board a crucial Federation ship. Unfortunately for you, door AIs tend to have a poor reputation of becoming self-aware and killing the inhabitants of their ships. Open doors to the outside of the ship to let the oxygen out. This will put out fires and kill plant life, but also harm crew members.

Balance the ship's __H__ealth meter and the crew's __S__uspicion meter while defeating threats to the mission's success. Beware, if the crew thinks you are attempting to kill them they will attempt to shut you off! The only way to shut you down is if one of the crew walks over to and accesses your terminal in the bottom-right of the ship. Lock the control room door to stall for time!

## Controls

Left Click: Open/Close Door

Right Click: Lock/Unlock Door - The crew must break down locked doors, rather than just walking through them

Z - Open All Doors

X - Close All Doors

C - Lock All Doors

V - Unlock All Doors

Enter - Skip Text


## Good Luck! The Federation is counting on you!

Writers block is a simple clicker game where you play as an uncreative individual who steals peoples ideas from the internet. Selling these ideas will earn you money. With this money you can upgrade your primary research website to find better ideas to steal. You can also purchase upgrades to increase profits from selling ideas, increase speed of finding ideas, and more.

**KNOWN BUGS**

* On occasion you may get an idea with the same name as one you already have.
* The layering of the pop up screens is not perfect, sometimes when you already have a window open a new pop up will appear behind it.
* You can earn enough money to cause an integer overflow and the amount of money you have will loop back to the lowest digit an int can hold.

**BUGS FIXED AFTER COMPO**

* Fixed title screen not loading when you return to the main menu during the start tutorial
* Fixed UI Scaling Issues
* Fixed some typos
* Changed title screen to suit more aspect ratios

You are Poppy, a newly arrived demon in Hell. But despite your employer's reassuring words and visible enthusiasm, you feel anxious to meet him. Is there a reason to that fear?

In Poppy, you start with nothing, not even a level to play on. As you move through it, the level reveals. The game is made of three different levels with different gameplay.

Controls:

 * ⇦ ⇩ ⇧ ⇨ or WASD to move (you can use two different controls in the settings)

![SC2.png](///raw/a82/e/z/26958.png)

 * Engine: Unity 2019.2

 * 3D Graphics: Blender and MagicaVoxel

 * SFX: Bfxr
 * Music: Wolfram Tones

Goals for this LD:

 * Improve 3D modeling

Thank you for trying my game, I hope you have as much fun playing it as I had making it!

entries.title: Leptogenesis
entries.description:
![Skärmklipp.JPG](///raw/4eb/72/z/2616d.jpg)

**One of the most fundamental philosophical questions of our time is: Why is there something, rather than nothing?**

Leptogenesis is a theory in physics which aims to give an answer, in physical terms: Why does the observable universe have more antimatter than matter? This game is (loosely!) based on this idea, as your mission is to separate antimatter and matter, both created out of nothing, in order to gain a surplus of matter, something. You do this by forcing them apart and preventing them from combining once more, again becoming nothing. 

*Note: I absolutely do not have enough knowledge of physics to actually understand this idea, so take it with a grain of salt! 😅 The game isn't meant to be an accurate representaion of the theory, and I hope any physics majors that happen to play it won't be too discouraged!*

![GameGif2.gif](///raw/4eb/72/z/2614a.gif)

entries.title: Overthought
entries.description:
![Pic2.PNG](///raw/3e7/d1/z/26670.png)

In the beginning, there was nothing.

From that nothingness, something emerged.

Move through the vast void and become something more than what you are.


This is my third jam, and the game I've spent the least time on thus far, and yet I can say I'm happy with the results. It's not as polished as I would've liked it to be, and I definitely would've added more features if I had spent more time on it (enemies is a big thing I'm missing, and a few of the upgrades don't add anything to the gameplay). It's a bit more "artsy" than my previous two entries as I've been wanting to make a more mysterious and vague game for a while. This is also the first time I've made music for a game - well - the first time I've made music for anything, so that's really exciting!

I hope you enjoy my game! Have fun :D

entries.title: Yogurt's Quest
entries.description:
## About

*It started in a dream. A dream of nothing but a spark. Yogurt found himself alone, drifting in space, separated from his one and only friend, Pudding..*

![Intro](///raw/5cf/62/z/264bb.gif)

Yogurt's Quest is a short experimental Platformer in which you *literally* start from nothing. Explore a surrealist dream space as Yogurt and try to find your best friend while avoiding perilous death pits and traps.

The game was made for the Compo and thus I didn't have time to add sounds, unfortunately, so that rating category is disabled. I live-streamed the entire event over on my [Twitch](https://twitch.tv/Aurailus) channel, where you can view the recaps if you want to.

## Development

All of the art was made in Gimp during the 48 hour compo window. The game runs on Phaser 3, and was programmed in Typescript. I did it alone (except for the moral support of my awesome friends) over the past two days, and I hope you like it!

## Screenshots

![ld-1.png](///raw/5cf/62/z/264b9.png)

-

![ld-2.png](///raw/5cf/62/z/264b7.png)

-

![ld-3.png](///raw/5cf/62/z/264ba.png)

## Controls

In the **beginning** section, click the spark and use your mouse to move it around. In the **platforming** section, use Left and Right arrows to move, and space to jump.

## Playing

The "Game (HTML5)" Link below should send you to my website, [Auri.xyz](https://auri.xyz/ld45), which hosts the game. Yogurt's Quest should run on both modern versions of Chrome and Firefox. I haven't tested it on Edge, but I'm not too optimistic about it.

# IMPORTANT
## **The game will not work properly on 144hz displays. I didn't have time to properly implement delta time. Please configure your display or use a 60hz monitor to avoid lightning fast player movement.**

entries.title: Shi no ganbo
entries.description:
![1.gif](///raw/db1/6/z/28f7b.gif)
# [Introduction]
You wake up in a boat with no memory, drifting in the sea of afterlife. The deities that cover the sky watch you drift to shore, where your fate seems to be cemented as a soulless wanderer.

This is, until you find a small shard of yourself. With a slight sense of self you now try to find the answers to your emptiness

## [What is "Shi no ganbō"?]
A side-scrolling platformer that tells a story about loss. Shi no ganbō translates to "Desire of Death", the rest you will have to figure out yourself!

### [Theme]
We really took the theme to heart and tried to make the game revolve around the concept of "starting with nothing". We conveyed the theme directly through gameplay, starting the player off with nothing to defend themselves. We further hammered home the theme through the narrative, which I won't spoil here. 


## **Controls**
- **[W][D] / [Arrow Left] [Arrow Right] - Move**
- **[Spacebar] / [W] / [Arrow Up] - Jump**
- **[Left Mouse Button] - Trigger equipped item in slot nr 1**
- **[Right Mouse Button] - Trigger equipped item in slot nr 2**
- **[E] - Open inventory**
- **[E] - Interact (Pick up, activate)**
- **[Escape] - In game pause**

## [Credits]
-	Belle Rahnasto   - **[Art], [Director]**   - [WindmillGames](https://twitter.com/WindmillGames)
-	Simon Rahnasto   - **[Code], [Producer]**  - [WindmillGames](https://twitter.com/WindmillGames)

entries.title: Something out of Nothing
entries.description:

About the game:


Starting with nothing, break apart the word itself to craft items and create your own unique world. A simplistic game of discovering new items and building a world based on your creative choices.


Thank you for playing and rating!


=[]=====[]=========[]==[]====[]==

• Mixcraft 8

• Audacity

entries.title: Nightwatch
entries.description:
Multiplayer game

![Skärmavbild 2019-10-06 kl. 05.31.51.png](///raw/cc2/c/z/25fed.png)

***As a nightwatch,*** _you thought your shift would look like any other - nothing to report._
***As an experienced thief,*** _you thought this job would be as any other - undisturbed.
But not this time._


You or your friend are going to try to **steal as much as you can from safes** that are spread out in different rooms.
Meanwhile the other is **trying to catch you** red-handed.
Then you **switch places.**
The one that stole for the **highest value wins.**


**Thief Controls:**
* Move - WASD
* Action - E
* Flashlight - F


**Nightwatch Controls:**
* Move - ARROWS
* Arrest - SPACE

![Nightwatch.gif](///raw/cc2/c/z/261ee.gif)

entries.title: When Nothing Came
entries.description:
* point and click mechanics (move with arrows and click to interact with words and objects)
* the story is short but there are lots of hidden things (THERE IS AN END and its like 5 min from the start if you just ignore most stuff)

Sometimes a deep sadness comes from nowhere, it starts from nothing ... she looks and searches every part of us .. 
This is a prototype of interactive poetry ... and also a very personal approach to the LD45 theme.

I always like being part of this awesome event that is Ludum Dare
this time though the theme became quite personal ...

we always struggle with the time available and the need to create something ... entertaining ..
however, after lots of game jams I think perhaps ... just perhaps ... entertaining is just not my thing ... 
... so this is possibly a "not-a-game" depending on your definition on that

The idea here was to create a sorta interactive poetry
something we have been trying to explore for a while
Although its not polished as intended, nor dynamic as intended
it is a rough prototype of what we were trying to convey

Art by https://www.instagram.com/nataliarrubio/
Music and sound by https://soundcloud.com/janyork
Overall workaround by Velvetlobster

btw ... the colors are a reference for the Yellow September

I would love to know what you think of this

entries.title: gaarden
entries.description:
Take a break. Come play in the gaarden.

![preview.gif](///raw/f5/z/288d3.gif)

gaarden is equal parts about interaction and observation.

Controls:
Mouse

# [Come play! (Web, HTML5)](http://jezzamon.com/gaarden)

----

From Wikipedia: "4X is a genre of strategy-based video and board games in which players control an empire and eXplore, eXpand, eXploit, and eXterminate".

gaarden is designed to be the opposite of that. In gaarden you have no empire, and to start with, there is no world. There is no win condition or ending. Just a blank canvas. But there's life waiting to be discovered...

If you're looking to see everything, here's a list of all the things you can find:

- Egg
- Tree
- House
- Mountain
- Human
- Baby Human
- Animal
- Giant

Have a nice day :)

----

## Post-compo changelog:
To port to mobile I made the following changes:
- Handle touch events as well as mouse events
- Make the touch targets of things larger
- Make the game larger on smaller screens
- Separate game update loop from rendering so slower devices can run the game

entries.title: Thief!
entries.description:
You play as a lost person that has no money and has to pickpocket others to get enough for a ticket home.

Play in fullscreen mode (everything is very small) but there may be bugs with some resolutions.

CONTROLS: 

PRESS LMB - for movement towards cursor

RMB with LMB for moving at higher speed

E - to start pickpocketing and to finish it when the white indicator is in the green zone

E - to enter the shop

Escape - to go the main menu (progress will be lost)

To pickpocket you need to get behind person and stand in his shadow (your character becomes darker).
![123.gif](///raw/d92/3/z/2689d.gif)


If you get ahead of him or stop pickpocketing in the red zone he will detect you and cops will come after you.
![999.gif](///raw/d92/3/z/26969.gif)

If you step out of his shadow while pickpocketing he will see you but cops won't come after you, but this will slide only once.

In the shop you can buy items that will benefit you while stealing and you can buy the ticket which will end the game.
![ырщз.png](///raw/d92/3/z/267e2.png)


If you didnt steal enough money at the end of the day to get yourself food it's game over.

The game was made in gamemaker and the few sounds were made in sfxr.

entries.title: Negation
entries.description:
*#Fixed game breaking bug that sometimes prevented next level from loading and subtitles desync*

*#Added HTML5 port (though Windows version looks **a lot** prettier)*

*#Changed default quality setting for Windows build (it was "very low" before and ruined the lighting)*

If you stuck on the first puzzles you can use **Walkthrough** below! Or use **manual level transitions** by left **ALT + 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 0**!



Negation is a logical operator that, well, negates anything it is applied to.

You're about to experience this many times on many layers throughout this short puzzle with original concept, voiced narration, surreal imagery and music.

*Ivan Pensionerov - code, design*

*Igor Vaiman - narration, music, design*

### Walkthrough (spoiler alert!)
This is a walkthrough of the first few levels, that may help you if you don't know what to do!
#### Level 1
Apply negation to the lock with LMB on the door to open the door. **You have 3 slots for your negations.** Use keys 1, 2, 3 to clear the slots and undo negation.

#### Level 2
Collect the word LOCK. You can negate not only single objects, but the concepts of them as well. Negate all the locks on the door, by choosing the word LOCK in the right part of the screen with the mouse wheel and clickng RMB. Note that twice no means yes, so if you have negated some of the locks individually they will appear after negating the concept of locks!

#### Level 3
Collect the word TEAPOT. Pick up one of the teapots from the pile using F key and place it on a pedestal, to disable the machine locking the door. Then negate that teapot and negate the concept TEAPOT to clear the way to the door. 

![1.png](///raw/fe1/72/z/27dff.png)![2.png](///raw/fe1/72/z/27e29.png)![3.png](///raw/fe1/72/z/27e2d.png)

entries.title: There were 8 hours left and I decided I wanted to participate after all
entries.description:
A quick game I whipped up seeing how LD was about to end and I had nothing. Didn't have time to give it a title so I just went with... that. Or "8 Hours" for short. Has nothing to do with the gameplay.

![Screenshot 2019-10-08 00-05-32.png](///raw/1d3/2/z/281cd.png)

### Here's some tips!

- You need to collect all four pieces of the ancient armor. Each piece gives you special buffs!
- You get armor from slimes. Shiny ones have a higher chance of dropping pieces!
- Try not to die. You'll be untouchable as long as you swing your sword, but don't let them overwhelm you with numbers!
- If you're having a tough time, try extinguishing torches. I heard it's the fire that makes slimes so agressive.

![digberto.gif](///raw/1d3/2/z/281c6.gif)

### Buffs provided by armor:

**Heroic Helmet** - Killing slimes heals you

**Cool Chestplate** - Your max HP is increased by 2

**Gigantic Gauntlets** - All slimes are a one-hit kill

**Bouncy Boots** - Get an extra jump mid-air

The game is a standalone .exe file - just launch it from your downloads folder and have some fun!

![digbertini.gif](///raw/1d3/2/z/281d6.gif)

#### Controls:
Arrows - run left/right;
Spacebar - jump;
A - attack (S in Revised version);
E - pick up items (D in Revised version);

entries.title: Nill
entries.description:
![logo.png](///raw/8ff/6/z/28980.png)You find yourself with a box of nothing... but nothing is all you need: use "nothing" in a box to confuse enemies to safely traverse the treacherous maze.

Now with controller support!

Use WASD or the Arrow Keys to move

Use E or Enter to activate your confusion ability

Use P or Esc to access the pause menu and settings

Use Spacebar to skip the intro cutscene

You can also use the mouse to control the camera

When you come across an enemy, they will attack if you get too close within line of sight. They can see you when "!" appears above their head. You cannot use your ability while they are looking at you! Instead, you must sneak up behind them or surprise them. (Or just get by really fast.) If you successfully use your confusion ability, a "?" will temporarily appear above their head and they will not harm you.

Update:
Added ability to skip opening cutscene due to rewatching every time you die
Added controller support: Left stick to move, Right stick for camera, Left face button to use ability, and start to pause or skip cutscenes
Fixed a bug where a torch would appear in front of the camera during ending cutscene

entries.description:

A short ASCII based puzzle platformer. Type commands in the terminal to help build your world and find your way to the next level.

## Controls
* Use arrow keys to move
* **space** or up arrow to jump
* **enter** brings up "command mode" which will allow you to type commands.

## Commands
* /h - At anytime you can type /h for help info or commands available to you.
* ls - lists files and directories in your current directory.
* open - opens a file or directory
* clear - clears and resets your terminal

entries.title: Start with a Click
entries.description:
## Introduction
This is a minimalistic clicker game. I wanted to make it very intuitive, so there is not much of a tutorial, I hope you can figure everything out by yourself.

Only one thing is not obvious and is not explained properly: 
# you can drag and drop squares from bottom block

There is an end to the game, it takes about 10-15 min and requires some thinking :)

Do not read further if you'd like to figure everything yourself! 
## Play the game now
https://maks-c.itch.io/start-with-a-click








## How the game works and what you can do:
**(spoilers, read only if you've played and didn't figure everything out yourself)**
* You have 4 blocks, each is clickable
* You can create dots by clicking on right block
* You can collect any dots flying on middle block by clicking the block (only 5 at a time will be collected)
* Collected dots accumulate in the bottom block and group by 4, creating a bigger dots
* Dots from bottom block can be dragged to any other block
* If a dot is put into right block, it will click it automatically, bigger dot results in more frequent clicks
* If a dot is put into middle block, it creates a circle, any flying dot that comes in contact with it will be collected. Circle needs a time to recharge after dot hit
* If a dot is put into left block, it will be destroyed and bar inside the block will fill
* Any dot that has flied through middle block and wasn't collected will also fill the left block bar
* Bar on the left block fills and decays quickly

Thank you for playing and leave a comment if you figured out how to beat the game :)

entries.title: ØJE
entries.description:
![banner.png](///raw/f48/c/z/28c05.png)

## Yøu play as a character in a cøld, distant and desertic land. But sømething seems to look at yøu...

For this Ludum Dare entry, we propose a 2D platførmer. We interpreted the theme "Start with nøthing" in terms of level design: at first, the level seems empty, making yøu cross the entire scene with nøthing else than a distant wind sound. Yøu can even finish the game just like this! But if you pick up the first coin, the level progressively reveals itself to yøur eye(s), allowing you to explore the same level again and again, each time with new features and an increasing difficulty.

![controls.gif](///raw/f48/c/z/28c25.gif)

![23d1b.png](///raw/f48/c/z/28c09.png)

-----

**Made by:** Julian & Thibaud & Julien & [Leønaaard](https://dribbble.com/Leonaaard)

**Music credits:** [Cellulous](https://www.deezer.com/fr/album/86049942) by Ben Lukas Boysen & Sebastian Plano

-----

entries.title: Blank (Demo)
entries.description:
Here's our first Ludum Dare game ever! It was fun to see how much you can accomplish in 2 days :smiley_cat:


It's a short puzzle platformer in which you start with a blank canvas which goes along with the theme "Start with nothing". Choose the platforms which will lead you to the end of the level. There's the challenge of finding the right path as well as using your platforming skills to pass it.

**Game Jolt:** https://gamejolt.com/games/blank-demo/443447

**Controls:**
Left click on platforms to spawn / despawn them.
WSAD or arrow keys to walk and jump.

## If enough people are interested, we'll make it into a full game! :smile_cat:

![Blank GIF.gif](///raw/fde/92/z/28d2f.gif)

entries.title: Allow
entries.description:
This is a simple puzzle platformer. The theme of ludum dare this year was "Start with nothing." Allow interprets this by having you start with no win conditions, or "goals" as they're called. You will have to think about which goals to pickup and when in order to complete each level.

entries.title: Robomata
entries.description:
Second Ludum Dare and glad of what I accomplished!

I wasn't too inspired with the theme since I thought it was too broad, but I ended up doing a platformer where you start as a broken robot with no modules attached, not even camera movement!
You have to find new modules and make your way to the end of the factory.

**Tools used**
- Construct 2 (Engine)
- Paint.NET (Graphics)
- Pyxel Edit (Graphics)
- Bfxr (Audio)
- Otomata (Music)

**How to play**

Controls are all indicated in the game but for reference:
- Use WASD/arrow keys and space to move around.
- Use the 'C' key to open up the console.
- Left Click: Grapple.
- Right Click: Flamethrower.

The game is a little short with only 2 levels, but I ran out of time on my planning of doing another level and adding one more module, let me know your thoughts in the comments below, enjoy!

![2.PNG](///raw/02e/7/z/264c9.png)
![3.png](///raw/02e/7/z/2651a.png)

entries.title: Armada
entries.description:
Armada is dodge-em up/shooter where you start with nothing but a lone mothership planning to invade planets, and you have to grow your armada on the way by taking more ships in.

![ArmadaGIFCompressed.gif](///raw/d8e/z/273c4.gif)

## Controls and How To Play
- Arrow keys to move.
- X/Space to shoot (if there is a fireship attached).

- To connect to another ship, be in their visible radius for specified amount of time (explained better in-game). While connecting - if you collide with the ship, or move too far away from the specified radius, the connection will break and the connecting ship will be destroyed.

- Avoid asteroids (or shoot them down). Note that if your mothership dies, the whole armada falls apart.

- Every planet serves as a checkpoint. You need an armada with at least X amount of ships to invade a planet when you reach that checkpoint (X is shown in HUD).

- You gain score for distance travelled + having more ships in your fleet than X.

Made by Diptoman Mukherjee (Programming, design), Pranjal Bisht (Art, design) and Joel Montpetit (Audio) for LD45.

## Screens
![Screenshot1.png](///raw/d8e/z/2732d.png)

entries.title: Simple? Tower Defense
entries.description:
A concept as simple as tower defense can become very strange if you don't start with anything.
You better pray for a miracle.

UPDATE NOTE:
I have done a post compo update to fix some bugs, here is the change list:
 - Fixed being able to select a tower when you don't have enough coins for it
 - Fixed some tileset issues in map03, this fixes come layering issues and some tile variations not being used
 - Towers can't be placed on paths anymore in map03
 - Fixed being able to place certain towers over another

This probably should have been part of in game dialogue, but the cannon tower shoots in all 4 directions in a straight line.

I am fairly satisfied with the game itself, but the later levels are a bit more rushed.
Also i didn't have the time to make any music, so I'll encourage you to play with your own !
![Screenshot_49.png](///raw/cab/1/z/269a1.png)
![Screenshot_50.png](///raw/cab/1/z/269a6.png)

entries.title: Nothing Matters
entries.description:
![splashScreen.png](///raw/1f5/2/z/2765c.png)


## You have NOTHING. But NOTHING matters.

*Nothing Matters* is a puzzle-platformer where you cave your way up a mountain in search for your stolen THING. The THINGLESS you, however, can count on the incredible power of NOTHING!

Controls:   
⠀⠀WASD to move   
⠀⠀Mouse to interact  

If you play on the Web version, please hit F11 to enable fullscreen!

**WARNING**: this game pictures spiders

## Version 1.0.5 changelog

+ Fix objects disappearing when teleported into the nothing
+ Fix bugs in the Web version
+ Fix projectile collision to the back of the player not working
+ Fix level layout where objects were out of bounds
+ Fix teleport not working at the edge of the nothing
+ More physics fixes
+ Fix teleport SFX playing too many times

## Version 1.0.4 changelog

+ More bugfixes in the physics
  + You no longer ocasionally swap places with teleported objects
  + You no longer jump for no reason
  + Improved collision geometries
  + And more
+ Balance gravity parameters
+ Bugfixes related to spamming right-click
+ Bugfixes related to the shield
+ Bugfixes related to graphics

## Version 1.0.3 changelog

+ Bugfixes in physics attributes and geometries
+ Improved feedback for enemy deaths
+ Bugfixes in enemy behavior
+ Avoid item sprites being hidden by props

![ezgif.com-gif-maker_2.gif](///raw/c6c/12/z/29392.gif)

In this short mesmerizing clicker you have a chance to solve the celestial mystery by creating your own constellations.
Begin with starless night sky and lit your way to victory!


Art: Scherbakov Alexander
 
Gamedesign & FX: Mosin Alexander
 
Code: Dmitrii Goriachev, Tutov Alexander
 
Music by Lee Rosevere and Daniel Birch - Event Horizon


Here are some tips if you are stuck:
- doble click to create a star
- drag a star on another to merge

- do not merge stars with different size and colors - you will damage it
- take time, and discover effect of each star
- enjoy!

entries.title: Empty Level
entries.description:
*** EN ***

Empty Level is an action/reflection game in which you must successfully complete 10 levels on which you yourself place components.

The placement of components is controlled  with the mouse and the movement of the character with the keyboard arrows.

To place a component in the level, select it in the lower interface and place it on the screen (the green cursor indicates that you can place it there, otherwise the cursor is red).

Move: Keyboard arrow or WASD

Components position: Mouse (left click)

*** FR ***

Empty Level est un jeu d'action/réflexion dans lequel vous devez réussir 10 niveaux sur lesquels vous disposez vous même les éléments.

Le placement des éléments se fait à la souris et le déplacement du perso avec les flèches du clavier

Pour placer un élément dans le niveau, il faut le sélectionner dans l'interface du bas et le placer sur l'écran (le curseur vert indique que vous pouvez le placer à cet endroit sinon le curseur est rouge).

Déplacement : Flèche du clavier ou WASD

Position des éléments : Souris (clic gauche)

entries.title: JustStart
entries.description:
So the theme says "Start with nothing". But I think it be hard to actually start a game with literally "nothing". I think many LDer might design a game where you earn basic game function or sth like that. I wanna go different.

And this occurs to me: A scene with nothing but only the word "start". Then I think of making a game that urge you to start it but just won`t start.

I made a puzzle game that focus on the part in a game before the game starts. I did not wanna waste my friends' time(cuz I might quit this any time) so I only have myself, and I'm a kinda lazy person, so I only made 5 levels. Sorry about that!


This Game only involves left click and scroll wheel of the mouse. No key on the keyboard is needed.

I ran into some problem but I think I had fixed it. Please leave a comment if anything is wrong again.
And also, please mention if you got stuck at any level. I have no idea whether players will think as the way I assumed.



![cover.png](///raw/126/32/z/26f07.png)![1.png](///raw/126/32/z/26f08.png)![2.png](///raw/126/32/z/26f09.png)![3.png](///raw/126/32/z/26f0a.png)

entries.title: Red Rush
entries.description:
![header-630x208.png](///raw/6cb/9/z/28218.png)

**Gameplay**

Red Rush is a puzzle game set on Mars.

You must find all the gold on each stage to progress. You can find gold on the ground, or you must drill into rocks using your buggy to collect the gold.

Beware that you have a limited amount of battery charge in your buggy, moving and drilling will deplete the charge. You can pay to recharge your buggy at the solar charge pad (an "X" on the ground).

To pay for charge you need to have money. To get money you must sell some gold that you gathered. You can sell gold at the gold deposit/drive-thru.


**Controls**

You can use WASD or Arrows to move and Spacebar to drill.

Most screens use either Escape to cancel/pause, and Enter to confirm/unpause.


**Credits**

Design and Art: 
https://helpcomputer.itch.io/ 
https://twitter.com/helpcomputer0

Sound and Music: 
http://bibikigarcia.com/ 
https://twitter.com/BibikiGL 

![rr-gameplay01.gif](///raw/6cb/9/z/2861e.gif)

Every level of the game start empty. There is just the starting plateform, your character and his objectives. You need to place the platforms to help him and win the game.
