entries.title: Sluggish Grind
entries.description:
**Arrow keys**: Move

**Space bar**: Jump

**X**: Interact

**Z**: Shoot


You're a deeply indebted slug who needs to get 100 coins quick, but no job can get you the money you need as fast as you need it.

It's time to visit the dungeon, where you will find plenty coin-and-slug-devouring jellycats, a lonely dragon shopkeeper and many coins among deadly traps.

Go from slow, frail and helpless to absolutely berserk and extremely mobile as you collect coins and purchase tools essential for a successful expedition to the depths

Once you have all the coins you need, make a safe return to the top and bask in the glory of an extremely rewarding and enjoyable end screen.

[Edit: Added Windows & Linux links even though they also lead to itch.io for clarity]
[Edit2: Added source code link to GitHub repo]

entries.title: Entangled
entries.description:
What will you do if you lose everything? Will you give up and move on or will you desperately try to make it right over and over again?

This is a little story about a villain, who is possessed with the desire to undo his past mistakes and ready to leave the world to crumble, and a hero, who have no choice but to chase him through time.

Controls:
* WASD
* Space to jump
* E to interact
* F or LMB to attack
* You can attack upwards or downwards if you hold W or S

Some screenshots:

![screenshot2.png](///raw/c0f/z/26f2b.png)

![screenshot1.png](///raw/c0f/z/26907.png)

entries.title: Soundsearcher
entries.description:
A minimalist auditory exploration game. This game is designed for playing with your eyes closed. Headphones are strongly recommended. [Click here to play.](https://nicross.github.io/soundsearcher/)

![screenshot](///raw/d3d/02/z/267ca.png)

## Controls
The user interface provides controls for forward and backward movement and turning left and right:
- **Mouse:** Hover over the edges of the screen
- **Touch:** Tap and hold the edges of the screen

**Keyboard** controls allow play with one or both hands:
- WASD for movement
- QE or arrow keys for orientation

**Gamepad** support is provided for controllers with one or two analog sticks

## Objective
**You start with nothing.** The world is filled with harmless creatures and sounds. And things to pick up:
- Footsteps
- Compass
- Three synthesizers that change pitch as you explore

Each play is randomized. Reload to start over.

## Technical information
- Vanilla JavaScript
- No base code, external libraries, or tools
- All sounds synthesized via Web Audio API

### Engine features
- Procedurally generated world
- 2d spatial audio system
- Movement physics

## Changelog
These issues were addressed after submission:
- Added sounds to start area so players can check their volume
- Balanced volume levels
- Improved browser compatibility and mobile-friendliness
- Fixed creatures effects
- Fixed distances between pickups

These changes were merged after voting ended:
- Updated control scheme, including basic gamepad support
- Improved compass and collectibles
- More ambient sounds
- Improved starting area
- Object culling (a performance optimization for folks who travel far)
- Increased ambient spawn count
- Gradually increase spawning from starting point
- Collectible reward after returning home with all other collectibles
- Various codebase improvements

entries.title: Confined Space
entries.description:
You wanted to go to the open outer space but now you are in the Confined Space.
You start with nothing.
You need to build a rocket that would take you out — checkpoint by checkpoint.


🚀 This is a physics-based puzzle game with indirect control. 

🚀 You can choose one of two hull shapes for your rocket. Then add thrusters to it. There are four types of thrusters: forward, backward, left-sided and right-sided. There are two important mechanics you can use to control thrusters:
- Drag them around to change where their force is applied. This can result in acceleration and/or rotation, blah blah physics...
- Change when they kick in and stop working. For this select a thruster and drag those orange triangular marks. Pink fuel bar will gradually decrease when the rocket is launched, indicating when a thruster is turned on and off.

Play around and learn to use these features to get the rocket where you want it!

🚀 **Note:** sometimes you can accidentally click on a thruster button several time, resulting in adding multiple thrusters stacked on top of each other and totally not see it! I only realised it later when watching people play (and would not have time to fix it during *compo*) so *fixing* this by letting you know, so it's not a bug, it's a feature!

Some screenshots:
![2019-10-06 22-29-23.mp4_snapshot_00.04_[2019.10.06_22.37.01].png](///raw/2bd/d1/z/263c4.png)

entries.title: Deal with your Death
entries.description:
**On Halloween night even _Death_ doesn’t want to play by the rules.** Your life has come to the End. Nothing awaits ahead. But Death gives one last chance: if you manage to defend the Fire of your Soul from Death servants, at the end of the night It gives you a new life.

And if not, you will forever sink into Oblivion.

But… will this night ever end?

Fight for your life:
https://test.octothorp.team/ludumdare45

![unknown (7).png](///raw/754/e1/z/28381.png)

Death puts you in the world of its little game. A terrible creepy forest surrounds you. Who knows what lives in it? But you have no tools and weapon so you should get the courage and go deeper into it. There you can find valuable resources: stone, wood and grass. Raw materials can be used to create traps and protective structures. Use traps to defeat enemies and fences to protect the bonfire!

![unknown.png](///raw/754/e1/z/283ae.png)

**Finish all preparations before the moon turns red!** When the Bloodmoon occurs, the enemies begin to attack the bonfire and try to extinguish it.

***To protect your Soul Fire you can:***
- Build wood fences
- Use mantraps
- Use a trap with falling stone
- Throw stones in enemies
- Pull the enemy back with a rope (you can collect grass to get rope)

![2019-10-08_01-46-28.png](///raw/754/e1/z/28462.png)

If enemies get to the fire, its flame becomes weaker. Throw the wood into the bonfire to help it flare up. If the bonfire goes out, the game ends. But you always can try one more time… and more… and more… It seems Death wants to play with your forever…

So don’t be surprised if something in this forest is not going according to your plan… All this – you know – flying staff, strange shadows, sky instead of ground… because death will never allow itself to be beaten!

***Enjoy our spooky (and cute) Halloween monsters:***
- Insidious pumpkins, jack-o’-lantern
- Jumping spiders
- Ghosts ~~seems sweet but really evil~~
- Ancient skulls from your nightmares

***Character Control:***
- *W/A/S/D* – move
- *Left button* – use item
- *Mouse wheel* – switch between items
- *E* – craft menu

Deal with your Death and try to beat other players in our LD-45 game! We hope you enjoy it! Unfortunately, there are a lot of bugs in the game now but you know all this first-bug-fix-day stuff…  We are going to fix all bugs soon so we appreciate all bug-reports and feedback! We hope that together we can improve our little game :smile: And of course make screenshots of all funny moments and bugs! Let’s laugh together before Halloween :joy:

**This is our collection:**

- the road of mantraps

![unknown (2).png](///raw/754/e1/z/28319.png)

- they probably have a party

![unknown (5).png](///raw/754/e1/z/28338.png)

- a spider has new cute stone dress

![unknown (6).png](///raw/754/e1/z/28358.png)

- interesting point of view

![2019-10-08_01-46-53.png](///raw/754/e1/z/2846e.png)

- something interesting, guys?

![2019-10-08_01-50-12.png](///raw/754/e1/z/284c7.png)

## Changelog

**v1.0**

- Initial release

**v1.1**

- Map generation (yes, it's random every game) was scaled down, so "the biomes" like forest should be more dense
- Tweaked resources requirements for craft recipes
- Lowered camera sensitivity


- Fixed mining process being interrupted
- Fixed sprint (with Shift) matching walk speed, now it's a little bit faster
- Fixed weird movement bugs like camera flipping
- Fixed weird crafted structures placement
- Fixed some recipes disappeared from craft menu

entries.title: MetaSpace

entries.title: Seven Dwarves Brawl
entries.description:
![screenshot.png](///raw/ad9/z/26668.png)

What a curious name for a card game! Try to not score any points.

**Game Hints**
- With a score of seven or above you lose. If you make it through the entire deck of 35 you win.
- If you get a pair with any hand you score points equal to the cards value. A dwarf is worth 8.
- You can fold for the value of the smallest card.
- If a dwarf card has been dealt you may fold without scoring any points but you draw one additinal card.

**Design Process**
I started with a physical prototype to figure out working game mechanics. The programming started with some crude placeholder art which got gradually more refined towards the end of the project. 

**Target Platforms**
The game works in any browser and has been tested on various Android and iOS devices. There is a glitch when rotating the device while cards are being dealt.

**Tools used**
Sublime Text, Adobe Illustrator 

**Typefaces**
Cocotte Heavy, Futura Medium+Bold, Abril Fatface

entries.title: The Island
entries.description:
## The Island
![theIsland.png](///raw/cff/11/z/27d84.png)

**Controls:**

You will need your **left mouse button to pick** and **right mouse** button **to cancel the selection**

How to:

Click to buy an item from the bar. Place the object on an island
![place_object.gif](///raw/cff/11/z/2761b.gif)
Placed object generates coins per X seconds
![cooins.gif](///raw/cff/11/z/2761d.gif)
If you click way too much on the object, you will destroy it eventually
Clicking on placed object generates additional coin. You can unlock many items. You can also expand your island by buying a new tile



**With each new tile**, you will loose all that is on your island, and you will have to **START WITH NOTHING** again, so make sure to have some spare money!

Can you reach the Last Tile? Can you reach the Last Item from the list? **SHARE SCREENSHOTS** from your islands and show us who’s got the nicest Island out there!

## This game is supposted to be relaxing, not challenging!


Code by [Sanguis](https://twitter.com/MalusSanguis)

Art/music by [Jin9310](https://twitter.com/Jin93101)

We use: Aseprite, GameMaker Studio 2, Bosca Ceoil





Thank you for Your time, playing our game!

entries.title: Lost Temple of the Monkey God
entries.description:
![temple_view.jpg](///raw/18/z/281ae.jpg)

You are exploring a lost ruin looking for treasure. You don’t have anything with you, so you’ll need to pick up some skills during your exploration in order to find what you need.

As you raid the temple, you may find ancient carvings that will give you the ability to access previously inaccessible areas. Look for the owl, which will give you the wisdom to understand your surroundings (a map), the fish, which will let you swim deeply, the eagle which will let you double-jump, and see if you can get to the Monkey Statue hidden at the end!

# Controls

WASD - Move; Space to Jump. 
Shift to Sprint.
C to Crouch.
E to Interact.
Esc to adjust settings.

# Blessings 

There are three blessings in the game:

* **Owl** - Gives you a minimap which may reveal secret areas!
* **Fish** - Gives ability to swim down
* **Eagle** - Gives you the ability to double jump and reach secret ledges. 

# Pickups

![coin.png](///raw/18/z/29b8f.png)
**Coin:**  Certain coin doors only allow the extremely wealthy to pass through. If you collect enough coins you may be able to cross through to the other side.
![pot.png](///raw/18/z/29b92.png)
**Pots:**  May sometimes contain coins - besides, what temple explorer does not break ancient pottery?
![relic.png](///raw/18/z/29b93.png)
**Relic:**  Golden Monkey Statue - find this to end the game. 

# Objects

** Coin Doors **

![coindoor.png](///raw/18/z/29b8e.png)
Coin doors require a certain amount of coins to pass through. 

** Pressure Plates **

![plate.png](///raw/18/z/29b8d.png)
Pressure plates do a number of things - try to figure out how each one works to solve the challenges that lay ahead. 

** Snake Statues ** 

![snek.png](///raw/18/z/29b8b.png)

Snake statues can be pushed around. They look heavy, but their design incorporates light materials used for easy moving during worship ceremonies. 

** Metallic Orbs ** 
![orb.png](///raw/18/z/29b96.png)
Mysterious rusty metal balls can be found in the temple - presumably they used to fit somewhere else...

# LD Rating Information

All sound effects and audio was made by clips taken from past LD projects since our main sound guy was unable to compose / foley any new sound effects. We did what we could to use existing sounds to create an effective atmosphere, but we have opted out of the sound category as none of the sound effects used were created during the course of the LD, just arranged and structured.

Level design was done by using a level creation tool we have created that allows us to snap geometry together.
We also used a base "kit" of some Unity extensions and tools to allow us to do proper data management and serialization. 
We reused a settings UI generator we made for past projects, but reconstructed all prefabs to match the aesthetic of this game. The player was constructed by taking the Kinematic Player Controller plugin and writing specific movement states for this jam. All gameplay code and game elements were created for LD45. All models and materials were made during the jam as well. 

Post LD Additions:
* Added a title screen and ending screen (the original version started you right in the game, and the ending was a simple "you win" screen). 
* Fixed a number of bugs where builds would bug out with the audio system which caused our scripts to throw exception and most people to not be able to get past the first area. 
* Changed balance on coin door counts to make not all of the coins necessary. 
* Added telemetry and metrics so that we can see how well people playing our game did. (Information such as, number of pots smashed, number of coins found, etc.).
* Added a loading screen to properly load audio system for WebGL version. 
* Fixed a bug where a certain door did not serialize its state properly across level loads (didn't affect gameplay, but felt kind of weird to have to open the same coin door twice).

entries.title: Memory Palace
entries.description:
Memory Palace: A game about (you guessed it) testing your memory.

When I think of Start with Nothing, I think of how clueless I am whenever I start something... like this jam! So I decided to make a game about that. 

Hope you enjoy!

entries.title: Winter
entries.description:
Try to find shelter in the harsh wilderness. Follow the trails of yellow sparkles. Offer trinkets to fires to reveal new trails. There are 4 trinkets around the environment.

If there are any bugs please let me know, something always slips by in game jams.

https://fashionbatman.itch.io/winter

Controls

Walk: Arrow Keys/WASD

Interact: Space Bar

![LD45gif2.gif](///raw/aab/z/267d5.gif)


If you're having trouble finding the trinkets, they are usually found sort of near the camp fires.

*update - I increased the speed in the movement and the small boost you get after leaving a fire by 0.5, so now the speed the main speed is 1.5 and the boost is 2. Hopefully that's is okay, and it makes it feel slightly better without changing much.

*update 2 - fixed a bug that prevented moving when holding multiple trinkets and standing near a fire and on a yellow sparkle all at the same time

*update 3 - fixed a typo and alignment on one piece of text

entries.title: Yöso
entries.description:
You're a small and cute ghost called Yöso. Starting with nothing, gather the power of the three elements given by the gods to defeat the evil elementals!
Change your form to defeat your enemies: fire beats grass, grass beats water and water beats fire.
Catch fireballs while you are in fire elemental form to raise your fire level!
When you are a grass ghost - catch herbal attacks!
Well, being a ghost of water - just catch water!
But be careful, otherwise the consequences will be catastrophic ...



![yoso.png](///raw/050/82/z/27968.png)

entries.title: tile.flip()
entries.description:
# Description

tile.flip() is a puzzle game, inspired by Minesweeper. Click on tiles to flip them, but tiles also flip some of their adjacent tiles. Your goal is to flip every tile over to the black side, unless that tile is a bomb. Flipping over a bomb will result in "game over." Try to complete each puzzle as quickly as possible.

![screen1.PNG](///raw/0d1/z/2686a.png)

# Theme

I tried to think of games that already exist and are both simple and fit the theme. Minesweeper came to mind because starting with no information about the puzzle leads to an interesting randomness in your starting position. I tried to replicate that randomness that originates from a lack of information with tile.flip().

# Tutorial

Just click on the white square to begin the game. There is not in game tutorial because (i) I didn't have time and (ii) I tried to make the game simple enough that people can figure it out quickly on their own.

# Advertisement

If you like game jams, and I know you do, check out the Philosophy Game Jam I'm hosting at itch.io. https://itch.io/jam/philgamejam-2

entries.title: Ships, Sharks and Shanties
entries.description:
Ulf the Viking would like to survive as long as possible. That could be a lot easier, had his ship not just met its demise due to an unexpected clash with a megalodon. As it is, Ulf must gather enough driftwood to build a new ship, reach new Highscores, and try to escape the gigantic maelstrom that suddenly appeared. All those hungry sharks and other viking ships shooting at him are not helping either.

As the developers we can tell you that Ulf will not succeed. The end of this game will always be Ulf drowning. It’s a tragedy; however, we included some happy music to lift your spirits.

![screenshot01.png](///raw/fbd/32/z/27d60.png)

![screenshot03.png](///raw/fbd/32/z/27d5d.png)

entries.title: Scrawl A Draw
entries.description:
'Scrawl A Draw' lets you "start with nothing!"

It's a game that lets you draw anything you want!
The only limit is your IMAGINATION!

Requires Flash + keyboard.

The controls are based on the classic game: Etch A Sketch, and as such, are a bit tricky to get used to (Left hand = up/down, right hand = left/right)!!

Game made with Stencyl.
Music made from scratch, by me.

About me:

I'm a composer, not a game developer!  But I like to challenge myself at game jams as much as possible.  Scrawl A Draw is very simple by design because I spent most of the weekend making the music for this and three other LD games. :persevere: 

Thanks for playing!

p.s. - If you draw something pretty, please upload a screenshot!  I'd love to see what kind of art people come up with.

entries.title: Amphibian Aura
entries.description:
![frogwindows_screensh_sO6gp.jpg](///raw/167/82/z/28f60.jpg)

About the game:

You are recruiting allies for the old frogman Croak. He cannot fight himself. You can choose between different classes of allies to hire in the Town view. Allies are placed in sixths of the circle around Croak and you can swap their positions. Enemies are spawned accordingly in a circle around you. 

If an enemy is facing an empty sixth he will attack Croak (the big health bar around all the allies) you need to rotate your setup to use each turn most effectively, because if Croak dies, you lose. Allies also have abilities that are detailed in the game.
![giphy (1).gif](///raw/167/82/z/28f71.gif)


Remember to use your abilities by clicking on them. The early rounds can be dull so you can skip through them using space, but as the complexity of encounters ramps up you will need to do a lot of decision-making to come out of encounters alive. Once you get a full 6 allies the game will endlessly put you against 6 random enemies. The game has no end yet.

Development:

Unity 2019.2.8f1

Blender

Audacity


Post-jam update:
v1.1

-Fixed multiple combat bugs

-Tried to fix save system but actually failed

v1.2

-Save system now works 100% of the time!!!
(before it wouldn't save allies if they weren't clockwise one after another starting from the top)

-Tutorial has more basic stuff so you don't miss it

-Fixed Croak moving too fast in Town view

-Enemies no longer make sounds if hit when dead

-Boat technology

v1.2.1

-Tutorial and intro simplified

-Allies now have tooltips when hiring them

-Camera skips allies doing basic attacks against nothing

-Camera transitions are now smoother

-Reduced post-processing

entries.title: SpaceShift
entries.description:
![Image_Sshift_Main.png](///raw/c75/92/z/2789c.png)

Welcome to SpaceShift, where you start with nothing, but will end up shifting the space and acquiring powerups to traverse your environment. Your goal? Collecting all of them Blue blobs, simple as that!

**NOTE: Each time you click the |> button, a random level will be selected for you from the 3 available maps, or a 4th one which is completely procedural. The procedural map is not meant to be a proper level, instead it is just for having fun with platforming around. If you get it the first time, we highly advise to randomize a new level for your first play!**

![Spaceshift_main.jpg](///raw/c75/92/z/277eb.jpg)

# How to play

SpaceShift is a First Person 3D platformer, where your goal is to collect the Blue "stars" in each level. You can race against the clock if you wish - the countdown timer will stop once all the Blue blobs have been collected! You can then open up the Quickmenu with Escape and click the |> button to randomly select another level or use a console command if you really with to play a specific map (see Console Commands below).

** The platforms are intentionally hidden. You start with nothing. They will stay visible after you stand on them. Also the blue blobs create a Sonar-like ping to reveal them. **

You will start the level in emptiness and will need to acquire your Jump (purple), Dash (green) and Double Jump (yellow) abilities to help you in your quest of Blue Powerup hoarding. Have fun!


## Controls

| *Keybinding*   | *Action*      |
|--------------|-------------|
| WASD         | Move        |
| Mouse        | Look Around |
| Space        | Jump        |
| Shift        | Dash        |
| Space Repeat | Double Jump |
| Escape       | Quickmenu   |

## Console Commands

You can open up the console with the ~(tilde) key and use the following console commands 

| Console Command | The Result of the Command                                       |
|-----------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------|
| RestartLevel    | Restarts the current level                                      |
| Quit            | Quits the game immediately                                      |
| Open Level_00   | Opens the procedural freestyle map that is meant for practicing and random fun |
| Open Level_01   | Opens Level 1                                                   |
| Open Level_02   | Opens Level 2                                                   |
| Open Level_03   | Opens Level 3                                                   |

## Credits

Developed by Norbert @dawnscream Varga

Audio by Peter @sloe Ekres  
https://soundcloud.com/sloevibes

entries.title: Damned Souls - Raising Blood
entries.description:
![raisingblood_cover.png](///raw/ac3/2/z/28eff.png)

Damned Souls - Raising Blood

After months of hiding, your escape from Mephistopheles’ hellish domain ended as soon as it began. Battered and bruised, you’re thrown back into your cell by the archduke’s minions, in a tower on the outskirts of the seventh circle of hell.

Armed with nothing but your wits, determination and unending hatred for your captors, you resolve to escape, even  if it means drowning the whole underworld in the blood of your unholy enemies.

-----

Rise through the hordes of demonic creatures. Ride their blood to the top of the tower. Escape this hell.

-----


![scr1.jpg](///raw/e0a/z/282f6.jpg)

![scr2.jpg](///raw/e0a/z/282f7.jpg)

![scr3.jpg](///raw/e0a/z/282fa.jpg)

-----

WASD to move, click to use the currently selected weapon.
Change between weapons with keys 1-5

The spear can be thrown: right click to prepare, and click to throw.

As you mow down the waves of enemies summoned to kill you, the entire tower is flooded in blood. Use the rafts to ascend higher and higher, and escape

-----
Removed webgl as build as it was buggy and did not support all the features in the game
-----

entries.title: Inkblot Shade
entries.description:
![InkblotShade3.gif](///raw/80d/1/z/25d03.gif)

An abstract downtempo moving-around-and-dodging-things game. 

You are the small blob to the left of the screen. Click and hold the mouse button to move around. Each time you make it from one side to the other without falling into any larger blobs, you get one point. Post your high scores in the comments.

Or you could just sit there and stare at the gently shifting inkblot patterns. Either are good.

I will admit, this had more to do with the theme when I started coding it. But it still kinda fits, maybe?

---

EDIT: Turns out I had a GLSL undefined-behaviour bug giving some laptops game-breakingly large blobs. I've pushed out a bugfix release.

entries.title: In the Beginning
entries.description:
## Story 
In the beginning there was nothing. But then there was a light. A very precious light. Can you defend the light that creates the universe? How many waves of enemies can you survive? How many stars can be born before the light fades away.

![Screenshot_2019-10-08_00.57.56.png](///raw/d99/32/z/286ca.png)

## How to play
Protect your light from the evil. Aim and shoot with the mouse. The further away you can destroy the enemies the more points you will get. You will get an extra life every 5000 points. But watch out that you won't run out of missiles! Post your high score and wave number here - let's see who is the champion!

![LD45-4.png](///raw/d99/32/z/286cc.png)

## Controls

* Move your mouse to aim
* Press space or left click to shoot
* Press M to toggle music
* Press F to toggle fullscreen

entries.title: Nightbirds
entries.description:
![banner.png](///raw/221/c/z/26aaf.png)

**NIGHTBIRDS**

Everybody prefers safety of own home when night falls. Except you. You are the nightbird and now is the time for you to shine. Show them who's the most tough bird in the neigborhood.

** How to play **

You *start with nothing* and the goal is to capture all 7 nests. The most of them are guarded with birds who built them but have no pity for them. They are the same hostile beasts like you. Flying spends energy so be sure to hunt also some vermin crawling on the ground. You don't need to do it alone whole the time. You can raise your family which will help you with collecting food.

For hunting or fighting you can use your claws obviously. If you'd like to hit your enemy harder, use your sharp beak (but this technique is hard to master). Beware of enemy's beak and claws!

![Snímek obrazovky 2019-10-07 v 1.23.29.png](///raw/221/c/z/26af9.png)

** Controls **

- Arrows left/right or A/D or azerty alternative ... movement
- SPACE ... flying / flapping
- attack by landing from above on an enemy
- X ... lay an egg (in nest)
- C ... eat (in nest)


** Used tools **

- godot engine
- inkscape
- gimp
- fl studio
- audacity

** Changelog **
16.10. - fixed a few annoying bugs (flying worms, disappearing prey after you catch it, very low music)

entries.title: Slay the Dungeon
entries.description:
![Screenshot_All.png](///raw/c06/z/281bc.png)

What do you get when you combine Slay the Spire with the Binding of Isaac?  Find out in **SLAY THE DUNGEON**.

Battle your way through a dungeon filled with monsters.  Build a deck of cards that will help you along your way.  Choose wisely, as your cards will decide your fate.  Can you make your way to the end and defeat the dungeon master?



 
**Controls**:

WASD/Arrows - Move the character

Mouse - Move to aim, click to shoot



 
**Software Used**:

Unity, ZBrush, Blender, Substance Painter, Audacity, FL Studio, Photoshop



 
**Notes**:

This is a Jam entry, but all game code, visual and audio assets were created by me in the 72 hour period.


When the theme was announced, I wasn't pleased.  Not that that's anything new, I usually don't like the theme.  It took me a couple hours to come up with an idea I liked.  I'm very proud of the game I've created and think it's a lot of fun.  The deck building aspect gives it some replayability too.  I hope you enjoy it and thanks for trying it out!  Please leave a comment with your rating and I will check out your game!

The boss was a last minute addition (literally I finished coding it 10 minutes before the deadline), so I'm sure there are some bugs with it.  Please report any issues you have to me in the comments below or email me at jharler@gmail.com.  Thanks!



**Known Bugs**:

- The music doubles up after losing and returning to the title screen.  You need to refresh/restart to clear it up.
- The physics sometimes causes enemies to be positioned where they can't be killed.  This also requires a restart.
- The WebGL version is a bit darker than the Windows version.  If you are having a hard time seeing things, try the download.



**THANKS FOR PLAYING!**

entries.title: Tiny Reactor
entries.description:
Explore Tiny Reactor's innovative system of generating energy by colliding balls on a hexagonal grid. Some studies say it's going to be the next big thing [citation needed]! There is a minor problem, however. The QA department took an entire month off before the launch, so we need someone to test each piece of our technology to make sure that it helps to achieve the required energy output and doesn't crash the system... and our stock. Click the link below to access the reactor remotely and help us create a better future for everyone!

![TinyReactor.png](///raw/4b5/81/z/27657.png)

Controls:
  - Click buttons on the GUI to select tools in the editor, click (or click and drag) on the grid to place them
  - Eraser is a separate tool, the "empty button" on the GUI
  - There are keyboard shortcuts for almost every button, and tooltips (hover to see them) for every one
  - To edit the grid, the simulation must be stopped, not just paused

Notes:
  - If the game shows black screen on start, try reloading the browser tab, we couldn't get Godot to play well with the HTML5 export.
  - We have playtested the game and verified that all lock targets are achievable with the corresponding technology level. If you think it's not possible, try another approach :)
  - Some of the rules of the game (e.g. how some of the tools work) are meant to be discovered by testing, but in general these things give you more points:
      - colliding balls at more obtuse angles (head-on is always best)
      - colliding balls of the same tier
      - colliding balls of higher tiers
  - Remember the tools you will see, their names serve as save points, so you can always go back to the game and explore more.

This game was made (almost) from scratch in Godot by 2 people. We used godot-gdhexgrid by Mel Collins to avoid reinventing the wheel.

entries.title: Draft & Doodle
entries.description:
![Banner.png](///raw/281/31/z/26fd4.png)

## Overview
Draft & Doodle is an art exercise/party game designed to let both novice and skilled artists practice drawing. Players actually draw pictures according to assigned themes and constraints. Beginners can practice the most important part of drawing, actually drawing things, without worrying about the quality of their art, while long time hobbyists and/or professionals can practice working with specific constraints. This game is a formalized version of an exercise I used to do for fun where I would attempt to draw things in Microsoft Paint with one minute time constraints.

### But I'm not an artist!
I'm not either, but it doesn't mean you can't draw! Everyone can draw. You just need to start doing it and practicing.

### But I'm an artist!
Great! You can practice techniques you normally wouldn't use in an environment that you're perhaps not familiar with.

### What do I need to play?
At minimum, you just need something to draw with and something to draw on. Any style or medium works, whether it's something you're intimately familiar with or some crazy new set up you've never tried before. However, it is also recommended to have friends to play with, either in-person or online. Drawing with friends is great fun.

## Post-Mortem
This is the first time I've ever competed in the Compo. I ended up starting very late because I was busy on the first day, and had no ideas to run off of until the night of the second day. I spent less than 24 hours making this game, but I'm very happy with the result as a whole, even if it is a very simple concept and system. This is the first time I've ever made a game that genuinely feels like something that is fun to play on a somewhat regular basis. Hopefully you can enjoy practicing drawing by playing Draft & Doodle!

entries.title: Sticky Fingers
entries.description:
### :worried: You don't have any tickets to get prizes. 

### :smiling_imp: Luckily, you brought your sticky hand.

#       [Play in Browser](https://ruthie.itch.io/sticky-fingers) (itch.io)

![banner.jpg](///raw/a45/1/z/2698b.jpg)


### CONTROLS

Steal as much stuff as you can in 30 seconds. Hold down the mouse button to wind up your throw, then grab stuff with the sticky hand using your mouse. (It's a jam game! The controls are janky! The reset button doesn't work 50% of the time!) 

=====================================

### TOOLS USED

Code: Unity / VS Code

Art: Procreate / Blender

Music: GarageBand

=====================================

### SPECIAL THANKS

Thank you to the rad crew at [Babycastles](https://www.babycastles.com/) in New York City for hosting the jam.

[Chevy Ray](https://chevyray.itch.io/pixel-fonts) made the pixel font.

entries.title: One And All
entries.description:
![2019-10-06.png](///raw/034/1/z/25dc6.png)
My previous LD jam game was too difficult, but maybe this one is too easy as there is no enemies to fight or anything like that. Anyways, please enjoy. Since this is a game that runs in the browser, it may take some time to load before it is ready, so please wait a few minutes for it.

If you want to run this directly and don't mind compiling the game, you can grab the source code and compile it yourself. You must have rust (cargo) installed on your system to compile.

EDIT: Sometimes saving/loading freezes the game, I'm not quite sure why it happens. If it does happen to you, for now you will have to avoid saving/loading I think, sorry.

EDIT2: I've found that if you're blocking third-party cookies in firefox and you try to save/load on the itch.io page, the game freezes. If you want to save, you will either have to use the other mirror or change your cookie settings, sorry.

**Pie Witch** is an exploration/baking game about making a pie. But you can't make a pie without ingredients! Explore a world full of mystical creatures and collect ingredients which you can then mix together in your magical cauldron to make a delicious (or absolutely disgusting) pie.

entries.title: An Error Occurred
entries.description:
# An Error Occurred

On a rainy sunday afternoon all you want to do is play that game you bought some time ago, but never got around to playing. You make yourself comfortable and try to start it up, but something goes wrong. You are stuck in the loading screen and have to find a way to complete the loading process by fixing things that went wrong.

The game is a short puzzler with a secret, observe your surroundings and you may find it.

**We are strongly recommending using the Windows version and not WebGL.**

## Controls

The game is controlled by mouse and keyboard. Left mouse click to interact and WASD or arrow keys or a combination thereof to move, once movement has been loaded successfully.

Thank you for playing and we hope you liked the puzzles.

SevenPence - Programming & Sound

Korevana - Programming & Sound

Pilarius - 3D Design

Plantless - 3D Design

Cataractar - Lead Programmer

Besides Unity, we used Audacity, BeepBox, LMMS and SFXR for Sound. Other Tools we used are Blender, Affinity Photo, VS Code and Visual Studio.

**We got three Textures from texture.com. We have decided not to opt out, since the majority of graphics were self made. Please consider this during rating.**

entries.title: Hadron
entries.description:
You are a lone traveler in the deepest reaches of space. Your challenge is to become the wealthiest one of all. To do this, you need to collect resources and develop your ship.
However, there are others who are doing the same. Can you survive?
Let's see.

- Not multiplayer, it's AI
- Only tested on Windows devices (probably works on other devices if Unity does it's job)
- Gamepads are supported but only for the spaceship movement. Menus are not controllable using a gamepad so a mouse will be needed.

PLEASE excuse the massive controls image on the start screen. I had to throw it in somewhere to inform the player but I didn't have time to do it well. I hope you appreciate that I at least provided you with the controls instead of leaving you in the dark. Once again, I am sorry about the eyesore.

Note: There are a lot of bugs and content that is unfinished. I tried to make a game that simply wasn't feasible for a 48hr game jam so QoL is not the best. I hope you enjoy what I made though!

entries.title: Collector
entries.description:
![screen_2560x1920_2019-10-07_15-28-05.png](///raw/eea/82/z/28543.png)
In Collector you start with nothing and go around a small level and collect various plants that are sold for gems. As you collect plants, blobs will spawn in increasing numbers, and come after you. If they touch you, they will take 
one item that you have collected from your inventory.

Going through the purple portal will let you sell the plants you have collected, resetting the level, and give you an option to buy a few upgrades.
Once you get enough gems you can buy an upgrade that will activate the larger Blue portal, allowing you to walk through and escape.... with nothing.

Controls
WASD - Movement.
Hold Shift - Sprint
Space bar - Jump
Hold E - Collect Item

entries.title: ZERO: UNDIVIDED HEROES
entries.description:
![Screen3.PNG](///raw/5f4/d1/z/29acd.png)

**ZERO: UNDIVIDED HEROES** is an arcade top down 2D shooter where you play the mighty zero warrior and fight against the other nasty numbers that want you and your fellow zeries dead. The main goal is to try to survive for as long as you can in the arena and score as much points as you can. **Why wouldn't you try and beat the current highscore which is OVER 9000 ?**


**Long story short, did you know that:**

**0+1 = 1** ["_Really ? Thought we were that dumb?_"]

Alright, let's try something harder:

**0*X = 0** ["_Wow! Must have took you long to compute!_"]

Hmm, you seem to be pretty good huh? What about this smarty-pants:

**X/0 = ?** ["_That's not even possible you idiot!_"]

Oh yeah? But have you even tried? We did, and it causes an instantaneous rift in the space-time continuum! What about trying this by yourself on your ennemies?

And, last but not least, you might want to take a look at this:

**0-1 = null** ["_Hum... NOPE!_"]

Whatever, we make the rules you fool! Bwahahahahaha...ah...ah..ahem, well. You're probably wondering what's the link between that and our game, well, here it comes:

The gameplay is based on very basic mathematical concepts: to kill your ennemies you have to divide them (Since you play as a zero, you can guess how painful it must be!). But you can also earn new health points by multiplying them and thus create little zeries that will follow you and absorb damages for you. By now, the most attentive of you guys (and gals!) may have notice that two rules have been left out, well what fun would there be in spoiling everything just yet?


**Detailed mechanics are written in the in game rules section. Default keyboard mode is Qwerty but it can be changed on the main menu, make sure to check that before you start.**


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L-unWaw8RDk

**Everything was made by us from scratch during the event.**

The team is composed of two students (**Maël Plantec** aka Sayanael who was the main artist but also developper, and **Thomas Cazaubon** aka DjindeGames who was the main developper) in 5th year of computer engineering at the INSA of Toulouse (France).

![Screen1.PNG](///raw/5f4/d1/z/29acc.png)

entries.title: Boing!
entries.description:
2D Platformer Shoot-Em Up with different weapons and modifier the player can pick up. Killing enemies collects coins that can be spent in a shop at certain wave intervals. Every few waves the difficulty will increase, spawning more enemies. Upgrades can be picked up that unlocks abilities or adds to the player stats.  

![Capture.PNG](///raw/498/72/z/26a4f.png)

Player has a health bar and an energy bar  
Player can buy different weapons, each with their own ammo count. Energy can be spent to fire if the weapon is out of ammo.  
Modifiers to weapons apply to the currently equipped weapon.  

Right now everything is overtuned to make the demo quicker to play.  

Executable:  
IMPORTANT: Restart the game once through the pause menu (Esc/Select) to fix the bugged UI in the WebGL version.

A WebGL version exists on Itch.io, I would recommend using the desktop version if you want to use controller and get 
better performance (no object pooling, so WebGL sometimes lag when killing enemies). The UI is also horribly unscaled 
for web so it's a bit buggy.    
Itch.io link: https://refsa.itch.io/ld45 (Source Code, Win64 exe and WebGL versions can be found there)  

Controls:
Keyboard+Mouse and Controller are both supported, no remapping.  

KB/M:  
  A/D: Move Left or Right  
  Mouse: Aim  
  Space: Jump  
  L-Shift: Dash (When Unlocked)  
  Q/E: Next/Previous Weapon  
  Esc: Pause  
  Mouse 1: Fire Weapon  
  F: Buy vendor item  
  L-Shift: Skip Vendor  
  
Controller:  
  Move: Left Joystick  
  Aim: Right Joystick  
  Jump: LB  
  Fire: RB  
  Dash (When Unlocked): A  
  Pause: Select  
  Buy vendor item: Y  
  Skip Vendor: A  
    
  
Unlockable Abilities:  
  Multi Jump  
  Dash  

Modifiers examples:  
Some modifiers lack an icon and as such it can be hard to identify its meaning. The message list in the bottom-right will show the latest modifiers added to the player, as well as the items the vendor is spawning.  
  Extra Damage  
  Extra jump height  
  More movement speed  
  Extra Health  
  Health regeneration  

Pretty much any variable for the player can be modified by pickups that spawn after each wave.

![pause_menu.PNG](///raw/498/72/z/26a50.png)

entries.title: Flow
entries.description:
Flow is a text adventure, written in inform7.

It’s playable on the web. If you play a lot of interactive fiction you might have your favourite interpreter, in which case you can download the gblorb file.

There is no graphics or audio in this game, so I opted out of those categories.

There is a bug in the compo-version that makes it possible to skip a puzzle, so I made post-compo release. In it, I also added one or two verbs that I saw people try and that should really have worked. The original version is of course still there.

entries.title: ReWorld
entries.description:
![ReWorld-Teaser.jpg](///raw/445/21/z/27c03.jpg)

In ReWorld you play - once again - our young dragon Kurisou.

This time, however, he is not trapped in a maze, but trying to find his way out of an escape room. You will find yourself in a world without color, sound or light.

Your task is  as simple as leaving the room. You will need to play with color an gravity to solve puzzles.
Note: You might find cards which are not needed in the levels as well as cards which might lead you into confusion. We follow one basic rule: What is layed down, is sticky.

Jump in and try it yourself. Tutorial included.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Controls:
WASD/Arrows or left stick/DPAD for movement
E/F/Right ctrl or A/Button 1 for Interaction (Card pickup etc)
hold Esc or B/Button 2 for giving up

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

HINTS:
- "Mixed" lasers (e.g. green & red) will look wrong, when the environment is tinted in single colors. REMEBER their color! THIS IS SUPPOSED BEHAVIOR!
- You do not need to put ALL cards on the table! Sometimes there are more than you need, also sound as well as mob cards do not change anything relevant (except they can save your life)
- USe cards in the right order. You could lokc yourself in or out else (a blue laser can'T be disabled after a red card has been placed)
- This is a puzzle game - expect the unexpected.
- *Use your brain.*

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you happen to envounter any bugs please let us know! Also if you encounter some in the linux or macos version, try the windows build. This is our official build. Mac/Linux are only provided for your convenience.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Thanks for reading - If you want to learn more about our game studio, head over to our social media or website:
- https://www.twitter.com/firesplashtv
- https://www.twitch.tv/firesplashtv
- https://discord.gg/firesplash
- https://www.firesplash.de

entries.title: A Ghost's Tale
entries.description:
This is a kind of exploration/adventure game where you will play Billy: a guy who has no idea how he got there because of his *failing* memory. All of this wrapped in a spooky environment.

We **higly** recommand you to play with headphones for a better imersion

(please tell us if you find any bugs)

# Controls
 - Movement : WASD / ZQSD /Arrows
 - Move the flashlight: Mouse


# Credits
- Meibo : Programming
- Elinks : Programming
- Cisx : Writing & SFX
- Robin : Music
- Ashtrail : Art & Writing

# Known bugs

- The player only faces right, even when heading left


# Tools and Organization

This game was made with Godot 3.1. We worked remotely using Discord but tried to get the best of each one depending on his availability (Work for exemple :sob:).

entries.title: You remember nothing.
entries.description:
You bolt awake to the sound of combat.
Your first emotion is confusion. You are lying on a small bed.
What is this place? Who am I? Why are they trying to kill me?

![cover.png](///raw/09f/82/z/26a49.png)

You remember nothing is a text-based adventure game, set in a fantasy world.

entries.title: FROGBERT: Road to Culinary Stardom
entries.description:
You are a frog with big dreams.
As Frogbert, you start out with no possessions other than your stretchy tongue. But Hark! A chef hat floats down the river, and as you gain a hat, you gain a dream... To become the best culinary artist the world has ever seen!

Build your way up from nothing and advance your tools and recipes to become the next star in the culinary world.

This is our first Ludum and for a few of us, our first game jam. Hope you enjoy :) 

Music by Oscar (twitter @ oscastyle)
Sound Effects by Progs

:frog:


![s1svffua.png](///raw/f31/82/z/26b87.png)
![bT97N5.gif](///raw/f31/82/z/26b82.gif)


> Changelog:
October 10, 2019, v0.1.2
- Fixed a bug where Frogbert eats his hat.
- Fixed a bug where you couldn't move on the tile below the Combining Station. You can now combine from all angles!
- Fixed a bug where you couldn't move on the tile below the Garbage Hole. Recycle without frustration!
- Fixed a bug where Frogbert holds his mouth open always.
- Adjusted lighting to make shadows easier to see so it's easier to know where to give food.
- Adjusted movement speed a bit. Movement still isometric, though.

entries.title: Crystallian
entries.description:
![276972c9-09a6-4a59-b3df-c86045a44065.png](///raw/2c7/c/z/26546.png)


:satellite_orbital: Defend the crystal. Build the ship. Fight off our enemies. Keep the crystal alive. :satellite_orbital: 


:star: How to Play :star:

The blue bar shows how much fuel you have left. Fuel is used for your jetpack, cutter, and gun. -- fuel replenishes after a while.

The green circle shows how much material you have left. Material is used for building. -- Material replenishes after you complete a level.

Use your tools to build up a ship and fend off enemies. You only have limited materials in each level though, so build carefully. The crystal can take three hits before it is compromised. You only take one. Don't worry, though. You respawn immediately. Everything red is an enemy--so shoot at 'em all. There are fifteen levels. See how many you can beat!


🎮 Controls 🎮

MOVE: A/S/D

JUMP: W
JETPACK: W in midair

CHANGE TOOL: Scroll Wheel

SWITCH TO CUTTER: E
SWITCH TO BUILDER: Q
SWITCH TO GUN: Right Click

USE TOOL: Left Click

FULLSCREEN: F


📷 Screenshots 📸

entries.title: Conjury: The Convocation the RPG
entries.description:
![cover.png](///raw/c53/z/2616f.png)
Welcome to the world of Conjury: The Convocation, the worlds hottest collectable card game. You have decided to make your place in the world by winning the prestigious masters tournament. To do so you'll have to trade cards, train your skills, outwit opponents, and play smaller tournaments to work your way up.

The game consists of three primary screens:
Character - Where you can allocate points for your character, your card collection, and your deck. There are descriptions of what each skill and card type does. It's important to make your deck, it is what will be used during a match.
Hub - Where you choose what tournaments to play, trade for new cards, and access the character screen. You should try to trade after each tournament. After each tournament there is also a chance you'll get a skill point to spend.
Match - Playing a match against an opponent.


How to play a match:
Matches are divided into four phases

1. Initial Choice - During this stage you choose the Card Type you'll be focusing on and your Play Sytle. The value of each Card Type is taken from your deck. The value of each Play Style is equal to the number of points you put in that skill. Click on the cards to side to choose it, click on the ones in the center to unchoose them. You can also adjust how much you want to Cheat by using the two buttons at the bottom.

2. Observation - You and your opponent now do a an opposed roll against each of your Observation skills. There are three possiblities:
   i. You win: You get a chance to reveal either the opponents Play Style, Card Type, or their Cheating value. After you've revealed something you can make adjustments to your Play Style, Card Type, and Cheating.
  ii. Opponent wins: You don't get to do anything. Your opponent will reveal something and make adjustments.
 iii. Tie: Both you and your opponent can make adjustments. The adjustments are applied after you reveal something.

3. Resolution - You and your opponent make an opposed roll. The base number of dice rolled is the sum of the values of Play Style, Card Type, and Cheat. These are rolled against a base Target of 4. Any die rolled above or equal to the Target counts as a success. The person with the most successes win. Ties are rerolled. There are also various modifiers applied before the rolls are made.
   i. If a players Card Type has advantage against the opponents Card Type the Target of the advantaged player's roll is reduced by one.
  ii. If the players Play Style has advantage against the opponents Play Style the Target of the advantaged player's roll is reduced by one.
 iii. If the players Card Type and Play Style work well together the number of dice rolled is increased by one.
  iv. If the player is using a net deck they Target of their roll is increased by one.

4. Cheat Detection - Finally the winner makes an opposed roll of their Cheating stat versus how much they Cheated in the match. If the Cheated roll is greater they were caught, and they lose.


Card Type Advantages:
Aggro beats Control
Control beats Combo
Combo beats Aggro

Play Style Advantages:
Bold beats Bluffing
Bluffing beats Strategy
Strategy beats Bold

Type-Style Synergies:
Bold words with Aggro
Bluffing works with Control
Strategy works with Combo

entries.title: Rag Racer or: How I learned to stop worrying and love the bump
entries.description:
![banneritch.png](///raw/a71/9/z/2698a.png)

Legendary bike racer Mike Glovemaker had it all! Fame! Mansions! The golden edition of the Nintendo World Championship cartridge! But it was all taken from him when the public found out that he spends most of his days in his underwear sitting on his couch! But Mike will not give up! He will gain back the public's trust, even without a motorcycle! Will he be able to make his grand comeback as... THE RAG RACER OR: HOW HE LEARNED TO STOP WORRYING AND LOVE THE BUMP™?!

So yeah, do you ever get the thought "I wonder how Outrun does its 3D effect" and then follow up the thought with "Wow, I should test that out in a 48-hour gamejam"? Good times. I hope the physics aren't too frustrating, if it's any consolation, the game isn't very long. If nothing else I feel like I accomplished my personal goal of involving the player more. In a bit of an unusual way, but that still counts!

Update: Dreamcast version is up.

entries.title: Cleaner!
entries.description:
You are in charge of the local dump and you have to clear it !
For hat you'll need the political support.
Because you don't have any material to accomplish your task yet...

This is a mini management game where you can build chain of builds to create resources from trash.

How to play : 
- click to select and assign tractor to trash
- click to select and assign transporter to building (e.g. assign transporter to the "steel workshop" so he will go take metal shards in the "sorting center")
- if you have select on building you can move it by drag and drop
- by default builds automatically sell their production, so you can use it for production chain. You can tell the building to stock is production by unchecking "sell production".

Control: left click->select | right click->unselect | escape->quit game

edit: build updated with bug fix

entries.title: The Tale of Earl
entries.description:
Meet Earl, a parasitic alien worm scouring the universe for food. You start with nothing, not even a whole body, but you can inhabit the bodies of humans in your path. Help Earl infiltrate a spaceship and inhabit the captain so you can redirect the ship to your home planet and feed your species!

![LD45-Screenshot1.png](///raw/993/72/z/28a32.png)

![LD45-Screenshot2.png](///raw/993/72/z/28a30.png)

![LD45-Screenshot3.png](///raw/993/72/z/28a31.png)

Controls:

- AD - Move left and right                                                                                                
- WS - Use hatches and ladders                                                                                            
- E - Inhabit body                                                                                                        
- Space - Jump                                                                                                            
- Mercenary: Click to shoot                                                                                               
- Strongman: Click to punch                                                                                               
- Officer: Click to use sword                                                                                             
- Robot : Cannot be inhabited                                                                                             
- Scientist: Pick up key-cards and click to open door

Tips:

- Use hatches to walk through the floor undetected, then inhabit enemies while you are underneath them                   
- You can only inhabit a body for a limited amount of time, and afterwards, it will make you sick for some time          
- As Earl, you can reach the next floor by jumping up and going through a hatch                                          
- Passing an alien scanner will alert enemies and cause them to attack even while you are inhabiting a body

We are working towards releasing a full version of this game on steam. Check out our website and subscribe to follow our progress and receive a **free Steam key** when the full game is released!                                                             
https://www.taleofearl.com/

                          Created By:

         Daniel Sousa | Sam Westerlund | Andrew Potach

entries.title: The Inexperienced ATM
entries.description:
You are a new ATM in the business. So, you start with no money whatsoever. Your goal is to be a selfish ATM and not let anyone withdraw from you, but only deposit. Beware. Vandalizers have caught on to your selfish ways so watch out for the man in black with the headband, for he will END you. You can always try jumping over him, doing flips and such in the air, but really the only way to make people turn away and not withdraw money, is to dispense money at them, because that makes perfect sense. They will probably just take the random money, go home, and store it somewhere instead of withdrawing from you. But, not all people will withdraw. Each type of person has a chance of either withdrawing, or depositing so it is up to YOU to decide what to do.
 ![PeopleInfo.PNG](///raw/c44/31/z/2626b.png)

The **Greatest Game in the World** is an **_atmospheric, non-linear, open-world, puzzle-based MMORPG_** set in Medieval England. In this build you get to see amazing _scenery, engaging riddles, and a vigorous Boss Battle_ you might need to play multiple times to master.

First LD entry!

Your ex-girlfriend's cousin's uncle happens to be able to get you a meeting at a venture capital firm. You possess nothing, no skill whatsoever, other than an expert command of tech buzzwords. How much investment could you coax out of the VC?

entries.title: Click the Balloons
entries.description:
Earn points! The rules of the game are a mystery, can you work out how to get the highest score?

![balloons.gif](///raw/faf/z/2607a.gif)

All you need is a mouse and patience.

![ss1.png](///raw/faf/z/26079.png)

Best described as "spinning plates" game where you have to first work out what the plates are and how to spin them.

If you reach 100+ points you are doing very well.

Dev notes:
This was a fun and refreshing game to make. I finished with several hours to spare which as I'm sure we all know is pretty rare. There's lots I could have added but the game hit a very nice point for me at which I felt sure it was Time To Ship. It's a very silly game and teaches you nothing about its rules other than in very sneaky indirect ways. 

Bonus: Press 1-4 and 0 for different colour modes! Don't play in red though. Trust me.

entries.title: Slimy Dungeon
entries.description:
## Welcome to "Slimy Dungeon"!

(Ludum Dare 45 Entry by @dodori & @thunder)

Slimy Dungeon was made in 72 hours for the Ludum Dare 45 Game Jam.
All the art, sounds and code were made by us in 72 hours.

#### Story

You are a small slime, outcast by your slime family. On the search for a new place to live, you find a dungeon guarded by Rock Crabs.

You make it your goal to explore the WHOLE dungeon, in hopes of finding new cool things to keep, to replace the belongings-shaped hole in your slimy heart, caused by leaving all your belongings at home.

(Too bad the dungeon is endless!)

#### Controls

WASD or ARROW KEYS to move.
Aim with your mouse, and hold LEFT CLICK or LEFT-CTRL to shoot!

You could technically use a controller for the movement, but none of us had a working controller at hand, so we didn't implement the shooting mechanic for it. (Sorry :/)

The dungeon is generated at runtime, and items drop randomly. Feel free to share your highest floor scores, or test out how the items stack!

#### Screenshots
![skele boss.png](///raw/86c/82/z/28354.png)


#### Change-Logs:


08.10.2019, 7:47AM [CEST]:
> Changes: Fixed Typo in Tutorial, Made skipping the tutorial work for HTML5, Fixed shots disappearing when you're too close to the wall, Fixed Eye Boss not applying Damage Animation Correctly, Fixed Floor Count going up by 2 instead of 1 per floor, by popular bug reports: Player now freezes correctly so you don't run into enemies when entering a room.

This is both mine and Thunder's very first Ludum Dare Entry, and of course we had to choose a Randomly-Generated Rogue Like... Sorry for the spare item and enemy variety.

### If you're going to play the HTML5 build, please run it in fullscreen. Thank you!

entries.title: Click-N-Move
entries.description:
Start with nothing and fight off hordes of enemies for as long as you can! Build your arsenal through playing smart and outlasting the baddies! Try to take the top position on the leader board!

## Progression Note !!! Please READ before rating !!!
- **Your progression continues after a death but death has a score penalty.  Keep going until it's too hard and you are dying too frequently to accumulate score!**
- **Weapons are obtained through progression.  You get the first weapon after 30 seconds**
- **You must reach 500 kills to see all the weapons and enemies**
- **The enemies will spawn faster as kills accumulate**

## Tools Used
- Godot 3.11
- Aseprite
- Gimp2
- ChipTone
- Bosca Ceoil Online
- Audacity

### Controls
- Move: WASD
- Shoot: Left Mouse
- Weapon Select: Keys 1-7
- Weapon Quick Change: Mouse wheel scroll

## !!! HTML Build Notes !!!
- Seems to work really well in Firefox.  
- Have to refresh if you get a black screen after loading on chrome.

### Development Statistics
- Energy Drinks: 6
- Annoyed Wives: 1
- Fell asleep unintentionally: true
- Times I wished I could art more gudder: 8927808984930893842908498912830190

entries.title: Mr.Grind
entries.description:
Hey it's my first time in Ludum Dare, i hope you'll like what i've done. I also can't wait to play other games :thumbsup:

**Mr.Grind** is endless clicker game with pixel art graphics.

**Lore**

You are Orc that lives by mining gold and you have nothing except your pickaxe. Your pickaxe is your everything. You are feeling happy when you are grinding and you don't even feel the starvation that your body feels. Only thing you care is your pickaxe. You are selling the gold you earned to the costumers and you are earning gem in exchange. Since your pickaxe is your everything you are using the gem you earned to upgrade your lovely pickaxe. :heart: 

**Controls**

Use A, D and arrow keys to move around. Use "Space" key to jump and use "Mouse Left Button" to mine gold. While i was play testing this game it was much more fun with joystick so try to play it with joystick if you can.

**Screenshots**

![Unity_kZJfBqirjH.png](///raw/6c9/72/z/25ecc.png)

![Unity_6Z55vNXo3o.png](///raw/6c9/72/z/25ed4.png)

![Unity_NHQlPQ0ZHf.png](///raw/6c9/72/z/25ecf.png)


**Changes v1.1 (6 October 2019)**
    - "Upgrade" button removed from "Menu", it now appears on game screen instead.

**Changes v1.2 (6 October 2019)**
    - The truck timer is now more game jam friendly (short).

**Changes v1.3 (6 October 2019)**

entries.title: Dreamscaping
entries.description:

Emptyhead has realized their dreams are so boring because they're so empty, so in order to have better dreams they'll build one themselves. entries.title: Vr.Punk
entries.description:
Well, we had some cool themes from first three polls. They didn't make it to the final one... So we spent two days brainstorming the rest 15 themes, and got some cool ideas for 10 of them. They didn't make it.
 
So jam starts, and apparantly our artist doesn't know how to sleep properly, so we wasted half of the first day doing nothing.

So okay, we gathered togather (finally), gave the theme a good old thunk and began our work. Code had a ton of bugs, artist was always forgetting about what he needed to draw, and the whole 3rd day we were debugging html5 version of the game (it is not presented as an option here, so...). Music guy is cool though. 
So basically we made this in 1.5 days. A platformer with guns, robots, bosses and NOTHING. Cool.

Controls:
WASD, lmb to shoot, Space to warp, alt+enter to fullscreen

entries.title: Nothing In A Bar
entries.description:
Start with 'Nothing In A Bar'.

**Description:**

A slow-paced Dialogue/Action based first person-view game where you talk to a bartender and do actions.
Different actions lead to different outcomes, the game has NINE different endings, with each ending having its own Plot-twists.
 
Personally, The "Get up & Check out the bottles closely" has the best ending. ( But not for the faint-hearted )

Each Game-play session lasts for about 1-2 Minutes, Different 'dialogues' do not affect the ending, Different 'actions' do.

**Controls:**

Mouse to click dialogue box/action button.

Use HEADPHONES for best audio experience.
All Audio From https://freesound.org/.
Removed Audio Rating as I do not own audio.

*Could not upload a HTML version as post-processing doesn't work properly in a Web Build.*

Few Screenshots from the game:

![SS1.png](///raw/7d0/62/z/2722b.png)
Start Screen.

Drunk Effect in game ( Blur + Chromatic Effect )

Interactive Action/Speech Buttons

**THANKS FOR PLAYING!**

entries.title: StarLink Xpress
entries.description:
**Captain!** We're running on fumes, here! We're out of fuel and we haven't even reached the pickup point yet. If the backup power for the tractor beam holds, we *may* be able to complete our deliveries, but we'd be endangering the lives of everyone on this vessel...

Is whatever's in those boxes **really** worth all that?

![Screenshot_0.png](///raw/e91/2/z/289bb.png)
![Screenshot_1.png](///raw/e91/2/z/289b8.png)
![Screenshot_2.png](///raw/e91/2/z/289bc.png)

*StarLink Xpress* is a time-trial physics game about a space-faring delivery company made in 72 hours for Ludum Dare 45. Use your tractor beam to zip and glide past asteroids and make all of your deliveries on time!

**Objective**

Pick up packages at stations and deliver them to homes. Don't let the time run out, and don't take too many hits.

**Controls**

* Left Mouse - Fire tractor beam
* R - Restart the current level
* Esc - Exit to main menu

![HowToPlay.png](///raw/e91/2/z/289bd.png)

**UPDATE** The HTML5 version is available [right here](https://morrilet.itch.io/starlink-xpress)!

entries.title: DECKER_
entries.description:
### LD45 - Start with nothing

![DeckerTitle.png](///raw/3c4/z/2717e.png)

You play as a nethacker, using your trusty cyberdeck to battle against other hackers in this free-for-all tournament. Upgrade your gear and prove that you've got what it takes to pwn your enemies. Five wins in a row and you win! But don't lose or else your deck will fry.

On your turn you can either use a floppy disk to run a program on the target or "pass" your turn to code a new program. After each win you get a Hacker Token which you spend/save to get extra Modules to enhance your cyberdeck. Each fight you will Start With Nothing so you must code new programs each time.

### Card Effects
- Damage: reduces target's hit points
- DOT: reduces target's hit points over time
- Heal: restores target's hit points
- HOT: restores target's hit points over time
- Guard: reduces incoming damage
- Weaken: reduces the damage a target can deal
- Strengthen: increases the damage a target can deal
- Biofeedback: prevent the target from drawing cards
- Reboot: remove any timed effects from yourself and reset your deck to nothing

### Module Effects
- Hard Target: Always have 1 defense
- Trojan: Always add 1 to DOT damage
- Half Adder: Always add 1 to immediate damage
- Grip Gloves: Increase hand size by 1
- Passive Scanner: Restore 1 hit point each turn
- Floppy Drive: Play 2 cards a turn

### BUG FIXES:
- Fixed Module name
- Fixed hp not resetting after each fight
- Fixed disks not resetting after each fight
- Fixed level and xp not resetting after each fight​
- Fixed code program screen overflow bug
- Fixed bug where Biofeedback wouldn't expire

entries.title: Run... Away?
entries.description:
Some kind of runner where you start with nothing. Would you stay with nothing?

![intrigue.png](///raw/db7/72/z/2640b.png)

Even if you think you did nothing, surrendering can be the solution.

![chase.png](///raw/db7/72/z/26409.png)

But why not building up **your own rules**?

![explosions.png](///raw/db7/72/z/2640e.png)

_The game is very short and not as complete as expected in terms of level design and overall content. However, it's working! Being new to game development and for a very first game jam, I'm happy to have a working deliverable (Even though much too short!)_

To reviewers: **THANK YOU** for trying my stuff out! Even though I'm new here, please be harsh on me and I would appreciate all kinds of criticism, so please let me know!

The ideal idea was to make a "runner" game that involve back and forth motion, instead of only having the stress of being chased. As for the theme, "Start with nothing" was the idea of starting with literally nothing (even in the life of the character) and building up momentum with weapons, unprecedented crimes and escalating military chase.

This game is made with Godot game engine.

Credits to Ray Larabie for his awesome Joystix font!

entries.title: Nullefense
entries.description:
# Nullefense
### Build a base and defense enemies
Game made in 26 hours for [Ludum Dare 45](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/45)

![gameImage.png](///raw/3d0/72/z/2600e.png)

## How to play

- absorb star particles and convert them into block
- build with the blocks to defend enemies
- try to create a indestructible base and wait for the bosses!

## Controls

- click: **buy (convert)**, **open transformator**, **place blocks**
- Q: **next step in tutorial**
- B: **buy (convert) focused items faster**
- E: **navigate between equipped blocks**
- mouse wheel: **zoom in/out**

## NOTE: I recommend using Chrome instead of Firefox when playing.

entries.title: Space Office
entries.description:
It's your first day at work and you have no clue what you're supposed to do.
With the theme being what it is, we took a long time to decide on what nothing should be, 
and we landed on knowledge.
The real challenge of the game is figuring out what to do.
It's a pretty difficult task, but if you mess around for a bit it'll start to make some sense.
Each day has something new as well, so make sure to try them out.

Mouse controls everything. If you get stuck early on, make sure you try all the buttons on various screens.
Actually, I lied, you can reset to the menu by pressing R.
Oh, and I should add, this game is not friendly to the colorblind, I'm sorry about that.

![game2.gif](///raw/c3f/a1/z/2737b.gif)

Programming/design: Celdur

Art/sound: Gauphastus 

Writing: Sgore

entries.title: deathlock
entries.description:
start each screen with no health.

the edges of the screen are locked, and will only open if you're dead.  now, the obvious problem here is that corpses can't walk - but they sure as hell can fly.

![gif 60.gif](///raw/2b6/82/z/29067.gif)

standard platformer controls + r to respawn.  note: the f key was a debug feature that was accidentally left in!  it's not an actual mechanic.

music by saiziju.  everything else by winterbeak.

coded from scratch using python and pygame.  sound effects mixed using ableton live's default libraries.  graphics made in graphicsgale.  no fonts were used and all text was pixelled by hand.

entries.title: Red Shirt Flying Super Powers Man

entries.title: Escape from Nabazka
entries.description:
This is my first LDJam game. Also this my first entry in any jam what so ever. And also this was my second game in Godot.

## Used tools

* [Godot](https://godotengine.org/) - game engine
* [Gimp](https://www.gimp.org/) - graphics
* [Beetbox.co](https://www.beepbox.co) - music

## EDIT

From now on I will start reworking the game (I will implement a lot of new features and I will expand the game, also I would like to add modding support, but I am not comletely sure about that.)

Released [version 0.1.1](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/9iujngtodctw2so/AACsMESA-KzVN1WH4kBETeoca?dl=0):
  * fixed most of the issues
  * added difficulty to make game more accessible

Original version can still be downloaded [here](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/1cxbjc82dkgxnpi/AAAAU1oQYRqkbhDFjRGU86lca?dl=0)

## My idea

My most idea was to create simple game (fast paced action hack and slash game with RPG elements). You are playing as mage that was imprisoned. But you wake up free in your cell, but without any knowledge of any spell and also without any mana. Your goal is to escape this prison and find a way out.

## Story of creation

I really underastimmated my knowledge of Godot engine and I have fallen behind really quickly. But on the other hand I learned a lot (mostly to make own font for next time so I don't have to spend hours just finding some free font - I ended up just downloading something in the end, without any metsionned licence and it looks good).

The game was made in 48 hours and all used assets were created by me and only me.

To see some of my progress you can check my gitlab (click the source code link), but sice today 14:00 CET I stopped creating devdiary into Diary.md, so you can't find all game history.

P.S. I am sorry for my English (in game and especially in source code), because I am dysgraphic and I have problems even with Czech (my native language) grammar. Also I am tired so and starting to get a little bit drunk (gf brought me 3 beers - already finished those - and bottle of wine - still in progress). So I will try to fix most of the things in next few days (also will add missing entries to dev diary)

P.P.S. I hope you like my game.

P.P.P.S. I will try to fix most of the bugs in next few days - if you discover one please create ticket in gitlab. There will be separate link to these builds.

(P\\.){4}S\\. I will try to rewrite and redo this game in few weeks and try make it public (probably free to play - also there will be other link - or watch closely my gitlab).

(P\\.){5}S\\. Please play this game with a mouse (with touchpad you will broke your fingers)

## Controls

Game contains full tutorial so you don't need to read this :D

* WSAD - to move
* Mouse - to look around
* LBM - to punch something
* RMB - to cast a spell

entries.title: Get A Job, Baby!
entries.description:
Originally intended as a COMBO project, but due to lack of time and insufficient preparation due to learning about LD45 too late, I had to push to to a JAM project.

The game is about being a newborn baby who has nothing and is put to work. Your goal is to earn as much as you can in the next 12 months.

The game was completed as a solo project under 12 hours and the game's source code can be found on Itch.io.

entries.title: Money Management Simulator
entries.description:
![MMS01.png](///raw/1e3/1/z/260ab.png)



Some people are born rich, some are born wise, but many are born ordinary.Their lives Start with nothing.
This game you will play an ordinary person, no inheritance, no high salary, you can only manage your money to make life better.

Game Features:
  -  Four different ways to invest and manage money.
  -  Over 20 random events.
  -  Every time you play a different stock move.
  -  With complete statistics, you will know your financial ability when you finish the game.

How to Play:
  -  "NEXT" Butoon to pass time.
  -  Spend money on deposits, funds, stocks or insurance.
  -  You can adjust your monthly consumption or agree to requests to increase your happiness.
  -  When you're 50 years old , you'll retire and take stock of your financial results.

Change your life by managing your money.


ps: happiness system is unfinished.

entries.title: Fan The Flames
entries.description:
Fan The Flames - LD45
Craft, harvest, and keep the fire going is the name of the game in Fan The Flames. With night and inclimate weather trying to put your fire out. You need to choose between crafting tools, feeding the fire, and managing your time away from camp. Tools such as the shovel, allow you to create snow tunnels to make traversing through the level easier, but is it worth the resources?

Watch out for that pesky snow, it will try to extinguish your fire and cover up previously tunneled holes.

If you've read the description this far... here's a tip: craft your first axe with stick, stick rock. There are two other tools and crafting recipes.

UPDATE 10/8 - FIXED GAME BREAKING CONTROL SCHEME

entries.title: Not My Hoarder
entries.description:
![story2.png](///raw/ed8/3/z/26ff8.png)

Mr Raccoon loves a simple life. **He lives in a zen home** with only the few items he needs.
But one day his peace is disturbed by **the delivery man**.
![deliverymanvero.gif](///raw/ed8/3/z/27000.gif)
**Someone is buying things**, a lot of things and they are delivered to Mr Raccoon. **There must be a mistake!**
After a couple of days **his house if full of clutter** and the delivery man keeps ringing! 
![longcluttehome.png](///raw/ed8/3/z/26fdc.png)


## The only way out is... to throw a giveaway party!

![storiagiveaway.png](///raw/ed8/3/z/27013.png)

** - Help Mr Raccoon move through the clutter that is building up.**

** - Answer the delivery man and collect new parcels**

** - Find the items Mr Raccoon's friends ask for**

** - Give away everything and get back to a minimalist lifestyle!**


## How to play:
move with arrows, interact with Ctrl, click non a distant object to pick it up.
When a friends arrives give him what he needs.


## Game Intro:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PNaxC-Qr5PY



## Game outro
https://youtu.be/JdUdVfSoEK8



## About the team
### This is **our third jam**.
Not My Hoarder was developed with Unity by @fanu.
The art is made with Photoshop and AfterEffects (because @tommyflower gave up extra coffees to pay them)
@ioleoso composed the music with FruityLoop.

## update: fixed bug on special package
