entries.title: Tale of the Toad King
entries.description:
🐸

# Let me tell you the Tale of the Toad King...

![VERZIERT.png](///raw/ebc/c/z/28897.png)


### What to do

Your toad crawls around and gathers a conga line of followers. ** Try not to bump into things or your line **.

In the bottom right corner you can see your ** lifes ** and the number of frogs you have to rescue.

We recommend you turn up the sound. Enjoy the story!


![Promo-export.png](///raw/ebc/c/z/28663.png)



### Controls

Arrow Keys / XBOX-Stick - move 

Mouse / Enter / A-Button - main menu select

Escape / Start-Button - pause



### Changelog

Version 1.1.0 (2019-10-12) (Download only for now)
- Added: Damage feedback animation.
- Added: Death animation.
- Changed: Tutorial background is now green.
- Changed: Narrator voice is now louder.
- Changed: Toad king changes direction directly when a direction button was pressed (if he is not moving).
- Changed: Screen shake is a bit more subtle.
- Changed: Improved the levels.
- Changed: Follower frogs won't die if they go out of screen.
- Changed: Main menu screen, win screen and game over screen.
- Fixed: Typos.
- Fixed: "Camera moves faster" area was too small.
- Fixed: In game menu was invisible when screen was fading to black.
- Fixed: Some text boxes appeared multiple times.
- Fixed: Mouse cursor was visible in tutorial in fullscreen.
- Fixed: Some bugs in the level maps.
- Fixed: Some level ended too soon (sometimes).
- Fixed: Dialog images didn't fit the overworld frog images.
- Fixed: Player could not die in the first level.
- Fixed: Player could go out of the world map.

Verson 1.0.1 (2019-10-08)
- Fixed: Dialog in level 1.
- Fixed: Some typos in dialogs.
- Fixed: Enabled goodbye voice.

Version 1.0.0 (2019-10-08)
- Initial release (Ludum Dare release).



### Credits

Basti - Code Wizard 

Kamil - Enemy Warlock, Master of Level 3

Tido - Implementation Fairy, Croaky Voice

Christian - Painting ~~Goblin~~ God

Lukas - Songmaster


**Have fun playing!** 🐬

entries.title: NSFB: Not Safe For Bugs!
entries.description:
![chrome_2019-10-07_17-51-42.png](///raw/94c/81/z/28945.png)

NSFB: Not Safe For Bugs! is a turn-based action strategy game! As the bugs, you're landing on an unexplored planet to bring life back to its dead soil. But watch out! Evil lizard aliens lurk on the surface and they will stop at nothing to destroy the outsiders. This planet is NOT SAFE FOR BUGS!

Featuring artwork by Val, music by caseJackal, and code by Emerson!

Controls: Click on the patch of grass you want to move your bug to. You can only move your bug after it has been attacked by an enemy. Moving to a new spot lets you heal and gain a better position, but watch out! If a lizard steps on green soil, it dies. You can heal it back by killing a lizard on it.

Hold right click to rotate the camera.

![chrome_2019-10-07_17-52-50.png](///raw/94c/81/z/28946.png)

![chrome_2019-10-07_17-54-53.png](///raw/94c/81/z/28948.png)

entries.title: In the beginning
entries.description:
![screenshot_3.PNG](///raw/a24/72/z/287ef.png)

Play as a caveman living in the dark...

Keys:
Q, E to rotate the camera
R to restart the scene

Wolves:
Can see two tiles in front of them and 1 one the sides, but cannot see behind them!

**Please Note:**

Several players reported issues surrounding input not working making the game unplayable.

I managed to fix those and with that I also added the missing music and sound effects , screen transitions and cleaned up some bugs relating to the breakable blocks. The original and the fixed build are both available for download.

entries.title: Hoarder's Paradise
entries.description:
![TitleLD452.PNG](///raw/d0e/31/z/2746f.png)

![AnExample2.jpg](///raw/d0e/31/z/2750b.jpg)

Fill your empty house with stuff and become the ultimate hoarder!

**Movement**: WASD
Use the **mouse** to navigate the YouBuy.biz webpage!

Congratulations on buying your very first house!

It's empty, but with all the money you've saved up, you should be able to amass yourself a mountain of stuff in no time.

Browse YouBuy on your computer to buy new things and add them to your house. You'll get a **satisfaction** rating based on how cool the item is!

Smaller items can be **stacked** to save space and increase satisfaction. Try to **stack** items of the same type together for **bonus satisfaction**!

**Stacks** can not be combined. 

Just be careful about stacking items too high, or they might **collapse** and hurt you!

And don't get too wrapped up in your shopping spree...if you neglect your **bodily functions** or the **cleanliness** of your home, **bad things** may happen...

**filth** attracts giant sewer rats that are too big for the cats to eat. 

Programming: Scott Steffes

Writing/Art: Dan Luffey

entries.title: Caravana
entries.description:
Explore a vast desert while defending your caravan from attack. Trade exotic goods with colorful characters in fantastical cities*

*That's the elevator pitch at least. I only got the combat basics in for the compo, but I might keep going with the prototype after the jam is over. I'm especially interested in hearing feedback about the combat system.

I've kept on working on the game since the competition ended. It's closer to but not quite at a demo of what I want the game to be like. More story, more combat options (combos, dodging, rolls), and better enemy balance. Camels still don't count for nothin'. The updated version can be found in the "Post-compo" zip and the original in the "LD 45" zip.

entries.title: Floatblox
entries.description:
# Images:
![Floatblox1.PNG](///raw/412/e/z/29ce5.png)
![Floatblox2.PNG](///raw/412/e/z/29ce6.png)
![Floatblox3.PNG](///raw/412/e/z/29ce7.png)
![Floatblox4.PNG](///raw/412/e/z/29ce8.png)

# ​About:
Floatblox is a Compo game made for Ludum Dare 45.

Floatblox is a sandbox game with infinite randomly generated world. However, you can still beat it by constructing and using the portal. You start with nothing and you have to gather materials to construct stuff. Build bridges to travel between islands and find magic crystal which is essential to activate the portal. Be careful though! When you fall into the void your progress will be gone and you will have to start again with nothing!

# How to play:
- Gather some resources.
- You can destroy almost everything by hitting it enough times.
- Construct basic stuff like workbench and furnace.
- Use workbench to craft planks out of logs.
- Use furnace to smelt ore.
- Build bridges to other islands.
- Explore the world and find magic crystal.
- Construct the portal.
- Use the portal to win the game.
- Be careful, there are no respawns.
- Have fun!

# Default controls:
- Arrows/WASD - Movement
- Space - Jump
- Left Shift/Right Shift - Sprint
- Left Mouse Button - Hit/Pick Up/Place
- Right Mouse Button - Drop/Cancel/Deselect
- Mouse Scroll Wheel - Choose item to construct
- R - Rotate item

# Note:
- Use Windows version for better graphics and performance.
- If you play WebGL version and have any issues, try the standalone Windows version.

# Known bugs:
- There is small chance that you will start surrounded by cliff with no chance to escape. If it happens to you just restart the game.
- After the game ends, automatic restart is not working. Restart the game if you want to play again.

# Have fun! :star::star::star::star::star:

entries.title: Get Some Cake!
entries.description:
![gsc.png](///raw/380/e1/z/265fb.png)

Can you craft a cake out of nothing? A puzzle game about combining elements.

This game was made in 30 hours only during the compo (started on Saturday at 6pm Europe/Paris). I had to sacrifice the audio and some juice. I hope you will still enjoy it!

Tired or stuck? **Check the walkthrough!** https://github.com/OwlyCode/LD45/blob/master/README.md

entries.title: Space Crash
entries.description:
![01_Title.png](///raw/c8d/c/z/26510.png)

It's a simple game, you crashed on an alien planet and lost your combustible. You need to recharge your 4 batteries in order to leave the planet.
In this land there are some monsters that could kill you with just one hit. You can't kill them, you need to dodge them to take 4 floating stones and use them to recharge your batteries.
Tips:
- Press the Fullscreen button to play it easier. The button is on the lower right corner.
- You move with the ARROWS, you accept with Z and cancel with X. Show the menu with ESC.
- The monsters are slow and not intelligent, so you can make them go after you and then run to get the stones.
- The monsters can't walk into the platforms. 
- After a while, the monsters get tired of following you and go back to their original place, nearby a stone.
- When you use a stone, the monster that was close to it will freeze and can't damage you anymore.
- The game can be a little hard, but you can try as many times as you want, you don't lose your progress.


You can play the game in your browser. It's on itch.io:

[![001_Playnow_Button.png](///raw/c8d/c/z/2652d.png)](https://xacur.itch.io/space-crash)


[PLAY NOW!](https://xacur.itch.io/space-crash)

[![Background001.jpg](///raw/c8d/c/z/264d6.jpg)](https://xacur.itch.io/space-crash)

Thank you for playing and enjoy!

entries.title: Totally Safe Space Systems
entries.description:
![logo-large.png](///raw/7ff/7/z/26a74.png)
 
 
Can you start a colony on an alien planet from nothing? Play as mission control and order your brave astronaut to scan down and find the vital resources you need!

### Play the game in your browser here: https://timeriksen.itch.io/totally-safe-space-systems

## Controls:
- Click to order astronaut to move
- Press spacebar to initiate a scan

## How to play:
Press spacebar to scan down points of interest. The locations you are searching for are somewhere inside the purple circles. The closer you are to the location, the smaller the circle will be. Just make sure you complete all the objectives in the mission plan before the astronaut runs out of oxygen!

entries.title: Let There Be Light
entries.description:
**Let There Be Light** is a tiny world simulator built for Ludum Dare 45.

Explore the elements and their effects, listen to the music generated by your world, and experience creations as you nudge, play, and discover.​

**Controls:**

Use your mouse to equip elements and place them in the world.

1, 2, 3, 4 on the keyboard also selects elements.

-
![Image4.png](///raw/55b/52/z/285a8.png)

entries.title: Over and over
entries.description:
![s1.jpg](///raw/947/c/z/26049.jpg)

![s4.jpg](///raw/947/c/z/2604b.jpg)

Hi guys, I always wanted to create a proper platformer game which will run smooth, so this is my try.
I m pretty interested about your opinions about the movement.This game is inspired by Jump King.


So, controls are easy just use side arrows to move, up arrow to jump and "B" button to dash in midair.
When you hold up arrow you jump higher, to jump low just tap the up arrow.

Thank you for your time and enjoy the game.

Spoiler alert!!

Spoiler alert!!

Spoiler alert!!

The game is pretty hard for nongamers, so if you will get mad after 1 minute, you are able to use "s" for save position and "x" to move for that position. The important thing is you have to find out why is this a good game for actual theme "Start with nothing". If you will be using this S and X buttons, there is no theme here.

entries.title: Wipe It
entries.description:
Start with nothing. Wipe with anything.

It’s your last chance to go to the toilet before your flight because nobody likes airplane toilets. And of course there's no toilet paper. There's only one thing to do.
Find a way to clean your behind and avoid getting famous on social media.

- All sounds and music made with our very own mouths
- Innovative pantless sneaking controls
- Creative butt wiping places
- Gleeful people trying to capture your every proud moment

Trailer:

youtu.be/XePFT0o5pLs

![Airplane.jpg](///raw/969/72/z/26b24.jpg)
![Falling.jpg](///raw/969/72/z/26b25.jpg)
![Photoing.jpg](///raw/969/72/z/26b27.jpg)
![Toilets.jpg](///raw/969/72/z/26b29.jpg)

entries.title: Chill Island
entries.description:
![ScreenShot00020.png](///raw/215/z/2684c.png)
You are trapped on a cold, stormy island. Starting with nothing, you must collect burning embers from lightning and create a smoke signal on the highest point to signal the rescue plane.

Controls:
* WASD/Arrow Keys - Move
* Left Click - Interact: Harvest tree, collect berries, collect ember, place building plan
* Right Click - Cancel building plan
* Space - Jump
* 1 - Start constructing wall
* 2 - Drop stick
* 3 - Start fire (if possessing ember)
* 4 - Eat red berry
* 5 - Eat green berry
* 6 - Eat blue berry

Notes:
* The red bar is your current health.
* The green bar is your food level. If it reaches zero you will take damage.
* The orange/blue bar is your temperature level. If it reaches either end you will take damage.
* Each type of berry has a random effect that changes with each game.

entries.title: Stranded
entries.description:
You wake up on a desert island. Gather what you need to survive and signal for help. Try to gather everything hidden throughout the island. As you gather, your camp will be built up, so return to it every once in a while.

![Stranded 10_7_2019 5_23_06 PM.png](///raw/a47/z/2835f.png)

*Note, this game has no lose conditions. You cannot actually starve or die. There is also no end screen for when you collect everything. You can alt-f4 to exit the game when you are done. Hope you all enjoy it!*

**Controls:**

WASD to move, Shift to run

Left click to collect items

Hold tab to display journal and supplies

Scroll wheel to navigate the journal

Press H to show/hide controls


*Made with Unity, Visual Studio, Beepbox, Audacity, Paint.NET, and Inkscape*

entries.title: Zombug Slayer
entries.description:
It's been a journey (with many miniature heart-attacks). After 72 grueling hours, this is the project in which I have to present to you all. This is my first Ludum Dare, so it is very exciting to show you all what I made. I'd love to know what you think and I would love to hear all of your feedback!

![Screenshot (15).png](///raw/50a/72/z/28089.png)

![Screenshot (16).png](///raw/50a/72/z/28091.png)

entries.title: Timed Cave
entries.description:
![gamejolt_cap1.png](///raw/61b/8/z/25fb1.png)

![gamejolt_cap2.png](///raw/61b/8/z/25fb3.png)

![gamejolt_cap3.png](///raw/61b/8/z/25fb4.png)

Get the treasure!

You’ll start with no tools for mining. Mine rocks to obtain coins so that you can purchase useful equipment for your adventure. But do hurry, time is running out!

You’ll pay a fee each time you re-enter the cave, so don’t hesitate on getting as much coins as you can.

Game ends when you find the treasure or you run out of money.

Controls:

A -> go left

D -> go right

Arrow keys -> dig in that direction

Shift -> use item (if purchased)

entries.title: Nothing
entries.description:
![screenshot_title.png](///raw/d1e/82/z/27227.png)

![screenshot_game.png](///raw/d1e/82/z/27229.png)


## Synopsis

A game starting with nothing (ha!), subverting established input paradigms to explore new methods of interaction.

Perhaps more interactive art than a typical game, the player has to learn the game mechanic by experimentation. 



## Tools

Godot Engine,
Blender,
Photoshop,
Ableton Live,
bfxr



## Misc 

Controls are explained on the title screen.

Hint: the game has more than one level.



## Devlog

Earlier versions used multiple axis for disjunctive RGB components, which was way more difficult to handle. The current version uses HSV. Those old calculations are still in the source code.

entries.title: Limbo
entries.description:
Programming: Preda |
Art: Jannick 
Soundeffects: Jannic and Preda

You wake up in an unknown place with no memory of who you are and how you got there. to get out of there, you will have to make your way through dark hallways and whatever might be roaming them. By picking up pieces of a police report you start to understand it more and more. Knowing the whole thing at the end.

![Limbo Windows 64bit Screenshot 2019.10.08 - 02.09.43.80.png](///raw/995/41/z/28679.png)
![Limbo Windows 64bit Screenshot 2019.10.08 - 02.09.03.39.png](///raw/995/41/z/2867a.png)
![Limbo Windows 64bit Screenshot 2019.10.08 - 02.08.37.74.png](///raw/995/41/z/2867b.png)
![Limbo Windows 64bit Screenshot 2019.10.08 - 02.08.50.59.png](///raw/995/41/z/2867c.png)

controls:
W A S D to move. |
E to interact. |
left shift to sprint. |
Tab to open inventory. |
R to use batteries and reload flashlight. |
F to turn flashlight on/off to stop it from consuming battery when not needed.

If everything goes black, its not a bug you've just ran out of power. You can look at your inventory with tab and see if you have any batteries, if you do you can just press 'R' in-out of inventory.
Also if you run out of power and batteries you can press escape and go back to the last checkpoint.

It was a pretty hard theme. We tried to spin the "You Start with Nothing" by taking away any context or objective from the player. We tried to keep the story subtle, but I dunno how well we did. (We kept finding weird glitches here and there)

entries.title: Idle Twit
entries.description:
Social media is the worst kind of idle game. 🐦🎮

HOW TO MAKE FRIENDS 🐦

- Interact with Twits and write your own to gain Peeps and Eggplants
- Gaining Peeps makes it easier to gain more Peeps and Eggplants

HOW TO USE SOCIAL MEDIA 📱

- Clicking the Graffiti button comments on a Twit
- Clicking the Echo button re-Twits that Twit
- Clicking the Eggplant button upvotes that Twit
- Writing in the Scratch Box will post Twits

TIPS FOR EARNING PEEPS ❤️
- Everyone loves Graffiti (but don't Graffiti your own Twits, that's just lame!)
- Echoing popular Twits will make you seem cool! (But who echoes their own Twits?)
- SMASH that Eggplant button and maybe the user who posted that Twit will be your Peep!

FAQ

*Am I doing it right? I've been playing for a while and I have 1 peep and a handful of Eggplants.*

This is an idle game - making friends takes a while. Try earning 100 Eggplants, maybe that will get more Peeps to show up! But even if you don't want to grind that much, however long you spend in the Twitverse, thanks for playing! <3


WARNING

This game may cause: fatigue, boredom, frustration, confusion, feelings of powerlessness, lack of agency, addiction, and in some cases death. Do not use Idle Twit if you are pregnant or nursing, or optimistic, impatient, or easily attached. Ask your doctor if social media is right for you.


![screenshot1.png](///raw/a7f/82/z/265b2.png)

![screenshot2.png](///raw/a7f/82/z/265b6.png)

entries.title: Game Master
entries.description:
# Description and Controls

You start with nothing. Even without a game. In this game, you should first make your game before play!

Build a game clicking in the icons on the bottom bar. From left to right, choose a background, put scenery elements, place the player, put some monsters and click play!

When playing, use arrow keys to move and spacebar to shoot. The shoot will go in the last direction you've walk.

![gamemaster3.png](///raw/424/82/z/298a2.png) 

# Development

100% pure javascript. No libs, not even jquery. 

# Tools

- Operating System: GNU/Linux Debian Stretch
- Source editor: Kate
- Browser: Chrome
- Graphic editor: LazPaint
- Sound: bfxr/Audacity
- Music: WolframTones

entries.title: Star Battle
entries.description:
STAR BATTLE is a game where you build and mine your own star system. Collect Creation Stars to spawn a star in EXO mode. Then explore your system in ENDO mode. Try different sizes of galaxies by adjusting the level. How much gold can you get?![screenshot1.png](///raw/598/2/z/268bd.png)

Audio sound effects and music tracks made with a Moog Voyager XL, Roland FA-08, and Ableton Live.

Changelog:

* Added `help()` function to display context-based instructions to players
* Fixed bug where planetoids wouldn't die when overmined
* Added `ButtonDetector()` class to help smooth out keystroke repeat issues
* Adjusted when sound effects are played to avoid muddy sound
* Fixed bug where start music got overplayed with level music

entries.title: &zwsp;
entries.description:
# Screenshots

![1.png](///raw/dc4/2/z/27e25.png)

![2.png](///raw/dc4/2/z/27e2b.png)

![3.png](///raw/dc4/2/z/27e2f.png)

# What does `&zwsp;` stand for?

- It is (an invented) [HTML entity](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/Entity) for [zero-width space](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zero-width_space). So our game title actually starts (and ends) with nothing.
- It is a [backronym](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Backronym) for

  **Zebras will solve problems**  
  **Zebras write some poetry**  
  **Zebras with silly plans**  
  **Zebras Wallow in Sorrow for Petting**  
  **Zebras with secret prophecies**  
  **ZWischen-SParen** (whatever that means :shrug: )  

which mostly refer to the cute zebra in our game:

![zebra.png](///raw/dc4/2/z/2786a.png)

entries.title: Press Start For Nothing
entries.description:
This is a game about nothing. It isn't even really a game. You should quit before you even begin...

entries.title: HOBO RAMPAGE
entries.description:
Hi people,
we are a group of five mentally challenged guys, who went full force to a unbelievable meta-level of the topic "Start with nothing". After a couple hours of debating an idea has been born. HOBO RAMPAGE.

 ![Crazy_1_Running_Attack_left.gif](///raw/503/72/z/27950.gif)

HOBO RAMPAGE is about a homeless guy, living in the streets of a nameless city. As if his circumstances were not already hard enough a bunch of assholes harass him. They take the last thing he has. His dignity. But as they take his last thing, they unleash something unexplicable. 

A GAME FOR ALL SENSES.
![game_menue-export.png](///raw/503/72/z/27a67.png)


CONTROLS
![Tutorial_Screen.png](///raw/503/72/z/27b0a.png)


LINK TO GAME

Please share your final scores as a comment!

# Instructions

entries.title: Chorus Critters
entries.description:
![cover2.png](///raw/83c/z/28703.png)

Chorus Critters (and some humans too)

Start anew after losing your beloved chorus, chill out, sing and... see what happens...
-Featuring Gabe the dog!- OMG

Background:

You, yes you, old and tired chorus master, black belt of the voice, after investing everything in a theatre and a team of the greatest singers you were able to find, a tragedy happened :( Everything you owned burnt down to a fire, losing all your chances to success in such a competitive environment. Yup, what a tragedy right?

Well just to breathe some fresh air and think about how you are going to get back in to your feet, you go for a walk, stop at some ruins near your town and start doing what you do best.

Long story short, start anew, you realise that just by singing you are attracting animals and making yourself some chorus with random singers around, yes! Some hope, not everything is lost.

**THE GAME:** (best played with headphones)

- **SING to your microphone! Activate your microphone and tune your voice!**
- **(While singing) Use Q(high), W(medium), E(low) to match the tiles**
- You are the main singer in your own chorus, attract other singers, the more you score, the more support you’ll attract.

_There is no winning or losing, but… try to go as long as you can before critters stop spawning, just for the lols_

-This game has been made with vanilla TypeScript, Adobbe Animate and omelette sandwiches.

Enjoy!

![quick tutorial.png](///raw/83c/z/286e3.png)

entries.title: Many Mini-Minions
entries.description:
![image 2.png](///raw/7aa/z/2907a.png)

Many Mini-Minions is a strategy role playing game where you play as an apprentice master of minions. Use magical seals to bind the monsters that roam this world to your control. Build a team of minions, and lead them to victory!

![image 4.png](///raw/7aa/z/29083.png)

### Controls:
Drag minions around the grid. Drag items from your inventory on to a minion to give it to them.

![anim 1.gif](///raw/7aa/z/29079.gif)

![image 3.png](///raw/7aa/z/29080.png)

entries.title: The Reader's Encounter
entries.description:
*You arrive from across the sea in the fetid hold of a rat-infested ship. You have left your friends behind — and with them, your books and the secrets you had uncovered. You are a reader, looking for secrets hidden by forgotten sages between the lines of their ancient tomes. Or rather, you were a reader; who knows what you are now, stranded alone in this foreign land. Perhaps here, unlike back home, there might be some use for your unusual skill?*

The Reader's Encounter is a short story-driven puzzle game about secret knowledge and manipulating words.​

![screen1.png](///raw/a26/72/z/27f3e.png)

The game has a built-in hint system; hints become active after 5 manipulations on each level. If you are stuck and the hints do not help, see the walkthrough here: https://pastebin.com/VwrEjUBH (caution: major spoilers!)​.

entries.title: The Runner
entries.description:
A trivial fighting game based on the principle of rock, paper, scissors.

The game is fun in single player, (you get a simple AI to play against), but the game was originally meant to be played with 2 players on the same screen. Find a friend and try it out! Can you stop your friend from getting a lot of kills and be a real hero?

No instructions required. The game will tell you what to do :)

This is my second Ludum Dare and I had a blast just like last time :)

![GamePic.png](///raw/d7b/81/z/26448.png)

![GamePic2.png](///raw/d7b/81/z/2644b.png)


Timelapse video of the development:

[The video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LhpmU3m1c1w)

entries.title: Zmaaone
entries.description:
Welcome to your new internship in **Zmaaone:tm:**, The world leader in parcel delivery !

![Zmaaone logo.png](///raw/4ae/82/z/27c7d.png)

Since you're starting at the very bottom of the corporate ladder, *with nothing*, your job will be to sort packages in our brand new "***Awesome Delivery System center***:tm:"  !

By linking our various *package sortingator* with our experimental *Rezstone Generator*, you'll be able to achieve wonder of engineering (unpaid, off course) !

But be careful, you'll need good timings and imaginative contraptions to be able to kickstart your corporate career successfully. 

![Circuit.gif](///raw/4ae/82/z/27ce3.gif)

Good luck, 
a wonderful underpaid future is awaiting you in **Zmaaone:tm:** !

![MyBoss.png](///raw/4ae/82/z/27c9d.png)


**Credits :**

**•**:art: Art, Music, Effect, level Design and a little bit of programming by **[Aune](https://ldjam.com/users/aune/)**

**•**:computer: Programming by **[Furano](https://ldjam.com/users/furano/)**


***This is our first Ludum Dare participation. Thanks for playing the game ! :smiley: ***

entries.title: Light Chaser
entries.description:
A tricky little Arcade game with flashy particles and some creepy autumn vibes.  

You start with nothing and you have to keep struggling to sustain the points you make. 

![Screenshot 10-07-2019 10.48.53.png](///raw/f29/82/z/26e73.png)

entries.title: Drum
entries.description:
Short platform game. Puzzle. You can jump and switch platforms. Easy boss in the end.
Collect drums, but remember - you start again when you die.

​Controls - AWD and Q, S/SPACE, E, F for instruments.

Screenshot:

entries.title: Escape Room
entries.description:
Can you solve the mazes in each room and escape? You start with nothing, no light!  You may need to place some lights, but be careful not to block your passage!

This is my first jam, really my first finished game.  I hope you enjoy!!

Controls:
WSAD or arrows for movement.
Left Click to Place a Light Block

![screenshot.GIF](///raw/240/82/z/25c58.gif)

entries.title: Llama Duck Mama
entries.description:
You're a llama... now go raise some ducks!

![Annotation 2019-10-08 001243.png](///raw/cde/22/z/28a13.png)

Controls:

WASD or Arrow Keys = movement

Hold E = Harvest

Press E = place items when you are clear of harvestable items

F = Cycle through the selected inventory item to place

C = Crafting menu

Crafting = Mouse over the item to see the required inputs and click it to craft one.

This was my second jam ever, and I think I bit off more than I can chew for a 48 hour jam. Unfortunately I didn't have time for any audio, and the animations are a bit strange. But the core mechanics are there. Enjoy chasing some ducks!

entries.title: Bearly Alive
entries.description:
## Bearly Alive
### LD45 - Start with nothing

You are a bear cub, alone and lost in a big forest. Winter is coming upon you soon, and you need to survive. Will you find mommy bear again?

entries.title: Rekindling Of Iron

Flesh ripped from bone. An unfulfilled prophecy. Traverse the dungeon, rekindle the iron, and break the curse.

entries.title: Start with "nothing"
entries.description:
![Zeichenflache_2.png](///raw/45b/c/z/285b7.png)

##### Content Warning: Suicide

Have you ever asked yourself what could ever hide behind the word “nothing”? There are many ways in this game to explore the secrets of something unknown. If you combine everything in a smart way you will see what you get from … nothing.

You simply play this game by clicking via drag and drop on different words and objects.
We are a nice, charismatic and sexy team of 7 and a half people. 
We hope you will enjoy this little game!

Cheers!

entries.title: Word Salad
entries.description:
![showcase.gif](///raw/a24/82/z/2687e.gif)

**WASD to move, click to attack. Escape to pause.** Your gun uses letters from the word "nothing" as ammo. You start with the word "nothing" (which does nothing). When you run out of ammo, you automatically switch to your fists.

**Punch zombies to make them drop letters.** You can pick up the letters and they will go into your gun. If you are using your fists and pick up a letter, you automatically switch back to your gun.

**Your gun does nothing unless you spell a word.** The gun just farts out dust if there's no active word spelled out in your gun. You can use this to your advantage to discard unwanted letters, one click at a time.

**Pick up letters in the correct order to spell out words.** When your gun's letters are glowing red, you have spelled a valid word.

**Spell a word to regain health and DESTROY your foes!** Each word is its own powered-up weapon. Click to fire out a projectile that kills scores of enemies! Shorter words like "no" and "hot" are quick ways to replenish lost health, and long words like "thigh" are effective weapons against crowds. For example:
- `no` shoots a 'no' sign
- `it` summons Pennywise the clown
- `ting` does... some-ting :wink:
- `hot` creates flames
- `noon` acts as a revolver (6 shots)
- `noggin` is the ultimate victory!

This game was built from scratch, in one C file, starting with nothing. :)
*If the audio sounds like it's skipping or stuttering, please let me know. If your antivirus quarantines the game, try temporarily disabling your antivirus. If you maximize the window it will stretch the whole screen - I didn't have time to make it resize properly - sorry!*

Full word list:
- `it` `go` `gt` `no`
- `ton` `hot` `hog` `hon` `ion` `inn`
- `ting` `onto` `noon` `hint` `goth` `thot` `high` `gong` `goon`
- `tooth` `thong` `thing` `thigh` `onion` `night` `ingot`
- `noggin`

**Patch v1.1 is here!**
- Fixed bug where dying didn't restore "noon" revolver ammunition.
- Fixed bug where some projectiles disappeared when hitting zombies.
- Fixed bug where zombies and projectiles moved too fast.
- Fixed bug where projectiles lived for too short.

entries.title: Little Robot Run
entries.description:
NOTE: YOU ONLY GET 1 LIFE, IF YOU LOSE IT YOU MUST START OVER. ALSO THERE ARE NO CHECKPOINTS BUT ITS NOT THAT LONG OF A GAME.

**BUGFIX EDIT**: I can't tell you how many times I played the game as I was designing it. But while testing it after uploading it I discovered a game breaking bug that I never encountered in all of my testing. The issue was when you got to the bottom of the red section after getting the spring the player would no longer be grounded which would cause you to be unable to jump, I checked the code and saw a potential problem and removed it. After testing it again everything seemed to be working. So I continued to play to make sure there wasn't anything else. Which of course there was because the universe is out to get me. This new issue dealt with trying to go through the red door after getting the red key. This made zero sense to me as the player has a collider and a ridgidbody and the door had a collider of it's own. If I jumped while touching the door it would open. I'm not sure what the issue was so if you encounter it, try jumping at the door. The yellow and blue doors work fine and I never encountered any error with them.

TL;DR: Fixed a game breaking bug dealing with the ability to jump and found another potential one that only happens some of the time. 


**BUGFIX EDIT2**: I believe I have resolved the issue with the red door not opening after you get the red key. So run little robot run!

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=--=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

 ** KNOWN ISSUES **

1. As mentioned above sometimes the red door will not open when you have the key. Jumping at the door is a possible way to fix it.

2. Speaking of the doors, there is no sound when you open them. I meant to put one in but it kept getting pushed and as you can see it was never put in. 

3. Sometimes when pressing down the animation for the box is slow to start but the effect still works. Not sure why this is happening.

4. Because of the way the character controller is setup it is possible to jump when falling off a platform while in the air after getting the spring that enables jumping.

5. While moving forward and falling off a platform after having gotten the DUCK, if you press and hold the DOWN key to turn into a box you will continue to move forward. This is especially bad if it happens when you are going for the blue key. As you will land on the bottom platforms and be shot by the turret. Thus ending your game and snatching victory from your grasp.

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=--=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

After suffering a vicious defeat six months ago, life with Dr Lud Umdare started getting worse and you've decided that you need to leave. After months of planning your route to the portal and the items you'll need to be successful you are ready to run.

First you'll need a SPRING so you can jump. The way to the portal will require it. There is one in the Red section of the base.

Next you'll need to get a DUCK if you're going to get by the floating sentries. The DUCK is a device Dr Lud Umdare created that allows robots to turn into boxes which the floating sentries are programmed to ignore. It just so happens to look like a duck and of no coincidence there is one in the Yellow section. 

Lastly you'll need to get a weapon installed so you can defect the creature who guards the portal room. You have a spot for the weapon already you'll just need one last piece to complete it. That piece is stored in the Blue section. 

Each section will also require a door key of the same color to open them. You know each section keeps its own door key but you were not able to discover where that was.

Besides the floating sentries and the portal guardian you'll also have to contend with the turrets that guard the base. The are indestructible so you'll just need to avoid their shots.



Once you get the SPRING you can start jumping using the SPACE key/Joystick Fire 1.

You use the DUCK hold the DOWN arrow key/DOWN on the joystick.

To fire the weapon once you complete it press the RIGHT CONTROL button/Joystick Fire 2.

** If you miss the spring you can restart by pressing R to restart the level. **


You are little robot and this is your story...

entries.title: Escape the Minotaur
entries.description:
​This game is a Ludum Dare 45 Submission. It is progressing game, where you need to run from the Minotaur, and if you can possibly defeat it! You can progress over time getting more stronger, and it is easier to kill the Minotaur!

This game was developed by University students from S.A.E. London, for some this game is the second game ever developed, for some it is the first! It was a really funny experience, even though we couldn't polish the game as much as we wanted and everything was breaking last minute. It was a good experience, and I hope you enjoy it!

We learned a lot in this project, which was what we were most looking forward to! Since this was everyone's first jam, it was very frustrating but very cool to work so closely and the team kept motivating each other!!


Sadly we couldn't put the game in the web sorry!

The controls are:

Right click - Bring torch up, can light other torches if close enough.
Left click - Attack if you have a sword
W-A-S-D - Move
E - open chest, grab torch from wall


Credits:

Pedro Rainha

João Guilherme

Freddy Hodge

Tachan Harris

Oliver Price​​

Umair Qazi​

Pierre Anisimov



![LD45 07_10_2019 22_05_07.png](///raw/bf2/92/z/27b0b.png)

entries.title: Socks

## Socks... the idle sock game... involving socks

### An idle game no one asked for

### A game made to fill a hole in the market... that did not exist.

### A game specifically developed for people who wear or have heard of socks

This is Socks... the idle clicker sock game... involving socks

![Socks Screen Shot.png](///raw/a69/22/z/29152.png)

The issue with size is now fixed :D (note the little magnifying glass in the top right of the screen shots!) 
You can also zoom back to the larger size if you happen to have a 4K screen . Alternatively, keep it tiny so your co-workers won’t even know you're not working.


The game itself is pretty simple. Click to earn money. Spend money on upgrades and auto clicking. Rinse and repeat! 

There is a lot of balancing issues, but with this being a Ludum Dare entry, I just didn’t have the time to get it sorted. I’ll be working on it though. 

Hope you enjoy it :)

Nothing to grab onto is a puzzle game where at the start, there's nothing to grab onto.

You are an alien astronaut and you've lost all your crew. You'll need to lauch yourself to little planets until you find something something to grab onto, the stars will be your friends.

![ezgif.com-optimize.gif](///raw/f26/a2/z/28e33.gif)
![Protagonist enters.png](///raw/f26/a2/z/291df.png)![Captura3.png](///raw/f26/a2/z/28e35.png)

**Full Gameplay**
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u2UfH9gaLTs

**Controls:**
- Go to a planets: Press left mouse button pointing to the cube.
- Rotate camera: Hold the right mouse button and drag.
- Restart level: Press R (Waring: In this Version doesn't work very well, we are trying to fix it, yhanks :D ^^.

**Credits:**
- Marc Galvez @optus23
- Jaume Montagut @JaumeMontagut

**Changelog:**

V.3
- After building, we found a bug in the build that didn't happen while we were developing on the editor, the player didn't stick to moving cubes.

V.4
- We deactivated things like crazy to try to fix the bug (such as, UI tutorial and player rotation).
- Time was running low so we made that if you won level 5, you went straight to the "beat the level" screen, avoiding the last 2 levels which involved the 'moving cubes' mechanic. This was the way we  could upload a 'finisheable' game on time.

V.5 (Post Jam)
- After the deadline, we fixed the 'player not sticking to moving cubes' bug (we creted a Unity development build and found there was an "NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object" error) and activated the last 2 scenes.
- We also reactivated the UI tutorial and player rotation.
- And we fixed that you could go back to the begging of the level if you pressed R as suggested by @afestivedolphin in the comments.

Tell us what you think about the game in the comments!

Thanks for playing ^^

entries.title: Blank Page Syndrome
entries.description:
Going meta with the theme and the fact that I struggled to find any idea that suits me : so I went with the blank page syndrome. You start from nothing, a blank page. And you have to fill it. Till the end. 
You will fight anxiety represented by those creatures that slow you down. But you will make it to the end. Cause we have to go to the end in Ludum Dare :)

Initially I wanted to use public domain poems ( and used time to do my research for that )... but I ( lately ) realised that may be against the rule of Compo… So I went head-on to wrote some poetry of my own, hope you'll like it :)

All in all, it feels like I set my goal to low. Next LD I will have to go on with more ambitious ideas instead of scratching them because “I won’t manage to finish them”. Give it a try dammit !

Opt-out of audio : 
Music generated with https://pernyblom.github.io/abundant-music/index.html
SFX generated with SFXR

entries.title: Draconomics
entries.description:
![title_animated.gif](///raw/9f2/z/27e6f.gif)

![ezgif-4-1cbcb8c6a112.gif](///raw/9f2/z/2888e.gif)

## How to play
- You need to collect 1,000,000 gold coins to win. If the dragon rage reaches 100% it's game over.
- If a mole gives the wrong treasure the dragon gets angry, otherwise you get gold coins.
- Kill unwanted moles with left-click.
- You start with a cap on your max treasure size, you have to buy and build mines to increase
the cap up to 1,000,000 before you can win!
- When you kill a mole the other moles panic and walk faster, their panic decays slowly when they are not
being killed.

Good luck!

## Description

This Dragon has no treasure hoard! 

Mole minions are running to bring him some of their treasure, but sometimes they bring him trash! Not to mention this dragon is picky, so he only wants particular treasures.

When the moles bring trash or treasure the dragon doesn't want, left click to fireball them! Dragon only wants what it wants. Whenever bad treasure or trash is given to the Dragon, he will become more and more enraged. If Dragon's rage reaches max level, it's game over!

The goal is to fill up the Dragon's treasure trove. Get 1,000,000 worth of treasure to win the game.

Dragon can build up another mole mine by paying 50,000 gold. Click the build button and place them anywhere on the map using left click. Mole mines increase the rate of treasures brought to the Dragon and also the treasure trove's cap! Dragon can also target and destroy mines.

But be careful. If you fireball too many mole minions, their panic will increase and they will run faster to you, bringing both trash and treasure! 

Feel like cheating?
Press 'G' to get 10,000 gold instantly!

Gameplay Video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4urBC3i63UU

![Screen-03.png](///raw/9f2/z/288ab.png)
![Screen-02.png](///raw/9f2/z/288ad.png)

entries.title: Relationship Calculator
entries.description:
"Relationship Calculator" predicts the type and duration of the relationship between you and her/him, using big data and mathematical formula.

### HOW IT WORKS
1. Input her/his name.
![1-input-name.gif](///raw/b27/z/27231.gif)

2. She/he will pick a random number while you start with 0. You need to match her/his number as close as you can using the calculator.
![2-math.gif](///raw/b27/z/27232.gif)

3. When you're satisfied with your number, press "END DAY" and get the "result symbol" based on your numbers.
![3-end-day.gif](///raw/b27/z/27233.gif)

4. When you've finished all 5 days' calculation, the final result of your relationship will be revealed. Good luck!
![4-result.gif](///raw/b27/z/27235.gif)

### PRO TIPS
1. Input large number by pressing two number buttons.
![tip-1-input-numbers.gif](///raw/b27/z/27239.gif)

2. The number will be clamped between 99 and -99. Use it wisely and you can get a large number easily.
![tip-2-cap-99.gif](///raw/b27/z/2723b.gif)

3. Use the operator buttons to operations.
![tip-3-operator.gif](///raw/b27/z/2723c.gif)

4. Number 0 is handy combined with operators.
![tip-4-0.gif](///raw/b27/z/2723d.gif)

5. The calculator can handle negative number. It's useful when target number has a different sign.
![tip-5-neg.gif](///raw/b27/z/2723e.gif)

entries.title: MLHA
entries.description:
MLHA 

„a thick cloud of tiny water droplets suspended in the atmosphere at or near the earth's surface that obscures or restricts visibility„

MLHA is an alternative walking simulator. The form is based on urban exploration.
Illustrations were based on real places. 

The whole project is a result of cooperation between a group of students from Ateliér Duchů (Herní Média) Faculty of Fine Arts - University of technology, Brno, Czech Republic.

Visual solution of the game was united through stylization. The look of the textures was achieved due to use of digitalized materials made by classic techniques. The visual impact of the environment is very complex due to the combination of abstract forms and concrete situations.
The atmosphere is supported by the use of original field recording and sound design. 
The unique aesthetics of the game world is a product of combining the talents and qualities of various artists.

- C - Opens Crafting
- Items:
	- 1 - ​UnEquip Item
	- 2 - Hatchet	
	- 3 - Axe​
	- 4 - Pickaxe
	- 5 - Sword	
	- 6 - Staff
	- 7 - ​Bow
- Mouse - Aim your tools/weapons

- Mouse Left Click - With a range weapon such as the bow or staff you can shoot projectiles by pressing LEFT CLICK

entries.title: i don't know what to feel anymore
entries.description:
it's like minesweeper. click around to find the goal. hearts indicate you are near the goal. no points are awarded and the levels go on forever.

pure html/css/javascript. almost all audio is synthesized on the fly via web audio, except for some sampled SID chip noise that plays at the end of each level.

it runs fine in chrome and firefox on osx. it's a little buggy in safari, and i haven't tested on windows or linux machines. if you're on a laptop i recommend using an external mouse rather than a trackpad.

this might be more a sound art piece than a game? idk

the fm synthesis operations can get pretty 𝖍𝖆𝖗𝖘𝖍 and 𝓪𝓰𝓰𝓻𝓮𝓼𝓼𝓲𝓿𝓮 so volume down if you're sensitive to ringing tones

tools used:
- sublime text 3
- cynthcart 2.0 for the SID noise, running in VICE

made at [Babycastles](http://www.babycastles.com) in nyc

entries.title: Kruzhok
entries.description:
Simple arcade game where your goal is to get as many points in 5 minutes as possible by collecting dots on the map and slashing your enemies, increasing your combo counter in the process. The higher your combo is the more abilities you have. But getting hit resets your combo back to zero, making you lose all of your abilities and forcing you to **START WITH NOTHING** again.
Recommended to play with gamepad.

Controls:

Left stick/WASD - movement

RT/(X)/Spacebar - attack

LT/(A)/Shift - dash

LB/(Y)/Q - shockwave

entries.title: Wirm
entries.description:
![cover](///content/ec5/3/z/26843.png)

Wirm is a platformer where you control a worm with groucho glasses. Wirm, the worm, starts with nothing and will have to acquire precious items to gain new abilities.

===========================================================

Made in 48-hours from the Ludum Dare Compo by Jordi Tudela Alcacer using:
- Unity 2019.2.8f1 Personal
- Photoshop
- Audition
- Bosca Ceoil

===========================================================

# Directions

- The levels are meant to be played sequentially. As you advance you will unlock new abilities.

# Controls

**General**
- **[A] / [D]**: Move Left / Right
- **[C]**: Submit (for the dialog boxes)

**Unlockables**:
- **[W]**: Go through doors to get to the next level (Level 1)
- **[Space]**: Jump (Level 2)
- **[Hold & Release Mouse1]**: Dash towards [Mouse Pointer] 

*Jump/dash recharges when you land. You can use a jump while falling*

**Quality of Life**:
- **[N]**: Next Level
- **[Esc]**: Main Menu

============================================================

# SCREENSHOTS
![screenshot1.png](///raw/ec5/3/z/268d2.png)

![screenshot2.png](///raw/ec5/3/z/268d5.png)

============================================================

# COMMENTS

- The first level is meant to be all black until you get the item (use the particles as an indicator)
- The dash is a last minute addition and it is nos as polished as it shoud be (but the chaotic behaviour is fun, maybe?)
  - Also, there is no icon for the item (red wig) and a white square & circle are used as placeholders

============================================================


# Changelog

[2019.10.09] *Level_02* was not included in the build and the player could not advance. Level_02 included in the build *(the level was already done, just forgot to added the scene in the build settings)*

===========================================================

# Contact
[twitter.com/bar0net](http://twitter.com/bar0net)

entries.title: Sneeter
entries.description:
![welcome to sneeter 2.png](///raw/b16/02/z/28731.png)

#### Build up your clout from nothing and become Sneeter Famous in this roguelike social media simulator. 

![sneeter2.png](///raw/b16/02/z/284fe.png)

**Sneeter.com** has very refined tastes, and every run you need to find out what they are by Sneeting into the abyss. Do they like dogs? Do they like cats? The only way to find out is to Sneet about it. If you make a good Sneet, then you get **clout**. And if you make a bad Sneet, well...

You'll just have to find out (actually though you just lose HP).

![sneeter3.png](///raw/b16/02/z/2852b.png)

#### How to play:

- Use the mouse to click on things!
- Each runthrough, people will **like** and **dislike** different things. It's up to you to find out what based on the reactions you get and use that to increase your clout.
- Build Sneets by collecting **templates** and **words** to put into the templates, whether using ones you get for free in the mail, or using ones you steal from other peoples' Sneets.
- **Attack** determines how much clout you get, **Defense** determines how much damage you take when you make a bad Sneet, and **HP** determines how much HP you start with.

If you want your Twitter/Discord name to be in our game you can send it to us [here](https://forms.gle/KfSZrJGzQXXFKHT47) and we'll add you after Ludum Dare is over!!


#### Credits:

Programming by 
- rob fichman https://twitter.com/bobacupcake

Art and writing by
- adam https://twitter.com/adam_s_j 
- ago https://twitter.com/agostaini
- andrea 'play kid icarus uprising' colorsplash https://twitter.com/ruddyroad
- andrew  https://twitter.com/legsrjust4show 
- carmela "g'raha tia final fantasy 14 lover" dansen https://twitter.com/carmeladansen 
- goldy https://twitter.com/sarazarann 
- lillie (our dog) 
- elly https://twitter.com/banananaki 
- dylan https://twitter.com/dylanrexed 
- james https://twitter.com/GusherGauntlet 
- peepo https://twitter.com/beeebobebo
- rob fichman https://twitter.com/bobacupcake 
- static https://twitter.com/staticcolour 

Fonts are from Chevy Ray's Pixel fonts!

and a big thank you to everyone who donated their display names to us!!

#### Known issues:
- If you die the UI freezes up and you can't click anything. Though this is a proper recreation of what happens when you die it is not intentional.
- If you go to make a Sneet but don't have the proper phrases/words to complete the Sneet, you'll be stuck there forever.
- Sometimes you'll make a Sneet so bad it kills you in one hit. You are not supposed to take that much damage at once.

Edit1: Fixed a bug that would not let you click on literally anything so thank god that's fixed am I right gamers

entries.title: Amalgame
entries.description:
# Concept

Flourish through your short lifespan in undefined scales.

Growth is an evolutionary decision-making process in this constantly shifting maze of beasts.
 
___________________________________________________________________________________________
 
![Amalgame3.png](///raw/4cd/82/z/27b65.png)
 
![Amalgame4.png](///raw/4cd/82/z/27b75.png)

![Amalgame6.png](///raw/4cd/82/z/27b7b.png)

___________________________________________________________________________________________

# Instructions
 
- Green enemies provide new cells

- Blue cells provide speed.
 
- Red cells provide a single-use passive defense.
 
- Yellow cells are used-up red cells.
 
- Survive 6min, your score is the number of cells in your body.

# Controls


| Action  | Keyboard | Gamepad |
|------|------|------| 
| Move | WASD or Arrows   | Left Stick |
| Dash | Space            | A |
| Evolve Speed (Blue) | Q | X |
| Evolve Shield (Red) | E | B |

entries.description:

![BBR_Screen_002.png](///raw/e72/82/z/26c45.png)

![BBR_Screen_004.png](///raw/e72/82/z/26c47.png)

For my first Ludum Dare (and game jam) I didn't quite finish in time for the compo, but I am happy with the result. The theme "Start with Nothing" inspired me to combine a roguelite dungeon crawler with the battle royale genre.  No this isn't yet another multiplayer only, battle royale.  BUT!..

Play as a dwarf that wakes up in a dungeon with absolutely nothing, and race to gather loot as flames fast approach...and then battle it out with a giant boss at the end. Check the notes on Itch or included in the ZIP file for controls, and known issues.

Note:  The loot that drops is randomized, so you might not see all items drop the first time you playthrough.

entries.title: A Platfomer
entries.description:
This is was made for Ludum Dare 45.

Description
A simple platformer, just make it to the goal, there is only one problem. There are no platforms, so you have to place them, but each platform you place will hurt your score.

The farther away you place the spawn point the higher base score your get, each other platform will remove score.

Try to make it to the goal with the highest possible score.
There are 6 levels, some have blocker and some have spikes, so you can’t always take a direct route.

I wanted to add more platforms types, pick ups and more fun levels, but ran out of time hehe.
I had fun and I hope you have fun playing it to.

![Screen03.png](///raw/c47/1/z/26167.png)

Controls
- Move - A/D
- Jump - Space
- Place object - Left Mouse Click
- Retry - R
- Main Menu - Escape

Sounds

Programs

- Unity 2019.3
- Visual Studio 2017
- Responsive WebGL Template

# What in tarnation is SOUL CORRUPTER?
* Swing on your tether around the map
* Gain speed to summon a portal and defeat enemies inside

In this game you play as a demon corrupting innocent souls to grow your strength. You are slow on your feet, but quick in the air. Using your grappling skull you are able to fly around the map and corrupt souls.

* release grapple by letting go of right trigger
* dash with left trigger

entries.title: Tightrope Gauntlet
entries.description:
https://youtu.be/5prWwbWi4Nc

**NOTE:**
I have added some minor adjustments to the controls post-compo from the feedback in the comments.
Jump and land are now one button(**Z**), and the game over screen is now skippable by pressing the jump and land button repeatedly. This is because a lot of people (understandably) found the length of time taken to get back to the start screen frustrating. I also increased the range in pixels where the player can use the land button to land back on the rope, as many were finding this extremely hard to do. Hope this helps!


**THE CONTROLS**


Left & right arrow - Catch weapon/Stab/Aim laser

Z - Jump/Land

X - Fire aimed laser

C - Drop current weapon

Thank you for taking the time to play Tightrope Gauntlet.
I've had a lot of fun making this, but there were many more features I wanted to add.

I will continue to develop this game beyond the competition so keep checking back.

And now...

**THE PLOT**

In the near future, people compete in virtual reality games.
One such game is the Tightrope Gauntlet.
The challenger has to remain balanced on the tightrope while
bombarded with enemies left and right.

To win, they must still be remaining on the rope after 5 minutes is up.


**YOU START WITH NOTHING.**

You may avoid the oncoming enemies by jumping over them, but be warned...
You have to hit the **Jump/Land** button before your feet fall beyond the rope
on the way down.

Occasionally a weapon may fly towards you. You can catch
it by using the **Catch** buttons.

If you manage to grab a sword, you can attack enemies by pressing
the **Left** or **Right** buttons.

A laser rifle will be your best friend, but you'll have to be
quick in dropping the sword and grabbing after. The *Drop* button will allow
you to drop your current weapon. Use the **Left** or **Right**
buttons to aim, and press the **Fire** button to shoot.

If you manage to stay on the rope for 5 minutes, you pass the gauntlet.
However, the enemy onslaught increases the less time you have left, and
the better the weaponry in your possession.

**FINAL WORD**


Enjoy the game, and if you have any comments or feedback, please let me know.


**TOOLS USED**

**Game engine**

Gamemaker Studio 1.4

**Art**

Aseprite

**Audio**

sfxr

Audacity

From Rags to Riches is a fantasy-themed incremental game.
The goal is to progress through the world map and ultimately conquer the shrine at the center.

In order to use the autosave function, please enable cookies when playing in a browser. Also note that the camera can be panned by dragging with the right mousebutton.

entries.title: Space Cell
entries.description:
![Screenie2.PNG](///raw/089/e/z/26b57.png)

Build your own asteroids!

## Controls
WASD to move, space to shoot, shift to swap between build & fight mode.

(alt controls are arrows to move, ctrl to shoot, tab/alt to swap modes)

In build mode, collect loot and drag components onto your ship with the mouse!

In fight mode, defend with your shield, dash and shoot around with your thrusters!

## Overview

- Attach GUNS for extra firepower against the incoming meteors.
- Attach THRUSTERS for more maneuverability and speed.
- Attach REACTORS for extra shield power.
- Attach STORAGE to hold more loot.
- Collect green LOOT for eternal glory.
- Protect your COCKPIT and CORE, or it's game over.

After being caught in the middle of a meteor storm, you're left deep in space with nothing but your cockpit and salvage core. Rebuild your ship with space scrap & collect more loot!

## Development

Made in 48 hours for the LD Compo. My first time using Godot (or any game engine), and it was a very smooth experience! Great tool! I think I was a bit ambitious with the theme, and probably spent a bit too much time mucking about with particle effects. As always, I probably could have done with spending less time on the base mechanics, and more on polishing some structure into the game.

### Tools:
- **Engine**: Godot
- **Graphics**: GIMP
- **Sound**: sfxr

### Changelog
- Asteroids were not firing in the right direction (at the player) because of a coordinate system bug. now they are more accurate
- Following this change, I had to reduce the fire rate to tame the difficulty slightly
- Damage to the cockpit turned everything red, now only cockpit turns red
- Fix shields and guns still working after death
- Added 'shift' as an option for swap mode (for web build - alt acts strangely in firefox)

# Please play in fullscreen and enjoy! :)
- Works best downloaded
- On web works best in firefox!
- On Chrome you have to close and reopen the tab after first load for some reason...

entries.title: Cowquest
entries.description:
![Cover.png](///raw/8d4/z/295df.png)

# Cowquest

A poignant adventure studying the mysterious origins of our universe and its evolution using multi-layered symbolism and metaphors. Scholars believe this piece of video-game may hold the key to unlocking our understanding of metaphysics!

You must renounce the desire for preconceived notions and bask in the immediacy of improvisation. It is not only a a profoundly comedic affair, but also simultaneously a thought-provoking commentary, a microcosm of society, an harrowing tragedy and a peaceful passing of time.

The unique beauty of absurdity is in its ability to seamlessly blend every emotion in the spectrum, far removed from the dignity of rationality.


## Controls

- WASD / Arrow: Walk
- Z: Interact / Confirm
- Mouse: Menuing features (except for one which is keyboard only)

## Enjoy!

The game is still very janky, but it's part of the charm!

---
## BEFORE CASTING VOTES

The game was NOT finished on Monday. Most of the main features were completed on Sunday, but missed the narrative element and story telling progression which mixes all the features together. The scope of the project was a little ambitious as you will see, and even an all-nighter wasn't enough to finish in time. I still posted in "Jam" because I think it wouldn't get much exposure in "Unfinished" and it would hurt to have such a passion project lost in the dark.

However keep in mind this is still a **post-jam** version only, finished 4 days later. I don't know if it's right for us to take votes, it'll be up to you to decide. 'Graphics', 'Audio' and possibly 'Humor' to some extent were fair and representative of the game on Monday when the jam ended, but the rest of the categories were absolutely not, especially for 'fun'.

If you feel like this is unfair to other games then stick to words. To us, comments are worth a thousand time more than scores. Ultimately we designed this game to make people feel happy, not to measure ourselves!

entries.title: Village Simulation Game
entries.description:
A simulation game about building up a village from nothing.

This game is played with the mouse. Click on objects in the world to instruct your villager to interact with them. By collecting enough resources you can start to build things, and attract more villagers.

**KNOWN ISSUE: Sometimes the game will pause without telling you. To resume, press the speed buttons again.**

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6lfoxGktmnk

You can play however you want, but if you'd like some more concrete goals, try these:

* Build first house  
* Build a food storage area  
* Collect 50 food  
* Build three houses  
* Craft a tool from the toolshed  
* Get some iron from the mine 


Other known issues:
* Sometimes villagers will become so hungry they refuse to do anything, (including eating). While this is a mood I can relate to, I consider this a bug not a feature.

entries.title: Start with no Fuel
entries.description:
"Guide: Captan of the space ship" initialized./nWellcome, captan! This guid will teach you how to surf the space and land on the planets.
To get off a planet, you need fuel. If you have run out of it... well there is a way to start the rocket with NOTHING.
Our scientists created a new tool that allows ships to rotate planets and so transform their angular velocity to the energy to get off it.
Press "A" and "D" to rotate planet, press "Space" if you have enoght speed to came off the planet.
If you have fuel, you can overcome gravity for some of it. Press "W" to do that. Also, if you have fuel, you can change direction of the spacecraft when in the space
"A" and "D" will turn you, while "W" will provide you some acceleration.
Use your mouse wheel to change size of the visible area.
Congratulations, you have learnt how to use your spaceship! Last advice: WATCH your oxygen amount. if you run out of it you die![img2.png](///raw/098/d1/z/269df.png)![img1.png](///raw/098/d1/z/269e0.png)

entries.title: Monster herding
entries.description:
Monster herding~ A tower defense game where you choose the path (NOW WITH BROWSER SUPPORT).

Build turrets to force the monsters to follow a specific path; careful, turrets cannot be deconstructed once built!

Monsters spawn on the purple tile, aim for the red tile, move fastest on the light green tiles, and slowest on the brown ones.

Turrets start with ineffective bullets, but can be upgraded to either high impact shells for maximum single target damage, or explosive shells for aoe damage.

Edit: I removed the windows build for the game, as it seems to have been giving issues and I couldn't find a way to properly fix it, BUT I have added an HTML5 (WebGL) build, so anyone should be able to play it though their browser!

entries.title: Beyond the Horizon
entries.description:
_"This land looks like it has been torn apart and sloppily put back together. What insane force could've turned it into such a spectacular patchwork?"_ 

![horizon_scr_01.png](///raw/1b5/2/z/296b1.png)

**Story:** after years of treasure hunting and adventuring you find yourself in a strange and hostile land shaken by mighty magical battles. And you know what? You've had enough, and you're going home. 

Good luck on your journey. It will be a perilous one, for sure, but just press straight on, don't look back, and you'll definitely reach your faraway motherland.
Because once you made up your mind, all roads lead home.

***
> * **Travel** through beautiful autumn-winter landscapes!  
> * **Scavenge** and use everything you can find!
> * **Engage** in special events and make tough choices!
> * **Reach** your final destination in the snowy forests!
> * **[Play in browser!](https://yanrishatum.itch.io/beyond-the-horizon)**

***

**Controls:** mouse only. Scroll to zoom in and out. Left-click to **travel** to an adjacent tile, gather resources and trigger events. Right-click on yourself to set up a **camp**, collecting all resources and events from the tiles around you. 

Your **goal** is to go as far as you can into the snowy forests to finally reach your hometown. Just choose a direction and march straight on! You literally **start with nothing** though, so your first objective is to plunder the village next to you and stock up on some resources. Keep a close eye on them, especially if you decide to travel in a group: 
- **food** and **water** sustain you and your companions on the journey, 
- **clothes** protect you from harsh environments like snow and Slith,
- **tools** are used to camp and trade. 

_Check out additional hints by reading tooltips in-game._

***

![horizon_scr_02.png](///raw/1b5/2/z/296b2.png)

Code: [Yanrishatum](https://twitter.com/yanrishatum). Art: [ZeusDex](https://twitter.com/zyuska_arts). Gamedesign, story: [Shess](https://twitter.com/yenneash). Music, SFX: [Theodote](https://twitter.com/bogdanr5000).

entries.title: Star Smasher
entries.description:
## About

How big can you get? As the one planet that finally figured out how to control its own orbit, you must dip and dodge gas giants, suns, and other large space objects as you absorb smaller planets to increase your size in the universe. As you get bigger, you may want to revisit those larger celestial bodies. The prey may just become the predator!

The goal of the each level is to reach a certain size by absorbing space objects that are smaller than you. As you grow bigger, you'll be able to consumer bigger and bigger objects. If you accidentally run into something bigger than you, you'll lose size, and if you lose enough size, you lose the level.

NOTE: The shader for the black hole in level 3 doesn't work in WebGL.  For the best experience, use the Windows download. 

## Movement

D or Right Arrow : Expand orbit

A or Left Arrow : Contract orbit

W or Up Arrow : Speed up

S or Down Arrow : Slow down

C : Toggle between side camera angle and top-down camera angle

## Engine

- Unity 2019.1.14f1
- FMod studio for music / sound effects

## Contributors

Adam Horvath - Programming, Art, Game Design

Andrew Clark - Programming, Game Design

Bloco - Music, SFX, Game Design

Tom Krzewski - Game Design

The theme of the game is somewhat applied  on current actuality having global warming in mind.

The aim of the game is to reduce the CO2 level to 0%. You reduce this by placing plants who suck up the CO2.

Because it's simplicity I made game pretty difficult so that the challenge makes the fun.

I hope you enjoy my game and hope to enjoy the other games as well.

Here is a video of how I beat the game:
https://youtu.be/batt3F565uY

[UPDATE]
Based on feedback:
- improved explanation at beginning.
- set starting money from 0 -> 20.
- fixed waiting when broke bug.

entries.title: Off The Streets!
entries.description:
This game didn't quite make it to the goals I had set, there were too many distractions this weekend, and I wasn't prepared to lose so many hours for socializing. But I did at least enjoy the process, and getting back into coding after about a year and a half off was great! Ludum Dare is a great way to spend your birthday, when you're a loner lol.

The game has no lose state, I didn't get it implemented in time, but the goal is to earn money and gain skills so that you can work better jobs and rent an apartment to Get Off the Streets, as the name suggests.

**IMPORTANT NOTE: **
You will need to use Alt + F4 to close the game, unless you run it windowed.

**CONTROLS:**
- Move with left and right arrow keys, or A and D
- Space to interact with the building you're in front of
- Shift while walking to sprint
- Shift while in a menu to close it
- Mouse to click on buttons to purchase/use

**TIPS**
When starting out, focus on rummaging in the dumpster for scraps which can be sold at the shop. You can use that money to invest in the bank for daily passive income, or you can level up stats at the library/gym to unlock jobs that pay better.

entries.title: My Friends Abandoned Me
entries.description:
![Cover image](///content/456/c/z/2643a.png)

### About
They left me, they literally left me before the jam even started. Actually I've been with nothing before the theme was revealed! 
My team mates couldn't participate in the jam BeCaUsE oF rEaSoNs (but these were important, to be honest). Since I am graphic designer I had two options: give up or learn some game engine. I present to you **THE RESULTS**.

### How to play?
Your goal is to escape the cellar. Exit is on tob of the empty room (so you strat with nothing, right?). Find more boxes to reach the ladder. Easy, right? Nope, there are bugs (literally and figuratively).

### Controls

| Button  | Action |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| **Lef arrow** or **A**  | Move left  |
| **Right arrow** or **D**  | Move right  |
| **Up arrow** or **W**  | Jump (you can also double jump)  |
| **Spacebar** or **Tab**  | Attack  |
| **E** or **Shift**  | Pick/drop a box  |

### Changelog

**07.10.2019**

Fixed an issue with weird behaviour of the boxes. It is not perfect, but these should act more properly now. No more sky jumping.

Removed one box from the starting room. Even after fixing physics issues the game was not chalenging and could be finished easly (it still can be, to be honest, but not THAT easy). 

### Known issues

~~Well, boxes can behave weird. There is something wrong with physics, for sure. I'll try to fix that. Tip: I'd avoid trying to pick a box if a character is "touching" two of them.~~ Fixed. I mean almost fixed. Well, it should be better now. At least I hope.

If you come really really really close to a box with another box in hands, they will switch places. But no more picking up a box you standing on!

Corpses of enemies doesn't fall. Damn bugs! They disapppear though, nice of them.


### Unknown issues

I suppose there is more than known issues. They're still unknown though.

### Credits

| User  | Credits |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| @foka  | Programming, graphics, almost everything  |
| @aart  | Absolutely nothing  |
| @sarneh| Absolutely nothing  |


### Music

* By: [TeknoAXE](http://teknoaxe.com/Home.php)
* Title: [Synthwave E](http://teknoaxe.com/Link_Code_3.php?q=1534)
* [License](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/)

entries.title: SYNTHMAN
entries.description:
![SYNTHMANLOGO.png](///raw/dab/82/z/283bf.png)

Have you ever been trapped in a abandoned subway station? We neither! But if we were, there is only one thing we'd wish for. What that is you ask? A flashlight? A gun? A warm wooly blanket to keep you warm while you take a nap in the corner? None of that Nonsense! ...Although... that blanket sounds splendidly comfy to be honest... Where were we? Oh yeah ... of course we'd wish for a [illegible scribbling] But if you don't believe us that it would be helpfull you, to put it quite frankly, better move your buttocks down there and try it yourself! 
![synthman_pic.JPG](///raw/dab/82/z/283b7.jpg)
Your Goal is to wake your inner bat and escape with nothing but sound to guide you. But beware! Those filthy, hairy, plague plagued rats lurk everywhere! They do have funny hats though tihihihihi

![keytar obtained.png](///raw/dab/82/z/28d0c.png)


![sonar02.png](///raw/dab/82/z/28d08.png)

We hope you'll have a lot of fun playing our game and enjoy the mechanics and visuals we poured days into.

## Controls

W A S D = Movement

SPACE = Pressing the synth

This Game has been a project of Students and recent graduates from the Stuttgart University and the State Academy of Art and Design Stuttgart. (Stuttgart in Germany that is, not one of those US copycats ;D  )

Many Users can double-click the .jar file and start the game. If you are unable to do that, open CMD and navigate in to the folder where the Synthman.jar is and then type in * java -jar SynthMan.jar * and press ENTER.

**Please try it out and have fun;)
We'd like to hear your feedback!**

entries.title: The Only Way is Down
entries.description:
![title.png](///raw/318/5/z/28376.png)

## IMPORTANT NOTICE
A version of the game has been released after the deadline of Ludum Dare. This new version only fixes a few fairly large bugs listed in the changelog below and does not add any new content to the game. The fixing of these issues after the competition deadline goes with the rules of the competition, however, if you take issue with this I have left up the original files marked (OLD) so you can play the game as it was if you should desire. Thanks for your understanding.

Changelog:
- Stopped story dialogue from appearing every level.
- Stopped player starting with a gun on the second go at tutorial.
- Menu settings carry over between runs.
- Fixed gun layer issues causing an invisible gun.
- Stopped tutorial stats from carrying over to start of a new run.
- Balanced painfully loud audio.
- Fixed shooting issue causing the player to float.
- Changed tutorial colliders to stop the player from being stuck at times.

## The Game
The Only Way is Down is an action, roguelike game set in the dangerous depths of Mars' expansive underground caverns. As an architect hired by Mars Mining Co. it's your job to figure out the mystery that has been plaguing the mines. After a strange occurrence at work, you are left without your stuff and trapped underground. Traverse through complex and winding cave systems, fighting off enemies and collecting items and upgrades to delve deeper underground. What lies at the centre of the planet? There is only one way to find out...

Our 6th entry into Ludum Dare and once again potentially a bit over-ambitious. The theme immediately made us think of roguelike games like the binding of Isaac and how you start with nothing but the base weapons and have to collect items and upgrades throughout the game, and we thought it would be great fun to try and make one of our own drawing influences from both games. Of all Ludum Dare games we have created, we believe this has the most promise for further development as roguelike games lend themselves well to more content being added to increase playability. Feedback is greatly appreciated both on bugs that need to be fixed and things you would like to see added wether items, enemies or other. Follow us on twitter if you want to keep posted about a post-jam version with features we didn't have time to implement within the competition hours.

The tutorial and story in the game can be disabled in the settings menu on the main menu if you want to start a quick run, however, if you have never played before I recommend keeping both enabled!

## How to play
There is an ingame tutorial which is the best way to learn how to play, however here is a brief overview of the controls:
- 'A' and 'D' to move left and right.
- 'W' to jump.
- Hold 'Shift' to sprint.
- Hold or click 'Left Mouse Button' to shoot.
- Press 'F' to drop dynamite.

## Notice
Please don't spoil the game for others, there is a special surprise for those good enough to make it through all 3 areas and complete it!

## Screenshots
All screenshots are taken from the first area and item room only to not spoil too much of the game!

## Links

## Future Development
If you are interested in the further development of the game, then feel free to subscribe to the devlog here: https://theonlywayisdowndevlog.wordpress.com/

entries.title: Alcindor the Alchemist
entries.description:
**Story:**
![alcindorcoverimage.jpg](///raw/ab7/z/26518.jpg)

One day when Alcindor was experimenting with creating something from nothing he got it all terribly wrong and instead transported himself to the middle of nowhere. So here we are in the middle of nowhere, starting with nothing, but at least the alchemist thinks he's got the spell right But he's going to need his magical keys and potions...


To make things worse, most of his potions and magical keys have been scattered across this strange world and if he's going to have any chance of making it home he's probably going to need some of those..


**How to play:**

Alcindor can transmute earth, water and fire into either stone, fire or water.

These elements are unfortunately also the way elemental demons enter the world.

So anything (except earth) will spawn demons.

Luckily the demons aren't too clever so they can be trapped or tricked.


Fire evaporates a water demon.

Water extinguishes a fire demon.

Water erodes a stone demon.




Collect the keys find the portal and.

Avoid the demons or trick them to their death


**Controls:**

XBox 360 controller or keyboard.

Buttons A/X/Y or keys E/F/G for the spells.


**Made using:**

C++ (Visual Studio 2019), SFML, Blender, Wings 3D, GIMP,LMMS, Audacity,bfxr, Notepad++.


**Tips:**

Alcindor can't really stand water, fire or demons. Don't stand too close to it!

When possible use potions to make a bridge across water or fire.

entries.title: Paws of Gold
entries.description:
You are a stray cat looking for a home. After receiving a kind gift from a traveling merchant you get inspired to pickup the art of trading. Your goal is to earn enough money to buy yourself a home.

**Warning: bad rhymes and cat puns ahead !!!**



**Tips:**

* Start high when selling items (try to find the sweet spot where customers won't instantly leave, which will happen if you start too high). Example: if an item sells for 20 try to sell it for 45 at first.

* Some items will be worth more on certain days. Be wary of buying "hot" items as they'll probably cost more.

* The cat will name the worth of some items throught out the game


**Known bugs**

* The price of hatchets seems to switch between ~20 and the normal higher price

* It can occur that 2 customers come at the same time. This won't break the game, but will result in a visual bug.
