entries.title: Election Simulator 2019 Island Edition
entries.description:
![promo001.png](///raw/11a/z/26289.png)

You are a young aspiring politician, ready to mix up the politics of Mariama, a small island in the middle of the Atlantic. You start with no voters, no one knows you, and honestly, no one cares about you (in politics). Gain popularity by buying ads or taking to shoutr.io to make some noise on social media. But take care, sometimes people will misunderstand what you write.

![promo002.png](///raw/11a/z/2628b.png)

By strategically working through the ranks you can become president of Mariama! Start with a cozy job in the parliament, move up to minister for dinosaurs, and increase your political power. Having already some political office helps to get elected in higher offices.

![promo003.png](///raw/11a/z/2628c.png)

A hint for shoutr.io messages: try to write positive things with a lot of positive words in it. Also, people love it if you mention them or their city.

**If the web version stays black just reload the page**

entries.title: Mole Bass
entries.description:
Create your own sound!

Find all rooms in the house and get some music stuff for your home cave

entries.title: Coinbold
entries.description:
![coinbold3.png](///raw/b0b/42/z/26939.png)

You are a blue kobold, and you collect coins. the room where you start has nothing in it, and as you collect coins, the music becomes more lively!

Well, my first time doing a compo by myself. This is largely unfinished and rough, but I really wanted to commit to submitting the work I was able to finish in time. I consider myself a novice with pico8, and this was time well spent in practice. I spent entirely too long on making the collision work! Please enjoy!

entries.title: Teotl
entries.description:
Use mouse​. Avoid green​​. Chase purple​​. Survive​​ and/or Kill.​


**Questions/​Advice:**

What's the point?
*I kept the game as clean as possible. Collect or survive. The more you collect, the bigger will be the cloud in the end.*


Music volume jumps.
*The song was randomly generated. Sorry for the annoying parts, but this was my best luck.*


SFX makes no sense.
*Ge-ne-ra-ted. The sound overall is the most frustrating part, but I did my best to reduce all the damage to the Universe.*


The game is slow/boring & you miss the theme.
*The same answer for both - this theme is the worst I ever got in a game jam. I will be very happy to hear how to improve the game AND keep the theme.*


**I hope you guys had more fun and inspiration than I did. Thank you for playing my game. Wish you good fortune and more fun next time!**

entries.title: Dead Again
entries.description:
You have died. The gods have decided to use you in their arena, where the souls of other men and creatures also lay trapped, unable to pass on to the afterlife.
You will have to compete with the others in the arena. If you die, the gods will bring you back to continue competing; a cycle of endless torment. If you win, and perhaps please the gods with your battle prowess in the arena, you might just earn a second chance at life...

When the game starts, you have the opportunity to select a weapon. Each weapon has different stats, like damage, range, and cooldown. Once you choose a weapon, your choice is final until you die again. After each victory, you'll be able to allocate some skill points - these persist after death, so if you're having trouble beating a certain enemy, keep fighting and leveling up.

Though starting with the right weapon will help you overcome certain enemies, sometimes the only way to win is to start with nothing...

## Controls

**WASD** - movement

**J** - **Dash** - Increase your speed. If you attack while dashing you'll score a critical hit.

**K** - **Attack**

**L** - **Dodge** - Allows you to pass through enemies - try pressing it while moving toward your enemy right as they swing to dodge their attack.

## Releases

 - **v1.3** - Big rebalancing. Most enemies have more health and do more damage. Changed the amount of skill points you can allocate and how much you gain. 
 - **v1.2** - Fixed issue where stamina was not upgradeable and where it didn't regenerate after a certain amount
 - **v1.1** - Fixed a few typos and miscellaneous bugs with skill points and unlockable features (fists)
 - **v1.0** - Initial release for LD45

## Screenshots

![Screen Shot 2019-10-07 at 5.17.06 PM.png](///raw/0c7/22/z/27b38.png)
![Screen Shot 2019-10-07 at 5.17.16 PM.png](///raw/0c7/22/z/27b3c.png)

## Team

Programming: @joe-bustamante, @dtkelch, @jason-porritt, @andyp

Music: @jason-porritt

## Info

**Graphics**

UI elements: [Kenney](https://kenney.nl/assets/ui-pack-rpg-expansion)

Font: [Retron2000](https://www.dafont.com/retron2000.font)

Sprites: [Dungeon Tileset by 0x72](https://0x72.itch.io/dungeontileset-ii)

Music made with [jxfr](https://jfxr.frozenfractal.com/) and [BeepBox](https://www.beepbox.co/)

Game development done with [Godot](https://godotengine.org/)

## Thanks for playing!

entries.title: Dayunisi Builds the World!
entries.description:
In the Cherokee creation story, the world was formed when Dayunisi, the Water Beetle, left the sky realm to find more room. When it found only water, it dove to the bottom of it and brought back some mud. This mud began to grow until it became the land mass we know as Earth. 

So here's a Terraria clone. 

![pic sunday 545 pm 2.png](///raw/a9e/d/z/265d6.png)

I didn't quite manage to finish it in time, so there's no end goal, the powerups don't actually work, and the map is relatively small. And, as seems to be tradition with me in these jams, I never got around to programming the death mechanic properly.

Controls:

A, D - Move

W / Space - Jump

Q, E - Change Equipment

Left Mouse Button - Mine block / Place block

Mouse Scroll Wheel - Change zoom level

entries.title: Generic Joe
entries.description:
This is Joe. Say hi, Joe!

Oh, you really don't want to say hi?

Oh, you're searching for some clothes. Sorry, I won't bother you.

Joe is searching for...

1. An orange shirt with blue stripes
2. A yellow hat
3. A badge

But Joe has nothing but ordinary clothes. He has nothing related to those clothes. So, he must make the trip to his local police clothes warehouse to get some. But, the warehouse is somewhat out of stock and confusing, so he must climb a bunch of ladders, press a bunch of switches, walk a couple miles, put on the proper police apparel, and find someone who will enlist him as a police officer. All without being physically fit enough to jump. All with epic music and fun art!

Note: Sometimes, you may walk towards something and not be able to walk any farther. If that happens, just back up, and try again. It may take several tries, but you will be able to continue walking eventually.

CONTROLS:

LEFT/RIGHT: LEFT AND RIGHT ARROWS
CLIMB LADDER: UP ARROW
SLIDE BLOCK: TOUCH IT
TOGGLE SWITCH: TOUCH IT
PICK UP ITEM: TOUCH IT

entries.title: Punch Punch Farm!
entries.description:
![zz.jpg](///raw/650/b/z/25ee9.jpg)

## Introduction

You've decided to abandon your boxing life to enjoy the peace of nature.

But you don't know anything about plants and country life, all you can do is punch, punch, punch!

Conquer nature with NOTHING but your fists and earn enough money to buy the home of your dreams, 
where you'll enjoy a well-deserved rest.

## What you need to do 

- Punch things to gather resources. 

- Sell it punching the coffer with the sign "Sell your goods"

- Go around and find Buy signs, punch it to buy upgrades.

- Earn 10.000 money and buy your home

- Enjoy it and DON'T TOUCH THE UNITY LOGO.

Have you tried to punch the su..? oh, nothing. Don't care about it.

## Commands

WASD - Movements

Left click - Left Punch 

Right click - Guess what? 

## Credits

@r4ndomthunder - Code

@andreadbx - 3D Art

@memel06 - Sound Design & Game Design

entries.title: The Chronicles of Stênio
entries.description:
![gamejolt-cover-1.png](///raw/bdc/2/z/27089.png)

The Chronicles of Stênio is a zelda-like game where you control Stênio, a mid age guy that randomly appeared in a medieval place and needs to find out what happened and his way back home.

![tcos-9.png](///raw/bdc/2/z/27090.png)
![tcos-13.png](///raw/bdc/2/z/27094.png)

# How to play
- Use **W,A,S,D** to walk. 
- When necessary, press **E** to interact with objects and dialogs.

You start with no skills. Once you find them:
- **Left Shift** to defend
- **Left Ctrl** to run
- **Space** to jump
- **X** or **ENTER** to attack

The game also supports Joysticks (partially) ingame:
- **Left analog** to walk
- **X** to interact
- **A** to jump
- **B** to attack
- **LB** to defend
- **RB** to run

# Have fun!

Please let me know if you have any troubles with the game. If your machine don't run the game very well, you can try to put the graphics on Low. There is an option in the main menu for it.

Also, feel free to record gameplays and put it on youtube if you want.

Don't forget to rate the game and, most important: leave your feedback in the comment section bellow!  :)

# [Play the game!](https://gamejolt.com/games/thechroniclesofstenio/443333)

entries.title: Edge of Twilight
entries.description:
![Edge_of_Twilight_logo_banner.png](///raw/b52/z/28781.png)  
Edge of Twilight is a City Builder Strategy Game, where you take control of a tiny town, one which is unprepared for the apocalypse. The Sun is being blocked out for a period of years, casting the world into abject darkness. Will your City be the one that survives? You start with nothing, no resources, and none of your buildings will make it through.  
  
  
#### NEWS  
- If you can: Download the game rather than playing with WebGL. It looks significantly better.  
- We're working on getting the game to be compatible with as many computers and operating systems as possible.  
  

#### About Us:  
Edge Of Twilight is from half of the team that brought you ATLANTIS (LD38), Off The Hook (LD41), DETRITUS (LD42), and De-Railed (LD43), and as of LD44, SHELTER! We're excited to return again for our Sixth completed game! This time we're joined by Courtbird, who provided the massive amount of writing it took to complete this monster.   


#### Social Media  
* **Company Twitter:** https://twitter.com/OccultSoftworks  
  
* **Nick's Twitter:** https://twitter.com/OccultGameDev  
* **Mel's Twitter:** https://twitter.com/FiresongBard  
* **Courtney's Twitter:** https://twitter.com/vault92e  
  
![giphy.gif](///raw/b52/z/287e8.gif)
We were not prepared for the coming Darkness.  

We had solved all the problems of the last world, but they left us unprepared for the next.
We saw ahead of us a gathering storm, we stared into the Abyss of the coming night that would devour us
The gathering twilight was upon us.

The sun is going to disappear for 5 years, and the city of Everett must re-outfit itself to survive this crisis. In a world with a solar based economy, this is no small task. Tear down the useless relics of the last world, and start again from nothing. Make fatiguing decisions, and accept their consequences in this turn-based city builder.  
  
![EdgeOfTwilightTitleScreen.gif](///raw/b52/z/28778.gif)

entries.title: Elementary Trouble
entries.description:
In elementary trouble you start as a blank and untainted crystal. In the beginning you can only use your clean energy to defend yourself against those vile elements attacking you from the corners of the map. But when you kill enough of one element (5 enemies), you can use the power of that element.

Controls:
Movement - WASD
Shooting and looking around - Mouse (LMB)

Switching elemental powers-
Alphanumerical1 - Basic clean energy
Alphanumerical2 - Water Spray
Alphanumerical3 - Spreading Fire
Alphanumerical4 - Wind pushes enemies away
Alphanumerical5 - Spawn a rose on mouse position that attracts all enemies for 12 seconds

![bandicam 2019-10-07 00-43-44-036.jpg](///raw/9b0/81/z/269c0.jpg)

entries.title: Something Special
entries.description:
![COVER.png](///raw/63c/02/z/2934e.png)

You are in the void. Darkness surrounds you. You can see a way out, but you cannot reach it. Start with nothing, finish with something...


Drag blocks and mechanisms to form a path, and walk along that path.


Arrows or AD = Move

Space or W = Jump

R = Restart level

Mouse = Drag and Drop

Download instructions: open Google Drive link, download archive, launch GAME.exe (you don't have to extract the files). Or you can use HTML5 version if you don't want to download anything!

entries.title: Appeasing the Quadopus

entries.title: ECHO
entries.description:
Title : 
![ecran_titre.png](///raw/ab6/82/z/273de.png)

GENRE : Exploration/ Survival 
 
DA : 8 bit/retro 

Developer team : 
![angryNERDS.png](///raw/ab6/82/z/27934.png)

GRaphic engine : Unity 

THEME : « Start with nothing » 

PITCH : The player embodies a strange creature just waking up from what seems to be a long sleep. After usig his capacity “sonar” for the first time, the walls of an ancient cave will briefly appear. In order to finally reach the so coveted exit, the player will have to be on the lookout, because he is not alone... 

Screenshots:

![CAPTURE1.PNG](///raw/ab6/82/z/27adf.png)
![CAPTURE2.PNG](///raw/ab6/82/z/27ae0.png)
![CAPTURE3.PNG](///raw/ab6/82/z/27ae8.png)
![CAPTURE4.PNG](///raw/ab6/82/z/27af0.png)
![CAPTURE5.PNG](///raw/ab6/82/z/27b04.png)
![CAPTURE6.PNG](///raw/ab6/82/z/27afa.png)
![CAPTURE7.PNG](///raw/ab6/82/z/27b07.png)


A few words about the creators: ANGRY NERDS/ Aka The studio

A team created by students from Gamesup, a French video game school, we wanted to challenge ourselves to create a game with a predefined theme in such a limited amount of time. The stress due to all of the different constraints and the proximity (9 persons gathered in the same room, for the happiness of ours dearest neighbors) gave us a taste of what a professional project can be, with moments of sadness that will make the playwrights cries, but we will get to it later. 

Just like in every self-respecting game project, the Game artists payed the price of the general lack of communication (I’m just specifying that text was written by a GAs, me, I’m just saying out loud what every Game artist thinks. The GDs lost an enormous amount of time to make complexes level design in papers cut and glued in a false cardboard (witch were all cut from a cereals box, the respect his gone, so far away), reminding themselves that Visio existed, 1 day before the deadline. 

![Capture.PNG](///raw/ab6/82/z/27441.png)
![image0.jpg](///raw/ab6/82/z/274a8.jpg)

The professionalism at his highest. 

The programmer, named Hugo, but I prefer to refer at him has “the guy who save the Jam” cause of his scripting talent, found amusing to ask the GAs to create that much model sheets and modular backgrounds/decorative elements (long live to the retro 8-bit). I didn’t count the number of failures and restarts, but watching the faces of the GDs bashed by some difficulties relaxes me.

It was our first time making an 8-bit game and create animation props, a rough experience but enjoyable. Ours Artistic Headmistress (Éline) fell in depression many times, for obscures reasons. Some artists felt sick (or had to, like, sleep. Obviously overrated) and were forced to quit the ship before the deadline. 

We’ll never forget them. 

I’m the only survivor, surrounded by strangers, making unspeakable noises, searching for problems that doesn’t even exist, patting keyboards like robots for their monstrous god: Unity.
It's actually during one of these moments of craziness that I took the time to wright those magnificent words just for you, who got through this (particularly longer than needed) text filled with ... nothingness, just a French humor touch. 

Whatever if the game correctly launches, we would improve it.
If the game can’t be played at his launch, we will take revenge and slaughter the GDs, because I don’t know what to do with this kind of situation... 
Whatever is the finalized result, the simple fact to see the beginning of a game which comes directly from our under slept brains, always gives us the same feeling : “I want to see more, when do we continue?” 

May our game amused you, and yours be accomplished

entries.title: Chasing Light
entries.description:
![Image.JPG](///raw/57a/92/z/270fd.jpg)

Survive as long as you can in the darkness. Gather light to increase how much you can see your surroundings, and use it to fight off enemies. Don't attack too much, or you'll run out of light!

Made for my first Ludum Dare! I hope you enjoy!

Thanks to @AFestiveDolphin for doing the great art and music <3


CONTROLS:

WASD: Move

LClick: Attack (with enough light)

Move cursor: Aim

entries.title: Space Shooter

Build your ship up from nothing by scavenging the remnants of your enemies.

entries.title: Styx
entries.description:
You start out with nothing, like... Well nothing nothing. You don't even have a body!

Welcome to Styx,

You're a ghost, a spirit or a will-of-the-wisp.  A trapped soul who can't cross the river styx to reach the underworld.  Fortunately there's a village nearby, I'm sure there's some nice friendly people in the village who would be willing to help a ghost out.  I'm in fact sure they would be screaming with delight at the sight of a spirit in need.

It might take a little work to find someone who can see and interact with you, but it's worth it if you want to reach the afterlife.

*Point and Click adventure game*

- Honestly, I fell kinda flat when it came to the storyline, I don't like spooky or spirits or ghosts. Check the game out for it's mechanics, and my first time doing real art for a game!  Woohoo.

- You may need to resize your browser (adjust window size/shape) to fit the game. It's designed to be A4 1:1.49 (I did my art on A4 paper)
- I highly recommend doing this in Chrome since I developed it on Chrome.
- Should be suitable for play on a touch screen device.  (Just tested it :) It works on the IPad, though the sounds are super slow to come through...)

I think the best play experience will come from downloading the source code, and running the index file located inside the Dist folder.  That way all the audio will be right there on your computer, and you won't have to wait for it to download before it start playing.

I hope you all enjoy, the "game" is pretty basic and blah, but the mechanics I think are solid!

entries.title: Small Town
entries.description:
![eek.gif](///raw/a58/72/z/287ab.gif)
# About 
#### You're a hardworking employee and student who forgot to go Christmas shopping, problem is: it's Christmas eve and you have * nothing *. Pick a place to buy the perfect present for your significant other, they deserve the best!

#### Gameplay: Short(1-3 Minutes), Interactive Narrative

# Controls
#### Press space to continue story, click to interact

# Credit
#### Programming + Art: [Emiliabeaexe](https://twitter.com/emiliabeaexe/), [Instagram: Emiliabhernandez](https://www.instagram.com/emiliabhernandez/)
#### Music: [Owen Smith](https://twitter.com/oweiney/)

# Known Issues
#### Try not to spam click or things might not be activated in time
#### Use only the spacebar to continue dialogue, don't click the screen pls

# Finally
#### I had a great time in my first ludum dare. I had to cut a bunch out, as I'm sure most people did, but I will do better next time at limiting my scope!

entries.title: Land for Sheep
entries.description:
There is only energy. From your energy, land and life will be created, and the land and life will return its energy to you.

The goal is to expand. Expand indefinitely. Good luck.

Controls
--------

* Place tiles and animals using the left mouse button.
* Consume animal energy by clicking animals with the left mouse button.
* Use WSAD to move.
* Use the mouse while holding the right mouse button to look around.
* Press escape to see the instructions in-game.​

Notes
-------
* All animals need to eat. Without food, they die. 
 * The orange bars above their heads indicate their hunger.
 * Sheep and cows eat grass.
 * Wolves eat sheep.
* The animals will multiply after some time, if they survive.
 * The pink bars above their heads indicate their ability to mate. Empty bars signal readiness. It's like a mating call, but with bars.

Screenshot
----------
![Screenshot.png](///raw/c44/32/z/272e0.png)

Changelog
---------
2019-10-07
- Fixed pathfinding. In some situations, the animals would be stuck.

Made using
----------
* Engine: Unity (LWRP)
* Modeling and animation: Blender
* 2D art: Krita, Gimp, Inkscape
* Music and sound effects: Boesca Ceoil, Audacity

entries.title: Jimbo's Ten Gallon Jamboree
entries.description:
A simple action RPG made for Ludum Dare 45. You play as Jimbo Tractor with one goal: get the tallest hat you can.

There is a "tutorial" area first, then you move on to a larger town with various dungeons. The game features real-time and turn-based combat.

KNOWN ISSUES:
- It would be smart to make a save in each dungeon, before you finish it, lest yee suffer the fate of a fatal game crash. If this happens, just re-load the save. I was not able to figure out why some boss battles cause a crash...sometimes.

![easton.png](///raw/fdc/72/z/27e18.png)

![dungeon.png](///raw/fdc/72/z/27e1c.png)

![battle.png](///raw/fdc/72/z/27e22.png)

CONTROLS:
- WASD/LMB to move
- Space/LMB to interact
- RMB to rotate camera
- Scroll wheel to zoom camera
- I for inventory
- ESC to pause

CHANGES:
- Oct 8. 2019: the tutorial area of the game was updated to make it more clear on how to proceed past the dreaded pigs

entries.title: ESCAPE
entries.description:
Welcome to escape.

My attempt at using a bit more physics in a game.

You're stranded on an unknown planet in a small survival pod.

You need to gather spaceship parts to get away from the planet.

You pod is very fragile and you have to stay away from walls as well as meteors while you try to find the parts.


To collect parts, use your small pod to find them and bring them back using your tractor beam.

Avoid hitting the ground, or being hit by meteors.

HINT: the world is a bit big (other features planned and so on). Some of the parts might be a bit difficult to find. Go down the shaft to the right and it should be quite easy :)

When you have attached all the parts to the pad. Attach yourself to the top of the rocket to finish the game!

Good luck!

NOTE: I notice the WebGL build seem to have a few graphical artifacts and strange seems. I'll add a Windows build later.

entries.title: Grab your katana!
entries.description:
![full3.png](///raw/920/8/z/29833.png)

## Foreword:

Hey everybody!

Here is my first COMPO entry.

For like half an hour before LD starts I first time dived into Game Maker Studio. And here is the result after precisely 22h of work and watching tutorials.

It was really fun to create a whole project cycle solo. Even those few sounds I added created using an audio recorder. xD

Actually I have started creating the game with visual code, but feeling not comfortable enough with it, I moved to common scripts in the middle of the jam.

As a result I have not much of gameplay. Even this katana feature was implemented to support the theme at least in some way.
But I am not a code guy totally, so even so this result is a small personal achievement for me.

I had a learning goal, and I achieved it. So I am proud of it. :3

**[Here I will add some tutorial links I used during the jam soon]**

**P.s.** To be very honest, before updating LD page I fixed a crystal feature (noticed it is not adding speed in the morning) and added death animation on character (same as on monster). I took me 15 minutes out of the jam.

Oh, just noticed I accidentally added a death animation on katana grab with this fix. Mm, ok. Let it be. xD

## Genre:

**Top-down action RPG**.


## Description:

Grab your katana and slash monsters.

Get crystals to raise your speed.

Struggle to have a high score.

And relaunch the game to restart because I did not have time to add the restart feature. xD

## Controls:

**W,A,S,D / Arrows** - **Movement**

**Aim attack with mouse**

**Left Mouse Button** - **Attack**

entries.title: Hermitage
entries.description:
*Alone in the woods lived a happy hermit who had nothing and wanted for nothing...*

![Hermitage.png](///raw/b42/82/z/26781.png)

- Arrow keys to move
- X to interact
- F12 to toggle fullscreen
- Esc to exit abruptly and without warning


This was my first attempt at Ludum Dare!

The game is written in C# with the [FNA](https://fna-xna.github.io/) framework. Music was written with [Pico-8](https://www.lexaloffle.com/pico-8.php)'s tracker and art was drawn using [Pyxel Edit](https://pyxeledit.com/).

entries.title: LD45_PickUpTheSword
entries.description:
LD45 starts, then I made a small, a very small platform game: Pick Up The Sword, to join this big party~
But for me, I find myself so lack of experince to make a whole game on my own in 48 hours. I really tried my best.
It has no music or sound, code is not health enough, level design is crap like hell...But still, it's my first game in LD.
So A and D to move, W or SPACE to jump, E to interact with NPC or door, button J, well, you can guess.
I know this game sucks, but I still enjoy the process :D

LOG:
fixed #1 accidently you can't open a dialog after you're reborn
fixed #2 slime can't attack you from your right
fixed #3 increase walking speed and animation speed a little bit
fixed #4 health won't go below 0 after you died
add #1 there is a new dialogue after you reborn, to replace the dialog the stranger has already said.

entries.title: Mastafoon!
entries.description:
![day3_animation.gif](///raw/f82/z/27784.gif)
You start locked up. :lock: :cry:

Somewhat humiliated and most determined to break free.

Avoid pesky *do-gooders* :angry: and other obstacles as you navigate the prison hallways.

Look for teleporters and don't be afraid of spiders :spider:

**How to play**
* `WASD` / `Arrows` to navigate
* `1-5` are hotkeys to drop items in your inventory (you can also use your mouse)
* `E` ends your turn
* `R` surrenders / restarts level.


**Special thanks to @skymandr for the elevator pitch that became the game**

entries.title: Big Brain Boy: An Intellectual Odyssey (now with GALAXY EDITION)
entries.description:
**ALERT**

We have released a new, post-Ludum patch of BBB titled GALAXY EDITION. This release squashes bugs, fixes colliders, reintroduces the green alien boi, features FULL VOICE ACTING, and adds an actual ending. We HIGHLY SUGGEST playing the new galaxy edition, but understand that its additions should not be judged for rating purposes. The original upload will still be available to play and rate below.

Inspired by the entire history of mankind, Big Brain Boy: An Intellectual Odyssey (abrv. BBB) chronicles the collective cognitive evolution of our species, exploring how our attention turned from what lies beneath our feet to what lies beyond the stars. You begin as Doug, a humble man who quite literally knows nothing, and share in his elation as he discovers sight, smell and speech for the very first time. No game before has so viscerally and accurately captured the magic of learning.

In BBB, curiosity is your guide, as you explore you surroundings and activate segments of your mind through pulse-pounding bullet hell gameplay. As Doug's intelligence grows, so does his confidence, leading him on an earnest crusade to become the savior of humanity. Is your brain the brain of galaxies?

Featuring music by alto (https://soundcloud.com/alto13)

![Screen Shot 2019-10-15 at 9.18.06 PM.png](///raw/c34/a2/z/29a1c.png)

Accolades for Big Brain Boy: An Intellectual Odyssey:

"It's not just a shitpost, it's a good game." - Kuviman, certified galaxy brain (https://www.twitch.tv/kuviman)

![bbb_bh.png](///raw/c34/a2/z/28de4.png)

![colorBrain.JPG](///raw/f91/92/z/27ee3.jpg)

entries.title: 28Ti
entries.description:
**TL; DR**  
Your computer doesn't have enough GPUs to render all textures in this game at once. You actually start with almost nothing. Collect more graphics cards to get sharper textures, better music and more objects rendered at once.  
Tell us in the comments what level you managed to reach :slight_smile: 

Play with resolution ratio 16:9!!!

**Warning** The Web version runs a bit slowly so we strongly recommend using a standalone executable for your system (if it's not there yet, we'll add it later).


When you start playing a game, you expect some basic things. To name a few, you at least want to have graphics and audio. 28Ti features puzzle-platformer gameplay that allows you to improve graphics and sound of the game as you progress through the levels.  
The game revolves around existing objects that are not rendered until you have sufficient amount of graphics cards collected. As well as revealing more and more of the level contents to your eye, those cards also improve the quality of all textures and even affect the quality of the music.  
28Ti is a level based puzzle-platformer game, which in our interpretation means that you need to solve problems, relying on your skills with the controls as well as how to use them in certain situations. Your memory is also important, as quite frequently you will be facing invisible (not rendered) obstacles in order to get to the next card. However, at the end of the level, when the exit portal appears, nothing on the level is hidden from you, so you can see the justifications of your (most likely) numerous deaths.   
The game starts easy and over the course of three manually created levels builds up to rather extreme scales of difficulty. For the most determined people, after the ending titles there will be a bonus level, so don't "Alt+F4" when you reach that moment if you wish to challenge yourself!  
Even if you ragequit mid-game and decide not to continue, let us know what you think of it (we expect much flaming towards our level designer anyway :slight_smile: ).   

**!The game does not have saves or a level selector, so don't close it if you wish to continue from where you left it!**  

_// All textures, animation and visual effects as well as the music pieces were created by the team from scratch. The only used asset provided an abstract background. //_

entries.title: Rush, Fumble, and Chomp (play in browser!)
entries.description:
![flytrappiggy.png](///raw/e01/82/z/2762a.png)


You are a brand new baby Venus flytrap (Dionaea muscipula) and you are hungry for flies! But beware: there's a bunch of guinea pigs on the loose, and they're coming to knock you off your sunny perch. Use the arrow keys or WASD to dodge piggies and the space bar to chomp at flies. See how long you can last!! (Exit the application with Q)

Note: Web version has been updated since initial publication. Start-up lag has been reduced, controls were adjusted to be less slippery, and graphics settings were changed so shadows are rendered in webgl viewport. Assets & code remain unchanged, otherwise.

entries.title: PolyPeople
entries.description:
​PolyPeople !


This game is my submission for LudumDare 45 with theme : Start with Nothing.


You can move with ZQSD or with the arrows and interract with people or object by pressing "SPACE". You go through the dialogues by clicking the button continue in the dialogue box.


The goal of this game is rally the whole village with you to overthrow the lord that humiliated you. But in order to rally the village, you have to help them with their task  Talk to them to know their needs and find what they want so they will help you through your rebellion.


DISCLAIMER : This project being my first jam and a full discovery of Unity, it is far from being finished : All green triangles represent objects and collision with walls are buggy. There is no win condition implemented right now but I am really proud of work so I share it here !

entries.description:

Drift through the Nullspace with your Null Blob

W,A,S,D or Arrow Keys to control.

There are different (invisible but still there) 'floor' properties, which will cause the Blob to change its rolling behaviors as you travel along.

Softbody physics using the awesome MathUtilities from Johnathon Selstad

Music made using [LOFI CHIP-HOP MACHINE] by fricochet

entries.title: Knight of Redemption
entries.description:
You have been exiled from the kingdom for terrible misdeeds, stripped of your possessions and your honour. To regain what has been lost, you must battle your way through the dungeons of Gloomnor, filled with dangerous monsters. Within you may find secrets of redemption and new treasures, in the quest to regain your honour and your place in the kingdom.

entries.title: Neon Merge
entries.description:
Neon Merge is a Puzzle platform game where you need to attach and detach yourself strategically to progress into the game.

Play it opn your browser: https://crostegi.itch.io/robsonneonmerge

It looks like the online version is messing a bit with the physics of the game, for a better experience, try downloading it ^^

## CONTROLS:

-Space (Fast click): Attach neighbors (And neighbors of your attached blocks)

-Space (Hold for about 1.5s and then release): Detach all blocks

-A or <: Walk left

-D or >: Walk right

entries.title: Runed Memory
entries.description:
## Introduction and Controls

Nothing. You remember nothing.

What is this staff? [**Click** to cast spells]

What is this dusty book? [**Shift** to open spellbook]

Even moving is hard [**WASD/Arrow Keys**]

Red eyes are glowing menacingly. Will you survive?

## Updates

2019/10/8 - Lowered music volume; fixed monster spawn rate

## Credits

* **Design, Programming, Visual Effects:**
Tony Aquino, Warren Dukes, Brian McBarron, Chris Pitstick, Kevin Pitstick, Zak Wise
* **GUI Design:** Kevin Pitstick
* **Level Design:** Zak Wise
* **Sound and Music:** Warren Dukes
* **Voxel Art:** Brian McBarron

Thanks to [Babylon.js](https://babylonjs.com) for the framework, [Qubicle](https://www.minddesk.com/) for the voxel editor, and [Hermetica](https://www.avanavana.com/hermetica/) for the awesome rune font!

## Screen Captures

  Runed Memory                                 |  Can you remember your spells?
:---------------------------------------------:|:---------------------------------------------:
![runed-title.png](///raw/01e/12/z/28fea.png)  | ![Cap7-2.png](///raw/01e/12/z/28886.png)

  Eat some lightning!                          |  How did they get up there?
:---------------------------------------------:|:---------------------------------------------:
![Cap3-2.png](///raw/01e/12/z/2888d.png)       | ![send.png](///raw/01e/12/z/2888c.png)

## Editorial Comments (from Brian/ComicSans)

This is more of a tech demo than a game. Our purpose was to learn new technology (TypeScript, BabylonJS) and have fun. You can see the pieces of a game are in there, but we didn't bother to string them together in a meaningful way. Still, we hope you have fun blowing up monsters and enjoy the experience.

entries.title: A Fishermans Friendly Island Builder
entries.description:
Hello, Hello.

As for everyone, my game is full of buggs, "content" had to be cut. so what you see is the bare bone, from what i imagined my game to be.

the game was made with start with nothing in mind.  start on a tiny piece of an island. then catch drifting wood and leaves, and smash them together to increase the size of the island.
this was going to be the first stage, where when the island was fully Explored/Build, then the second stage will begin. plants trees minerals and other objects of those kinds will start popping up on the island. and the player were supposed to build a comunity, to eventualy sail out to the seas.

buuuuuuuut only barely managed to get stage one completed, but there are no polish at all, i made the gui and character with fishing in the last 3 hours so myeah, some polish is definitly needed.

there is no sound aswell.


How To Play:
use the arrow keys to move the character.
to expand the island click on the shovel and pickaxe symbol. to expand the island you need 2 wood and 2 leafs each expansion.
to fish you need to stand at the shore of the beach. (the collision is abit bugged on the hook, a simple change but time)

when you feel satisfied with the game, press alt + f4 to exit the game.   didnt make a exit button :dog: 



feel free to completely destoy me in the comment section, feedback is always welcome either good or bad.

entries.title: SwordMaster
entries.description:
My first Ludum Dare entry!! 
Also worked on game solo.


Ludum dare 45 entry by "HiveMinds"

Theme - "Start with nothing"

Title - "SwordMaster"

DISCLAIMERS:
Crude language - If it bothers anyone of you guys.
Only windows build was tested - Please comment if you seem to be getting problems!

I started out with tackling this theme - just as confused as everybody else.
The logical way to approach this theme, was to have an entry where you gradually evolve the capabilities of the player / game the farther you progress.

I saw a unique twist I could take this:
You start with nothing. But you don't gain anything at all.
The game is designed to let you really play with whatever little you can do and how it affects the environment.

So in the end, you start with nothing but you do gain something - experience, skill, knowledge.




STORY:

"""

Play as a master swordsman, entering finally his 1st real dungeon to smite all who stand before him with his mighty sword!!!

At least I hope he does. 

...

Is that his sword here near the couch?

HEY WAIT UP!!!!- Welp he's already locked inside.

.....

Hope it goes well......

"""



Would love feedback (even negative feedback is welcome)!!
Hope you enjoy!

Tech stack:
- Unity3D
- Unity CineMachine
- Unity TimeLine
- TextMeshPro
- Bosca Ceoil


Resources (Special thanks to the following for public domain assets):
- `.fbx` Assets by Quaternius (http://quaternius.com).
- MicroSoft's Cascadia Code font.

entries.title: Nothing But Hunger
entries.description:
# Description

You are a monster. You are very hungry. Everything looks tasty. Eat everything on your path ! Some enemies excite your hunger. Devour them as fast as possible.

The theme was Start with nothing. You start with your belly so very empty. You win when you are finally not hungry anymore.

The game is hosted on itch.io. You can also find the linux and windows unity executables on the itch.io page.

# Controls

WASD or arrow keys to move around.
R to restart if you are in a hurry.
Esc to go back to the menu.

In the menu, Esc to quit and Enter to Start if you don't want to use the mouse.

# Screenshots

![MenuFinal.png](///raw/d99/z/267a4.png)
![SoHungry.png](///raw/d99/z/267ab.png)
![ReallyHungry.png](///raw/d99/z/267a6.png)

# Tools && Wrapup

This was my first time using Unity so I had to learn everything while jamming.
I used Gimp for the graphisms and Audacity for the only sound I added.

# Edit

BugFix 1: Added the J key to activate the consume ability. This makes it possible for player with no mouse to play. (right click with the mouse isn't easy with a touchpad :( )

entries.title: Emergency Procedures
entries.description:
In the distant Future, humanity conquered The Final Frontier. However, some sturdy ancient methods found their way into the future alongside unbelievable, fiction-like technologies. For instance, in this future biomech robots that depend on oxygen use vacuum energy batteries to jumpstart failed quantum fusion reactors.


![Записати.PNG](///raw/c46/72/z/29243.png)

You activate yourself in the engeneering bay to alarm horns blaring and a monotone repetition of the automated emergency beacon. Your only task now is to restart the reactor on the dying ship, whatever the cost, whatever the purpose.


**DISCLAMER**
This is my first ever. First time participating, first time making a game from scratch, first time doing graphics, like literally the first time i ever placed a pixel on a monitor.
The game is not complete. It lacks half it's manual, the main meu, some of the story telling, and most importantly SOUND, 
all due to my crappy time-management skills. I've decided to post it, as the core game is playable, maybe not fully enjoyable

**SHORT MANUAL** 
Use mouseclick and hold LMB to jump from wall to wall.
You have to find the battery, fill it with vacuum (i know) in the airlock (it depressurizes for 5 seconds), charge the battery in the vacuum generator and discharge in the reactor charger.

Pay attention to life support levels as 0 will kill you,
and shield levels as asteroids will too.

to charge them up use the manual power generator.


**Changelog:**

~~fixed small but very annoying ui click-through bug that inconvinienced player movement;~~
fixed a cosmetic issue where some ui elements were not supposed to be interactable;

~~unfixed previous fix because it broke everything.~~
fixed a stupid labeling error.

fixed the annoying ui bug.
small collider problems fixed!


![54.PNG](///raw/c46/72/z/29244.png)

entries.title: You Gotta Be Kitten Me

A game by [Engima Dragons](https://enigmadragons.itch.io/) for [Ludum Dare 45](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/45/you-gotta-be-kitten-me)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i2Ujrd8n6gM

## About

You Gotta Be Kitten Me is a 3D Platformer built in Unity 2019. You play as a mutant cat attempting to escape from the A.C.F (Animal Cruelty Factory). As you progress through the laboratory the cat unlocks new abilities allowing the player to get closer to escaping.

## Features

entries.title: Quest about... Nothing?
entries.description:
## Hello everybody!
This time we decided to make a quest game. As always, we added some humor to it. I hope you enjoy this quest, quest about... nothing?
 
Although I do not think that it is about nothing. After all, doing the same as the characters from this game is quite real... 

Many thanks to **СircleOfLife**, for what he invented and detailed the plot of the game.
# Actually, about the game
![ld45prew1.png](///raw/453/e1/z/26edc.png)

There are **12** endings in this small game. And below, I wrote useful information about hotkeys:
```
** Space ** - skip (text)
** 1, 2, 3, 4 ** - choose an answer ~~you only need the first three~~
** WASD ** - move
** E ** - use
** P ** - FULLSCREEN (Only after the start of the game)
Extra:
** Shift ** - run
** Ctrl ** - walk
** secret key ** - dev Mode (useless)
```
## CREDITS
- CircleOfLife - author of the story, graphics designer;

- Me - mostly, programmer

- Freesound.org - sounds & music, special - [ValentinSosnitskiy](https://freesound.org/people/ValentinSosnitskiy/sounds/331596/) (for the music - September_Hords_Loop_mp3)

## What's next?
If you liked the game (or vice versa), let us know about it. Also, if you have any questions or suggestions, write about it in the comments!

If the project gains a good rating, then perhaps we will continue this story and make a full-fledged game, only with:

- better graphics

- optimization

- more choices and locations

# Finally
You can download the game from the link below. One of them will download the *exe* file, the other - the *archive* with the game.

The game has a **save file**, which, after completing the game, it is advisable to delete. To do this, go to the 
**...AppData\Local\LD_45\** and delete file named **QAO_save.sav**.

entries.title: Mage in Exile
entries.description:
You were one of the powerful mages in the Noble Order of The Duck, but you have been exiled. Now you are seeking revenge. You will have to fight flesh-eating flowers, angry villagers, strong soldiers and powerful mages to get back what is yours. But you start with nothing. Will you be able to return your old powers?

The game belongs to the beat-em-up genre. Controls are W-S-A-D or arrow keys, Spacebar or MouseLeftButton to shoot, 'U' to open the inventory. Don't forget to craft health potions and mana elixirs in the Tower to use them during battles!

Unfortunately we didn't have time to put sound into the game. And balance is quite off... We hope you will still enjoy the game! We definitely do!

entries.title: De-Desertification
entries.description:
# De-Desertification

- Irrigate the desert
- Plant trees and crops
- Turn the desert green and provide a habitat for happy animals
- Win Llama beauty contests

![9.png](///raw/3e7/3/z/279f1.png)

## Engine

The game is written with C++ and OpenGL using my own engine.

## Tools

- Visual Studio
- Photoshop
- Audacity
- Wolfram Tones (http://tones.wolfram.com/)

## Links

https://cbehler.de/ld45/ld45.zip

**If the game doesn't start, try installing the Visual C++ runtimes and OpenAL from the redist folder.**

## Comments

I only realized Ludum Dare was this weekend when I opened twitch 2 minutes before the starting time and saw Quill18 streaming and just joined in. The theme allowed for pretty much everything, so I made a simulation/strategy game.
I prefer the rules of the compo and made almost everything in the 48 hours of the compo (I only fixed a problem with my audio engine and made some minor adjustments on the last day), however, I can't really share all of my libs and therefore cannot enter the compo.

entries.title: Duck Fortress
entries.description:
![Duck Fortress](///content/459/1/z/266e0.png)

BASICS:

AVOID enemies, PLACE TRAPS with care to open up pathways blocked by enemies. Escape the fortress.

Movement has a fixed rhythm, use careful time to outsmart enemies.

share a screen with your stats here!

- 28 trap pickups, can you find them all?
- how many enemies can you neutralise?
- Speedrun a new best time!

CONTROLS:

move:            W S A D
pick up traps:   space
place traps:     space

![duck_fortress.png](///raw/459/1/z/2799f.png)

Story and hints:

You are Pluckie Duck. Secret Operative of SAASFD, part of F.E.A.T.H.E.R. After all, you are a special forces DUCK.

While under-feather investigating the evil goings on in the Duck Fortress of the undead duck emperor, you discovered his horde of undead duck minions. alas.. despite expert espionage and infiltration. A malfunctioning walkie-quackie unit alerted the enemy of your presence. Caught undercover, they are looking for you.

The duck undead are quite stupid, and most do not detect your presence as a threat. But, they will KILL you on physical contact. *Avoid at all costs*

You have many traps stashed around the fortress, the big blue guys are attracted to the wrapping paper facade. 

Find your way to an exit. The hunt is on, Pluckie. Good luck. ..out..

Versions and OS:

The Linux version requires the library "sfml" which is available from the package manager of your distro.

The Windows version has required dlls included. I had trouble compiling in windows, It was 2 days late.

I fixed a bug where the game would crash rather than restart. It now restarts :)
I fixed a 2nd bug where character movement was broken!

entries.title: Church Demo
entries.description:
## Could not finish it, sorry!
Not much of a game right now. I got lost in asset creation and only started programming in the last 4 hours of the compo. It is still 'playable' though.

![Schermafbeelding 2019-10-07 om 00.00.24.png](///raw/cb5/z/26765.png)
![Schermafbeelding 2019-10-07 om 00.01.06.png](///raw/cb5/z/26767.png)
![Schermafbeelding 2019-10-07 om 00.03.21.png](///raw/cb5/z/26770.png)
![Schermafbeelding 2019-10-07 om 00.04.06.png](///raw/cb5/z/26775.png)


# Time lapse
https://youtu.be/F9fxCyAaTvw

# Tools used
Recording
- Screenflow

Audio
- Mulab

Development
- Unity
- Monodevelop

Assets
- Cheetah 3D
- Clip Studio Paint Pro

# Theme explanation
This was going to be a short story of a human growing powerful to the point of God's fright. God banishes and robs them of all except their non-dominant arm, hair, eyes, ears and skin; for he is merciful. Though his mercy would prove his mistake as even in a forsaken realm, humanity can find ways to rival the might of God.

# Gameplay
WASD + space and the rest is explained in game.

Gather the forbidden items:
- Valkyrie's Headgear
- Cloth of Gales
- the Dark Knight's Armor
- the Doomed Shield
- the Doomed Arm
- Raptor Boots+ Trousers
- Sword of Shared Pain
- Peasant's Clothing

entries.title: Hobo VRawl

entries.title: Necros
entries.description:
My Ludum Dare 45 entry: **​Start with nothing**

​​
#### Game
​Play as an undercover necromancer with a single goal, wiping out humanity to create a mighty army of minions! Walk through villages and find a good spot to unleash your curse, transforming all humans around you into your minions and let them do the heavy lifting.

#### Controls
- ​Arrow Keys / WASD - Move
​- Space - Unleash Curse (once per stage)
- Left Mouse Button - Gather nearby minions
- Right Mouse Button - Shoo nearby minions
- Scrollwheel - Zoom
- R - Restart stage
- 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 - Warp to specific stage
- ​Turn all humans into your minions to win. You lose when the necromancer dies.

#### Credits
Music:

- YouFulca​: Town Theme
- SketchyLogic​: 5 NES Shooter Music


SFX:

- Klankbeeld​: Evil Laugh (Freesound.org)

#### Screenshots
![3.png](///raw/973/6/z/2892c.png)

![4.png](///raw/973/6/z/2892d.png)

![5.png](///raw/973/6/z/28931.png)

entries.title: End With Nothing!...?
entries.description:
It's assessment time so I almost didn't participate this time around! In the end I procrastinated on my project so hard that I ended up spending 5 hours on LD. It somehow feels more complete than my last one.

![AxisMundi_2019-10-07_08-19-22.png](///raw/bf7/d1/z/267f2.png) (pretzel galaxy)

I can't say much about the genre or content, but I can say it generates a very rudimentary spiral galaxy with 2-3 "arms". It then fills it up with some stars. You can then click on the stars to progress.
...Look, I came up with it on the spot. I may update it in the future.

It's quite short. I hope you enjoy spam-clicking, and perhaps find a little bit of weird humor in the dialogue and story! (my delirious mind certainly found it hilarious for no good reason!).

I look forward to playing everyone else's submissions!

## Tools Used
* Gamemaker: Studio - Engine
* Bfxr - Explosions
* SunVox - Music

## Controls
* Left click - Left click

![Runner_2019-10-07_08-21-38.png](///raw/bf7/d1/z/267ec.png) (this one... uh... they look better when you zoom out, I swear!)


Yes it is 640x360 scaled up to 1280x720. Tell me if I should have just left it.

entries.title: NOTHING GETS OUTSIDE
entries.description:
![Здымак экрана (60).png](///raw/bd7/22/z/27ef1.png)


You play as a strange dark entity named... Nothing.
Nothing has no weight so it cannot fall and only moves horizontally.

It also has 1 interesting feature:
IT CAN POSESS nearby objects!

Each oject has its own properties, simillar to ones it has in real world.
(Barrels roll, Wooden planks swim in the water, spiders crawl, etc.)

Use your surroundings to progress further! Everything around you may come in handy!
The end of the level is marked with an Oil Lamp.

CONTROLS:

WASD movement (when objects can do that :) )

CLICK at a nerby object to posess it

R to restart current level (do that if you messed it up :smile:).


BY THE WAY:

Sountrack was created during the Jam using BOSCA CEOIL.
All Art was made during the Jam using Photoshop.

entries.title: Underground Robot Fights
entries.description:
Hey guys!

We're So happy to show you this game tonight.

The UI was harder to integrate than we thought and we couldn't implement some feature but it was a lot of fun !

We hope you'll enjoy this as much as we enjoyed making it anyways.

Cheers from France! :cheese:


## Team

- [KeithDae](https://ldjam.com/users/keithdae/) (programming)
- [Sabeurre](https://ldjam.com/users/sabeurre/) (programming, graphics)
- [Hmaya](https://ldjam.com/users/hmaya/) (graphics, BGM)

## Tools

- Unity
- Aseprite (pixel art software)
- FLStudio (Digital Audio Workstation)
- Figma (Wireframe, UI mockup design, and SVG editor)

## Story (should have been in the game so added here instead)

You are a freshman from an engineer school, and, sadly, you have lost everything in business because you followed your best friend who wanted to make a video game studio.

You're now broke, and homeless. Even your friends and family have forsaken you because they were disapproving of you doing making video games for a living in the first place ("too risky" they said).

As you're looking for a nice bridge to sleep under, an unknown man approaches and makes an offer to you : he loans money to you so that you can live on, and you must engage in Underground Robot Fight in exchange (a business of his) until you pay it back.

You decide to take his offer. Will you succeed in paying your loan back ? Will you let your debt swallow you whole ? Or will you awaken to the Underground Robot Fight Beauty, and become the uncontested boss of the arena ?

## How to play (or at least how it was meant to be played)

The game has two phases, a preparation phase and a fighting phase.

You win when you manage to pay back your loan.

To earn money, you can have your robot fight every night. The stronger the foe, the greater the reward.

Either you win or lose, if your robot is damaged, it is repaired the following day. This is not magic, this is engineering. (you can at least handle this much after studying this for 5 years I hope)

You pay interests everyday as long as you have ongoing loans. Generally, the higher the loans, the higher the interests amount.

You can spend your remaining fund on robot upgrade to win over tougher opponents, and earn more money.

You lose if you go bankrupt.

### Fights explained

![1570479622105.png](///raw/f03/92/z/27966.png)

This is a one on one robot fight with a turn-based combat system. Your robot is always on the left hand side.

You can choose one of 3 attack types :

- Attack : Your robot performs a physical attack, effective against Projectile
- Guard : Your robot attempts to parry and counter incoming attack, effective against Attack
- Projectile : Your robot performs a ranged attack, effective against Guard

Both robot strike at the same time when you press either of three attack button.

You win if your oponent's health reaches 0.

You lose if your robot's health reaches 0. 

**PRO TIPS**

1. enemy attacks are not random. Each enemy generally have a preference for a certain attack type. Stay alert ! (we all have our favorite attack in such games don't we ?)
2. Each attack type deals more damage when your opponent perform a certain other attack type. be sure to check health bars when blows are exchanged.
3. On the right side of the screen, an attack type icon is displayed next to a percentage range. This is the probability for your oponent to perform an attack of the shown type (SKL on the screenshot above). The range will get more precise as your OBS stat increases.

### Preparation phase

During this phase, you can

- pay back your loan (and win if you pay back everything)
- upgrade your robot or your character

#### Money

![1570479032178.png](///raw/f03/92/z/2796b.png)

In this panel, you can check how much you have left to pay, and info about each of the loans you have taken.

Yes, you are already broke AND indebted with one loan, and you can borrow more money if you need.

The fights will get tougher as you days pass so you'll probably need to resort to this to overcome stronger enemies. Be careful though as your daily payments will increase too. Don't go bankrupt!

#### Robot upgrades

![1570479063703.png](///raw/f03/92/z/2796d.png)

Here, you can buy upgrades to make your robot stronger.

DMG increases the damage dealt by all three attack types. DEF decreases the damage you take. SKL makes effective attack types even stronger and reduces the damage taken when your opponent hits you with an effective attack. There are also special upgrade you can unlock later which effects are described on the Interface.

Oh, and you can also check out your robot's stats on the right side!

#### Character upgrades

![1570479202708.png](///raw/f03/92/z/2796e.png)

Buy assets for yourself!

There's only one upgrade on this screenshot but there might be more when the game is actually released.

OBS stands for Observation and increases your odds to see through your oponent's next move during a fight!

Click the "you" tab to check your character's stats.

**PRO TIPS**

Your reputation will have an effect on the loans you can take. Higher reputation means better deals!


**Edit after release : **

I have written the how to play section with hope everything would be ok but sadly we couldn't fix all bugs in time. It is actually playable but the game never really ends as the win screen doesn't trigger when you pay back all your loans. If you do reach this stage, consider you have won :smile: 
If your money balanced gets in the negative, you're supposed to have lost.
Also, be gentle with the UI (don't click too fast) as some other unexpected behavior might occur...

Hope you'll be able to enjoy this anyways :smile:

ESC - Exit game  

**ChangeLog:**  
v2: Fixed not reloading after failure or success. Made text easier to read. https://uecasts.com/files/rickity-rails-ld45/  
v1: Original still accessible here: (https://uecasts.com/files/rickity-rails-ld45-v1/)

WASD or arrow keys to move

entries.title: CELL WARP / セルワープ
entries.description:
CELL WARP is a puzzle game where you move by warping to portals.

Please rate me low in the THEME category. I was brainstorming ideas for the potential themes the day before LD, and the one I came up with for Unconventional Travel really resonated with me and I wanted to make it.

This is my first puzzle game. Even though I didn't have very much time to implement puzzles, I think the idea may have some potential. I'll have to explore it further.

# CONTROLS:

- Click on portals       : Move

- WASD/Arrow  : Strike

- R           : Restart


# CREDITS:

- Cory Martin - Design, Code, Art

- Russell Mehringer - SFX

- Ross David Cooper - Music

---

entries.description:

![screenshot2.PNG](///raw/4b3/72/z/2751f.png)

![screenshot4.PNG](///raw/4b3/72/z/2757a.png)

The goal is to leave the island by building a raft. Find items to your raft on the island. These items can be crafted into the raft. Eat berries and mushrooms so you won't starve. Be prepared with a fire and a sword before the night falls.

Controls:

Use W, A, S and D to move the player.
Use E and R to pickup and place items.
E can also be used to eat food, chop down trees and attack with the sword.
Use the number keys or the scroll wheel to select items in your inventory.

entries.title: From Nothing
entries.description:
Hack your way though enemies and collect spirit skulls. You start with nothing, and keep collecting!

There are a few key bits that I didn't get in here, but there were also a lot of things included that I've never tried before. Hack away and have fun!

##Controls
* Right Click to Move
* Left Click to Interact
* 1 to swing your weapon (when you pick it up)

entries.title: While you're here
entries.description:

LMB - Use interactible object.
RMB - Back to exploration.
R - Restart (any time).

We’re the team of two people, we used: Unity3d, Blender, Photoshop.

Thanks for your feedback! Enjoy.

entries.title: Mergem
entries.description:

[Play _Mergem_ here!](https://mertios.itch.io/mergem)

## Controls

- **Mouse/LMB:** Drag & drop

## Objective

Drag and drop items to merge them. Try to increase the complexity!

## Details

This game was entirely made in the last 36 hours of Ludum Dare using first-party assets after the failure of two other game prototypes.

- **Engine:** Unity 2019.2.8f1
- **Source-code editor:** Microsoft Visual Studio 2017
- **Graphics editor:** Aseprite
- **SFX editor:** Musescore 3
- **Music editor:** Musescore 3

Thanks for playing!

entries.title: You Gotta Buy Everything

The game includes 3 different randomly generated areas and 50+ different upgrades to purchase. ![Ld45 intro.png](///raw/3a7/2/z/27fc6.png)![LD45 shop_2.png](///raw/3a7/2/z/27fe0.png)![LD 45 area1.png](///raw/3a7/2/z/27fda.png)![Ld45 area 2.png](///raw/3a7/2/z/27fde.png)

- Music & Sounds: [Actual_Potato 69](https://www.christosdourisaudio.com)

Version History  
Update 1.1:  
- Fixed issue with player when killed stayed in combat screen and could even kill enemy creatures.  
- Fixed issue with attack damage by both player and enemies was dealt at the beginning of attack making dodge mute!

Not everyone's a fan.

CONTROLS:
- Click to begin game. 
- WASD to MOVE. 
- F/Left Mouse to Use POWER. 
- Spacebar/Right Mouse to REPEL.
- Escape to close game.

TIPS:
- This world of nothing does not take kindly to change. Your POWER will be used against you.
- DISRUPTIONS must first be REPELLED before your POWER can be used on them.

![b6d094270f06667cc863f79266cd853d.gif](///raw/191/82/z/27410.gif)

Music/SFX sounds much better on the standalone versions.

To see more of our work, check us out at longstorystudios.com!

entries.title: Monks Can Into Space

Our story is about a man who felt that his life was boring and useless, and was trying to find a way to change that. Fortunately, he discovered certain space program that could fulfill his desire to find inner peace in exciting and somehow religious style. ‘How’ you may ask? entries.title: Eventualities
entries.description:
A game about a conversation.

**How to play:**
Interact with some one via a text message conversation and explore the dialogue paths to reveal who's arguing, how they feel, why they feel that way, who else is involved, what happened and what the consequences are.
Once you feel like you completely understand the story, select your solution elements and submit them to find out how close you were.

*Warning: this game exhibits very high levels of passive aggression.*

**Please note: The game has only been tested in 1920x1080, 1024x768 and 800x600 resolutions.  Other resolutions may be available when launching, but I can't guarantee a pleasant experience.**

Also, pressing ESC will immediately exit the game, if necessary.

The ONLY tested build is the Windows build.  I have provided a Mac and a Linux build, too, but **they are completely and utterly untested and may not work at all!!!**

entries.title: Deer Game
entries.description:
As future guardian of the forest you must travel the land, talk with the other inhabitants and discover what kind of guardian you are.

This game is split into two phases. The first phase is a personality test; after you answer the questions of the 5 creatures spread across the land, your powers will be revealed and it will be time to confront the creature spreading corruption across the land.

Arrows/WASD : Move/Jump

Z/J : Primary attack (after powers have been acquired)

X/K : Secondary attack

R : Restart

entries.title: Orb Override
entries.description:
Orb Override is a short and simple real time strategy game where the goal is to claim all of your enemy's orbs. However, you start with nothing but a command line to try and navigate the virtual space. Find an enemy, claim a nearby orb, and then try to prevent your enemy from taking over the system.
![Command Screen.png](///raw/e4f/72/z/264bd.png)

To capture new orbs from your claimed orb, you need to select an orb you own, then select an orb you can target. Peeps will be transfered from your selected orbs to your target orb, and if you have enough Peeps, you will take over the orb.
![GUI Screen.png](///raw/e4f/72/z/264c1.png)



This was a fun lil game to make as I haven't programmed in C# in some time, but Unity got me back into it. It started out as an RTS where you upgrade the game from text to RTS, but somewhere down the line it evolved into a lesson in basic C# syntax and naming conventions, something educational for someone who wants to start. I hope it is as fun for you to play as it was for me to make.

~MusicBlox

entries.title: [NSFW] Naked Escape
entries.description:
I was a bit frustrated with the theme.

"Start with nothing" implies that at some point later in the game you would have something. And this means you have to have a character, and be able to get things... which is kind of a lot of imlications that are not really mentioned in the Theme.

So I decided to make a kind of "Nope" interpretation of the theme and make a game where you start with nothing, but at no point later in the game you get anything. And to really hammer the point of starting with nothing home, I decided that player character will start with absolutelu nothing - not even a loincloth.

Though I made kind of a censuring system so you are not forced to see something you might find offensive. It is on by default, but you can turn it off in Options menu. But remember - you have to hold "Control" while you disable it. ((If you can't follow this instruction, you are probably too young to play uncensored version)).

The game utilized Unity Input system, so it should be friently to different input devices. It was tested using WSAD and mouse. Please let me know if something is not working for you.

All intended builds are now published.

entries.title: Alin
entries.description:
## :purple_heart: DESCRIPTION

Loneliness ...
It's everything that a little soul in the universe could know until a cosmic storm brought him to a mysterious planet where he could take a shape ... Who knows what waits him in the end of this adventure and is he that much alone in this universe...

![Untitled-3.png](///raw/958/z/28508.png)

![Screenshot_11.png](///raw/958/z/28485.png)

![Untitled-2.png](///raw/958/z/28459.png)

## :video_game: CONTROLS

**Arrows** - move

**Hold Space** - show elements to choose

**Arrows while holding space** - choose elements

**Z** - jump

**X** - shoot fireball

**C** - use special ability


## :star: ELEMENT ABILITIES  :star: 

**Water** - Jump. More water - more heigh

**Air** - Speed. More air - more speed

**Earth** - Mass. More earth - more mass

**Fire** - Fireball. More fire - more fireball distance


## :star2: SPECIAL ABILITIES  :star2: 

**Fire + Water = Steam cloud** - You turn into a steam that can pass gates

**Fire + Water + Earth = Meteor** - you turn into a meteor that flies far

**All elements combine = Smash** - you can destroy the earth

## Changelog:

v. 1.1 Fixed critical bug when player shoots spider. Fixed end of the game bug.

v. 1.2 On slow devices wind obstacle is too strong. Added standalone builds (WIN / LINUX / MAC)

entries.title: Rude Bear Refurbished
entries.description:
A kleptomaniac decorating simulator. Steal your neighbour's furniture to get ready for your hot date.

A jam game by Alex Rose, João Dias and John Pennington

![ludumdarecover.png](///raw/41b/z/2883f.png)

=== Controls ===
Keyboard:
WASD = Move
Arrows = PAN THE CAMERA TO LOOK AROUND
X = Steal/Hang things up (near a wall)/Place on ground
Space/V = Punch
C = Block

DS4:
Left stick = Move
Right Stick = PAN THE CAMERA TO LOOK AROUND
Square = Steal/Hang things up (near a wall)/Place on ground
X = Steal/Hang things up (near a wall)/Place on ground
Circle = Block

Xbox:
Left stick = Move
Right Stick = PAN THE CAMERA TO LOOK AROUND
X = Steal/Hang things up (near a wall)/Place on ground
A = Steal/Hang things up (near a wall)/Place on ground
B = Block

=== STORY ===
Rude Bear's just moved into the neighbourhood, and manages to score a date with Robed Bird. Unfortunately - she loves furniture, and Rude Bear has none. Better steal a bunch of furniture before she comes back at 9PM.

== What’s a Rude Bear? ==

This is the 20th Rude Bear game in the RB core series, the 22nd Ludum Dare extended universe Rude Bear game, and the 24th extended universe Rude Bear game. It was made for Ludum Dare 45’s jam, under the theme “Start With Nothing”. 


== My own feedback ==

I wish I'd got better audio and player feedback in here, and a proper rating system at the end with more depth to it. I wrote the dialogue but there wasn't enough time to implement all of the little things I wanted to do, like admonish you for too many beds, check the upstairs and downstairs. Everything had a point value it was worth, but I abandoned that eventually. There is still a win condition but you're unlikely to find it lol.


                                 === CREDITS ===

           @AlexRoseGames - Code, Design, Animation, sound design/SFX
                           @BitsAndCrafts - Dope ass Art    
                            @Atmospherium - Music & SFX    
                          

If you want to support the series, buy Super Rude Bear Resurrection on Steam/PS4/Switch:

(Gamespot GOTY 2017 Editor’s Choice)
http://store.steampowered.com/app/384250

entries.title: Sand&Sea
entries.description:
## Description
Every day nature gives us challenges when you have to start with nothing.
There is a strategy game that every child plays first - sandbox. Use sand that you have collected to protect your small fortress.

## Screenshot
![WhatsApp Image 2019-10-07 at 23.21.20.jpeg](///raw/912/82/z/2784b.jpg)


## Controls
Left click on ground - take sand.
Right click on ground - put sand back.

**Left click on bottom menu - select figure to build** (you must have enough collected sand). Left click on ground to build a figure.

## Rules
**20 star-points – win**. Collect sand, create figures, protect them.

🦀Crab - increases the amount of sand that you collect

🐟Fish - decreases waves size

⭐️Star - get 20 of them to win the game;

🏰Tower can be mixed with other figures. It greatly increases bonuses from figures. Just create one on top of the other.

🗑The bucket is good protection against waves.

P.S. Humor-related bonus on start menu)

entries.title: Mitosis
entries.description:
In Mitosis you play as a cell. Move your cell around and click on the food to collect it.
Use the food you've collected to make different organelles for your cell! Don't let your energy drop below -1 or it's a game over!

Controls
----
WASD = Movement

Left Click = Select

Right Click = Go back to map view

M = Mute(you may have to click it a few times for some reason)

Upgrades
----

**Cytoplasm:** The body of your cell, lets you place other organelles in your cell

**Mitochondria:** The "powerhouse of the cell", this organelle is an Energy factory

**Endoplasmic Reticulum:** The networks of the cell, connects the organelles to the Nucleus (the brain) of the cell so they work

**Ribosomes:** The Protein factories of the cell, these bad boys turn your energy into Protein

**Cell Membrane:** The defense of the cell, protects you from bad Food trying to hurt your cell

**Vaculoes:** The storage of the cell, allows you to hold more Food, Energy, and Protein

**Falgella:** The transportation of the cell, allows your cell to move faster

![screenshot1.png](///raw/c8e/d1/z/2889a.png)
![screenshot2.png](///raw/c8e/d1/z/2889b.png)
![screenshot3.png](///raw/c8e/d1/z/28936.png)
![screenshot4.png](///raw/c8e/d1/z/28938.png)

entries.title: I Forgot My Sword!
entries.description:
​![scr.png](///raw/ab9/z/27cef.png)

_"So, I finally arrived. Two days on foot to the Great Dungeon of Moo and now I'm here. A month ago the wizard told me to clear the mazes from the evil minotaurs by today to prevent the evil and there is just no more time to waste. Hey, monsters! I'm here to slay you! Just let me draw my mighty... my mighty... hold on...... Oh crap!"_

So, you forgot your mighty sword and need to kill the minotaurs? No, dummy, your fists won't give them a fright. ​But you can still use your legs to run around the mazes. How can it help? Well, try to figure it out! Good luck!

NOTE: Levels are sorted by difficulty. It's highly recommended to start with the first one.

***

Credits:

* [Syudzius](https://twitter.com/syudzius) -- all the visuals.
* [Yngvarr](https://twitter.com/_yngwarr) -- all the logic.
* Egor Kontorov -- all the game design.

Special thanks to @aviktorov and *SibGameJam* team for the local event!

entries.title: Deep Space Mining
entries.description:
Deep Space Mining - Play as an eager but pennyless mining magnate. Start by taking a loan to buy your first ship(s), then gradually build up your Net Worth as you expand your mining empire !

But beware ! Pirates might take an interest if you grow too big...

Made by Marc "Hoshi" Jacob (Game Design & Code) and Martin "Permilias" Jacob (Graphics & UI Design) on Unity.

Spent around 35h on this game, total. I do plan on working on the game further after the jam (obviously the jam version will be separate from the version on which I'll add more features, I'm no cheater). Such features would include but not be limited to : 

- Radar to show what's present around the ship outside view (to get a better idea of the situation, where the pirates are...) 
- Proper NPC management interface : 
    - Configure the behavior of your miners and fighters.
    - Assign them to zones or fleets
    - Dynamic fleet system (and fleet of fleets...) for easier mass control and real empire building
-    Dynamic station building & destruction
- Dynamic economy (based on supply, demand, and inflation) with production and resource consumption (ships will no longer be spawned from thin air).
- NPC factions with dynamic diplomacy, territory control...
- Astronomical scale : add a warp drive to warp to other sectors of the map.
- Add more sectors.
- More ship sizes (Fighter < Frigate < Destroyer < Cruiser < Battlecruiser < Battleship < Capital)
- More ship types (haulers, radar ships, construction ships, support ships)
- Dynamic equipment fitting system

I'll be streaming the development (just as I did during the event), and maybe some gaming too, at : https://www.twitch.tv/hoshiqua.

entries.title: Void Prisoner

![Screen1.PNG](///raw/e13/1/z/282db.png)

Monsters come from nothing.
And to nothing they return.

You are a slave.
Spend an eternity following instructions.

Create. Destroy.
Net gain: zero.

Listen to your lord.
And don't disappoint.


-----
Make sure to try all the orb combinations. Could there be... a way out?
