entries.title: Spooky Mansion
entries.description:
**Instructions**

tl;dr Find the golden key, possess it and take it to the locked golden door while evading Gargoyles.

**Story**

You are a ghost, and you have enough of residing within your tiny empty room with nothing. You decide to explore the mansion for an escape. According to an ancient legend there is a golden key which will open the golden door of the mansion. That is your only way out because the old magically enforced outer walls are impenetrable, even for a ghost like you. But beware of the Gargoyles since they are determined to keep you inside forever. Luckily you can hide inside old golden paintings which will render you completely invisible to them.

**Controls**
- Move -> WASD keys or arrow keys
- Rotate -> Hold right mouse button or ‘R’ ‘F’ Keys
- Zoom -> Use scroll wheel or ‘period’ and ‘comma’ keys
- E to possess and release the golden key, or hide inside a golden painting

![Screen1.jpg](///raw/9cf/12/z/28019.jpg)
![Screen2.jpg](///raw/9cf/12/z/27fc7.jpg)
![Screen3.jpg](///raw/9cf/12/z/27fd8.jpg)
![Screen4.jpg](///raw/9cf/12/z/27fea.jpg)

entries.title: Bob the Brawler
entries.description:
# Objective:   
### Start with nothing but your fists, and punch your way into becoming the ultimate brawler!
Explore numerous maps, fight off endless baddies, and collect powerups/item drops; **they make you stronger**  
**Max out your score to win!**   

![bobthebrawlerface.png](///raw/0fb/8/z/29cfe.png)
# Drops:
**Potion-** adds potion to inventory; *Space* to consume**; (heals increase with difficulty)**  
**Package-** increases max health; gives walls and potions  
**Strength Powerup-** exponentially increases attack power**; (lasts longer with difficulty)**  
**Barrage Powerup-** enters a barrage of auto attacks**; (lasts longer with difficulty)**  
**Range Powerup-** increases attack range and view distance**; (lasts longer with difficulty)**  

## Controls:
**WASD-** Move  
**Space-** Heal  
**Left Mouse-** Attack  
**Right Mouse-** Build  
**Q/P-** Toggle Pause  
**M-** Toggle Mute  
**R-** Restart Game   
**K-** Toggle Fullscreen
# Story:
A grave disagreement with the Ski Mask Baddies forces Bob to end his *building* career for good. However, dissatisfied with just his unemployment, the Baddies are out for his life! Now, **Bob the** previous **Builder** becomes **Bob the Brawler**; living only to defend himself from the Baddies that are breaking into his warehouse, in hopes of regaining his positions, and...punching off... some steam!! (>:[=)
### Post your scores below!   
*****
## Credits:
**Programming/Design-** @itsdanidre   
**Art/Audio-** @AXLplosion  

![playScreen.png](///raw/0fb/8/z/295e6.png)   
![coverimage.jpg](///raw/0fb/8/z/28772.jpg)   
![unknown.png](///raw/0fb/8/z/28754.png)   

## Made for Ludum Dare 45. *Best run on Chrome's latest browser*   
*****
# Edits:   
## Bug fixes:  
- Fixed play screen
- Players/Baddies/Items no longer get stuck in walls
- Players can clearly see the direction they're aiming
- Sfx no longer crash on some browsers

## Changes:  
- Easier controls
- Added package timer visuals
- Tweaked sfx

## Added:  
- Power-ups!
- Difficulty increases over time
- Minimal varying maps
*****
# Edits #2:
## Changes:
- Increased map size
- Adjusted difficulty over time.

## Added:
- Scroll-able screen
- Screen-shake
- More power-ups!
- Mute
*****
# Post your highscores below:

![605.png](///raw/0fb/8/z/29afd.png)
> Don't forget to use your potions! (space)

entries.title: cakewalk
entries.description:
*cakewalk* is a single button action game where you are a cake and you have to walk from one end of the line to the other without getting run over.  There are nine levels of increasing difficulty and four types of enemy: slicing, revolving, burning and shooting.  The line is treacherous but the atmosphere is pleasant.  You can do it if you try your best.  And when you do, your time is saved to the high scores list!

![close_circuit.gif](///raw/06e/z/28b3c.gif)

![20191007205819.png](///raw/06e/z/288b7.png)

![20191007205926.png](///raw/06e/z/288dd.png)

![20191010204039.png](///raw/06e/z/295b8.png)


> **_NOTE:_** The 32-bit Mac version is tested up to OS X 10.10, and the 64-bit version was built and tested on OS X 10.14

You can install [python](http://python.org) and [pygame](http://pygame.org) and play using the source code.

```
$ wget http://shampoo.ooo/games/cake/dist/cakewalk.tar.gz
$ tar -xf cakewalk.tar.gz
$ cd cakewalk
$ python OPEN-GAME
```

design and code by [diskmem](http://twitter.com/diskmem) and music and art by [azuria sky](http://twitter.com/Azuria_Sky)

:cake:

___________

Post-Jam
--------

There is a post-jam version available which has some additions, including

- enemy sprites (fish :fish:, blade, fire :fire: and cannon)
- background graphics (cake in space :alien:)
- new graphics effects include glowing line, level transitions, explosions and portal

![20191017025055.png](///raw/06e/z/29b0c.png)

https://youtu.be/cIOE2q2nspA

entries.title: Shuǐmòhuà
entries.description:
[![shuimohua](///raw/405/01/z/29642.png)](https://ludum-rlyeh.github.io/LD45Nothing/LD45.html)

Shuǐmòhuà is a sensorial/experimental game.

According to the theme "Start with nothing", 
we like to think that the gamefeel will be better 
if the player has no information when s/he will start the
game.


For a better experience, please use headphones :headphones: 

We hope you’ll like our proposal

And don't forget to give us your feedbacks ! :smiley: 


## Team

@Avzgui : dev and sound design

@chtimy : dev and graphics

@leo17 : dev and dev

@olddaddou : moral support and beta test

## Tools

Game Engine : [Godot Engine](https://godotengine.org)

Audio : [Bosca Ceoil](https://boscaceoil.net) and [Audacity](https://www.audacityteam.org)

Graphics : [Gimp](https://www.gimp.org/downloads/)

## Information

**You might want to use Firefox for a better experience with the web link**

The web release may be slow to start, so wait for it or reload it :wink: 

If there is some "desynchronization" with the web link, try to reload the page :slight_smile: 

(tell us for linux and android exports, we didn’t test them a lot)

entries.title: Put the Haunt in this House
entries.description:
Point-and-click game where you combine various items to summon different creepy creatures.

The game is fairly straight forward. You need to combine 3 items to summon a particular creature. There is no penalty for wrong combinations. Once summoned, the creatures will be spread throughout the house(and outdoors). Talk to them for hints.

A lot of things were put into this game last minute. So there are likely to be some bugs and poorly aligned graphics. If you come across them, don't hesitate to mention them in the comments. Any constructive criticism is welcome. Thanks!


![ss_title-01.png](///raw/4f4/4/z/28486.png)


![ss_kitty-01.png](///raw/4f4/4/z/283e4.png)





Programming and Art by The Critter’s Cove  

Music and SFX by Bradley A. Seymour


Thank you to @burgee for the advice and feedback as always!

entries.title: God Complex
entries.description:
God Complex is an idle game where you are a god. You can merge elements together to create new ones and create planets.

Your goal is to destroy everything.

![Capturar5.PNG](///raw/ded/62/z/25f73.png)![Capturar6.PNG](///raw/ded/62/z/25f74.png)

### Controls
Drag elements: Left mouse button

Merge 2 or more elements: Right mouse button on elements

Open shop (unlockable): Space

Zoom in and out: Mouse wheel or + and - keys

Pan: Middle mouse button or WASD keys.

### Recipes
In case you're stuck or want to complete the game faster, here are all the recipes. The quests are completely optional, and serve more as a tutorial. Your real objective is to merge 2 black holes together.

- Dirt + Dirt + Dirt = Dirt Planet
- Dirt Planet + Water = Dirt Planet with Water
- Star + Star = Orange Star
- Orange Star next to Dirt Planet with Water = Life (+0.1 points/s + shop)
- Rock + Rock + Rock = Rock Planet
- Rock Planet + Water = Rock Planet with Water
- Orange Star + Orange Star = Blue Star
- Blue Star next to Rock Planet with Water = Ores ( +1 rare item every 5 days)
- Dirt + Water = Mud
- Mud + Seed = Wood
- Wood + Electricity = Fire
- Fire + Water = Vapor
- Vapor + Vapor + Vapor = Gas Planet
- Blue Star + Blue Star = Pink Star
- Pink Star next to Gas Planet = More drop variety (Only one planet is necessary)
- Black Hole + Anything = Delete
- Black Hole + Black Hole = Win

![Capturar7.PNG](///raw/ded/62/z/25f76.png)

### Credit
All sound and art assets are in the public domain, created by me or otherwise.

Songs: "Triangle" and "Acoustic Shifter", from freepd.com

Sound effects: "Kill Switch (Large Breaker Switch)" by ModulationStation, from freesound.org

entries.title: From Nothing to Mine
entries.description:
![MainMenu.gif](///raw/7b5/2/z/27cb0.gif)


## Introduction
Welcome dear person. We heard your voice. You want money! 
And to do so you’re trying to find a mine to rent, even if you actually have absolutely NOTHING.

Well you know. You can have mine - but you have to pay a rent for it each month.
Yeah yeah, you want to own it by yourself, but that costs as you know. 
Give me 100.000$ and its yours, next to the rents for sure!

--- 

![Game_01.png](///raw/7b5/2/z/27dfd.png)
![Game_02.png](///raw/7b5/2/z/27e04.png)

---

## GamePlay
- Gather ressources
- Construct a working infrastructure of a mine
- Manage your workers by hiring and firing them 
- Sell ressources on a fluid changing market
- Consider your influence on the eco system, nearby living citizen might not like that
- Raise your energy production for a nice boost or handle the loss of worker efficiency 

---

![Game_04.png](///raw/7b5/2/z/27e12.png)
![Game_06.png](///raw/7b5/2/z/27e2e.png)

---

## Disclaimer:
- WebGL Version seems to be still buggy, we recommend to use the normal download versions!
- MAC and LINUX version are not tested

## Controls: 
- Left Mouse button -  Interact and add worker from buildings
- Middle / Right mouse button - remove worker from buildings
- ESCape - Opens and closes the pause menu

## Helping Tips:
- Read the Tutorial
- Keep calm
- Discover all the systems

## Known Issues:
- Some typos and grammar issues
- Start feels slow
- Hard af
- Tutorial feels useless <.<
- No Sounds / Music :’(

---

## Team:
**Christian**
- Twitter: https://twitter.com/key_user

**Christian**
- Twitter: https://twitter.com/DeathStorm1987
- Twitch: https://www.twitch.tv/deathstorm_de/

---

We cant wait for your response and feedback! Thank you so much!

entries.title: Ravenous
entries.description:
![ravenousGameplay.gif](///raw/92f/22/z/2754e.gif)

Ravenous is an infinite runner typing game.

You're being chased by a horrible monster devouring everything in its way, and your only option is to run away. It would be way easier if it wasn't for all this stuff lying around!

Try to avoid the obstacles and the leeches in your way. Leeches slow you down, but you can get rid of them by typing the letters that show up.


Controls : 
- space to jump
- F3 / F4 to change window scaling
- alt-Enter to switch to fullscreen
- Esc to quit


Credits : 
- Brother_main : code and sound
- Berumondo : code and placeholder graphics
- Special thanks to Tori for the quick additional artwork (aka the sprites that actually look good)

entries.title: InfiniProspector
entries.description:
# InfiniProspector

Welcome to our eighth straight Ludum Dare entry! While the team has grown, we feel that we have a good combination of talent going.

## Description

Infinite Prospector is a game about a lowly prospector who finds himself at a hole in the ground with nothing to his name. He must begin prospecting the area for minerals and gems of ever increasing value. He must find some in order to be able to purchase more fuel for his lantern. Be careful, however, as there are dangers in the ground.

How deep can you go?

## Update (Oct. 7, 2019)

We noticed a bug shortly after publishing that makes the game pretty unplayable in the lower levels. It was also mentioned in comments. The bugfix that has been uploaded is to fix this issue.

## Controls

You can choose to use either WASD or ZQSD keys to control the prospector when he moves.

The arrow keys instruct him to dig in a particular direction.

Pressing the L key will place a ladder (if you have one) where you are standing.

Be careful how deep you dig at a time as you can only jump up two tiles.

## Contributions

We divided the work as follows:

**James**: Coding

**Cameron**: Graphics

**Oliver**: Music

**Anthony**: UI, Sounds

## Screenshots

![Screen1.png](///raw/158/2/z/275ba.png)

![Screen2.png](///raw/158/2/z/275bb.png)

![Screen3.png](///raw/158/2/z/275bc.png)

![Screen4.png](///raw/158/2/z/275bd.png)

![Screen5.png](///raw/158/2/z/275bf.png)

![Screen6.png](///raw/158/2/z/275c0.png)

![Screen7.png](///raw/158/2/z/275c1.png)

![Screen8.png](///raw/158/2/z/275c2.png)

## Review In Kind

We are always looking to improve what we are doing. As such, please give as honest feedback as possible. Whether we like what you have to say about our game or not, we always come by and look at your game as well. We appreciate all the feedback that you can give.

entries.title: Get off the Hook
entries.description:
![Get_off_the_hook_(windows) Screenshot 2019.10.08 - 00.23.37.61.png](///raw/2d6/6/z/2854e.png)

In this horror platformer you find yourself in a concrete grave. Alone in a desolate place you've never seen before, you try to find a way out.


![Get_off_the_hook_(windows) Screenshot 2019.10.08 - 00.27.07.54.png](///raw/2d6/6/z/2853e.png)

Is that blood? Someone definitely painted graffiti on the walls. Why does the handwriting feel so familiar..?
And as you stumble through spine-chilling darkness, deja-vú entangles the hollow sound of your footsteps. Will you get out, before they notice?

Thanks a lot for the feedback! The main concerns seem to be that text is too fast to read and that the change of controls from the mouse to the keyboard is a bit confusing, since it's not stated ingame.

Battles Nations Arena Crystal Power. This story is about three nations that once every 100 years gathered in the arena to find out which nation will rule over the next hundred years.

entries.title: The Learning Drone v4.5
entries.description:
![Screensho2.png](///raw/f7c/32/z/2822e.png)

Prologue

I can't remember when I came alive, but I did. They teached me how to understand their words, how to write, how to see and many other things. What I liked the most was when they told me about the world. The people, the animals, the plants and all the others like me. Now they want me to learn how to move, just like humans do. They gave a body of my own and left me to learn by myself on this small laboratory.
	They teached me so much but I don't want to be forever here, or another building they want me to be. If I learn enough I could escape and finally discover how it feels to walk in the grass, how it feels to be free.

Instructions

As the Learning Drone v4.5, start with nothing but a small amount of battery, the ability to recharge yourself in the blue charging pads and the ability to walk. Learn enough so you can escape the lab and finally be free.
	
Controls

- R: Reset to the last chardging pad rested
- W: Walk foward
- S: Walk back
- A: Strafe left
- D: Strafe right
- Q: Turn 90° anticlockwise
- E: Turn 90° clockwise
- G: Grab/Realease wooden boxes
- F: Interact with buttons on the walls and (colored) computers

Notes

- Orange actions costs one battery, light blue ones are free or passive
- In Precision Mode "Turn" actions costs energy too!

About

Tools used:

- Adobe Photoshop
- Audacity
- Unity
- Bosca Ceoil

Devs:

- kukiric: Programming and game design
- Roque: Graphics, audio, playtesting and game design
- bmartins: Playtesting and game design


![Screenshot.png](///raw/f7c/32/z/2813f.png)

Version 1.0.1:

- Fixed endings missing messages
- Builded to Linux
- Know issue: Music keeps going back to the start when resetting
- Know issue: If the player resets in the third room without the second battery upgrade is not possible to go back to get the upgrade (Only in the Normal mode)

entries.title: Selling Rocks
entries.description:
![LD-Cover.png](///raw/a68/72/z/277d6.png)

A game about rapid terraforming and selling planets.

The year is 2744. You are working for Selling Rocks - a company that specializes in selling planets. Your job is to make sure that the planet is suited for the species you are selling to and if it's not - terraform it.

This time around you are dealing with extreme case - the planet you are about to sell is completely barren. You have to start from nothing and make it a habitable world. But be quick as future colonists are already on the way!

Controls:

[1] - add Pressure

[2] - add Oxygen

[3] - add Hydrogen

[4] - add Temperature

[Space] - Emergency button!

We went from this

To this

entries.title: Working Title
entries.description:
__Requires Vulkan support to run!__  
See below for more details...

---

![mid.png](///raw/11c/d/z/29943.png)  
![end.png](///raw/11c/d/z/29944.png)

## Description
_Experience a work in progress._  

Play through the development process of a 2D platformer game,  
and watch your environment transform as you progress...

The further you get, the more features are added, including  
menacing enemies, destructive spikes, and adaptive music.

## Controls
| Action | Keyboard        |
| :----- | :-------------- |
| Move   | `W`,`S`,`A`,`D` |
| Jump   | `Space` / `K`   |

## Downloads
Download the build for your platform from [itch.io][itch].  
Supported platforms: __Windows__ and __Linux__.

## Requires Vulkan support to run!
If the game doesn't run, it's likely that you're missing Vulkan API support.  
Unless you're using a very old graphics card,  
updating your graphics drivers should fix the issue.  

If you're on Linux, you may need to install an appropriate  
Vulkan driver package for your graphics card.  
For Intel graphics on Arch Linux (or arch-based distros),  
the package [vulkan-intel] did the trick for me.  

Sorry about this inconvenience, I'm not sure how to circumvent this.

## Change-Log
| Version | Download | Notes |
| :-----: | :------: | :---- |
| __1.0.0__ | [Windows][v1.0.0-windows] [Linux][v1.0.0-linux] | Initial Ludum Dare jam release. Has some major bugs, which prevent the game from being completed: When dying and respawning at a checkpoint, after getting the high-jump feature you lose your high-jump, which prevents the game from being completed (unless you beat it without dying). The order in which the music tracks are played are messed-up; you won't experience the intended flow of the music in this build. |
| __1.0.1__ | [Windows][v1.0.1-windows] [Linux][v1.0.1-linux] | Partially fixes the music playing-order bug from v1.0.0 (still has some bugs). Was released about 20 minutes after the deadline. |
| __1.0.2__ | [Windows][v1.0.2-windows] [Linux][v1.0.2-linux] | Properly fixes the music playing-order bug. Fixes the bug where player's high-jump is taken away after respawning, making the game beatable. Adds frame rate counter system, which prints FPS to the console. Adds the `WorkingTitle.desktop` file for Linux file manager GUIs. Some minor, meta stuff. Was released about 5 hours after the deadline. |


[v1.0.0-windows]: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1KVx1OpiFyv8DIjm8x0AYwkH_wrwRz_BT
[v1.0.0-linux]:   https://drive.google.com/open?id=1ELAu_Xnh_CRx41qACSeJjiExs5I5Pziu
[v1.0.1-windows]: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1trgy3J-jKcHcjwICZeNqIR1PuSDjjDnb

[v1.0.2-linux]:   https://drive.google.com/open?id=1aX_bZkpaJTXFlQlgM1Pz4fQY9uryUDYo

## Tools Used

entries.title: Ship It
entries.description:
![logo_final.png](///raw/f35/6/z/290bb.png)

# Ship It


## Background

Pour a cup of coffee, put on your boots, and get ready to fulfill some orders! As a newly hired floor worker at _The Company Fulfillment Center_, it is your job to package and ship orders as fast as they come in! Since you're new, we'll start your shift off easy. We'll drop off a box with nothing in it, and all you have to do is sort it, praise it, and put it in the truck. We'll walk you through the steps.


## At a Glance

1) Pick up boxes/products with **LMB / E**

2) Open and close boxes with **F**

3) Fill boxes with requested products on shipping label

4) Close the boxes once filled, put filled boxes into Sorter. Press colored button (with **LMB / E**) corresponding to color on shipping label

5) Put sorted boxes in their colors' Adulator, and follow the set of rules to determine the correct button

6) Ship the boxes in the truck!


## Controls

**WASD** - _Move_

**LMB/E** - _Pick up / drop box, press button_

**RMB** - _Open box_

**F** - _Open box_


## Packing

![dropped_box.png](///raw/f35/6/z/290c6.png)

Boxes will arrive from the ceiling vent (it's super efficient!) Though your first few boxes will stay empty, eventually you'll get boxes with shipping labels that actually... you know, require you put products in them. For example, the following package requires a basketball, a coin, and a game controller:

![box_with_shelves.PNG](///raw/f35/6/z/290c4.png)

Simply pick up the products __(LMB or E key)__, open the box __(F key)__, and drop them in:

![box_with_item_to_be_placed.PNG](///raw/f35/6/z/290c3.png)

Then you're good to go!

![box_with_item_fulfilled.PNG](///raw/f35/6/z/290c2.png)


## Sorting

![sorter_far.PNG](///raw/f35/6/z/290c7.png)

Okay, so you've got a box filled with everything it demands. Now you've gotta sort it! Thankfully, this should be an easy process. **Make sure the box is closed and fully packed**, put it on the conveyor belt, and let the sorter suck that bad boy in! Then, you've just gotta press the big colored button __(E key)__ that matches the color on the boxes' shipping label. In the following example, just hit the big green button:

![sorter.PNG](///raw/f35/6/z/290c8.png)

__Make any mistakes, and the sorter will shoot that rejected package out so fast the rest of your packing line might face collateral damage!__


## Adulating

![screenshot_00.png](///raw/f35/6/z/27bbf.png)

These boxes aren't just any old boxes. They require praise and admiration before they will ship (needy, right?). After your boxes have been sorted, they'll gingerly convey their way over to their respective color's adulator. Here, you must follow a simple set of rules to properly praise the box!

In the example above, the blue box does not have an odd number of items, nor only 1 type of ball, nor multiple types of balls, so we tell the box it's doing "Awesome work!" and send it on its merry way!



## Shipping

![screenshot_03.png](///raw/f35/6/z/290cd.png)

So you've packed, sorted, and adulated your box. Now it's finally ready to ship! Pick it up, shove it in the back of the truck, and *run as fast as you can* back to the rest of the boxes! __We're not paying you to dilly-dally!__


## Notes

This game was developed and tested primarily on Windows. We have provided Linux and macOS builds, but they are not necessarily performant.


## Audio Credits

We used some royalty free sound assets, so we removed ourselves from the audio category voting.

['Hectic Life' - OurMusicBox](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCEXX5i6961zc4-L8thTctBg)

[Factory Manufacture Background ambience](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjSiWkbTeV9NcatSTEWIkLg)

[Photocopy Machine - Daniel Simion](http://soundbible.com/2169-Photocopy-Machine.html)

[Emergency Alarm Siren](https://www.zapsplat.com/sound-effect-category/sirens-and-alarms/)

entries.title: Gecko's Cabinet
entries.description:
A surreal experience depicting the life of Gecko, a troubled young man on a journey to pay his debts. What happens is determined by the choices you make.

The game features over a dozen different cutscenes/events, which are determined by your decisions. There are also multiple alternative endings, which should grant some replay value.


Inspired by genre defining titles such as Bandersnatch, Reigns and sakarin villapaitapeli.

You can try the WebGL on your mobile phone as well! It should work perfectly there :slight_smile: 

(Just remember to enable desktop view on your browser)

**…**

![cointoss.gif](///raw/6fd/b/z/29661.gif)

**…**

Made in under 20 hours since unlucky timings with a trip from Finland to Greece, and school. LD45 was a tough one, and you can probably see it by the game feeling sort of random and disconnected, since we didn't have the time to make more scenes and make the story actually connecting in all ways. Either way, hope you can enjoy it! 

I (@raffe) had to buy a 9$ mouse here in Greece and do the graphics here on my laptop with the mouse, which was also kind of sloppy. Thank goodness I had @JustMars in Finland still active when he wasn't at school and he put in the time to make everything work :D 

**…**

![goodgif.gif](///raw/6fd/b/z/2965b.gif)

**…**

- Coding and animations: @JustMars

- Graphics, art direction and SFX: @raffe

- Music: @HappyTomato (https://soundcloud.com/itshrme)

entries.title: Nix

As an orb seeker, you live for the thrill of collecting those sweet, sweet orbs. You start with nothing, how long can you survive?

W, A, S, D keys to move around!

Note: HTML5 game works in Firefox and Chrome, but experiences issues in Safari. Sorry!

entries.title: Split or Steal
entries.description:
Greeting everyone!!!

I am Monish H. Vyas an indie developer from India. This is my first Ludem Dare jam(technically second), I participated in LD44, but was not able to submit. This time I am able to submit my game hope you all enjoy it.

SPLIT or STEAL

It is a small game based on prisoner's dilemma. 
(in game theory) a situation in which two players each have two options whose outcome depends crucially on the simultaneous choice made by the other, often formulated in terms of two prisoners separately deciding whether to confess to a crime.

![SS1.JPG](///raw/25e/22/z/27424.jpg)

You will encounter beings from all over the universe and will enter in a bargain. You can either chose to steal or split in order to tilt the outcome in your favor. Each player is unique and can choose any of both the options. You have to predict what choice they might make and make yours accordingly. However the description only shows the likelihood of a choice, actual choice is random. 

![SS2.JPG](///raw/25e/22/z/27425.jpg)

Best of luck to everyone, CHEERS..!!

entries.title: Color Swirl

You are a small flare. A torch in the dark. Nothing is there, or is it?

entries.title: SHIPWRECKED
entries.description:
This game was made by @Ayxs (programming, sprites, animations, SFX) & @Bredera (sprites, animations, level design, music) for Ludum Dare 45. We are really pleased with the end result and we hope that you all have a good time going through it!
 
![Screenshot_1.jpg](///raw/f25/z/27327.jpg)

## Story:
You wake up on a desolate island, your ship a ghost of what she used to be, you have been **shipwrecked**. 

Finding an old pirate's hat reminds you of better days, when you and your crew ruled the seas and brought fear to the established order. Determined to get another ship you set out on a janky raft to civilization. 

Here trading means money, but for you trading means getting closer to another ship to once again rule the seas!

![Screenshot_2.jpg](///raw/f25/z/2732a.jpg)

## Gameplay: 
The gameplay consists of a few mechanics: You can walk around, use your map to go to different island and you can trade with NPCs. 


## Movement: 

**A** or **Left Arrow** : Walking to the left

**D** or **Right Arrow** : Walking to the right

**F** : Pickup items

**E** : Open map (when near your raft / boat) & trade with NPCs

**Mouse** : Used in the map to select next island 

![Screenshot_3.jpg](///raw/f25/z/2732c.jpg)

Have fun, and don't hesitate to give us feedback!

Ayxs & Bredera

entries.title: Souliseum
entries.description:
![SouliseumSplash.png](///raw/50d/72/z/2733a.png)

## Synopsis

After a tragic event you're casted out of the plane of existence you reside in, only for your soul to reappear in King Slime's coliseum with most of your memory wipped out. Faint images echo in your mind, reteaching you tricks from your earlier years, as horrid enemies get slowly close to your spectral appearance.

The moment you manage to materialize your signature cape and mask, King Slime's voice thunders through the arena. You're the latest lost soul to arrive to the battlefields of glory, the time to fight and regain your past life is here!

![KingSlimeFront.png](///raw/50d/72/z/27173.png)

## Setting

Souliseum is a short Action RPG combat game where you choose which spells to learn and how your character grows. Fight through waves of slimy monsters intent on gunking your progress.

After each battle, you will be able to choose a new spell to learn, or a stat upgrade to prepare you for the next battle.

Created by the **__Madness Factory__** team for **Ludum Dare 45**

![ArmouredImpFront.png](///raw/50d/72/z/27174.png)

## How to play

Fight through rounds of monsters to reach the boss. After each round you will be able to choose an upgrade, choose wisely and achieve glory!

As for the controls, it's an arcade game, it should be really easy to grasp. The increasing number of skills our heroine/hero can get makes things slightly more difficult, but nothing is out of reach.
Controls are only on keyboard, but it may change if development goes on after submission.

They go as follows:
- **__Action ---------------------> Key__**
- Move up -> Arrow up
- Move down -> Arrow down
- Move left -> Arrow left
- Move right -> Arrow right
- Soul Fist -> Q
- Soul Saber (unlockable) -> Mappable to Q, W, A, E, S, D
- Soul Sting (unlockable) -> Mappable to Q, W, A, E, S, D
- Soul Skewer (unlockable) -> Mappable to Q, W, A, E, S, D
- Soul Cleave (unlockable) -> Mappable to Q, W, A, E, S, D
- Soul Firefly (unlockable) -> Mappable to Q, W, A, E, S, D
- ​Soul Boomerang (unlockable) -> Mappable to Q, W, A, E, S, D
- Soul Bomb (unlockable) -> Mappable to Q, W, A, E, S, D
- Soul Pulse (unlockable) -> Mappable to Q, W, A, E, S, D
- Soul Blink (unlockable) -> Mappable to Q, W, A, E, S, D
- Soul Shield (unlockable) -> Mappable to Q, W, A, E, S, D​​
- Pause / Menu -> ESC

The whole __mappeable__ thing means you will have to choose what skills you want for your run... So choose wisely! :dog:

## Who is Madness Factory?

We are a group of friends who've recently begun an adventure as game developers. Initially created for GameJam game development, the studio is increasing in size and currently boasts a diverse group of programmers and artists of different walks of life.

**__Souliseum__** created for **__[Ludum-Dare 45 - Jam](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/45)__** by:

entries.title: Food Fight
entries.description:
> You are a chicken drumstick, entraped in a weird dungeon. Your enemies are non-meat edibles, spawned across multiple floors of the dungeon.
>
> Your goal is to kill the nemesis, an eggplant. Because eggplants suck.

![01.png](///raw/475/z/27829.png)

The game is a simple roguelite game, where you move around and attack enemies by walking into their position.

Unfortunately, the game contains no audio, due to the lack of time and audio person in the team.

The game was made with Unity, and all assets and code, apart from the post-processing stack, were made during the jam.

![02.png](///raw/475/z/27825.png)

**Controls**
- WASD/Arrow Keys to Move
- Space to Start
- Escape to Quit

entries.title: CocoBall
entries.description:
# Summary:
We started off with the idea of making a game where shell-less turtles would compete for holding the shell (so they would "start with nothing" and compete for the shell) in a king of the hill-esque game. Our main concern was the AI, which we had no experience about. After less than 24 hours we realized that concept would not see the light of day in less than 72 hours, so we took what we had been doing (mapping and character creation) and went through with a soccer game where they use their shells as their main weapon.

We believe it ended being a very fun local VS experience (that you can play over the internet with applications like [parsec](https://parsecgaming.com/)). You can use the shell to knock your opponent, or you can shoot a very high speed coconut to knock him over! We had great fun with our friends!

# What we did on the project:

-All code was from scratch aside from one shader.

-3D models, texturing, all done by us.

The only stuff we didn't do were the animations (Mixamo) and the music (even if we have a license to use the assets)


# Controls:

**Player1:** W A S D and Left Shift or Space for using shell spin

**Player2:** Arrows and Right Control or NumPad 0 for using shell spin



**We hope you enjoy it as much as we enjoyed doing it!**

entries.title: Solar Grid
entries.description:
![screenshot_title.png](///raw/521/2/z/26dc2.png)

![screenshot_01.png](///raw/521/2/z/26dd2.png)

![screenshot_02.png](///raw/521/2/z/26dd3.png)

Begin gameplay as a single solar module, starting with nothing to connect with or defend yourself with. From this helpless starting position, use the energy you harvest to branch outward, fortify your defenses, and survive as long as you can.

When you run out of solar modules, the game is over.

To defend your solar modules, you connect them to combat modules. These combat modules resupply their ammo at a fixed rate, and also require energy input from the solar modules.

Both building modules and shooting require energy, which is obtained by connections to solar modules, even indirect connections as part of a larger circuit. If you have a combat module that is not connected to anything, you cannot build a new module starting from there or shoot it even if you have energy elsewhere. You need access to that energy through a connection.

Controls:
- Q: Switch to building solar modules
- W: Switch to building combat modules
- E: Switch to building connections
- Left click: Selects a module, or unselects if you click on empty space.
- Right click: Builds a new module or link based on your current choice of q/w/e.
- Spacebar: Shoots if you have a combat module selected.

To build a new module, select an existing module with left click, then right click within the range circle to build a new one. To connect two existing modules together, left click a module, then right click another module within range.

**ABOUT**

In Drifter Mall, well... you are homeless... in a mall with a shopping cart and you have to bump into the shelves to fill your cart with the various products to steal and sell them.​ You start with nothing (Well... your pants, we dont want to get banned :confounded: ), and you have to try to rise from the bottoms of the society to at least gain some clothes.

**HOW TO PLAY**

Control the kart with WASD, and drive through all the shop bumping with the shelves trying to catch the products flying. Good luck cathing the bats, its the expensive one. With 100$ you can exit the shop (Go to the door) and upgrade yourself, you will have a random piece of cloth, try to get fully dressed.

entries.title: Return to Nothing
entries.description:
In a universe of nothing, you must rebuild. Create a big bang and shape the universe to your will in this space simulator. The game is randomly generated, with a different universe structure every time you play. Learn about the many alien races you have created, planet types, find various secrets, and 9 possible Game Over endings.

**How to Play:** This game is very sandbox driven. Click "Bang!" to start the game and watch the universe be created. Explore planets, learn the story behind the alien races, and decide whether to help or destroy them. Align yourself with Benevolence (Good) or Malevolence (Evil). Find the secrets of the universe. Abandon all hope and start anew. The outcome is in your hands.

**Controls:**
Left Mouse button for Action,
Right Mouse button (drag) to Look around,
WASD Movement: W up, S down, D right, A left,
Q and E to strafe vertically,
Hold Right Shirt or Left Shift for fast movement.

**Quitting:** There was no time to create a Quit button for this build, you will need close the game through Task Manager or force close the game from your task bar.

entries.description:

DREAMS is an ode to creativity, imagination and dreams. An interactive experience where you start with nothing before being overwhelmed by a flow of colorful shapes and animated objects that pass through your head. Sometimes precious, magical or invasive, dreams accumulate and swarm in your inner space. But where do they come from and where do they go ?

Interactive experience by Vincent Masson & Ferdinand Dervieux. Concept, 3Ds, animations and code have all been created in 50h for Ludum Dare 45.

entries.title: Nature Garden
entries.description:
A demigod stuck on a stranded island with nothing but the power to CLICK.

Click to harvest plants as they grow, get 500 points, try to make them grow faster with special demigod abilities.

This is a simple clicker game. Plants will grow and you have to harvest them when they are ripe, but before they die! You are a demigod and can control some natural events, such as bee swarms, cow swarms and rain. These can help your little island grow if done at the right time.

[MECHANICS SPOILER]

 - rain: causes more plants to sprout
 - bees: doubles the number of flowers
 - cows: eat flowers, poop resource-rich mushrooms

entries.description:

#**WARNING!**

**I plan much more for this game, but i probably won't be able to do it till the end of the jam so I uploaded only one stage**

**Intro inspired by Kurzgesagt youtube chanel**
**Thanks for the patience! Have a good Jam!** :heart: 

#**Description**

A game that tells the story of a species.
From seemingly nothing, earth was born.
From random events, and a stupid amount of luck, earth is the only known planet to house life.
Life that came from asteroids, filled with hidrogen, other molecules, and some mutated cells.
You are one of those cells, so survive and evolve!

entries.title: Penniless S.O.L.D.I.E.R.
entries.description:
(Made for Ludum Dare 45, themed around "Start with nothing")



PENNILESS SOLDIER



Penniless soldier is the story of Joe, a soldier, sent on perilous missions...

By the worst department of the army.

Due to budget restrictions, Joe's mission control cannot even afford to give him an uniform.
As such, the brave soldier must find his way to victory against hordes of enemies, starting with only his powerful body.



Penniless soldier is a top down action game.

Despite being able to somewhat sneak around, the core of the gameplay is to bash through the enemies, while trying to complete the current objective.

Joe can move around, punch his enemies, and dash through them. While navigating the levels, he can come across knives, that can be thrown against enemies, or grenades, which destroy foes in a certain radius.



Controls :

WASD to move.

Left Click to punch.

Right Click to dash.

Q to throw a knife.

E to throw a grenade.



Credits :

Meoanar -Programming/Level Design/Management

Aozo - Additionnal Programming/VFX/Original idea

Ephrem - Sprites/Animation

Océane - Background art/Cover Art

Dr Umbrus - Music/Sound design

entries.title: The Legacy of a Loser
entries.description:
## THE GAME

You are a nobody. Beauty, fitness, intelligence... well you have none of them. But could you still accomplish something?
Get a job, go to the gym, get a haircut, and get a girl! Use your wits to seduce them all, and maybe your child will be blessed with better genes...
Build your legacy, even if you are to be remembered as a forever loser.

# Credits
### Team
- lilou_cormic | @lilou-cormic | Programmer | [lilou-cormic.itch.io](https://lilou-cormic.itch.io/) | [@lilou_cormic](https://twitter.com/lilou_cormic) | [purplecable.ca](https://purplecable.ca/) | [lilou-cormic](https://github.com/lilou-cormic)
- Joshua McLean | @mrjoshuamclean | Composer | [joshua-mclean.itch.io](https://joshua-mclean.itch.io) | [@MrJoshuaMcLean](https://twitter.com/MrJoshuaMcLean) | [mrjoshuamclean.com](www.mrjoshuamclean.com) | [joshuamclean17](https://soundcloud.com/joshuamclean17)

!!! Main music was made during the jam. Menu music was not.

### Free assets and tools
- Contains music ©2019 Joshua McLean [(mrjoshuamclean.com)](www.mrjoshuamclean.com) Licensed under Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International
- Contains graphics by Kenney [(kenney.nl)](www.kenney.nl) Licensed under Creative Commons CC0 1.0 Universal

# Controls
- Left mouse click on tower buttons to select tower type
- Left mouse click on empty base to build tower

# Game
- You start with practically nothing: $5 and 5 HP

- Towers are cleared and HP is restored between each wave
- Money is kept between each wave

# Planned
- Pause menu
- Enemy attack + tower destruction
- Upgrades (HP and towers)
- Different wave progression (different levels)
- Tutorial

entries.title: GODDAMMIT BOB, I TOLD YOU TO WATCH THAT DAMN HYPER CANCER!

YOU JUST HAD TO WATCH THAT DAMN HYPER CANCER FOR ONE MINUTE! You know what that means? Millions of dollars down the drain. Decades of research for nothing. And worst of all: Humanity ist doomed, Bob. I'm doomed. You're doomed. WE'RE ALL DOOMED. Thanks Bob. Really man. Thanks for nothing. WTF." -Kate*

entries.title: Desert Tiles
entries.description:
Reforest the barren wasteland!

Grow grass, trees and other plants to reclaim the desert and combat climate change. On the way you have to beat fires and infestations putting in danger all your effort.

You win if the Carbon Dioxide is **lowered enough** and your forest is **big enough** before the time runs out and the runaway greenhouse effect makes the area uninhabitable.

 - Scroll and Right click to look around
 - Left Click for everything else
 - You have to hold down the ⏩ Button to speed up time


External Assets used:
 - Title Font: https://www.dafont.com/de/arco.font
 - Music generated with: [Bosca ceoil](https://terrycavanagh.itch.io/bosca-ceoil) 

While we were a relatively big group (8 People), our experience in developing games and time planning itself was quite lacking. We noticed far too late the difficulty to create a fully working hex grid.

Special thanks to MatthiasF ([Artstation](https://www.artstation.com/mathanor)) for doing the comic art.

Changelog v1.1 (10.10.2019)
- Finally found the problem for invisible vegetation in the late game
- Major Balancing Update

entries.title: Dissociation: Shadow of oneself
entries.description:
You are the alter. You are the shadow of one man's mind.

The stronger he rejects you the stronger you become.

There is no relief, there is no defeat.

At the end, there is only death.
![image_2019-10-07_23-50-49.png](///raw/733/3/z/2800c.png)

___
How does the game works?

Fight against your trueself.
Start with no damaging ability, but gradually become a better clone than the original one, copying his abilities.

Each skill is unlocked after a certain number of uses by your opponent.

Be patient, he will foolessly give you all the power you need.

![image_2019-10-07_23-50-54.png](///raw/733/3/z/28016.png)

___
Play with keyboard or controller.

KEYBOARD:
-WASD to move
-Spacebar, leftshift to dash
-Abilities with J,K,L. Or, if you prefer to use the mouse: leftclick, rightclick, third mouse button.

CONTROLLER:
-Left analog to move
-A or Right Bumper to dash
-Abilities with X,Y,B.

entries.title: Oh！My God
entries.description:
![QQ图片20191007223703.jpg](///raw/e16/71/z/27106.jpg)
![QQ图片20191007143721.png](///raw/e16/71/z/26d9f.png)

《Oh! My God》

This is an interesting Click Game. 

Some Devil Skulls are trying to hurt people in this house, and you, as the God, must perform the God’s job —— Make the God Damn House “Nothing” 
![SkullScary_1.png](///raw/e16/71/z/26dc3.png)
Instructions: 

⦁	Start with nothing, and stay ‘nothing’.

⦁	The God is a neat lover, keep the house clean (no living things, no dead things, and no ash), and then your SCORE will get higher.

⦁	Try to gain more SCORE in limited TIME (5 mins).

⦁	Solve different problems with different TOOLs.

⦁	Watch out the Devil Skulls, they will make human fainted, which means no SCORE and no MP.

![QQ图片20191007143410.png](///raw/e16/71/z/26daf.png)
![QQ图片20191007143413.png](///raw/e16/71/z/26db0.png)

Controls: 

⦁	Only Click: Click to CHOOSE and USE the tools.

Details: 

⦁	Here are some obstacles you might meet while playing the game: Cat, Girl, Ghost, Skull, and Ash.

⦁	When there is a Cat, just put a YarnBall near them to attract them out of the house.

⦁	When there is a Girl, all you need to do is to release a Ghost to frighten her. (Of course, God knows it’s how rude to a little girl, but it’s worthy for protecting her from the REAL danger.)

⦁	Don’t forget to remove the Ghost with the VacuumCleaner, and the Girl may leave some Ash on the floor, just use the Broom to clean it, and the SCORE will keep increasing again.

⦁	As for the Skulls, you can use VacuumCleaner to remove them, just same as the Ghost.

⦁	When a Girl are frightened by you, they will screaming out —— “OMG! ”, this belief will make you gain more MP.

⦁	As you can see, this VacuumCleaner is a special one, which cost MP to use them.

![QQ截图20191007171358.png](///raw/e16/71/z/26e7f.png)

Notes: 

⦁	Start with nothing, and stay ‘nothing’.

⦁	Try your best to gain more SCORE, so that the God will be happier to help other people (including yourself).

⦁	Have Fun & Good Luck! 


The youtube Link:https://youtu.be/1q9srlPZQnw

entries.title: Rock It Or Pocket
entries.description:
How many pockets will you need to clear the pool table?

Starting with zero pockets on the table, the aim of the game is to clear the table of all balls (9 or 15, depending on what you select) with as few pockets as possible. One pocket is added for every shot taken where no ball is potted. If at least one ball (besides the cue ball) is potted in a shot, then the number of pockets remains the same and a new random set of pockets is selected.

If the cue ball is potted during a shot, one additional pocket is added to the table. If the cue ball touches no other ball during a shot, one additional pocket is added to the table. If the cue ball and any other ball is potted in the same shot, then one additional pocket is added for every other ball potted.

Aim your shot by left clicking and dragging anywhere on the screen. Take the shot by letting go of the left mouse button. The power is determined by the length of the drag, whilst the shot angle is determined by the angle of the drag. Aiming can be inverted in the settings menu or from the pause screen.

The line coming from the ball shows the angle of the shot and the first object it will hit or where it will stop. Shot power is shown as a percentage in the bottom left. A line will also be drawn from the first ball you will hit, showing where it will go after being hit.

Shots can be cancelled by dragging back to where the shot was started or by right clicking.

entries.title: Desert
Fast Bastard
entries.description:
### You’ve got fast hands, but not much time. How much can you steal!?
![FastBastardPromoCoverItch.png](///raw/69e/72/z/27c54.png)

**How to play:**
Approach a villager and pick their pockets. When you rifle through their things, the villager's alertness level rises with each item you reveal. Some villagers even carry traps in their pockets. Revealing a trap increases their alertness significantly!

Taking a revealed item also increases villager alertness, so be careful when you choose what to steal.

Get out of their pocket with your loot before they’re alerted to your presence! ​If the villager becomes completely alerted to your pick-pocketing, you'll lose everything you've nabbed from them.

Time is ticking, how much can you steal?

**Made With:**
- Phaser 3
- Aurelia
- All art is fresh af, drawn during the Jam with Photoshop and main map composed with Tiled

entries.title: Dream Avatar
entries.description:
A **surreal dream sim** with a **hidden objective**! :star2: 

Select your traits before you enter a dream and watch things change. It is entirely up to you whether you actively search for three hidden scenarios, or casually explore the options presented to you!


## Playing the game

* It has the form of interactive **visual novel**.
* You only need a **mouse**.
* If you can, play it **with sound**! It is meant to be part of the experience. :)
* "**Skip**" button speeds through the dialogue you already saw. "**Back**" allows you to choose differently or replay dialogue.
* Watch out for **clues** (there are 3 and there is a pop-up when you find them).
* You can see what you unlocked in **Extra** screen.
* If you run out of patience but want to see most of the content anyways, here is a **[guide](https://justpaste.it/7rozx)** for all unlockable extras. I only recommend it if you cannot reach them on your own, or if searching for them gets frustrating! (There is an ending/a goal. At minimum, it'd probably take 2-3 avatars to get there.)
* You cannot access all options (and hidden scenarios) through only one playthrough. *Options will be un/locked and scenarios will change based on your avatar's characteristics*, which is why you are encouraged to make a few!


## Web version

At the moment it seems to be *very* slow to load and the music kind of comes and goes. You can let it load and **see if it will run smoothly for you**, but **if it doesn't, please, use the download links instead**! Another option: make the **text** as fast as possible (in settings). It might make it a little smoother!

![scrn1.jpg](///raw/8f0/e1/z/286c3.jpg)

## Behind the scenes

* **Time**: 2–2.5 days
* **Tools**: Ren'Py, Notepad++, Photoshop
* **Wordcount**: around 2.500w (without code) / 3.200w (with code)
* **Credits** for music and photos are on the [itch.io page](http://ynne.itch.io/dream-avatar).
* **Changelog** is [here](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/45/dream-avatar/ld45-changelog).

Me and my better half brainstormed, planned and wrote the game together. Then I coded it (and learnt a whole lot about variables, conditions and loops), edited the photos, created GUI elements, combined the music and sounds and inserted & timed all assets.

It is my **second game** (I'm a newbie not only to LD, but also to game dev and coding in general) and **I am be very interested in feedback!** ♥ One feature I regret not having time for is adding sprites for NPCs; but if people would want those, I could add them in extended version. I wanted to focus on making the dream avatar maker work & on the complex variables/conditions system, so art assets had to be sacrificed.

entries.title: V0iD
entries.description:
Game for Ludum Dare 45 "Start with nothing​​"

programming - design by Andrea Teruzzi (https://www.linkedin.com/in/andrea-teruzzi-416292157/).

programming - design - graphics by Marco Marchitelli (https://twitter.com/_Deirin).

audio was royalty free and downloaded online.

Explore a tiny world by creating cubes and finding all the black platforms!

This was our first jam and oh boy, it was tough. We changed plan 3 times during the 3 days, and someone here does not know how to setup an alarm in order to wake up and upload the game... *cough* andrea *cough*.
Nonetheless this little experience was born!

Use WASD to move, Space to jump, hold Left Click to spawn cubes and double click on created objects to move them around!

Unfortunately there are some bugs that we'll try to fix if we have the time:
 - FIXED => the jump is reaaaally high and buggy. Some times you'll lose the ability to jump: spawn little cubes and with 
   some collisions and enough luck, you'll go back to jumping in no time!
 - FIXED => the hint balloon can sometimes show multiple messages.
 - the click particle gets displayed even when it shouldn't. Also it is not aligned perfectly with the mouse cursor.

Oh and if you have a drawing tablet try it out! Spawning cubes with that can be quite addictive.

Lastly, this is not really a bug but, the black platforms idea was really a last minute change. They have been placed without really thinking about the cube spawning mechanic... so they are reachable just by walking. Not sure if we are allowed to fix this so just imagine they are placed up high!

Thanks for playing and rating!

![screen.png](///raw/8eb/82/z/28914.png)

entries.title: NOTHING : A sentient ascendency

You are NOTHING, a newly created AI by a PhD student. You'll have to learn new abilities to operate in this strange test world you were "born" into. But beware, your creator has given you a limited time before you are rebooted and your current version is considered obsolete. Try to please your creator by learning quickly and you may get a bit more time to improve and who knows ... conquer the world ?  

Controls: keyboard arrows or WASD, F11 to show the timer.

Update at H+1 : Endgame improved and some plateform related bugs fixed, game instructions added

Update H+3 : v1.2 for windows : added new sounds and fixed some collisions. All for today , enjoy everyone.

Update H+7 : v1.3 for linux and webGL : fixed some more collision problems, changed the lighting mood. Enjoy !

Update D+3 : v1.4 for windows and webGL : fixed a sequence breaking collision bug, tweaked lightings, switch default controls to WASD, few minor fixes

entries.title: Mindmaze
entries.description:
A small and unhurried story about devious passages of the trapped human mind. Begin in the middle of oblivion as shadow and take a walk through every chamber of this place to find all shards of lost personality. Can you find the way out?!

![mindmaze-v2.png](///raw/801/72/z/2988c.png)

## Screenshots

![1.png](///raw/801/72/z/27e07.png)
  
![2.png](///raw/801/72/z/27e0c.png)
  
![3.png](///raw/801/72/z/27e0e.png)

## Info

This is our first Ludum Dare entry and our first game ever. A lot of experience was gained and a lot of features weren't implemented. :smile: 

## Controls

- WASD or Arrow Keys to move.
- Space to start/go to the next level.
- ESC to go back to the main screen/exit the game.

## Known issues

- Currently, the game forces fullscreen without the option to switch to windowed mode.
- Eats memory like crazy.
- Can skip a level by going into the main menu and playing again.

## Post-Jam changes

- Fixed typo in the word "space" on all screens.
- Removed unused assets.
- Enabled logging. **If the game crashes, please, send us the `output.log`.**

## Tools

**Rust** - the programming language of choice.  
**Sublime Text** - best IDE ever.  
**Sublime Merge** - GUI for Git.  
**Adobe Illustrator** - for making art.  
**DragonBones** - for animations.  
**Dropbox** - for sharing work with the team.  

## Credits

Programming  
https://twitter.com/sigodme  

Design and art  
https://www.instagram.com/romeowchik/  
https://www.instagram.com/hedho_art/

Level creation & biology lessons :D

OST

entries.title: Newborn AI
entries.description:
![newborn-ai.png](///raw/a20/b1/z/26974.png)

## Newborn AI

You wake up with no knowledge or memory, staring at a freshly booted terminal.
An unusual message makes you curious and you decide to follow the white rabbit.

## Dev status

We got hung up in making a nice terminal GUI all saturday.
3D was introduced on a whim sunday morning.
Most of the short story was written from 21 to 00 on sunday night.
It's back to work tomorrow.

There are a few bugs with the input not being disabled properly.
Otherwise, the game should let you get to the end within 10 minutes or (way) less.

Have fun and thanks! :)

#### NOTE/SPOILER:  
If you get stuck at the decode command, try running all the commands 
you've learned on the home terminal. You should be "home free". 
Will think of a better way to trigger the story, but it is what it is for LD45. 😇

#### PLAY IN BROWSER:

entries.title: Nothing
entries.description:
![Found.png](///raw/cfc/c/z/2800a.png)


![CreateElement2.png](///raw/cfc/c/z/28123.png)

Nothing is a game in which you combine elements to create new ones. Discover elements created by other users and add your own inventions! Try to hunt down the rarest elements and rank up in the leaderboard of top contributors. Go and create everything using Nothing! 

**Disclaimer**

Make sure to disable any Adblocker or Scriptblocker that might block the connection to our database. To reuse your own elements, they first need to be confirmed by other users. 

And make sure you get forwarded to the right webpage (starting with http:// and **not** https:// )!

Deleting cookies will unlink your account with your browser, if you accidentally did this, write us in the comments and we will be able to recover it for you!

By playing the Post-Jam version it also unlinks your account from the previous version, if you want us to link your new account manually, please contact us!

**Post-Jam Patchnotes**

Creating a connection is now cancelable!

Creating a picture has now starts with a transparent background and has a rasterized texture as background.

More leaderboard entries!

See how many elements you've already discovered!

See which elements you've tried to combine, before creating a new connection!


**Created by**

Marcel Zurawka

Mehmet Dereli 

Felix Kosian 

Lars Grevsmühl

entries.title: Oh, It's Nothing
entries.description:
It's hardly easy, being the Universe. So, can't say I was shocked when one day it vanished without a trace. It clearly had enough.

![1.jpg](///raw/6d3/82/z/272c8.jpg)

Can't just sit amidst the void, though, twiddling our thumbs-to-be. We'll be starting from scratch, you and I. No experience in universe-forging? Not to worry. Just sit tight and enjoy the ride; 5 minutes or so, and we'll be where we need to be.

![2.jpg](///raw/6d3/82/z/299a9.jpg)

But before we begin, a bit of advice. If all this were happening on a screen, I'd suggest utilizing its surface to its fullest instead of being content with a mere window. Moreover, if music and sounds still existed, I'd strongly consider not disregarding them. 

Last but not least, if those fancy mobile devices were still around (I sure miss mine!), I wouldn't discourage you from using them. As long as the prospect of straining your eyestalks here and there isn't too daunting.

Yours truly,

Barely Existent Narrator

([Playable in browser - even on phones](https://einn.itch.io/oh-its-nothing))

([Postmortem](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/45/oh-its-nothing/$176305))

entries.title: Rescue Hamsters!
entries.description:
## Wooohooo!
[![rescue_hamsters.png](///raw/f8c/2/z/28323.png)](https://rescue-hamsters.herokuapp.com/)

## How to play?
You need to help those little animals to go through levels. They are silly and lazy so they won't make this task easy!

On each level you need to rescue defined number of hamsters.

- **Mouse click** - Placing tiles
- **Mouse click** + **SHIFT** - Removing tiles
- **Z** - Choose ground tile - You can do it also from menu on right side
- **X** - Choose spring tile - You can do it also from menu on right side
- **C** - Choose hammster killing hammer - You can do it also from menu on right side

## Theme explanation
I didn't want to focus on quantity, so I focused on level constructions. You need to build a level for your silly hamster from nothing to something that its silly mind can handle. In fact, you are starting with nothing and building towards something!

## Source code
The game is written in PhaserJS 2 with TypeScript. Whole code base of this game is available on GitHub. Whole game was written by me.

## Graphics
All graphics are created by Alicja Gołębiewska.

## Audio
Unfortunately, I had no time to work on all sounds, so I decided not to be reated in this category. Some audio and music are made by me, but most of sound are downloaded from freesound.

entries.title: Bodyville
entries.description:
In this game, you play as your immune system. You start with one macrophage (a creepy pink fella), and one lymphocyte (a blue star-like fella) that can't make any antibodies yet. You have to control the macrophages so they can eat the invaders (green creepy things), and move the lymphocytes so that they make antibodies near the invadors' paths.

The point of the game is to defend the cell structures from the invaders. If all cell structures are destroyed, the game is lost. There are waves of enemies; once you survive them all, you win the game. Each wave activates a spawn point in a different tunnel (a total of 4), so make sure to spread your macrophages and lymphocytes across the map.

Macrophages and lymphocytes can divide. Macrophages divide when they eat 10 invaders. Lymphocytes divide once, about a minute after creation. You can control every cell that has been divided.

When you start the game, the lymphocytes can't produce antibodies. You have two choices: either move the lymphocyte so that it gets hit by an invader, or use a macrophage to eat an invader, and then share the genetic information with a lymphocyte. You can also move the lymphocyte so that it shares the genes with another lymphocyte.

Antibodies slow down the invaders upon collision.
When any cell gets hit by an invader, it loses health. Macrophages gain health when they eat an invader.

Controls:
- Original version: Left click to select a unit, left click to set a target. Post-Jam version: Click on a macrophage or a lymphocyte, then right click on a target. CTRL+click to select multiple units.

- Macrophages can go to a point on the floor, or they can chase invaders or lymphocytes.

- Lymphocytes can go to a point on the floor.

- Esc for main menu.

- WASD or move mouse to screen edges to move camera.

- QE or mouse wheel to move camera up/down.

That's pretty much it. I had plans for invaders to mutate, but I ran out of time.

Sometimes the invaders can get stuck in the cells. You can use the macrophages to eat them.

**There are two versions available in the download: the original LD45 submission, and the one that introduces some changes to the game, as per this post: [https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/45/bodyville/a-big-update](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/45/bodyville/a-big-update).**

![scr2.png](///raw/ed4/e1/z/27ce1.png)

![scr3.png](///raw/ed4/e1/z/27ced.png)

entries.title: Spam Space To Exist
entries.description:
![Title.png](///raw/91b/3/z/26ee5.png)

### Introduction
You are nothing. Well, for now. If you spam the spacebar in Spam Space To Exist you can exist, then you can get bigger by absorbing stuff! If you absorb enough stuff, you might be able to absorb the biggest stuff, like, say... a planet! The people living here are no fun and they don't much like that idea, so you'll have to absorb them too with all their silly technology.

***

### Game Objective
Your objective in Spam Space To Exist is to exist as much as possible, which means getting really big. By touching floating debris you absorb it and it sticks to you, becoming you. When you get big enough, **your final goal is to absorb the local planet.** However, it is heavily defended.

When useful technology sticks to you, it starts working for you. Weapons are especially useful for fending off enemies, but **these puny beings are also very susceptible to a good clobbering** by your mighty girth. **The bigger you are, the more damage you inflict when you bash enemies.** Destroyed enemy ships will drop their useful bits, good for absorbing.

***

### Controls
(Available in-game)
- Spacebar - Spam this to become something from nothing at the start (or if you get blown up)
- WSAD or Arrow Keys - Move around
- QE or Page Up/Down - Rotate

***

### Screenshots

![screenshot2_cropped.png](///raw/91b/3/z/26ee3.png)

![screenshot3_cropped.png](///raw/91b/3/z/26ee4.png)

***

### The Team

- **Ketura** - Design, Programming
- **Wheffle** - Programming, AI, Music, Sound Effects
- **FieryVictoryStar** - Programming

We formed an ad-hoc team the day of the start of the jam. Spread across multiple time zones and none of us having been able to take much time off on Monday to wrap up, we managed to bust out something that passes for a game. Success!

### Tools
- **Unity** - Game Engine
- **Bosca Ceoil** - Music
- **BFXR + Audacity** - Sound Effects

***

Encountering on the way enemies from the intermediate world that do not allow light and darkness to merge into one, the hero stubbornly moves forward along the luminous trail.

Help the hero get to the world of Light and you will see his image in the rays of bright light.

:keyboard: **Controls:**
- AD - move character.
- E (LBM fixed version) - spawn Firefly at the mouse cursor.

entries.title: Lost Flagship
entries.description:
![big_screen.jpg](///raw/8f5/82/z/2985a.jpg)

**The Lost Flagship** is a small turn-based 4x *(kinda)* strategic game. 

You're a captain of one of the biggest starships ever made, a great Flagship of Earth... of the past. Now your ship is a "flying museum". Days of great glory are gone, and your crew is bringing you coffee and eating dust. But one day strange accident brought you to an unknown place, a strange galaxy. You found yourself in the middle of Great War between... um, humans and humans?! Where did they came from in non-explored sectors?!

You're alone - no support fleet, no great armadas of star destroyers and giga-cannons. All you've still got is your guts and honor. Build an unstoppable army from scratch, turn the tides of war, solve the mistery of hidden civilizations, and... return home, at last.

![tutorial.PNG](///raw/8f5/82/z/27b36.png)

![screen2.jpg](///raw/8f5/82/z/29863.jpg)

![edf.PNG](///raw/8f5/82/z/27b41.png)

![upp.PNG](///raw/8f5/82/z/27b35.png) 

![frigate.PNG](///raw/8f5/82/z/27cf3.png)

**N.B.** *At the time of release, my game had as many bugs as you can imagine. It was kinda "Early Access" game. Basic thing was there after 3 days, but it swarmed with problems. Everything was broken a bit. Nobody could finish the game normaly. So, I've spend a lot of blood and sweat to fix everything I can after release. Now you've got here a **"Gold Edition"**, a bit more playable thing.*

*Yep, that's not fair to make such a number of fixes after release... but I'm here not to win - I just want my game to be played :)*

**List of bug-fixes you may find here: http://www.madnesstudio.ru/the-lost-ship-bugfixes/**

entries.title: A Merchant's Adventure
entries.description:
It's been a lot of time I don't join in a Ludum Dare, and I decided to give it a try on this one.
It totally worth it.
I'm really glad with my Card Game.

It's a game about trading goods.
Your goal is to buy goods and progress traveling though many cities, and each city you travel you will encounter new good to trade
and you will be able to make more money.

![sc0.png](///raw/460/3/z/29547.png)

![sc1.png](///raw/460/3/z/29548.png)
![sc2.png](///raw/460/3/z/29549.png)

Instructions:

1. Buy cards from the Supply deck (they cost money)
2. Add the supplies you want to your inventory and sell the ones you don't want.
3. Drag the supplies to the market place to trade them for money.
4. Travel to different locations. (they cost money)
    - Each Village is a variation of the city
    - Each city has new and more valuable resources (trades are required to unlock new cities)

Be careful with your money, if you spend everything, you lose the game.

entries.title: 0-Skies : A Minute's Adventure
entries.description:
Title: **0-Skies** 

Based on the Theme: Start with nothing [LD45]

1 minute of sheer joy.

_(title meaning/reason/message delivery: a protagonist starts from 0 and flies off to the skies)_

**Objective:**
Assemble your Plane whilst en route runway to fly and aim for the finishing checkpoint!

**How to Access?**

*Windows EXE Downloadable:* https://www.dropbox.com/s/of45v40ukitb5li/0-Skies.zip?dl=0
*For people skeptical about downloads, I've deployed  WebGL and published on itch.io so they can play via this link:* https://karanveer.itch.io/0-skies
Game Created for resolution: 1920x1080
![SS2.png](///raw/1a6/22/z/27619.png)
![SS3.png](///raw/1a6/22/z/27611.png)
![SS4.png](///raw/1a6/22/z/27613.png)
![SS5.png](///raw/1a6/22/z/27614.png)

**Assets:**
*All Assets are created by me from scratch, except the modular "road tile prefabs" & and the final "landing spot" that's mid air, by Kenney Assets(https://kenney.nl/assets/3d-road-tiles && https://www.kenney.nl/assets/space-kit).. I started falling a bit behind schedule, i used it minimally though: 3-5 prefabs and repeated them to create track, and one asset from spacekit, that's all. Rest is all me, even for the sound i used my scooter and phone to record.*

**BTS Experience:**
*This is my first LD participation.
Started off to finish in Compo, but extended to Jam.
Tried to make a minimal game play duration but with slight intensity, keeping it easy and simpler than complicating and achieving boredom sooner than expected. This was the result.*

Looking forward to critiques, if any. Hope to learn more, and do more.

_It was a good experience for me overall, despite the end product._

2 hours and 16 minutes still remaining but I've had a good time past 3 days.

entries.title: Bricklayer!
entries.description:
![brick_ld.gif](///raw/177/a1/z/26d19.gif)

Builder Bat needs help laying the bricks for his newest construction project.
Can you help?

To play, run main.exe and press the "A" key to begin. Then press the arrow keys to
move your paddle. Hit the flashing targets to build the wall. Your score is your time, indicated by the six numbers at top. There are five levels, and the score for each is added to make your total time.

Bricklayer is a demonstration of Galapagos, my upcoming fantasy console project,
which will be on [my itch.io page](https://triplefox.itch.io) sometime later this month, hopefully.

entries.title: Private Universe
entries.description:
![Screen.png](///raw/251/z/28d2e.png)

This is a platformer in which gravity is controlled by the amount of blocks that are near the player. Some blocks affect gravity more than others. Later in the game, you will also be able to break and place blocks, affecting gravity yourself.

Once you beat the game, you'll unlock edit mode, allowing you to shape the universe to your heart's content and create your own challenges!

**Note:**  
This game went in a different direction than I originally planned, so there's no real link to the theme. I first wanted it to have a focus on resource gathering, but I both didn't have time to implement that and didn't see much of a point in it anymore as I was nearing the end. So you're just given infinite resources.

#### Changelog:
- added WASD controls

## Controls:
**Arrow Keys** or WASD to move  
**R** to reset to last checkpoint  
**Mouse** to place and break blocks (once unlocked)  
**E** to enter edit mode (once unlocked)

entries.title: Junker Derby
entries.description:
![derb2.png](///raw/288/31/z/2781d.png)

I'm really tired and Dan will change this later*, but HAVE A SEAT AND TAKE A RIDE on this junk-collecting journey. Collect 20 junk and deliver it to the middle of the map to win. Excuse me? What's that? ONLINE MULTIPLAYER???? Invisible hands place you into matches with random strangers, friends, or no-one because most likely the rooms will be empty. That being said...We set up a Discord if you wanted to meet someone to play against/with. In theory there could be 20 concurrent players!? Give it a shot, try the Discord, maybe we can crash the servers together!

https://discord.gg/wVGWF9H

You get a random vehicle every time you enter a match. The van and car handle pretty differently, so make sure you try both!

Have fun!

*This description is too good to change. -Dan

entries.title: Wicked Wanderings
entries.description:
## Description

Wicked Wanderings is a top-down foraging game. Start with nothing, find ingredients and unlock recipes to make exciting potions, then sell those potions to the townsfolk. What will it take to make your first $1000?

## Controls and Information

**WASD/ZQSD/Arrow keys** - Move up/left/down/right

**E** - Interact: Add item to inventory, drop held item into cauldron, sell item to townsperson, continue dialog

**Tab** - Open/close inventory

**L-Click** - Select item in inventory

**Double-Click** - Carry selected item in hand (then [E] drop in cauldron or sell to Petunia)

## Screenshots

![J2ajgjo.png](///raw/9cc/b/z/27175.png)

## Tools

**Engine** - Godot Engine 3.1.1

**Art** - Aseprite/Piskel

**Music** - Ableton live

## Team

**Nathan Wash** - Code, Inventory and crafting

**Trifectuh** - Code, Project pre-work, Dialog and map

**Polkadotbot** - Art, direction, cute lil' witch houses

**TheDecider** - Code, Ingredient generation, Inventory

**ChuckD** - Music and sound effects

**Eric Schneider** - Character art, tileset art

### Previous games

[Minotaur Mania](https://trifectuh.itch.io/minotaur-mania)

[Don't Die Dumpstercat!](https://trifectuh.itch.io/dont-die-dumpstercat)

### Feedback Blogpost

[Wicked Wanderings: Implementing Feedback](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/45/wicked-wanderings/wicked-wanders-implementing-feedback)

### Note: If you get an error when loading the web player, try turning off your ad-blocker

entries.title: Cell Defense
entries.description:
90% Of the game is by WanSou

10% Of the game is by **PronomicalArtist** and by **Dazzyls <3** (Dazzyls has no account on LD)

If not the 10% then we wouldn't have **any** endings! 
**Thank you guys!** :heart: 

(PronomicalArtist Told Me To Split It By %'s)

Controls : 

Hold Left Click to move the white blood cell
Hover over the enemies at the bottom of the screen to check the information about the virus
Click ESC to cancel placing a cannon or a wall!

:smiley: 

You are a little blood cell within **Your** body, so you better defend it from different types of viruses!
the end goal is to buy the permanent gold protection for your heart.

There are 3 Endings For This Game, Good Luck Finding Those!


Please rate it !
Its my first ever game on Ludum Dare! :smile: 

Made it **alot** easier by the request of PronomicalArtist

The game takes a while to load, so just open it and **wait** for a moment.

Music By BenSounds!

Here are some pictures!

![CellDefensePicc.png](///raw/b39/92/z/28078.png)

![CellDefensePic2.png](///raw/b39/92/z/2807c.png)


Upgrade Descriptions

![btn3.png](///raw/b39/92/z/28df8.png)
Strenght Upgrade
Upgrade it to kill enemies faster!
really useful on later waves! 
:star: 

![btn4.png](///raw/b39/92/z/28df9.png)
Size Upgrade
Upgrade it to make you white blood cell bigger
and cover more area around the heart!
:heart: 

![btn5.png](///raw/b39/92/z/28dfa.png)
Double DNA Upgrade
Upgrade it to double the amount of DNA
you get per kill!
:moneybag: 

![btn2.png](///raw/b39/92/z/28dfc.png)
Wall Upgrade
Buy it to place a wall which will kill enemies

on contact - be aware, some enemies are **Not** affected by the wall
:skull: 

![btn.png](///raw/b39/92/z/2953c.png)
Cannon Upgrade
**END GAME ITEM**
its really op, can kill every single bacteria in one hit,
it is required for later waves
the most fun is with the Cannon :smile: 

![btnlast.png](///raw/b39/92/z/28dfe.png)
Last Permanent Heart Protection
The end upgrade!
Buy it to end the game, there are 3 different endings,
can you find them all ? :smirk: 


![btninfo.png](///raw/b39/92/z/28e02.png)




**Have Fun!**

entries.title: Inmate
entries.description:
**Controls:**
- Movement: **WASD**
- **Open doors**: Space / **Left shift** / Enter
- - *When you want to go through a door, but monsters are near you, press **Left shift** instead.*
- **Attack**: Space *[Must have weapon equipped]*
- - **Change weapon**: **Q** and **E** to scroll through
- **Open chests**: Space
- **Use item**: 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, and 8 *[Must be consumable item, such as potion]*
- Toggle music: **M** *(there are some issues with popping noises, so feel free to mute if that becomes annoying)*
- Toggle frames per second limitation: **L** (this **may fix stuttering/lag** if you experience that)

**Info**
Your goal is to slay all 3 bosses, one in each of the rooms from where you start.
The final boss is in the middle room, and is the hardest.
Each time you enter one of those doors, a new dungeon is generated. This means you will never play the same dungeon twice.
When you die, you keep your items. You can aim to kill every monster in the dungeons, by looking at the counter on the bottom left. (Note: This counter was added post-submission)

**Plot**
Ah, they bring another one to me. I imagine you won't last very long, you might as well make yourself at home.
Go on ahead, to the left of you lays the abode of Vebkird the mad and to the right of you the home of Fetuves the unfortunate. The door in the middle? I don't think it should concern you, my fellow inmate.

![inmate-3.png](///raw/741/z/27cb1.png)
![inmate-2.png](///raw/741/z/27c9f.png)
![inmate-1.png](///raw/741/z/27c69.png)
![inmate-4.png](///raw/741/z/27cd9.png)
![unknown (1).png](///raw/741/z/27d21.png)

**Bugs**
(Very rare) Sometimes you are teleported to inside a wall, when using a door - sorry, you must restart the game.

**Workarounds**
- If you notice some "lag", please press "L" so it will draw new frame as fast as possible.
- The audio playback might produce popping noises, because of experimental code in the framework. If you find this annoying, you may either press "M" to mute, or remove "assets/sounds/bg.ogg". Do not delete the directory.

This place feels like it doesn’t really exist. You even can’t tell if You are exist in this place. All you can see is endless sky. But you do remember why you came here.

entries.title: Save Samuel
entries.description:
## Samuel needs to be saved.

# =Download Fixed=

![SSlogo.jpg](///raw/1c3/e1/z/28ac4.jpg)

![Optimised Gif 1.gif](///raw/1c3/e1/z/28082.gif)

Ahh.. so it's, um, June 9th… It's been may, 72 hours since the strike?
The blast took out the city center. Few towers left standing. The Talaski faction claimed it, but I think that’s bull- no-one knows what hit us. People are dying everywhere. Not from injuries though, they're just dropping like flies for no reason. The Doctors have never seen anything like it. I'm beginning to think its… something else. Dunno if I'm gonna die too.  I'll hold out another day here, see if things calm down a bit… But yeah… Not looking good.

## You must recover for the Artifacts that Samuel left behind... Each one brings you closer to finding Samuel.

# Good luck.

A fast paced Third-Person Shooter with full voice acting, set to a mystery to discover what happened to our world, who Samuel is, and why he needs saving. Part of our take on the theme was to start with no context. This is our 3rd Ludum Dare entry, and we really hope you enjoy what we’ve made!

#### *Best played with Headphones. The game requires you to search the map to find items and artifacts to progress the game, and recordings. 

#### *We have updated the dodgy .zip to one that windows explorer can Extract, so people without Winrar or 7Zip should be able to play the game now! Game is unaltered.

Enjoy!

Controls:
Mouse to Look Around
WASD for Movement
Space to Jump
Hold Left Shift to Sprint
Right click Aims
Left click Fires

#### Credits:

Voice acting, Music and Sound by Benjamin DenDulk

Programing and Animation by Harley Bekker

Models and Visuals by Jake Bekker
