entries.title: No Stone Uncrumbled
entries.description:
![No Stone Uncrumbled Banner](///raw/cbb/9/z/28ff6.png)

-----

![Game preview](///raw/cbb/9/z/29dcf.gif)

-----

# "No Stone Uncrumbled" by Jonasz Kądziela & Artur Jaszczak
### _Also known as "No Stone Unturned"_

-----

## About the game:
***No Stone Uncrumbled*** is a number-based puzzle game.
Take control of the purple kobold living underground and help him get enough boulders to reach the target.
You can add, subtract, divide and multiply, but be careful - you have to use your strength to move the rocks.
Plan your route accordingly to avoid running out of energy and don't take too long of a route - the boulders crumble and get smaller the more you push them!

### Team roles:
* Jonasz Kądziela - Programming :computer: & Graphics Design :art:
* Artur "ShadAcinonyx" Jaszczak - Audio :musical_note: & Graphics Design :art:

-----

## How to play?
* At the beginning of each round, the _Target_ number is randomly generated from a specific range.
* Every round you start with nothing, number 0, and your goal is to get as close as possible to the _Target_ number.
* _Energy_ is limited and dictates how much you can move. If you run out of _Energy_, you faint - game over.
* After each round you will receive a reward consisting of more _Energy_ and _Money_. The closer your number was to the _Target_ number the more _Energy_ you will get. Resolving the puzzle quickly will give you bonus money.

## Pro tips:
* _Sandstone_ (brown rock) is lighter than _Granite_ (grey rock), however it crumbles more easily.

-----

## Controls:

### Movement
* **W** or **Up Arrow** - move forward
* **S** or **Down Arrow** - move backward
* **A** or **Left Arrow** - move to the left
* **D** or **Right Arrow** - move to the right

### Actions
* **Space** - Pick up or drop a nearby stone
* **ESC** - Exit the game

-----

**We do really hope the game isn't too difficult or straight up boring. Time was tight and playtesting short - balance might be off. There are also some of the features that we couldn't implement before the end of the Jam** :sweat_smile: 

### - A friendly reminder to rate the game based on the initial release version -

-----

entries.title: LD45 - Cards of Creation
entries.description:
Phew! 
My first entry for Ludum Dare :D 
As expected I both mismanaged time and scope for the project, but I learned a lot during this Jam.

You control the environment via cards, there are 9 different ones, the arguably most important one being LIFE which will kickstart a while lot of things.
If a caveman sees a fire (preferably from lightning) he will construct a village, which will slowly progress towards modern times and ultimatelly launch satelites into orbit.
The game doesn't have a lot to do but I had fun experimenting with different concepts, I may revisit this project once I acquire adequate experience for it.

Btw if the energy bar and autocasting on overcharge annoys you you can disable it with SPACE

EDIT: So everyone was annoyed by the autocasting and energy bar so they are off by default, you can re-enable it with SPACE for some chaos xd

entries.title: Baryon Asymmetry
entries.description:
In the beginning there was **nothing**.

For a few moments after the *big bang* you can influence the creation of the *universe* by controlling the positition and direction of matter-antimater particle pair production out of nothing. 

Matter sticks to other matter, making bigger chunks of matter. Same goes for antimatter. Matter colliding with antimatter results in the annihilation of both, regardless of their size.

A universe like ours has a lot of matter and hardly any antimatter. But is that the only way to create a viable universe?

Tools used:
- Unity 2019.2.8f1
- Visual Studio 2017
- Inkscape
- Bfxr

Special thanks go to [Aziraphal](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCOyk1QIBrvT8F4MniT1egfw) for the soundtrack and some sound effects made especially for this game, not to mention QA.

How this game was made: https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/45/baryon-asymmetry/how-i-really-started-with-nothing

If you are having trouble playing the game, watch me play:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IkgBsFfaFiI

entries.title: Crashteroid
entries.description:
You are a little robot pilot that has crashed their ship on an asteroid. To get off the asteroid, you need to bring some resources to your ship to fix it.

### Controls:
- WASD to control, mouse to look
- Space to use your jetpack
- E to build mines on resource nodes
- F to enter resource cannon placement mode. F to place the cannon and F again near a cannon to enter aiming mode. F to accept aim direction.
- Don't tell anyone, but if you die in a late level and you'd want to get back to that level, you can skip levels with the N-key.

## How to play:

### Find resources
![Screenshot 2019-10-06 at 22.51.47.png](///raw/060/1/z/26267.png)


### Build a mine on the resource node
![Screenshot 2019-10-06 at 22.51.56.png](///raw/060/1/z/2626c.png)
Build a mine by pressing E close to a resource node (there will be a prompt when you're close enough)


### Build a cannon to shoot the resources forward to a new cannon and finally your ship.
![Screenshot 2019-10-06 at 22.17.44.png](///raw/060/1/z/26251.png)

Build the cannon by pressing F and F again to place it. If you want to aim the cannon, say more upwards, press F close to the cannon and aim. Press F again to exit aim mode.

Code by: @i-h @n1cc3 @kankje @katis @dmnt @hunttis

(IntelliJ Rider, which is an awesome tool for Unity projects)

Models by: @katis @hunttis

(Blender, textures with Gimp)

Sounds and ambience by: @MikroPiru

(Garageband, guitars, basses and all kinds of strange tools like an "ebow", cowbells, tamburins)


## Notes

We might've gone a little overboard with some things, but relatively modern machines should be able to handle the game in a browser. If not, try the native builds!

There are **three levels**

I hope you get to see all the **cutscenes**! xD

entries.title: Spellody
entries.description:
Spellody is a music based hack and slash game. Cast musical attacks by swishing your magical keytar at the neon enemies!!!

![27f30.png](///raw/4a0/92/z/28887.png)

![27f51.png](///raw/4a0/92/z/2888a.png)

Playthrough of the game on YouTube: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jfUAFnW5RVw

How to play:

- Move with WASD and Mouse
- Left or Right click on enemies to cast spells on them or yourself
- Left clicks cast "Major" spells which are RED
- Right clicks cast "Minor" spells which are BLUE


- Create shapes using the Spell Icons, but don't use the same one twice
- The icon you start your spell on determines the spell type you cast: 

- Green Triangle = Range attack
- Magenta Diamond = Melee Attack (teleports you to the enemy)
- Yellow Square = Speed increase spell
- Cyan Circle = Healing spell


- Start with simple line spells (Example: Green Triangle to Yellow Square is a "weak ranged" attack)
- Then move to angles (Example: Magenta Diamond to Yellow Square to Cyan Circle is a "medium melee attack)
- Finally use all 4 shapes for the most powerful attacks! (Remember, don't use the same one twice)


- Enemies are weak to the colours on their skins
- Example 1: GREEN & BLUE spider is weak to "Green Triangle / Ranged" attacks done with a "Major / Left Click" spell
- Example 2: MAGENTA & RED dog is weak to "Magenta Diamond / Melee" attacks done with a "Minor / Right Click" spell!

entries.description:
Get in charge of a planet converting company and make one a habitable place!
You start with nothing, just empty planet.


Your goal is to reach oxygen level of 21% and temperature 291 K.

Trees are producing oxygen and are growing in the sunlight.
When Trees are burning, they rise temperature.
Use asteroids to burn trees!

There are 3 kinds of trees: 

Bush - Produces little oxygen and temperature but is cheap

Pine - Produces little oxygen but when burns, rises temperature a lot!

Oak  - Produces a lot of oxygen, but little temperature when burns.


Controls:

WSAD - move camera

QE - zoom in/out

LSHIFT - speed up camera

MOUSE - use mouse to select and plant trees and launch an asteroid!

I made it alone in one day using free assets, please rate and enjoy guys!

entries.title: Adventure Bag
entries.description:
# Ludum Dare 45

This year I had some initial trouble with the theme, but thanks to a [post](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/45/dog-of-war/steal-my-idea) from @pandademic42, I found something good!

Unfortunately my team-mate @peter1987 was not able to participate this time.

I have removed myself from the audio category as my only sound was music courtesy of [pytchie](https://github.com/jeremycryan/pytchie).

# Game

![gameplay.gif](///raw/cb3/31/z/26fcc.gif)

Welcome to the wonderful world of adventuring, except you're not the one having the adventures!

You play as a trusty backpack to a wanderlust-filled adventurer.

Rearrange items in your pack to make sure he gets the right tool for the job.

# MINIMAL INSTRUCTIONS REQUIRED TO PLAY

## Download / Setup Instructions
- No-Install: Download > Direct Download in top right, extract, and run .exe
- Install: Download >  Direct Download in top right, install

### NOTE: There is a tutorial in the game as well, but what you'll find below is much more in-depth

## Controls
- Click and drag to move items
- Release Left mouse to drop
- Q and E to rotate items
- Click on the speaker icon to mute the music

## Quick Notes:
- Items in queue disappear at the start of each new event
- You cannot move items that are directly below other items
- On the adventure track, Exclamation point means Combat event, Compass means Location event, and Snake means Wilderness Event
- An item will always be pulled from the highlighted column

# Read below for more info on how exactly the game works

## Further Information
- The adventurer goes through events throughout his journey, halfway to each event a column will be highlighted in the grid, this is the column from which he will pull the topmost item from once the event occurs.
- You have to provide the adventurer the best possible item in the scenario to get a good result
- You can kind of guess what you may need based off of the hints in the bottom left, and the icons on the adventurers timeline.
- After an item is taken by the adventurer, the progress bar will fill up at the top, once that fills up, you get a result of how the event went based on your item. You can the result either depicted to the right of the progress bar with an image, or in text form on the left side of the screen in the message area.
- After the event resolves, you might get items dropped into your queue on the right based on how the event resolved. Make sure to drag these items into your bag quick, as the queue is cleared once the adventurer reaches the next event

## Tips and Tricks (Spoilers):
- For Combat, swords and sticks are useful
- For Location, key is useful
- For Wilderness, swords, sticks, bear hide, and meat are useful


## What's unfinished:
- HTML5 version
- Proper game over/complete state
- Better grid texture for the backpack
- Fix tutorial errors ( Telling you to refresh the page to replay, but since it's not HTML5, you'll have to exit and restart the game, sorry!)
- Needs more Content

entries.title: Homeless Business
entries.description:
Homeless Business is a game where you embody a homeless man working with a Punk Gang to clean up Chaos City. Run away from the police, they will try to stop you !!

Use your shopping cart to bring junk to the landfill and get your pay ! Hide from policemen, they will try to steal your money. Try to get as much as you can before the time runs out.

Our team is made of 4 French game design students who wanted to have a little bit of fun. We wanted something a bit whacky and physics based, especially with the shopping cart controller, the trash items and the random AI.
With more time we would have loved to polish more and add some more sound/feedbacks. The objective of the game changed during production and in the end we put the timer, not original but encourages the player to rush to gather trash.
The map is fairly big and well set up but we did you 3rd party assets, so no Graphics category for us. :(

We had a lot of fun anyways and thanks for playing, see you at the next Jam !
Special thanks for Alexis, our friend and inspiration <3

entries.title: SectClicker
entries.description:
So you are bored in your couch and you have a brilliant idea, let's create a sect!

Manager your own sect with a few clicks. And take care of the taxes, the police is watching you!

![SectClicker2.PNG](///raw/829/2/z/27f50.png)

![SectClicker1.PNG](///raw/829/2/z/27f5f.png)

**How to play:**

entries.title: Zambies!
entries.description:
You wake up unconscious in the middle of the street, in a town you've never seen before. With only the clothes on your back. Everything is destroyed and there isn't anyone to be found. As night approaches you find a flashlight in a nearby building when you hear low rumbling of creatures. Turning the corner you see a zombie! The zombie apocalypse is upon us! Before you're seen you hide as night sets in. 

A radio nearby is on and you hear there's help coming in 3 days! Survive for 3 days, scavenge for food, weapons, and ammo in the wreckage and survive the apocalypse!

# Controls:

Keyboard:
WASD: Move
Mouse: Aim
F: Pickup Items
Mouse Wheel: Change Hotbar Item

Gamepad:
Left Analog Stick: Move
Right Analog Stick: Aim
X/Square: Pickup Items
Right/Left Shoulder: Change Hotbar Item

![2.png](///raw/86a/1/z/2895e.png)
![3.png](///raw/86a/1/z/27f7f.png)
![4.png](///raw/86a/1/z/28961.png)

P.S. There's a secret item on the map that can spawn in one of 3 random locations at the far reaches of the map! 2 locations are hidden in the rubble one is in a lonely place. Good luck finding them!

## Post jam bug fixes:
### Oct 7
- UI Textures no longer pink
- Mouse controls on WebGL no longer have a backwards Y Axis
- Ammo now spawns properly
- Guns no longer fail to add ammo on pickup
- Player no longer gets stuck in walls when pushed by zombies

entries.title: Summoning Soup

You'd always dreamed of being a real cultist like all the adults, but you were too young to learn the anceint magic of the village, that was until the village was crushed under a giant soup cauldron, armed with a newly gained spell book and magical healing and empowering coffee you must eliminate the warden of the soup ingredients to apease the demon responcible for destroying your village.
Controls-
Move with WASD, Aim with the mouse, Hold to charge and release to fire a spell.

![GIF58.gif](///raw/42d/z/29663.gif)
## Controls:
**Press U to open the upgrades menu when you are on the ground.**  
Hold the mouse to charge the jump.

While in air hold the mouse to activate your rocket boots.  

## Notes:
**Jam?**: Well originally I targeted the compo but ran out of time to polish the game. I really wanted to get the game to a playable state regardless, so I decided to finish it at least for the jam.

entries.title: Bruno's Bootstraps
entries.description:
# The DeepLore

The year is 2006. You are Bruno, a cobbler in Argentina. TOMS shoes has capitalized on Argentinian poverty in order to market their cheap shoes to privileged Portland college students who want to feel morally righteous without changing their consumption habits. As a result, the local market for footwear in Argentina has been flooded with donated TOMS, completely capsizing the Argentinian shoe industry. Your business collapses and your entire inventory is repossessed. They took everything from you - but there's still hope. You've still got your shoemaking expertise. You have only one goal now: pull yourself up by the bootstraps and into the middle class.

# Instructions

This is a WarioWare-esque rhythm game. Please turn your sound on. Push either the left or right arrow keys to the beat. Think of it as counting to three, where you push the key on beat three. If you miss a beat, you lose! Can you make it all the way to the moon?

![1.png](///raw/817/z/26e7e.png)

entries.title: Nothin' To Muffin
entries.description:
![Screenshot (5).png](///raw/04c/72/z/26f8d.png)

-Don't you just hate it when you want to bake something but there is nothing in your fridge, and the store closes in 2 minutes? This game is about just that-

-Play as a chef who has to take the dangerous road to the grocery store in order to bake something-

![Screenshot (1).png](///raw/04c/72/z/26f8e.png)



**Our first Ludum Dare Experience**

This was the first game jam we entered as a team, and most of us had almost no experience with unity or game making before. We had a lot of fun and we are all very happy with what we have accomplished, though we had some difficulties along the road. 


**Things that could have gone smoother**

As mentioned before, we were very new to unity, we hadn't even tried the unity collab feature until just before the jam started. This lead to some tricky situations where merging conflicted and some progress was lost here and there, but we managed to restore everything to the state it was before the merge. We should have taken some more time before the jam to figure out how the unity collab feature worked. 

A few bugs were spotted along the way, some easier to fix than other, for example; dropping an item from the hotbar sometimes only removed the sprite but the slot was still occupied, this was a big problem as it happened quite frequently but in the end, we got it to work nicely! 

Getting animations to work properly has been a major difficulty, and we're still not quite satisfied with how some of them are looking, but that doesn't really impact gameplay too much.

We never felt like we wouldn't have enough time to complete the game, until the end of day 2(the last day we could work on the game together). We realised that there were a lot of features left to implement before we could publish the game, so we were quite stressed in the end of day 2 but we did manage to fix everything.


**Things we are proud of**

The game is fully playable and most of the planned features have been implemented. We are very pleased with the look of the game, even if some animations are a bit weird. We added particles and sound effects to make the world feel more alive, though there could definitely be more. 

We are very proud of what we have done in such a short space of time, we had a fully playable game by the end of day 2, and on day 3 we did some final polishing and bug fixing. 


**More about the game**

Nothin' To Muffin is a fast paced, time based game consisting of 2 main stages, the _road_ and the _store_. The objective of the game is to make it to the store while collecting recipes on the way. _Watch out for any dangers on the way which may cost you valuable time!_ 

After getting to the store, you will see all of the recipes you have collected, take a good look at them and try to remember what ingredients are required to bake those items. Then use the time you had left from the first stage to complete as many recipes as possible, you get more points for more advanced recipes and you lose points for items which aren't baking related. You have very limited inventory space so make sure to only grab what you need. At the end of the run, you get a score based on the recipes you completed, the amount of extra baking ingredients you had in your inventory(some items give negative points, watch out for those) and finally a time bonus multiplier. The game will automatically reset and a new run will will start. 

-We managed to get a total score of about 2850, can you do better?

entries.title: WHILE (TRUE) { JAM(); }
entries.description:
A Ludum Dare Game Jam Simulator created for the LD-45 Game Jam ("Start With Nothing!")!

Dive into the seat of a game jam developer flying solo on another jam hoping that all of the modules can be completed (at least to some degree) before the ludum dare timer runs down!

MODULES:
- **CODE**     (GAME_CODE.CS)
- **ARTWORK**  (ARTWORK.PSD)
- **MUSIC**    (MUSIC.MP3)

FEATURES:(some working, some not)
- **Manage Energy Levels** (if you let yourself crash you lose 8hrs of precious time)
- **Eat Pizza** (2x slices available per day of the jam)
- **Drink Coffee** (3x cups available per day)
- **Sleep** (Re-Charge your energy levels - more effective than snacking but you lose time)
- **Mini Games** that hopefully recreate the 'gist' of working on the various areas of a game (CODE, ARTWORK, MUSIC) in puzzle form)

I hope you have the time to check it out, its not a long game and a lot of the features aren't yet finished but i had a blast working on it, so that's what counts!

**WebGL(HTML5) version now active!**

Thanks

Reutemeteut. A Super Meat Boy-like platformer, for the web. I focussed on writing a game in a total new engine, perfectly in line with the theme 'Start from nothing', I guess... Made using Typescript, React and Matter-js. I had way more plans for the game, but 72h only got me this far. Have fun!

72 hours went by fast, hence the crappy graphics, but I'd like you to focus on the flow / feel. Any questions / suggestions? Let me know!

Game takes about 10 minutes to finish. Make sure to use your Ludum Dare username!

Play here: https://reutemeteut.dries.io

Follow me on twitter: https://twitter.com/croewens

entries.title: Stop at Nothing
entries.description:
![unslide_000.png](///raw/e09/z/27846.png)

## Instructions

Arrow keys: Select direction, Move cursor  
Z: Commit move, Next level  
X: Select marker, Cancel move, Undo  

Stop at Nothing is a block-sliding puzzle game. Each level starts with a block on each start point, and ends with nothing. Move the blocks to the goal tiles to remove them.

Stop at Nothing is a block-unsliding puzzle game. Each anti-level starts with nothing, and ends with a block on each start point. Unmove the blocks from the goal tiles to unremove them.

Try to beat all 31 levels!

## Miscellaneous

Whenever you complete an anti-level, try undoing to see how it looks going forwards.

This game is very confusing! It doesn't help that PICO-8 only has six buttons, so I had to give each button multiple functions. I spent a lot of time to make sure all of the animations looked good, which I think actually helps with understanding the game's logic. Despite the innate challenges with the premise of the game, I think I did a fairly good  job of making it understandable. I think I might extend this later to add some more mechanics, especially those that reverse the flow of time partway through the level.

There is a slightly hidden level select. Press enter to access it from the PICO-8 pause menu.

entries.title: Sandbox CTF
entries.description:
**Important: When the game freezes after you click Play it is generating a world. It should resume after 10-20 (a bit more in the web version) seconds. I would recommend being careful (and not playing the web version especially) if you have a slow computer.**
![Screenshot](///raw/1ca/72/z/28211.png)
Sandbox CTF is a game where you attempt to steal a red flag and bring it back to your base, in a sandbox world. Or, if you prefer, don't craft a sword and no enemies will ever spawn.

Controls:
- WASD to move
- Left click to destroy things
- Right click to place things and open chests
- E to open your inventory
- Scroll crafting recipes to choose one and click to make it
- Walls can be destroyed with a sledgehammer
- Other blocks can be destroyed faster with different tools
- To obtain a red flag, kill one of the grey enemies in the brick castle on the right side of the world
- If you want to play without any enemies, simply never craft a sword!

This game is ... a bit buggy but I had a lot of fun making it.

The Windows version works significantly better than the web version on my computer. I didn't spend a whole lot of time trying to make the tilemap work quickly. Play either version at your leisure.

Note that I didn't opt out of humor because the website will only give you partial credit for rating my game if I opt out of any category. Feel free to not rate, but that does damage your 'balance'.

Post-compo changes:
- Added AZERTY support
- Reduced dirt digging volume
- Fixed bug regarding enemy spawn limit that causes Godot crash

entries.title: The Auction House
entries.description:
Welcome to the Auction House game ,
you play the role of a mmorpg charcter that got 
kicked from his job after losing everything while trying to become rich using shurtcuts
but wait!! its not over yet !?
you get offered a loan by three different banks each one has its own Pros and Cons,
after that you have to use your intelligence and tactful brain to regain your wealth.
Guid:
 in this game you start with 0 money and you get the choice of asking a loan
from 3 different banks each bank have its own benefits and downsides,
after that you can bid on different items and if you win you can sell them again with a profit 
if you pick the right time, but becareful some items might be fake.
and you will have to pay your loan back slowly and if you dont have 
enough money to pay when its time you lose the game and have to start from 0 again.![Capture2.JPG](///raw/e69/72/z/27f66.jpg)
![Capture1.JPG](///raw/e69/72/z/27e84.jpg)![Capture4.JPG](///raw/e69/72/z/27e8d.jpg)![Capture3.JPG](///raw/e69/72/z/27f68.jpg)![ldm3.JPG](///raw/e69/72/z/29302.jpg)![ldm.JPG](///raw/e69/72/z/29303.jpg)

tips:

bank give you  amount of money to start and take % of that every counted rounds choose carefully 
bid is always 10% of the current bidding 

when listing items more time = high sell chance and high listing fee

if the time is up and you have item listed and no one bid on it, it will return to your inventory and item  sell chance will decrease

Note: Download the game if you feel UI and text is small

entries.title: Venus Ascending
entries.description:
Venus Ascending
---------------

![Screenshot from 2019-10-07 19-40-24.png](///raw/bda/72/z/274f2.png)
![Screenshot from 2019-10-07 19-40-44.png](///raw/bda/72/z/2754d.png)

![Screenshot from 2019-10-07 19-41-02.png](///raw/bda/72/z/274fb.png)

Help a young plant grow from nothing and achieve its full potential. Your keyboard (alphabet keys) control the mouths of a hungry young venus flytrap. Tower Defence / Typing Game mashup done in HTML5/JS

I interpreted the theme "start with nothing" as kind of like a "rags to riches" story, so I went with something with the potential for growth (a plant). 

Controls
---------

- a-z keys on your keyboard to type words 

Tips
----

- Try to catch multiple enemies in one of your mouths at once.

- You don't have to type all of a word at once! Typing all of it and then waiting for the right moment to press the final letter is a good strategy. 

- There are multiple levels.

Known Issues
------------

- Because I'm an idiot, the soundtrack is >5MiB big even though it's a tiny drum loop... if it doesn't play or the page takes ages to load, I'm sorry!


Misc Thoughts
-------------

This was fun! It was my first Ludum Dare.


Tools used: PIXI.js for rendering, howler.js for sound. Gimp for sprites, JFXR / chirp composer for such sound effects as there are.  

v1: commit hash d82c559 on `gh-pages` branch

​Play as a nun who must purge the basement of evils.  Outnumbered, and out of ammo, can you make it through the hordes of enemies?  Made with the theme "Start with Nothing" for Ludum Dare 45, thus in this game you start with no ammo, forcing you to use your gun as a melee weapon.

CONTROLS:

- WASD to move

- Mouse for direction

- Right click to aim

- Left click to melee attack 

- Left + Right click to fire (if you have any bullets)

- **E to throw your gun (stuns enemies)**

- **Space to dodge roll**


NOTE: Elite enemies must be stunned before they will take damage.

entries.title: Polychromatic Escape
entries.description:
***Polychromatic Escape*** is 'find all keys to escape' mini-metroidvania in full-3D (he-he:) with gravity-shifting and color-mixing shooting mechanics.

---  

**UPDATE** : improved character movement and collision handling, now you don't stuck in the wall (so often); also running/jumping tweaked to be more comfortable. And now there's a proper ending. See "post-jam" version.  
  
  
---  
You are trapped on cube floating in space.

![ld-world-16x9.png](///raw/675/8/z/28e4b.png)

Each cube face has its own gravity vector:

![ld-cube-world-4Mb.gif](///raw/675/8/z/28e0b.gif)

The only way to escape is to find all keyword-runes to activate exit-portal.
To do that, you have to find and use three pods. Each pod can shoot with single color; pods can be combined to shoot mixed colors -- to destroy certain objects blocking your way.

![ld-polychromatic-weapon.gif](///raw/675/8/z/28de7.gif)




**Controls (gamepad)** : 
left-stick - move, right-stick - aim, 'cross' button - jump, square/triangle/circle buttons - shoot (hold several buttons to combine colors)

**Controls (mouse+keyboard)** :  
WASD - move, mouse - aim, 'space' key - jump, left/middle/right mouse-buttons - shoot (hold several buttons to combine colors)




Screenshots:

![PolychromaticEscape-screenshot-2-480p.jpg](///raw/675/8/z/28e23.jpg)

![PolychromaticEscape-screenshot-3-480p.jpg](///raw/675/8/z/28e25.jpg)

![PolychromaticEscape-screenshot-4-480p.jpg](///raw/675/8/z/28e26.jpg)

Our Black Hole has one special ability. She knows everything about every living creature, she had eaten. Because of this, she suffers because of conscience and proud of herself at the same time. She is clearing the world from such bad and such good creatures.

entries.title: Addicted

You’re a drug-addicted homeless guy, just looking for his daily dose. The problem: You’re lost in the subway AND you’re being chased by a bunch of hallucinatory horror dolls that are trying to kill you. If that weren’t enough, you start with nothing but a train heading to you. Can you escape the underground maze?

entries.title: A Developer's Adventure
entries.description:
# How it all began...

Most developers started with nothing, usually with the idea of creating something great - and nothing more.

With time opportunities revealed themselves and you learned new skills, new programming languages. If you continue this idea of growth you can see a bright future. You can become a CEO of a giant development firm. Who knows, maybe you will pile riches with ease.

If you don't want to wait for that to happen, this game will lead you through all those experiences in a classical clicker game.

![P1.png](///raw/332/c/z/27a96.png)

# In-depth explanation

In this clicker game a new ressource is added. With upgraded actions you gain SKILL, which has an influence on the probability of success. Just like knowledge determines your success in real life programming. If you don't succeed with an action you will lose half of what you would have gained. This means that you CAN in fact lose. If you do, don't worry, you can start from scratch again. :D

![p2.png](///raw/332/c/z/27a98.png)
![p3.png](///raw/332/c/z/27a9b.png)

Every action (sentential calculus, assembler and c# programming, working with a small dev group and leading a programming company) has four upgrades representing ways of getting better in each task: trial and error, video tutorials, participating at a Ludum Dare and professional support.
In order to successfully "complete" the game we want you to get to 1.000.000!
All of this follows just one big goal: piling money as much as possible!

**PS**: Don't worry if your upgrades don't show the time saving any more. Unfortunately I had no time getting the formatting to the point where there are no visual bugs. That may get changed in a future version :D

entries.title: The Land of Milk and Honey
entries.description:
![Titlescreen.png](///raw/c31/z/2834e.png)

# Description
This is a game about a young person, searching his fortune in the rich land of Agamadeni by becoming a merchant leading his own caravan. 

You have to watch the markets of the different cities and make the best deals. Buy low, sell high.

Each town has it's own production chains which need goods and produce more valuable goods from them, thus generating supply and demand. The other caravans will try to make their own profit and will influence the markets as well.

Get rich and wealthy in this economy simulation. 

# Controls
Controls are explained in-game.  
If you want to mute the music, press M in-game.  
If you want to mute the sounds, press N in-game.

# Technical Details
The game was made in Java using libGDX (http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/). I made all the graphics myself, using PyxelEdit and GIMP. All the sound effects were created with Bfxr. The music was created using Cubase.

# Made by
Skosnowich


# Screenshots
![Screenshot1.png](///raw/c31/z/28477.png)

![Screenshot2.png](///raw/c31/z/28478.png)

# Downloads

**Java 11 needed to play. Start by executing "java -jar ./The_Land_of_Milk_and_Honey_1.0.0.jar" in the directory with the jar-file.**

entries.title: Lucifer's Rise
entries.description:
![title.png](///raw/63e/82/z/27da1.png)

## Here comes our cute story...

Cute angel Lucifer lost a battle and accidentally fall from the heaven, and her Halo shattered!

She needs to get earn 1000 coins for a new Halo, by doing businesses between shops! 

But her old hPhone does not even support contactless payment, she is completely on her own now!

Help starting Lucifer's business while she has nothing with her! She needs to show the instincs as a true business man!

Caution! Lucifer is now now powerless, those animals can steal her money! 

## Platformer without kill

The angel believes that violence is not the solution to everything (especially after she lost her power). Try to avoid all the animals that will steal your coin!

![10frame_chopped_smaller.gif](///raw/63e/82/z/2902c.gif)

![First.png](///raw/63e/82/z/27da7.png)

![sea.png](///raw/63e/82/z/27daa.png)

## Trade to win

Buy goods at a low price, and sell it higher at somewhere else! 

![store.png](///raw/63e/82/z/27dbd.png)

## Lots of original arts

Thanks to our team member @RabiChora for facinating art works and @Sevidax for amazing BGM! (The one for the open scene and the one for the underwater world)

![begining.png](///raw/63e/82/z/28434.png)

## I don't want to spoil the end

You can never believe what will happen in the end! 

~~(If you just can't wait, GOD can secretly put 100 coins to Lucifer's pocket when you press both left and right ctrl then z, remember to collect a coin so Lucifer can realize what happend)~~

## Frequently asked questions (sorry should add some hints inside the game)

+ The intro scene can be skipped by pressing the escape button
+ To exit the shop you can press the escape button

## After competition updates

**There are some known issues for the WebGL version, including the strange screen width and screaming sound effect when you collect a coin. We are investigating them now. We suggest to play the Windows version for the best experience.😢**

### Bug fix 1.1 

+ Add hint inside the store for exit. (hit Escape)

+ Fix buggy platform in the sky scene.

+ Modify the character control to make it easier. Add small jump and big jump.

+ Loss 10% of your coin when you run into an enemy.

+ Some Platforms move now.

### Bug fix 1.2

+ Fix the problem of sticking to the edge of the platform.

+ Fix the random superjump.

+ Allows to skip the introduction scene with both ESC and ENTER.

+ Changed the layer of the coin so it won't be flashing.

+ Remove the rabbit that hard to be noticed.

+ Player moves together with the moving platform.

entries.title: Succulentia
entries.description:
![Succulentia-final-title.png](///raw/b83/92/z/2863a.png)
![Succulentia-gameplay.png](///raw/b83/92/z/2869b.png)

Start with nothing but an empty pot in your dry garden. Plant, water, and grow healthy succulent plants while clicking away at pesky bugs that are trying to invade your garden and damage your precious plants.

### Controls

This game is played entirely with the mouse.

* Use the **Target** tool to squash incoming insects with **a single click**. Some bugs are tough and might need more than one!

* Use the **Shovel** tool to add soil to an empty pot with **a single click**. After that....

* Use the **Watering** tool! **Click and hold** on a pot filled with soil to hydrate it. After a bit, you'll see a beautiful succulent in its place! (You don't need to water them at this point.)


### BUGS SQUASHED POST-LD:
* Fixed issue where dead succ cannot be regrown
* Added forgotten fonts
* Fixed absurd spawn rates
* Fixed succulent hydration
* Fixed cursor collision
* Fixed pot
* Fixed wrong enemy instances being spawned
* Fixed bug spawning

entries.title: Force of Nature
entries.description:
We completely misjudged the amount of time making this game was gonna take. We used an engine we never used before (Phaser 3) and didn't think out the features at the start. So with only a few hours to go the project looked more like a simulation instead of a game. In the last few hours, we hastily tried to put as many “Gameplay features” into it as possible. So a little sad about the fact that we haven't had any time to playtest, balance and polish, but still proud of the effort! We present you Force of nature. Time to wipe out humanity, like humanity wiped you out!

# Controls
* Use the arrow keys to scroll the viewed area
* Drag cards onto overgrown tiles to build special plants
* Click on the loudspeaker to turn of music


# Mechanics

You wipe out the humans by overgrowing sector by sector. The more a sector is overgrown the fewer humans it can support. To help you do this you have three plants that cost different amounts of "Growth Power", displayed top left, that you earn by taking over tiles.

* Cross Block Plant (free): Allows plant growth to spread to neighbouring sectors
* Slowdown Plant (1O GP): Slows down the movement of all humans in this sector. This effect stacks.
* Nature Fort (20 GP): A very sturdy tree that's not easily felled. Ideal to keep humans busy or protect your Slowdown's.

Once your spread reaches the threshold in the panic bar on the right the remaining humans will panic and start crossing sector boundaries. There are multiple ways to deal with this wave, either build large defences, or try to quickly expand in the now quieter territories to starve the humans.

entries.title: til0x
entries.description:
til0x is simple tile-based game. You start with nothing, at first you don't even have your own character. Grab a tile and stay away from bombs.

![til0x_gif.gif](///raw/64c/72/z/29638.gif)

## Controls
- Arrow Keys: Move tile.
- Spacebar: Pause/Unpause game.
- P: Use piggy bank.
- S: Use speed up

## Rules
- at start of game, move aim towards to tile which you want to grab.
- number in the center of the tile is move count.
- after every move, move count reduce.
- when move count is 0, you can't move.
- increase to move count, grab tile which same colored with your tile.
- if you grab different colored tile move count reduced.
- when a tile's move count is 0, it turns out bomb.
- piggy bank tile gave you extra move counts to use later.
- turtle tile reduces game speed.
- with speed up button you can gain extra move count and score but game speed increase too.

## Tools
- Engine: Godot Engine
- Sounds: Sfxr
- Textures: Piskel App

```
<Changelog>

v1.2
- Default game speed increased.
- Speed up button added. You can use it with S button.
- New tile added (turtle tile). If you grab this, game speed reduces.
- Some bugs fixed.

v1.1
- Game speed added and game speed increases as game progresses.
- Tutorial upgrated.

v1.0
- First Release!
```

entries.title: Nullified
entries.description:
Nullified
======

[cover](///content/2df/2/z/28436.png)

You are the Antivirus, protecting your system from threats and attacks.

But one day, the most powerful virus you've ever seen strikes, crashing your system and corrupting your data. You manage to escape, but there's only enough bandwidth to save your core program before you lose your connection. Now, you must traverse the network, collect new utilities, recompile yourself, and return to your home server to purge the worm from it once and for all!

How to Play
------------

Controls:

* Move: Arrow keys
* Jump: Space or C
* Boost: Space or C (in air) (requires Booster)
* Slash: Z (requires Melee)
* Shoot: X (requires Ranged)
* Drill: Down+Z (in air) (requires Melee and Charger)
* Quarantine: Down+Z (requires Ranged and Charger)

Utilities:

* Signal Amplifier: Hidden somewhere in the network. Protects against corruption damage.
* Melee: Found in the first server. Enables a sword attack.
* Ranged: Enables a blaster attack.
* Charger: Adds special abilities to the Melee and Ranged weapons.
* Booster: Enables limited flight.
* Health Boost: Increases your maximum health. 8 in all.
* Armor: Reduces damage received.

If you return to your home server through the red hyperlink portal before collecting the Signal Amplifier, the corruption there will cause you to steadily lose health until you retreat.

The yellow "!" blocks can be broken with the Drill. The green circle blocks can be broken with Quarantine.

[ld45-screenshot.png](///raw/2df/2/z/2846d.png)

Having Trouble?
----------------
If you want to speed things along and get a feel for the game without having to go through the exploration process, use this cheat code: While holding Up, type ZCZX.

entries.title: Blossoming Cosmos
entries.description:
In the beginning, the universe was null and void, and then there was you...

Create the universe, one bloom at a time. Use your power to summon forth beautiful blossoms and fill the vast emptiness with color. Be warned that your power is limited: you may not plant two blooms too close to each other, nor can you plant any but your first in the void itself. Your power builds over time, and planting blossoms consumes that power, so plant wisely!

Beware: fiery sparks of all-consuming entropy will spawn from the void and attempt to tear through your precious blossoms. Even without their interference, your blossoms do not last forever: they will wither and die eventually. Plant anew, and fill the universe with beauty!

Mouse controls supported. Left click to plant flowers.

**UPDATED 10/17/2019:** The Post-Jam version is now available! This version includes several visual, audio, and quality-of-life improvements: the power bar charges faster, the SFX have all been replaced to better fit the mood of the game, and there are now better indicators for when you can't place flowers (as well as an indicator for when you can). A title splash with basic instructions has also been added.

Please rate the game based on the original Jam version!

- WASD to move
- Left click to shoot
- R to reload

#### Controls - VR

- Right controller trigger to shoot.
- Point your hand down to reload


#### Disclaimers

- The PC and WebGL builds were made post-deadline, but the gameplay is as similar as possible from the Quest game.
- We made all the assets but the door, which comes from the asset store.
- Our plan was to make the player start with nothing, make him grab the crossbow, and then heavily rely on pickups to become powerful enough to actually put up a fight. But we didn't have time to implement it, and because of that the game doesn't fit the theme at all. Sorry about that.

entries.title: Lost Somewhere
entries.description:
## You start with seeing nothing. You need to dive down to find the iconic characters that are lost somewhere, but where?

**How to play:** Move camera with WASD and zoom in/out by SPACE. 

**Goal:** Find all of 4 iconic characters and photograph them to complete the game.

We have developed this small hidden object game within ~48 hours by eating lots of munchies and slacking most of the time. Hope you enjoy it as much as we did while creating it!

**Dev:** Burak Kurkcu / [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_burakkurkcu)


**Art:** Elif Tavkul / [Behance](https://www.behance.net/eliftavkul) / [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/erifharvur/)

entries.title: Goblin Keeper
entries.description:
​This is Goblin Keeper​. A civilisation building adventure where you are one of the last goblins in the world with nothing left thanks to the nasty king Clement. Fight for survival and build a goblin empire to last the ages.

The Sprig dynamite team

entries.title: Rail shooter prototype
entries.description:
It's our entry for LDJam45. We've come across many technical issues, which delayed us and prevented us from making a proper level design. Or even a proper complete level (we had planned to create 2 of them). Or even the scenario (you won't see a real implementation of the theme).

However, it was a fun Ludum Dare, and we'll probably make a more complete version soon!

The game was created with Godot engine 3.1.

![screenshot_LD45.png](///raw/477/91/z/27949.png)

Tools used :

- Godot Engine
- Blender
- Gimp
- Nanoloop Mono
- Audacity

We hope you'll enjoy the journey in our demo game!

You'll find in the downloads the complete musical track of the level, because you won't be able to hear it in the game.

entries.title: Spooktober Survival
entries.description:
It's Spooktober ! You're a lost soul in a small spooky city. Hurry up to find a body before the bad pumkins come to hurt you. Survive as long as possible, and kill as much ennemies as possible.

![Horde.png](///raw/d4b/32/z/261eb.png)

#### Controls

WASD / Arrow keys : Move

Left Click : Attack

Escape : Pause

PS : Hey ! A message from me, Sir Galloy de Fierpâté : We want to upgrade our game and have a lots of ideas. But what do you want first ? What is missing and is the most important ? Leave a comment to tell us about it !
What we want to add : More ennemies paterns, A game over screen, The stats of the player, details on the map, details on the entity textures (like the player), etc.

entries.title: Trueque
entries.description:
You are a beggar who has nothing. But you have always been good at bartering. You look in the trash to see what you find...

With what you find you will have to keep exchanging it and going up in value. You have two possible paths, try to get a Nintendo Switch console from a broken PS4 controller, or get a house from a simple match. But, beware! Some items are scams which are not what they seem like. And some others are bargains which will help you get to your goal faster.

The controls are as follows:
- Swipe Left: Reject deal.
- Swipe Right: Accept deal.
- M: Mute sounds.

Developers:
- Victor Reiner: Programmer and SFX. (https://twitter.com/victor_reiner)
- Shubi_Art: Artist. (https://twitter.com/Shubi_Art)
- Bobemv: Programmer. (https://twitter.com/bobemv)

entries.title: The Little Adventure for Slime
entries.description:
![screen2.png](///raw/8e7/21/z/27163.png)
Hi ! We are a group a friends who like to make games. _Also we're french, please pardon our english._

Mimus at the code and level design on Unity, Nephelias at 3d modeling on Blender, and Lukein at 3d modeling on Blender and some textures and icons on paint. (do not judge too quickly guys!)
We didn't make the sounds, music and the water texture ourselves.

This time around we began slowly, picking up an idea to develop : A sidescroll 3d platformer !

You'll play as a little slime who needs to return to his home. The poor little slime lost slimy parts you'll have to gather on your way to recover some capabilities. Like spliting in two, jump or walljump to name a few.
We recommend to use arrow keys to move, it is way easier.



Programs we used:
- Unity
- Blender
- Paint. I swear it's looking good.
- Audacity just to cut out sounds from source.

Control: (if you got the bonuses to use them)
- Left / Right Arrow: Move to Left or Right
- Up / Down Arrow: Spiked mode to attack enemies
- Space: Jump
- Tab: Split slime
- Ctrl: Join slime (In proximity)
- Mouse Click: Change slime you control
- C: On Ground Transform into Cube, in Air Transform into Anvil
- V: Pancake mode to plane

Sources:
- Water texture: https://www.deviantart.com/berserkitty/art/Seamless-Cartoon-styled-Water-Texture-743787929
- Sounds : https://opengameart.org/content/atmospheric-interaction-sound-pack
- Music : https://opengameart.org/content/pack-of-loopable-game-music
- Slime sound : https://opengameart.org/content/40-cc0-water-splash-slime-sfx!

Patch: (After Deadline)
- Corrected Controls
- Reworked Jump
- Reduced Animation Time
- Simplified The Wall Jump Tower

entries.title: Crypt Hero
entries.description:
This is the world created for you as you where created for it. In the darkness of the void an hummm was heard. With patience you are born in this world, naked barely seeing, walls surrounds you! A door you can distinguish from the limit of your perception.

Outside the wall of your birth place stands a garden filled with trees and a river, you cannot see really well yet. There's a bridge to cross the river, but it's garded by a vile creature, a scrumy green two legged creature. As soon as you approche the creature attacks you, you retaliate and crush the skull of that weakling, blood splatter everywhere, blood, crimson blood, on green grass.

You continue your way to an other building and try to not step in the void arround you.

Once inside you are greeted by a young boy.

¨Welcome, Hero, this world is for you and you are for this world. That that sword and make your way down to the crypt as it is your destiny to go there. But beware, those walls are infested with goblins. At the end of the crypt you'll find the evil that was created for you. Beat him and wait for the world to be released from you into the void once again.¨

--------------------------

Now that I'm done with the story I wasn't able to fit into the game in time:

For this competitions I made a small rogue like. It's the first I ever made and it was the first time I was working with python-tcod. And after 35 hours of intensive coding I present to you Crypt Hero as I was able to finish it for the jam.

**It's full of bugs and not balanced as the hero is practically immortal. It's far from finished but it's playable.**

Don't fall into the void as it'll terminate that world you'll need to summon a new one.

Have fun and explore a little
![explore.png](///raw/92c/22/z/29418.png)

You can press enter while looking to get a small description of what you're seeing.
![Descriptions.png](///raw/92c/22/z/29417.png)

entries.title: Blank Spaces INC.
entries.description:
![ludumpost9.gif](///raw/817/e/z/27581.gif)

**Welcome to Blank Spaces Incorporated, where we take pride in preparing everything blank!** 

From pages, drives and desks to people stares, we make from something – nothing. Our mission is to help all those poor souls get rid of their indispensable items and precious memories. When you are desperate to start anew, Blank Spaces saves the day!

You (and only you) have been carefully selected for our Beginner Learning Assistant (not College) program. Please come in at any time between 3AM and 8AM, when usually nothing happens. Which is how we prefer it. Take that as your first free lesson.



Yours truly,

**Simon Void**

*Senior Manager of Vacancy*

*Note: Black Spaces Incorporated (incorporated in Bareington, U.S.K) is not liable for any damage or harm caused by removing individual’s possession from their life, with or without their prior knowledge. Most notably removing money from their pockets and bank accounts.*





------ **INFO** ------

- Game has no audio.
- Gamepad Required.
- Right Trigger is the big lower button on the back of your gamepad :) Putting a picture in the tutorial next time! 

Tip: Try holding Right Trigger just a bit, instead of all the way.

----- **THANKS** ------

entries.title: Universe Inc.
entries.description:
# Universe Inc.
My first Ludum Try, don't let that temper your critisisms. Unfortunately, I sourced some assets from the UE4 marketplace and some sfx from freesound, so I am not admissible for the compo.

Fairly simple walking game, mostly focussed on presentation. You are a worker at Universe Inc., when things go horribly wrong.

## Controls:
WASD - Move

LMB/e - Interact

Ctrl - Crouch

f - Turn on flashlight (If you have it)

## Total runtime
About 5 minutes if you know the steps

## Hardware

This was developed and tested on

- AMD Ryzen 7 1700X
- Nvidia RTX2070S
- 16GB RAM

## Note

There is no menu system. The only legitimate way to exit the game is by completing it. The only other way to exit is to alt+f4

entries.title: Witches Beware
entries.description:
**STORY**
  
These are dark days, in the land of Ludum. Hunger and disease have laid waste to the brave people who live in the region. The death and destruction is blamed on the free-thinking women, who are accused of witchcraft and banished from society, if not burned at the stakes.

You, Romina, are one of these women. Banished from your hometown, you took to the roads, leaving all your belongings behind. After a long journey, you finally came upon the regions capitol, the city of Dare. A city where no one knows who you are. 

Here at last you can begin to earn the trust of the townsfolk and eventually get your revenge on the city and its King, and take over the land of Ludum. You start with nothing however, so it will not be an easy quest.
  
**CONTROLS**

'WASD' or 'Arrow keys' to move.  
'Space' to jump.  
Mouse to navigate dialog.
  
**HOW TO PLAY**

Walk around in the city of Dare, talk to the townsfolk, and find ways to earn their trust. Use your skills as a witch to brew poisons and potions to aid you in your quest for revenge and power.

Screenshot 1                            |  Screenshot 2

entries.title: Medieval City Sim
entries.description:
![Cover.png](///raw/f10/d/z/262ca.png)

Can you find the best possible combinations of buildings and to score the best results?

MCS is a minimalistic game made under 72h for LudumDare 45. Theme: Start with nothing.

The rules are simple. You have 42 turns (build choices) after which the game will score the board and will show you the score. Post your results in the comments below! Let's find the best combination of buildings!

How to play:

- Select a building from the list of available buildings
- Read the description of every building and how it will score at the end
- "A" means adjacent (orthogonal + diagonals), "R/C" means Row/Column bonuses apllied to the buildings in the row/column. 
- Place it on the dirt spaces in the castle
- You can click on "SCORE CITY" button to force score evaluation and to reset the board

Credits:

- Font - Boxy Bold - William.Thompsonj - Collaborators: Clint Bellanger, cemkalyoncu, usr_share - https://opengameart.org/content/boxy-bold-truetype-font
- Kenney Assets - https://www.kenney.nl/assets/bit-pack

entries.title: Witchcraft: the Collecting
entries.description:
![logo.png](///raw/33c/62/z/277b7.png)

✨Welcome to the world of magic and wizardry! What? Never heard about the collecting card game Witchcraft: the collecting? Here is your first card! And yes, it’s called “start with nothing”, but it’s better than nothing, ha-ha!✨ 

But now you don’t need to make hard decisions of which card to play - your deck fight by itself! Just sit back, slightly relax and have a cup of hot tea. 

Open boosters, collect all 150 cards and make it to the top-level tournaments like a wizard, but without any scars or changing robe’s color!🧙‍♂️ 

🎮**GAME RULES** 

1. Click on the club on the map to start a challenge.

2. While challenging click on the animated fluents to increase your chance to win cards after the challenge.

3. Open boosters to view new cards.

4. Sell cards from your inventory to increase player's level.

5. Unlock new clubs by increasing player's level.

6. Be proud of yourself and reach the top-level tournament.


![booster_animation.gif](///raw/33c/62/z/278f5.gif)

Full walkthrough:

entries.title: Solar System Clicker - Browser game
entries.description:
![Capture.PNG](///raw/5d2/8/z/28697.png)

Has only been tested with Chrome!

Click to add matter and watch what happens.  When you have collected enough matter it will come together to form planets.  When you have formed enough planets, your star will suck them all in and upgrade.  Upgraded stars will support more planets.

I worked on this with my two kids, ages eight and seven, who helped with brainstorming and did all of the art.

Tip: the more matter that goes into a planet the bigger it will be.

Next immediate steps would have been to enable zooming in and out, as well as giving the asteroids more erratic orbits.  I would also have liked to add buttons so that you could be more in control of whats happening, like a typical clicker.

The kids were hoping the biggest star would implode into a black hole, and then you could start forming whole galaxies!  Maybe someday haha.

entries.title: Survive in Neon lights
entries.description:
# How to play:

So, you might have opened the game and have no god damn idea what to do. Naturally, you clicked "Controls" button like a weakling you are. I'm giving you the *last chance* to get the rest of your dignity and to go play the game like a **man**... You still there? Well, it's OK now, because I'm here. The whole thing is to build and defend your base from enemies. Simple stuff right? Let's start with the buildings available to you.

You got your generator *(I GOOOOT THE POOOWER)*. It's the heart of your base that generates electric impulses that move it all to life. An impulse will spread out and power all of your buildings, making them do their designed function and generally your base will appear to be more ***fancy*** than it actually is.

Mine *$Money Maker$* with each impulse will generate a small amount of currency. You need currency to set up new buildings. Cost of 'Mine' will increase depending on the amount of Mines you already posses. You can upgrade it to get more money per impulse.

**Turret** is a basic defensive structure, that shoots lasers. With each upgrade, turret's damage and range is increased, making it more deadly.

**Wall** is like, I uhhh... what else you want me to explain? IT'S A FUCKING WALL. Isn't it? Ok, it regenerates some of its hitpoints with each impulse. Walls' HP and HP-reg is increased with each upgrade.

There is also a limit to the amount of buildings you can set up. Sucks major ass, so we are giving you **Supply Depo** to increase number of structures you can have, so that's nice.

And your enemies: energy thirsty spiders that want to get to your generator. **KILL THEM WITH CRUELTY.** If not, you will die and dying isn't exactly fun or interactive gameplay.

That's basically it. Go and play the game now.

# Credits:
## Programming:
- Grzegorz Koperwas
- Eryk Kściuczyk
- Mikołaj Czarnecki
- Michał Danikiewicz
- Kamil Kowalski
- Andrzej Kominek

## Art:
- Maja Więzik
- Maja Oszczypała

## Music:

- Paweł Mendzik
- Marcin Grabysz

entries.title: More Decor
entries.description:
This was a 2-person project for the Ludum Dare 45 Jam - Theme: Start with nothing.

This is a puzzle game where you start with an empty room and you place furniture to earn points and unlock more furniture.

You earn 1 point for each piece of furniture that is placed on the left grid. The points for that furniture piece are multiplied by 1 extra point for each side that is adjacent to a matching colour. If you place furniture on the side with the stripes then you are deducted 1 point.

Additional furniture will be unlocked based on the number of points you have collected.

There is no explicit end state but the goal is to unlock all of the furniture.


Controls:
- Mouse
- Click on a grid square on the right to select a piece of furniture. You can only select unlocked furniture
- With furniture selected, click on a grid square on the left to place the selected furniture.
- With furniture selected, click the rotate button at the top of the screen to rotate the selected furniture.
- Esc: exit


Tools:
- Unity 3D
- Blender
- Krita
- Aseprite

![screenshot_2.png](///raw/4c2/32/z/28236.png)

entries.title: A Phony Incarnation
entries.description:
**A Phony Incarnation** is a short **narrative game** where you start even without a body.

*Everything starts when your drifting consciousness is awaken by the feeling of an imminent threat. Your only way of contacting the material plane is through an old cellphone. Embark a military spaceship and try to unravel the plans of the forces plotting against you !*

![sc1.png](///raw/ccf/21/z/2852e.png)

![sc2.png](///raw/ccf/21/z/28534.png)

![sc3.png](///raw/ccf/21/z/28538.png)

![sc4.png](///raw/ccf/21/z/28540.png)

**Controls :**
- Use the **mouse left click** to browse through the dialogues
- When the phone is visible, use **space bar** to ring it
- When prompted, use the **arrow keys** to move the camera and the **mouse left click** to select object.

Overall, the game is shorter than I would have liked, but cutting stuff down is what game jams are for. Thanks for playing !

entries.title: Osage
entries.description:
After years of dust storms and extreme drought conditions, the Great Mus Plains that once fed all mice in the kingdom of Muridae are now a barren wasteland with one final hope…
Osage, the last harvest mouse in the plains, is tasked with finding the restorative Cybele's Tears that will save the Great Mus Plains. Find all of the Cybele's Tears and collect seeds along the way to save the mice of Muridae!

THE INSOMNIACS:
We are a group of young professionals in Oklahoma City with diverse skill sets, including Computer Engineering, Software Development, Graphic Design, and Digital Marketing. While this is the Insomniacs third Ludum Dare, this is our first one since adding two new members to the team and our best game yet! 

We used aspects of Oklahoma and its history throughout the game with references to the Dust Bowl, native wildlife, and state counties. As a state that has persevered through natural disasters and economic downturns, we thought it was only right to pay tribute to the Okie spirit through Osage.

  
![OSAGE1920x1080.png](///raw/cb4/f1/z/285b4.png)

entries.title: Full Moon
entries.description:
![Banner-Resize.png](///raw/0b1/2/z/26b91.png)


**An elderly MAX SOLDIER recounts how he met his loving wife, Delores.**

 


*"Full Moon is a timeless story for the ages." - GameInformer*

*"This is simply the best game I have ever played." - IGN*

*"I'll be completely honest, I shed a tear at the end." - PCGamer*

 

---

 

Full Moon is our entry for Ludum Dare #45. You explore the mind of an old soldier of the MAX program as he regales his grandson with the tale of how he met his dear wife.

Like Ludum Dare #44 we played pretty loose with the theme. We could have stuck closer to it, but we all fell in love with the game idea so deeply that we couldn't resist bringing it to life. We hope you enjoy playing as much as we did creating!

 

For the next few weeks, you can find VoDs of the gamejam at:

http://mixer.com/slimabob

http://mixer.com/chambre19

http://mixer.com/divic

http://mixer.com/thegrandpa

 

**THANKS FOR PLAYING OUR GAME!**

*The Team:*
- Alex Houger (Music)
- Collin Lyons (Level Design, Programming, Sound Design)
- Divic (Sound Design, VO- MAX SOLDIER)
- Ryan / Chambre19 (Concept Artist, Environment Design, Screenplay)
- Tony Simmering (3d Artist, Level Design, Screenplay, VO- Grandson)

 

*NOTE: Due to an issue with version control, I'm not able to push the most up-to-date version of the source. I'm trying to figure out how to resolve that issue. In the meantime, the current repo is a snapshot from about 2/3 of the way through development.*

entries.title: Blue Juice Dealer
entries.description:
A few days ago, I was standing under an apple tree and an apple fell on my head. After that, I forgot how to make potions. And potion books are expensive!

On top of that, Grubnag the Warchief will raid the city in 20 minutes and I need to make some cash to get outta here!

This is a game that lets you combine ingredients to make potions. You need to combine three ingredients with at least two of them having matching effects to create a good potion. Which ingredient does what? Who knows! You dont remember!

![screen2.png](///raw/36b/32/z/28248.png)


![screen1.png](///raw/36b/32/z/28254.png)

entries.title: The Ghost Haunter
entries.description:
"Enjoy the Ghost Haunter the scariest game ever. Nothing can't make you feel more like you have nothing then this!"  
"How do you know it?"  
"I know nothing, I have some suspects.... anyway:  
You, with nothing, will arrive at the incredible gate of hell.."  
"Nothing seems special here."  
"...maybe nothing so incredible but, anyway:  
You, with nothing,  will arrive at the gate of hell to find out that your terrible sentence is..."  
"It seems nothing like hell" . 

"I can't do a presentation with you here! I can do nothing!"  

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
CONTROLS:
Directionals arrows + Space bar to scare. Esc to exit.

WE ARE SORRY! ​Game made in quite a hurry so you have to forgive if is a bit rough and we've got only one level complete :( .

entries.title: I want to live
entries.description:
# A game to start in life

## Topic

Once upon a time a young spermatozoid dreamed to be able to run.
The brave spermatozoid start his journey of life to possess a heart and a body.
Our young hera dash into the scrum to retrieve what he missed so much: legs.
But inside the ovary he has to face the bad habits of his future parents. (Male, Female, Non-binary).
This young soldier should defend it self until his evolution has complete and finally start his journey.

![I want to live 5.png](///raw/1a5/91/z/27583.png)


## How to play

The game is composed of two phases.

## First phase - Race

You have to dodge and be the first.

| Symbol   | Action   |
|:-------- | --------:|
| Up       | Run      |
| Left     | Left     |
| Right    | Right    |

![RaceLD.png](///raw/1a5/91/z/275c4.png)

## Second phase - Arena

You have evolve to resists as long as you can.

| Symbol   | Action   |
|:-------- | --------:|
| LMC      | Shot     |
| Mouse    | Aim      |
| Up       | Up       |
| Down     | Down     |
| Left     | Left     |
| Right    | Right    |

![ArenaLD.png](///raw/1a5/91/z/275c8.png)

Note: We censored us a lot during our brainstorming because we saw a political debate behind pro and contra abortion. We support free will.

**Tools**
Unity3D, Visual Studio, TextMeshPro, Audacity, MPC Essentials, Krita

entries.title: I Was Nothing At All
entries.description:
![Game_1920x1080_0.png](///raw/758/6/z/27171.png)

![Game_1920x1080_1.png](///raw/758/6/z/27172.png)

A platformer with minimalistic graphics and 8-bit music. You start with no abilities, then gain them gradually. There is an enemy that bombs you from the sky, you need to defeat it. You can see the game as a metaphor for defeating our problems when we had nothing at the start.

The main idea (escaping from bombard) is the same with my earlier prototype, [Escape From Bombard](https://aslangames.itch.io/bombard-game). I didn't use any old code from Escape From Bombard, though, all game code is written from the start.


**CREDITS:**


Design & Programming: Ahmet Kamil Keleş


Music & SFX: Özgür Kahraman

entries.title: Sprout: Tree Simulator - Evergreen Edition
entries.description:
PLEASE MAKE SURE YOU HAVE JAVA INSTALLED AND UPDATED!!!!!!

This is my first game jam submission ever. I wrote this in java using a game engine that I had previously written for another game. You start out as a seed and have to place roots to absorb water and fertilizer and grow your tree. Spend fertilizer to upgrade your environment!

This was written in java using LWJGL 3, slick util and java native libraries.

How - to - play
You must go underground and construct a root system to collect water and fertilizer. After placing the first root you can build more roots by clicking on the nodes at the end of the roots and spending one fertilizer. Water will feed your tree as it grows and fertilizer is used to buy upgrades.

entries.title: Small Mouse, BIG SHOES!
entries.description:
## Description
*Small Mouse, BIG SHOES!* takes the idea of starting with nothing to a much more personal level. It asks the question, what is nothing and when do you start with it. The story revolves around a man who had his body taken from him by a level 33 Rabbit Warlock. Now our relatable yet quirky protagonist must embark on a quest to recover his body and enact vengeance on the Rabbit who wronged him. He will run into many colorful and distinguished characters along the way; like Stuart Little, who, as he puts it, is the "Best Damn Shoe Collector This Side Of The Mississippi."

## Cool Images
![screencap2.png](///raw/4eb/22/z/28a63.png)

![smallMouseBigShoe.png](///raw/8fe/8/z/289ad.png)

## Controls
### General
* e - interact with people
* esc - brings up the menu
* r - restart
* wasd - move
* space - jump

### Sheep
* c - spin dash

### Human
* v - start grab / stop grab
* hold shift - pull grabbed object


*shoutout to [MowtenDoo](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYFvEPbFbDIVRiODrh1-x4g) for his amazing videos and remixes*

entries.title: Learning the Human
entries.description:
Hi!

Every week our team gathers to create a game in 1 day, (usually in 8 hours but this time we took a bit more). It's always about a theme somehow related to education, and this time we picked the theme "Non-verbal Communication". We decided to join the Ludum Dare late and use "Start With Nothing" as an additional theme! 

In our game you play an alien landing on earth, and you have to communicate with the folks around in order to be friends.

"Learning the Human" is a game about communication, except you will not be using a single word. You'll have to make do with only emoticons! (:

Try it out and give us feedback!

Cheers
![learningTheHuman_4.png](///raw/8b3/a2/z/27be8.png)

entries.title: Drop Defense
entries.description:
In Drop Defense you play as a drone that all the evil minions are trying to kill. You must defend yourself by killing and looting the drops to build better towers to fend off the ever increasing horde that is out to get you.

Use left mouse button to move to a position and/or pick up items/tower boxes
Press "1" to drop items
Press "E" to activate the manufacturing stations (the hatches in the floor)
Hold "alt" to show detailed stats of the items

NOTES/BUGS
It is better to restart the game completely instead of ingame.

changelog 1.1
- adjusted camera clipping
- added bullet decay for improved performance in later stages
- fixed bug where you would pick up an already deployed tower
- fixed bug where negative damage on towers would heal enemies

entries.title: Snake Farmer
entries.description:
The Santa Fe Snake Trainer's Guild is the most prestigious and exclusive snake training league in the country.
Joining is all you've ever wanted.
The only problem is... you don't even have a single snake!

![images (1).jpeg](///raw/336/1/z/27c50.jpg)

Now, high quality snakes are expensive, but you have a plan. By planting tasty crops, you can make the snakes come to you.

Buy seeds from the Market.

Plant crops and wait for them to grow.

Harvest the crops and sell them at the Market, or wait and see if a snake shows up.

Catch that snake!

Enter your snakes into snake shows to try to get the best score of all time.

The snakes are the colored cubes. Walk up and hit space to catch them.

CONTROLS

wasd to move
space to interact

TIPS

You can see your snakes by walking into your front door.
More expensive plants attract rarer snakes.
Different judges like different kinds of snakes.

Updates-
   -Fixed UI bugs
   -Fixed Feedback text not showing
   -Fixed crash on snake view

entries.title: Lost in the Fog
entries.description:
You, once a noble man who had everything, now kidnapped, deprived of anything and left to die in strange foggy forest. Now you have nothing and must find some way to escape this foggy place.

![piece2.gif](///raw/a84/72/z/28b7b.gif)

Dive into the atmospheric world of this game.

- W,A,S,D - Movement
- F - Interact
- R - Use Medkit
- LMB - Attack

This is my first game jam. And as all who participates for the first time I overestimate my possibilities. :smile: 
I am eager to know what you think about it. Leave any kind of feedback, thus will help me make my game better, and probably publish it in the future. So, give it a try and enjoy :slight_smile: 

Credits: 

This game is made for you by Pavlo 'Eifersuuucht' Nemchenko.

entries.title: Jesaouf VI
entries.description:
**A simple shooter.**


"We come from nothing, we are going back to nothing-In the end what have we lost? Nothing!” 




Really poor Gameplay, sorry. I hope you will enjoy the context and the musics





All assets are googled (and propably copyrighted for some).

But the game engine is mine:

The source is split in three parts:

- Ludum45: the game itself
- chaos: a base C++ libray, the core of the engine
- death: another library more dedicated for games

Otherwise i use the following C++ libraries

- OpenGL (4.5)
- Glew
- Glfw
- Irrklang
- Boost with MPL
- STL
- FreeImage
- Glm
- Tinyxml2
- Freetype
- Nlohmann/json

And 

- TiledMap Editor


Sources are publicly given but due to some libraires dependencies, you probably won't be able to compile.
Let me know if you want some informations relative to the code.

![Jesaouf6.jpg](///raw/7d2/1/z/28c95.jpg)


## GAMEPAD CONTROLS:

    Gamepad to displace

    Button A: Fire
    Button B: Dash
    Button Y: Bright side of life

    Start / Select : pause the game

## KEYBOARD CONTROLS:

    Arrows to move

    SPACEBAR: Fire
    CONTROL : Dash
    ALT     : Bright  side of life

    F10 : Toggle Fullscreen

    ESC/P : Pause
    SHIFT+ESC : quit

entries.title: Medium-Sized Field Simulator 2019
entries.description:
Experience the thrill of tending to a medium-sized field. Can you turn your empty field (medium-sized) into a thriving ecosystem? Do battle with invasive weed species through strategic placement of beautiful plants like 'Tree'. 

Tutorial (**reading this is cheating**):
Click on tiles to select, toolbar to perform actions on them (drop or extract water, place plants).
Press end turn when you finish.

Water management is important, parts of the medium-sized field will dry out if they don't have enough water. This looks awful and you will be straight back to managing smaller fields by the end of the year.
Use 'scoop water' to pick up water from sources, use 'water' to distribute around your medium-sized field.

Place plants to get your medium-sized field looking as it should, and to ward off weeds that might appear.
Different plants have different functions, but they must be watered and grown to maturity to perform those functions.

Blue plant: pulls and distributes water to its surroundings

Purply plant: drains water quickly from surroundings, good for depriving weeds of water and killing them. Also good for ruining the surrounding ecosystem.

Tree: defensive plant that can block water drainage when used correctly, prevents scrub from forming.

(**you can read again now**)
The medium-sized field is yours now. I made it for you. 

![MenuPhoto.png](///raw/0a0/82/z/26c66.png)

![InGame.png](///raw/0a0/82/z/26cfa.png)

**Tools:**

Unity3D

Pyxel Edit

Ableton 

**Outside Assets:**

Background sounds: https://freesound.org/people/Luftrum/sounds/48983/

Font: https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/2d/fonts/free-pixel-font-thaleah-140059

Pixel art is my own, but referenced: https://beast-pixels.itch.io/overworld-tileset-grass-biome

entries.title: Zen Master
entries.description:
A meditation simulator made by two students.

Hello I'm Onat the designer and programmer. In some of the recent game jams I've done I had some trouble with overaiming on game design. So this time I went for a super simple concept. As we first planned the game would be a tiny bit challenging but we had a bug on a feature so our vision changed to a more relaxing theme. We adjusted the balance of the game to be very easy. The only way a player could lose takes at least 10 seconds of inattention. However not losing requires constant attention to your breath, just like real life :). Hope you enjoy a couple moment of relaxation.

Hi, I'm Berkay, the digital artist.
You can play the game by different mindsets, you can just play to have fun, or feel the ambiance and try to meditate with the character and notice 'your own thoughts'. 
I had so much fun while drawing the sprites, icons particularly.
In this project I've improved my layering and workflow skills. For the future projects I'm planning to focus on more shader-like graphics and animation. However It was an opportunity to amuse people with simple sketches. And it was so pleasant to know your game being played by random people in the world.
 
Controls:
Hold space to inhale,
Release to exhale.

Tools used:
Godot Engine,
Krita,
Audacity.

2019-10-09 Updated for minor input and animation bugs

![ZenMaster.PNG](///raw/031/31/z/27ab3.png)

entries.title: Acorn Rush
entries.description:
Thanks so much for checking out our entry! After you’re done playing, please share your high score in the comments. (our high score is 3300)

Current non-creator high score: @tygrak with 1600 points!

### Lore
You were too busy participating in game jams to gather acorns for winter! Now you have to start with nothing and collect enough acorns before it’s too late! Oh! -and watch out for the other squirrels trying to steal your acorns!

### How to play
* You can deposit the acorns into the tree by either shooting them in, or putting them in directly (clicking when you’re in the hole)
* Make sure to watch out for the thief squirrels, they take the last 2 things you deposited and make a run for it. If you knock them down, the points are added back automatically. Plus, they leave a golden acorn worth double a normal acorn!

### Controls
* Movement - WASD or arrow keys
* Pick-up - Right-click
* Throw - Left-click
* Pause - Esc key

### Credits
* Programming and music by @MrPiedPiper
* Art and animations by @StinkyKitty

Also, there's a bug right now that sometimes causes thieves to get stuck after falling. Also the thieves always run to the right :P

![Title.jpg](///raw/816/21/z/28221.jpg)

![Gameplay.jpg](///raw/816/21/z/2822a.jpg)
