entries.title: Shadowy Monster Land
entries.description:
Press F1 for in-game instructions.
If F1 opens browser help page instead of the game help then you need to click on the game window first.

My first game jam. It's been intense, but great fun. Definitely doing it again!
Didn't get as much done as I wanted - biggest disappointment is that I didn't have time to make any proper levels - I spent too long implementing mechanics which are then barely used...

Here's the story (also in-game, with helpful graphics):
Because you had NOTHING else to do, you've randomly found yourself in Shadowy MonsterLand.

You START WITH NOTHING.
If you enable Dark Mode (over on the right), you will be able to see almost NOTHING.

On each level, you need to find the exit.

If you are lucky, you'll find a torch. Press 'T' to turn it on and off, Up/Down arrows to focus the beam between short and wide and long and narrow. Legend speaks of spare batteries...

Beware of Monsters, and don't fall into any Volcano Pits!

Monsters mostly sleep. But they will wake if you get too close, or if any light shines on them.

Some blocks can be pushed, and some have lights on top, for some reason.
If you stand next to one of these, Up/Down can be use to focus the beam (like the torch), and Left/Right can be used to aim the beam.  Unlike the torch, these don't use batteries. (Since you asked, they are powered by zero-point energy extracted from nothing. That's right, they START WITH NOTHING.)
Oh, yes, and hold SPACE to drag them!


A solo effort, all my own work apart from graphics - which are taken from the following great libraries - thank you!
https://opengameart.org/content/dungeon-crawl-32x32-tiles
https://opengameart.org/content/dungeon-crawl-32x32-tiles-supplemental
https://jasonlab.itch.io/seamless-real-texture-pack

entries.title: Kitty Litter Defence
entries.description:
Solo dev, first submission, pretty much winging it.

![Annotation 2019-10-07 004412.png](///raw/c42/82/z/2692f.png)

Start with nothing:
==
Embracing the theme of "Start with nothing", you control a cat who is trying to protect his empty litter box from dogs trying to do their business in it. As the cat, you will have to defend off waves of dogs, using temporary buffs that expire at the end of the round. Each turn you start with nothing, and you have to cleverly use each buff to defeat all the waves.

How to play
==
WASD or Arrows to move.

Left Ctrl or Left mouse button to swipe.

Left click on abilities to get their buff for *1 ROUND* only. Next round you *start with nothing*

Win by stopping all the dogs from pooping in your litter box!

Survive 10 waves to go to the next level.

Abilities 
==

*Abilities can stack, but are lost at the new round.*

Claws - Your attacks hit 3 times.

Fishy - You attack twice as fast.

Bone - Your attacks disable the dog for 1 second.

Water - Your attacks slow the movement of the dog.

Collar - Your cat now can push dogs around and block their movement.

There are 10 levels of 10 waves of "randomly" generated levels with constraints. 


Some details about the project:
==
I produced all code and game assets you see. Since this is my first submission, I skipped the compo, but I pretty much stuck to those rules. The only art asset that was made previously was my main cat character. I am a software developer by day, but I went art heavy this time as I couldn't think of a good idea for the theme and thought I could brute force good ratings with cute cats and pretty graphics.

Tools used:
==

Unity for the Game engine.

Oculus Medium for sculpting.

Blender for model prep.

Substance Painter for texturing.

Instant Mesh for fast retopology.

Visual Studio 2019 for coding.

Final thoughts:
==
All in all, I'm happy with how this turned out. I'm not happy with the game mechanics at all, and the idea of "losing everything" at the start of each turn is actually a terrible game mechanic, also you rarely want to use your powerups. 

But apart from that, it was a lot of fun and I appreciate the opportunity to participate.


I was doing updates but couldn't figure out how to post them without completing my game, so I left them in now.


First update:
==

The first set of assets done:

![Game Jam pictures.png](///raw/c42/82/z/259ab.png)

I still need to animate some of them, and some of them are starting to scare me a bit, but so far this is good enough to work with. 
Some feedback on my acquaintances who love it:

Person one: "First one looks cool!"

Person two: "Electric, and I can’t stress this enough, chair"

Person three: "OK I'm not sure if this is going right 😅"


I've started on world generation.

![Game Jam picture1.png](///raw/c42/82/z/259c8.png)

I just need to hook this up to pathfinding and then I should be good to start on the enemy AI. The floor is possibly too bright, and the character is getting lost in it, but I will desaturate it later.

Update 2:
==
Other art assets are complete! They are really starting to come together. They all start to show faults if you look closely at them.. so please don't...

![9d0625c8-2418-47f3-ae07-6e9aab0023e7.jpg](///raw/c42/82/z/269b8.jpg)

![7f307a88-e576-4981-8d18-538652c8f6b6.jpg](///raw/c42/82/z/269bb.jpg)

![452c5513-a805-49d1-b0e6-8c8960ad47dc.jpg](///raw/c42/82/z/269bc.jpg)

![ab27de48-5a40-41e7-b15c-505ba0321fb4.jpg](///raw/c42/82/z/269be.jpg)

My cat is finally fully kitted out!

![6d0c09e4-9399-4a06-bd39-c4afcf5e1c7b.jpg](///raw/c42/82/z/269c5.jpg)

This guy slaps your dogs' ass, what do you do.
==

entries.title: Paint a Solar System
entries.description:
A game about creating a solar system. 

Controls:
Move by holding left mouse button. 
Press C to create more star dust. 
Select planet by clicking it. 
Change paint mode with buttons. 
Press ESC to quit. 
Pressing Space will apply the drawing to the current planet. 
Pressing Space when not drawing will take a screenshot and save it in the main folder directory. 
Note* Screenshots from previous plays will be overwritten if more are taken. Change the name or move the ones you want to keep. 

Update 1: Currently working on making a button for applying the paint. I notice a lot of people on mobile and because you need to press space it won't work! Will update this accordingly. 
- Update has been published. Also removed shortcut keys since they only let you paint where you shouldn't be!
- You can now just hold the mouse down on the + and - to change the paint size.

entries.title: Fall of RS-17 Icarus - an Akaban Tale
entries.description:
This new point-and-click adventure from us-two-dudes takes you to the doomed space station RS-17 (Icarus), a top-secret research facility used by the shadowy Akaban corporation, in its final moments. Dr. Alex Pratchett has no memory of this place or how they got here. What will they find? What can they do? Can it be saved? Find out!

This game has FOUR (count them - FOUR) endings. Can you find them all?

Bugfix 1.1 -- Added collider to airlock / Adjusted Credits to include ourselves.

POST JAM~!
We've heard your feedback and somehow _just now_ realized we can respond to it with additional releases! This latest release has:
- Slightly increased base movement speed (still slow and atmopsheric)
- Press left shift to run (when you know where you're going)
- The wires are colored to kinda look like wires
- Fewer unhelpful pop-ups
- Some new (more?) helpful pop-ups
- Better wire placement
- Improved WebGL input handling (so you don't keep losing mouselock)
- More consistent interactive object hilights
- Shorter interaction distance
- Improved prompt UI interaction (text-boxes autofocus and enter submits)

entries.title: Pen and Play

entries.title: All But Starlight Here
entries.description:
### This game was designed for use with Tobii Eye Tracking in mind. This game WILL WORK if you don’t have the peripherals, but the visual effect itself will be less powerful.

## NOTE:
### There has been some issues with understanding the objective so I'm going to give a few hints to get players started.

1. Walk along the cliff to your left until you get to the two pillars in front of you. (Follow the lit path)
2. Pick up the flask on the altar. This will lock you in place until the next step is complete.
3. Look upward towards the large swirly star that is framed in the window of the pillars. (If not using Eye Tracking, place the 'no eye track' icon on the star. If using eye tracking, just look at the star)
4. Once the star does what it does, there will be a clear path through the rest of the environment.

![Screenshot_01_Hint.png](///raw/56b/2/z/28bb1.png)

This game is titled “All But Starlight Here” which is in reference to the poem Enosis by American transcendentalist poet Christopher Cranch. While enosis is a complicated political issue not addressed in this work, the poem is quite nice...

This game follows the letter but perhaps not spirit of the theme. I used this LD as an opportunity to construct an experience around an abstract visual effect I have been working on for some time. In short, this effect “adds detail” where the user is looking. If you are not using the Tobii Eye Tracking, ‘where the user is looking’ is set to the center of the screen where the ‘no eye track’ indicator is present.

![Screenshot_02.png](///raw/56b/2/z/283d0.png)

CONTROLS:
This game uses standard WASD and mouse controls, with left shift for a (slow) run and the space bar for a (short) jump. The jump is mostly used to free the player if they get stuck on some set geometry (usually it’s the steps down that give the character controller trouble).

NOTE: This game is fairly intensive in terms of both graphics (visual effect) and CPU. I was unable to test this game on a variety of systems so I don’t know if it will work on Mac, Linux, or systems with integrated graphics. Please let me know if the game does not work at all for you, including the issue you’re seeing and your system specs and I’ll try to get another copy of the executable compiled.

CREDITS:

Matt Mitchell for the use of his Crotales

Anna Martin and St. Michael Catholic Church for the use of their space for the purposes of recording.

entries.title: Stolen Goods
entries.description:
Snoop around the house and steal all the items you have on your list! But be careful, the more you steal the slower you become, so snoop tactically and more importantly DON'T GET CAUGHT!

entries.title: Everything Shall Be Ours
entries.description:
​Made for the 45th Ludum Dare Gamejam
Didnt had to much energy/time so I made this alone and kept it simple.
Your an ant queen spawning ants constantly. Not walking increases how fast they are spawned. Send them out to get food for you so you can grow stronger. Command your warriors to attack enemy bees or they will kill your army.

entries.title: Stealing is Theft
entries.description:
<< You wake up in a supermarket fitting room.
The worst hangover of your life.
No memories. No self respect.
No CLOTHES.
What could possibly go wrong? >>

entries.title: Genesis
entries.description:
![plants.png](///raw/d2c/22/z/2833e.png)

![mushrooms.png](///raw/d2c/22/z/28342.png)

Genesis is a game about evolution. You start out with nothing but algae, mushrooms, and a basic fish. You can evolve these types into more advanced forms. In order to win the game you must obtain one of the 4 magic plants or animals: The Magic Tree, The Magic Mushroom, The Magic Skeleton Horse, or The Magic Giant Squid.

Features:
26 unique species with evolution, a realistic trait allele system, and procedurally generated terrain.

Notes:
2 plants or animals are required to breed. Nothing will happen if you only place 1.
If you are in a hurry, use the time options in the upper-left.

Disclaimer: Even though it is noted in-game that 100% magic resonance is required to obtain the magic plants and animals, this restraint is not active in the current version of the game.

Allele Information (Skip if you already know about how alleles work in the real world):
https://pastebin.com/wxDbrSaz

---DOWNLOAD INFORMATION---
The current version of the game may require you to update your c++ runtimes. If you have any problems, go to https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/2977003/the-latest-supported-visual-c-downloads and download the appropriate runtime.

entries.title: Hungry Holly
entries.description:
![Screen_2.png](///raw/a7/z/28d3a.png)

Holly is hungry, catch the red tomatoes to eat them. Don't let any tomatoes hit the ground. You don't want to eat the green tomatoes, so throw a rock at them instead. Avoid the falling rocks

Move left/right with arrow keys or A/D.
Left mouse click or space bar to throw.

You lose if you miss 10 tomatoes, or if you are hit by 10 rocks.

entries.title: Trick or Retreat
entries.description:
You are an alien that comes down to earth on Halloween to go trick-or-treating dressed as a ghost. But your arrival doesn't go unseen! The military are sending in helicopters to capture and take you to area 51!
Dodge their bullets while trying to collect as much candy as possible, and call in your trusty spaceship once you're satisfied with your bounty

Made in 3 days with C and the C binding for SFML (https://www.sfml-dev.org/).
All textures were created by me. All sounds are CC0 from opengameart.org

**Controls**
* A/D keys or Left/Right arrows to move
* W/S keys or Up/Down arrows to navigate main menu/Retreat
* Space/Enter to collect candy from doorstep

![LD Screen 1.png](///raw/ffb/42/z/276d2.png)
![LD Screen 2.png](///raw/ffb/42/z/276d4.png)


# ATTENTION!
**Linux users will need to install CSFML**
* To do this with apt run `sudo apt-get install libcsfml-dev`

entries.title: Battleground Command
entries.description:
![TITLE.png](///raw/26d/81/z/293e9.png)

How to play
------------
```
H: Toggle help
WASD: move
SPACE: Jump/Stand up
F: Draw/Hide weapon
X: Crawl
C: Crouch
M: Music ON/OFF
Rightclick: Strategic view / 3rd person view showing the forbidden zones
Mouse wheel: zoom in / out
N: Restart Game
P: Quit game
```
As a prisoner, you must find a weapons and ammo to eliminate all the enemies. You will be fired at if you walk into an forbidden zone or if you are seeing with your weapon drawn. You can hide your weapon with F, but weapons can be detected if you walk near guards.

Enemy Detection AI:

![Animated GIF-downsized_large.gif](///raw/26d/81/z/2974a.gif)

Hide behing walls to remain undetected.

entries.title: Ragin' Racers
entries.description:
![thumbnail.png](///raw/8c4/2/z/2811a.png)

Race through the post-apocalyptic desert and be the last car standing in a brutal race to the death.  Each race gives you the cash you need to upgrade your car and purchase power-ups for the next race.  Protect yourself with extra armor and mess with your opponents by sliding them into walls and into each other with the oil slick.

Play with up to 3 other friends in local competitive play or race against the other 7 AI racers on your own.  Compatible with Xbox 360 controllers, other controllers might work, but we only tested on Xbox 360 controllers.

Thanks for trying our game, have fun!

entries.title: My Stuff is in There!
entries.description:
[![cover_image.png](///raw/b4e/12/z/2833b.png)](https://madbarron.itch.io/my-stuff-is-in-there)

[Play in your browser! Takes 10 minutes to complete.](https://madbarron.itch.io/my-stuff-is-in-there)

A story about Ben, who doesn’t value his relationships with others. When all his material possessions are lost, can he discover the social wealth he had all along?

Made in Unity with a team of four and some copyright-free music.

How to Play
-----------

Click the ground to walk. Click someone to talk to them. Click words to talk.

At a certain point, you will need to help Ben develop some active _listening_ skills.

Updates
-------
* Made a small conversation tweak to hopefully make it easier in one tough spot.
* Fixed some quest dead-ends and adjusted text to be more indicative of what the player should do.

Credits
-------

Alex Davis: Writing

Ryan Hansen: Writing

Brandon Quinn: Programming, Sound Effects

Ben Romney: Graphics

Music
-----
"Sea of Ancestry" by Jesse Gallagher

"Easy Breezy" by Silent Partner

"Memories" from [Bensound](http://www.bensound.com)

![Cover image](///content/b3/z/280f4.png)
  
**___**  
  
An Universe From Scratch is sort of an alchemy game with concepts as elements, and the goal is to find the "END OF THE GAME" concept.  
There are 45 concepts to find, and 6 bonus concepts (that have no use for reaching the end).

entries.title: The Seven
entries.description: This is our first game jam. Hope you'll love our game. We are 3 students from Europe, Hungary. The game is about Billy Boy who can't escape from the prison of colors. Your job is to help him in the process of escape. You have to press the the numbers from 1-7 to change the color of Billy Boy, because you can only jump on platforms that are the same color as you.  There're also special things that you can use to stop the border(what kills you if you are not fast enough) for 5 secs or to make Billy Boy a rainbow(that's good because you can jump to any kind of platforms, but be careful, watch the time) for 5 secs. The music in the menu is pretty cool, but in the game...(be careful for your nervous system)!![72630237_403534723894879_8485311512246747136_n.png](///raw/276/72/z/27a02.png)![72243304_797858707301011_3289262474137698304_n.png](///raw/276/72/z/27a07.png)![71677836_913052545747180_9161867134513446912_n.png](///raw/276/72/z/27a0c.png)![72633437_1395813733909346_1624305263538339840_n.png](///raw/276/72/z/27a0d.png)

entries.title: Caravan Wars
entries.description:
# **Caravan Wars**
### Caravan Wars is a amazing game where you can rob enemy's caravans and defend yours.:horse::horse::horse:
___
#### You can:
- Send your caravans to the market and, if they return to the base, you will recieve a points
- Attack the enemy's caravans and steal their gold
- Attack the enemy's units, defending your base or caravans
- Attack the enemy's base and steal their gold
- Attack the enemy's units, wearing stolen gold and steal them back
- Steal enemy's gold with caravans (if the market is empty)
- Upgrade units and caravans (Each level improves speed and capacity)
___
## Manual:
To spawn unit press on the scene in place, where you want to spawn. To spawn caravans press the button in right menu or press key Space on keyboard. You wins if you steal all the gold from enemy's base. To upgrade units or caravans, press the buttons in the right menu. You can choose the difficulty of the game, moving the slider in the right menu.

## **Dont forget to open game in full screen!!!**

![Art](///raw/f82/a2/z/2746d.jpg)

entries.title: I Don't Think That's Math
entries.description:
0=1, and 1 = 0. Nothing is as it should be. But nothing is everything, and everything is nothing. So, does that mean you can put everything as it should be?

The object of the game is to use the various math operations to go from the original equation to one that is actually true, thereby "proving" the original equation.

Operations include: 
- **The Law of the Mirror Image**: you may take the mirror image the equation, if possible for all digits, and retain the same result.
- **The Law of Rotation**: as we all know, you may rotate the digits on each side of the equation by 90 or 180 degrees, if possible for all digits, and this will not change the result.
- **The Laws of the Outside Digits**: You may remove the **same** digit from the front (leading digit) or back (trailing digit) of each side of the equation. You may insert the same leading digit to both sides. 
- **The Laws of Splitting and Merging**: Of course, you may deconstruct a digit into its parts, or construct a digit from its parts. For example, it is well known that an 8 is simply a 0 with a belt through it. You may remove the belt and place it to the left side, and therefore 8 = -0.

![Screen Shot 2019-10-07 at 3.58.00 PM.png](///raw/658/72/z/27735.png)

entries.title: There's only Dark and you're a Cube (TioDayaaC)
entries.description:
Our first jam attempt, mostly as an exercise in Unity :)

This is a simple **MAZE** game where you search for keys and look for the exit. Effective play time is around **5 minutes**. Don't expect too much, as it's just a proof-of-concept of a design. Would you like to play more levels? Please give us a feedback how you would continue to build upon this, or if you have any other improvement idea! :)

The code is open-source on GitHub, feel free to fork it if you are interested, or check the changelog. We've strived for a **minimalistic design**, so there is not really any artwork. We are still deploying various cosmetic hotfixes and integrating your advices, so you can keep watching for changes! :) The level itself is not being changed.

The most current version for the best user experience: https://scsc.itch.io/there-is-only-dark-and-you-are-a-cube

The ***old*** alpha version, submission @ deadline: https://scsc.itch.io/alpha-version-there-is-only-dark-and-you-are-a-cube

entries.title: Deep Station Fine
entries.description:
​Welcome aboard Deep Station Fine Commander. You and your officers will embark on a great adventure about Klongons. ![promo00.PNG](///raw/16b/z/266dd.png)
Lt.Wax, a freightful Science Officer, Chef O´Bran an always horny engineer, Gunslinger Joe the rambling security guy and Doctor P, the doctor aboard the station with a small alcohol problem.
![promo01.PNG](///raw/16b/z/266eb.png)
You only need a mouse to play it. Consult your officers and choose your orders wisely.
![promo02.PNG](///raw/16b/z/266ed.png)
This is a space parody heavily inspired by Star Trek DS9 with strong language. Although i would have loved to build in minigames where you have to defend the station, play dabbo or have random encounters. The time only allowed for one "episode" and little tidbits here and there. The theme might be a stretch, but i hamfisted it in whereever i could ;)

entries.title: Monolith
entries.description:
*UPDATE:*
Guys thanks SO MUCH for your feedback and kind messages!!

We have fixed some bugs so far, everything has gone straight to Git repository for you to be able to check the source code if you like.
We keep itch updated to.

Hope you enjoy!

And speaking of music, we uploaded our original ost to youtube, check it out!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y9YCetREef8

*A game about knowing nothing.*

Monolith is a puzzle game with rpg-like elements; in this game, you take the place of an unknown protagonist on an unknown realm. Your goal, motives, reasons, abilities, they're all unknown, the only thing you know is the Monolith, who will guide you through your journey, but, your journey for what?
What are you doing here?
What is the Monolith talking about?
And why is he talking... like that?
Only one way to find out, there's not much time left, so you better hurry.


 Requirements


- OS: Windows 7 SP1+, macOS 10.12+  
- Graphics card with DX10 (shader model 4.0) capabilities.​  
- CPU: SSE2 instruction set support.​
- Memory: 4 GB RAM

![Screenshot_Itch_01.png](///raw/470/82/z/282b5.png)

![Screenshot_Itch_02.png](///raw/470/82/z/282bd.png)

![Screenshot_Itch_03.png](///raw/470/82/z/282c9.png)

We have no information about controls and cannot provide you with any further support. Sorry and have fun!

Source code aid...

If you want to know more about this code, we'd be more than happy to hear about you!
Write to us: info@applicate.co

entries.title: Nothing left for Jim!
entries.description:
Have you ever wondered, who cleans up the mess, that our usual heros make?
Play as Jim, the construction worker and prepare a race track for another race to run.
The clou: He has to bring all items from the finish line back to the start line, so the race can start with nothing left in his pockets. Can you beat the game in just 40seconds? Because, if some items are not placed where they belong in time, you better run. Ha! Get it?! :smile:

Features:
- Random level generation
- Cameo appearance from 2 famous guys
- And Jim!?

Have fun and thank you for playing!

entries.title: 9 Rooms Many Buttons
entries.description:
![img1.JPG](///raw/fa5/82/z/275da.jpg)

IMPORTANT: It seems the game sometimes has issues with your mouse leaving the game when not played in full screen. I would recommend playing in full screen when playing on itch.io.

9 Rooms Many Buttons is a first-person puzzle game with 9 rooms of puzzles.

Controls: To move around use WASD. To look around use your mouse. You are able to interact with buttons and doors by left-clicking on your mouse. 

ESC will attempt to close the program, so avoid using this feature if you are playing in a web browser.

If you get stuck, look for a clue in the previous room or in the corners of the current room ;) .

All object assets used were built into Unity. 

Sound files were made using the amazing bosca ceoil website.

entries.title: Mall-icious Intent
entries.description:
## Summary

Hey, slacker! The soul collection deadline is today! And you have no souls! You need to head to the busiest place you know, and collect as many souls as possible, otherwise your boss is definitely going to yell at you. Steal human souls and avoid their ethereal bodyguards. The humans can’t see you, but their protectors can. How many souls can you collect in Mall-icious Intent?

## Controls

- WASD to move
- Space to jump
- J to attack
- K to dodge
- P to pause

Made with love by: Yenny Yulianny (@Doraemon),  Sheena Marquez (@divii), Olivia Weeks-Kristie (@Ojwk), Pip Reyes (@Pip) and Jeremy Weeks (@superjai)

entries.title: High Steaks
entries.description:
![cover.png](///content/0d6/52/z/28392.png)

You're stuck on an island with a cow and you're starting to get really hungry...

---

### The Player
You play as this orange shirted* guy; the camera follows the middle of him and your mouse.
![player.gif](///raw/0d6/52/z/28736.gif)

*or is he just really sunburned?

### Picking up Sticks and Stones
You pick up sticks, stones, and your tools by walking over them.
![picking up.gif](///raw/0d6/52/z/28737.gif)

### Crafting
Pressing (X) will open the crafting menu, where you can click on an item on the left side of the screen to craft with the materials you've picked up.
![crafting.gif](///raw/0d6/52/z/28732.gif)

### Spear Tossing
While you have the spear, holding the mouse button will start a "swing aim". Let go to have the spear fly in the direction the yellow line is pointing. Once your spear lands, it will be able to be picked up again by walking over it
![spear throwing.gif](///raw/0d6/52/z/2873a.gif)

### Equipment
You can only carry one tool at a time, pressing (O) will drop your currently held one allowing you to pick the other up.
![dropping.gif](///raw/0d6/52/z/2873c.gif)

entries.title: Kebab Stand

Grill up kebabs in this three-day challenge!

Customers will get mad and leave if you do not serve them quick enough. Click or tap them to open up the preparation screen. Make sure you put the chicken on the kebab skewer!

entries.title: GeoKill
entries.description:
# GeoKill

This is GeoKill. A game where you are a brave square and fight against other geometric bosses. But in every level, you start without guns, so your task is to collect you gun and kill the boss!

## Instructions

```
D or Right Arrow: walk right

A or Left Arrow: walk left

W or Up Arrow: raise the gun

S or Down Arrow: lower the gun

Space: Jump

Shift, Ctrl or Tab: Shoot
```


## Development notes


The game is developed by Felipe Guimarães, Octavio Mathias and Guilherme. We are Brazilian students from ITA, and here we have a game development group called ITAbits. Unfortunately, we ran out of energy on Saturday here on our dormitories, so we lost one day of development and the game couldn't be polished with everything we planned for it  (as audio, animations and more complexity on the fights).


Thank you for playing. =)

entries.title: Gardenia
entries.description:
Gardenia is a little game about plant breeding.

![gardenia.png](///raw/058/3/z/29b07.png)

You'll manage a garden on unfriendly, arid planet and create new plant species by cross-breeding to achieve wanted properties.

Published version does not have a way to fail, so feel free to experiment and have fun with numbers going up and new plants showing up.

Help is available in-game but also below:

### How to manage a garden on another planet
##### A guide for future colonists

#### Introduction

Hello! Thanks for picking up my book. I'll try to guide you step by step
in how to manage your own garden to make your colony completely self-sufficient!

#### Ground preparation

Well tilled soil is a must to make sure your plants will grow fast and big thanks to
easier access to deeper, higher quality soil.

After preparing the ground with tilling tool of your choice, it's highly advised to
put crops in your new farming spot. Support will help your plants grow and it'll make
breeding easier and more manageable for you.

There are two types of crops.
Regular one that can be used for planting and as ground for natural spreading and cross-crops
used for breeding.

#### Spreading

Every plant can spread around in a shape of "+" as long as there's tilled and cropped ground available.
New plant will be exact clone of its parent.

#### Breeding

By planting two plants of any type with cross-crop in the middle there's a chance for you to get a new,
mutated plant in the place of cross-crop. Child of two different parents will have it's statistics in the middle
with slight variations. This mechanic can be used to make your plants bigger, more nourishing and in the end,
make them evolve into completely new species!

#### Additional information about plants

How much you get from a plants depends on it's size, it's root size and it's nutrition. Keep that in mind while breeding new types.

Speed of growth depends on plant's size and moisture absorption. Small plants with huge absorption grow the fastest.

Spreading is a chance for your plant to mutate or spread to nearby tiles every hour.

In order for your plant to produce food on picking up it must be in it's fully grown state.
It's also true for both breeding and spreading.

#### Compost

You can drop seed you don't need anymore here to get rid of them.

#### Team Management, Food and Actions

Gardening is a hard job, and it's intergalactic edition is even harder. It may be helpful to get your friends to work.

Every healthy team member will grant you one additional action per turn.
Keep them filled and happy to make sure you won't lose your precious action points.

Every team member needs one unit of food every 8 hours to keep working.
In case you've forgotten, our specie cannot die from starvation thanks to our hibernation mechanism.
So if your friend seems dead, you put a nice veggie in front of their face to put them on their feet.

In order to skip turn, click on your ship. It'll move the clock by one hour, tick your plants and refresh action points.

#### Some more info:

​You may have problems with images loading with a little delay. It's caused by game not pre-loading any data. Sorry for inconvenience.

Also, it uses some very fresh JavaScript features so if something goes wrong, please try updating your browser.

entries.title: Untitled Robot Game
entries.description:
![Screenshot_114.png](///raw/c20/7/z/28240.png)

===============================================

Bug Fix: (08/10/2019) Fixed a bug where movement speed was inconsistent for different frame rates and could lead to clipping into the walls and floors

Bug Fix 2: (11/10/2019) Fixed a bug where standing beneath the second elevator would allow you to clip far enough into the ground to fall through the level

Bug Fix 3: (11/10/2019) Fixed ending of level to guarantee triggering of end screen

Bug Fix 4: (11/10/2019) Removed ability to infinitely wall jump, which had the side effect of making your speed high enough to clip out of bounds.

Bug Fix 5: (26/10/2019) Fixed the part of the tutorial that allowed you to clip out of bounds

===============================================

A puzzle platformer. You are T.I.T.A.N, a nearly forgotten robot in the basement of Atomic Labs. You must make your way back to the surface. However there are many obstacles blocking your way. Which require items to be placed in pedestals to deactivate. You start with nothing and you will have to get rid of all picked up items to make it to the end of the level so you will, once again, start with nothing! You must find the items and solve the puzzles to make it to the end. 

===============================================

Controls: 

A - Move left

D - Move Right

W or Space - Jump 

E - Activate Pedestal 

================================================

Unfortunately we ran out of time and so we only got 3 levels and no sound implemented. We hope you enjoy this proof of concept regardless. 

There is a known bug that happens if you try and wall jump with the reactor in hand where you can fall into the floor. Your meant to place that in the pedestal to go up and complete the puzzles. It can also occur after the long drop at the end of the level.

entries.title: adventure again
entries.description:
# How to Play a game
- Up key: Jump
- Right Arrow Key: Move Right
- Left Arrow Key: Move Left

# Game Concepts and Level Designs
- The concept of a level design for this game is that there's nothing at first, and then there's a level added as the character moves. 
- As the character moves, a new level is added. 
- But the level that was created in the past is either lost or modified. That's an important concept of the game's level design.
- So there's no help for character movement at first. I want to know what to be moved by how the level of experience.
- But I fixed this part. Now I've shown you how to move forward at each level.
- It's a simple and easy game, but please play it fun. And give me some advice

# Graphic 
- He painted with his hands.
- I took a picture.
- Only the resolution was modified.

# graphic production process
- After painting on paper, take a picture. Modify the resolution of the picture.
- All graphic data were drawn with pencils.

# Game engine
- stencyl

# Update(1.0)
- Add and Modify Levels (Number of levels increased to 7 -> 13)
- Add game progress help icon
- Add game endings

You know that time when your flat lease is ending and you are trying to keep the flat as clean as possible so you get your deposit back when you move out? 

Do you know those pesky multicultural flatmates that just stop that from happening?

Do you ever feel like you just have to run around and clean up after them?

Well this game has all that and more! 

YOU **START WITH NOTHING** WRONG.

NO BACTERIA - NOTHING. BUT THOSE WEIRD NAMED FLATMATES OF YOURS.... GOD... DANGIT.

============================================================================

WASD - Movement
SPACE - Interact
OTHER - Keyboard keys

Goal: 

**Keep the flat clean as much as possible until the time runs out.**
**If you manage to keep it 90% clean or more - YOU GET YOUR DEPOSIT BACK WHICH YOU CAN THEN INVEST IN CRYPTO.**

Assets are half drawn half taken from online.

Very first Ludum Dare entry by us. Thank you!

-Multicultural Weird Named Flatmates

entries.title: LIME
entries.description:
Sandbox-style game inspired by Terraria.
You literally start with nothing in your inventory.
Explore, mine, build, make, and more!

![scr1.png](///raw/af0/42/z/27e4a.png)

Controls:

A/D - Left/Right
W/Space - Jump
E - Inventory
Scroll Wheel - Switch held item

![scr3.png](///raw/af0/42/z/27e5e.png)
![scr4.png](///raw/af0/42/z/27e64.png)

--
This was actually my first Ludum Dare, and I probably bit off more than I could chew. I intended to also add mobs, working health system, pause menu, caves, day/night, etc., but due to the time constraint couldn't add all that I wanted to. Here's what I got done in three days!

entries.title: Cheese Finder
entries.description:
![team_logo_with_name_3.png](///raw/2b7/8/z/27b09.png)

> Сontrol:
>- AWSD  movement
>- LMB  attack
>- E  grab - "E" need to be kept throughout the stick selection animation

Game was made by two girls (programmer https://vk.com/ikusiya and artist Veronika - wished to remain unknown :)) who formed team "2mice" specially for Ludum Dare 45.
The original game concept was about little mouse surviving in harsh post apocalyptic world. But since it was the first time we took part in LD we overestimated ourselves and simply had not enough resources to bring the idea to life :)
So we ended up with cheese haunt and and cockroach killing, but we are glad to have what we have at least ^^

by gameplay
>Yes, now I understand my mistake, it was necessary to more accurately describe the rules of the game))) The correspondence of the topic here is complete as it seems to me, because our mouse always starts without anything, takes a stick, hits cockroaches, but when I kill it, it starts not from scratch) in that the number of cockroaches at the level of course, as well as the items of support - cheese and sticks. You can only lose if you run out of something from this resource) The task is to build your tactics in such a way as to kill all roaming cockroaches and defeat the guards of big cheese)
My main mistake is that I am not talking about this through the visual representation of the game)
Thank you very much for the feedback, and it helps to correct criticism of its mistakes, which are not always visible from the position of the developer)



https://youtu.be/XkaUNfuEpq0

entries.title: Noth INC.
entries.description:
We really ran out of time making so there isn't really an ending and might be wonky.

The idea was to upgrade everything in the game for the start menu to the ending. Sam (the AI character) does all the attacking while you do all the buying and upgrading.

entries.title: Updates
entries.description:
Start with nothing...

Your CPU crashed and your game is now showing only binary code! 
Don't worry, you can collect updates in the game and unlock the graphics and audio. BUT be careful - if an enemy hits you, you will lose your progress and you will have to install them again! 

Hints: When you hear the witch laugh, stop move!
Frankenstein is surely big, will he still be big in binary form?


INSTRUCTIONS:

Please play full screen

Move with W A S D 

Code by Marco Minganna - https://www.marcominganna.com

Graphics by Lucia Paganini - https://lucisaurus.com

Audio by free online resources - www.youtube.com/watch?v=JRlcYMiHtE8 www.youtube.com/watch?v=ChbWFvZATFA


We hope you enjoy our game, thanks for dropping by!

entries.title: Unstable Dungeon
entries.description:
roguelite dungeon action game for Ludum Dare 45
made in about 30 hours with my wife.

![splashscreen_title.png](///raw/8e1/72/z/2756b.png)



some stats:

Melee is 1 DMG + 2DMG per blue Upgrade (thats what you get after upgrade 5 times)

Range is 4 DMG per blue upgrade and only usable at 1 blue upwards

Armor is 20 HP + 20 per blue

Amulette is 10 MP at first blue and +10 every after

Bag let you hold 10 per item per blue upgrade


if you die you lose all
so just teleport back to upgrade via B for Inventory and then T

entries.title: Broken Broom Adventure!
entries.description:
Procedurally generated dungeon crawler where you've been captured and thrown into a cell by as yet unknown baddies! (Unknown because unfortunately, due to my work schedule, I only had about 1.5 days to work on this project, so there are exactly: Zero enemies)

There is an HTML5 version as well as Windows, Linux, and MacOS variants, with the following cautions:
 - I haven't had time to test the Linux build on my actual hardware, but the export from Godot normally works
 - I don't own a Mac to test on, so *hopefully* the export from Godot works :)

However! You CAN experience:

 - 10x10 room dungeon, Procedural Generation (special thanks to Derek Yu for releasing Spelunky and the source code, as well as http://tinysubversions.com/spelunkyGen/ for helping me to understand what is going on)​
 - Every play through is different
 - Don't forget to grab the broken broom, it grants special powers!
 - Start at the bottom, climb your way towards the top
 - Some sound effects and cutesy pixel art (special thanks to 0x72 for pixeldudesmaker located at: https://0x72.itch.io/pixeldudesmaker) ***

Controls:
 - Arrow Keys or A/D keys to move, Space to jump
 - The final screenshot shows the "End" room (the one that doesn't have a texture yet)

***"Cute" is subjective, as I drew all of the artwork.


![LD45_ss1.png](///raw/8c5/81/z/276a0.png)

![LD45_ss3.png](///raw/8c5/81/z/276a2.png)

entries.title: Green Dragon Inn
entries.description:

Green Dragon Inn is a choose-your-own-adventure game that starts with you naked in a field. From there, it's up to you what you want to do and where you want to go. How trusting are you, and how willing to take risks? Find out as you explore Dragonshire and try to discover its secrets.

Major thank you to Sam for delightful music and MrTroy for fixing all the bugs I caused.

****
From MrTroy:
There is audio. If you press "Restart" it will play the audio. I don't know why this is the case, but I couldn't figure it out in the 72 hours we had.

As a side note this is the first time I've ever used Twine. As an example project I made a side game called "SuperMarket Shuffle" I did it in only 6 hours, and it was to help me adjust to using something other than Unity.
http://troydpatterson.com/go2019/supermarket/

entries.title: All Is Well
entries.description:
A peasant with nothing stumbled upon the throne room of an ancient castle. Inside, he sits upon a glorious golden throne for some much needed rest. 

At the right hand of the throne is a *WELL*. He hears something. Is that a voice in the WELL?

Turns out the *WELL* is evil, so is the castle, and now a bunch of bright-eyed adventurers believe him to be evil, too! This can't end *WELL*...

---

**CONTROLS**

**Arrow Keys/WASD** - Movement - Moves the player around

**Left-click** - Basic attack - Performs an AoE melee attack that damages any enemies immediately in front of the player

**Right-click** - Fire blast - Fires a projectile that deals good damage to one enemy if it hits

---

entries.title: Starting From Nothing
entries.description:
**Content Warning**: Suicide

We wanted to make a game for players to understand how some people have to cope with daily struggles to keep themselves alive. We often feel the need to help fix people's problems, but sometimes those people are not looking for solutions from us --just understanding. Hopefully this game helps you empathize with its characters while they work to stay alive and achieve their goals.

**Controls**: Mouse

Click on buttons to do things. Click+Drag the ball back to fire it forwards. Each ball represents an Action in someone's life; line up 3 or more to match them. But be careful --each match you make might have a strong positive or negative impact on the person you're helping, and may affect their Suicide Risk meter.

**Ludum Dare Stuff**
* Art & Music are not ours; see Attribution.txt.
* We've wanted to make this game for a long time. We apologize that it doesn't fit the Theme exactly.

**Known Bugs**
* Game may crash. Sorry!
* Emotion & Risk bars may sometimes disappear. Keep playing --they'll come back
* Lifelines may not always active. (Don't worry, they will always save you at Risk Level 3.)
* Music sometimes double-plays. Restart the app (I've only seen this once.)
* Zoom on HTML5 for **mobile** devices is wrong.
* Audio buzzes on Android. (Keep volume low or use headphones.)

**Screenshots**
![screenshots_b.png](///raw/136/z/28d8a.png)

entries.title: D*ck Hunt
Pinbuilder
entries.description:
## Pinbuilder

A pinball game where you start with nothing.
Slowly build up the pinball table and the higher the ball goes, the more you can build.

I didn't have a lot of time time this jam (~8hrs), so this is more of a POC. I think with some tuning and more pieces it could be a lot of fun (right now it is on the hard side).

entries.title: Red Metal Gatherer
entries.description:
Red has no money. But he is in a plain where people throw regularly scraps of metal and trash. Gather thoses thrown ressources to sell them and buy yourself more and more scraps and trash !

![sc0.png](///raw/1ad/81/z/27634.png)

The game revolve around a simple loop of 
-> get metals
-> sell metals
-> buy things to be faster/have more metals
-> sell metals again

![sc1.png](///raw/1ad/81/z/27641.png)

There is actually no win condition, as I... well... lacked of time. But eh, this time I made sound and even (a) music !

So... as it it has actually no end but I hope you'll enjoy it anyway ;)

![sc3.png](///raw/1ad/81/z/2764a.png)

Don't hesitate to comment on the game, wether you liked it... or not :/
But it was an interessing one to do... Even if it's absolutely not the kind of game I was planning to do... For full disclosure, the project was called NeedToFight at first, and well... the figthing went away... and the looting part stayed in.

Anyways, Next days will probably revolve arount playing the other jam's games and continuing #devtober !

;) Have a nice day, reader

## Controls

Interact - SPACE
Sin info - E

Mute music - M

## How to play

Use your tablet (Press Q) to read about the sins.

entries.title: Necromanic

![menu.png](///raw/e0c/1/z/28e03.png)
Become a necromancer, raise the death and take over the world.

HOW TO PLAY:

After the first level, choose a town and select how many of each unit you want to sent to battle.
There's a bug you get stuck if you sent no units.

Since we had some last minute problems with the audio, we were not able to put our audio in the game.
Our audio engineer build a version with audio working, but broke some other things. We still uploaded this version due to the fact the audio was indeed made during the jam and we'd like to show everything we done in the weekend.

entries.title: First planet
entries.description:
Pass the main evolutionary stages. 
Send people from cave time to megacities and space flights.

![planet_tutor.PNG](///raw/272/82/z/284e1.png)

P.S.
You are a kind of entity that depends on the creatures that inhabit this planet. You want to spread to more planets, for this it is necessary that your creatures fly to other planets. You can influence the population of the planet. You need the planet’s population to develop science and build an inter-star ship.

Unfortunately, we were not able to implement all the influence functions, they are in the code, but they do not work well. This is our first experience of such an event, tasks and time were allocated incorrectly.

We are thinking about implementing a full-fledged game on this topic, if you are interested in this, we are waiting for your wishes))

entries.title: The Island
entries.description:
Short story : You are alone on a island, and try to survive and escape.First you need to build a house with a fence, to survive the nights. After it you need to build a boat and escape with it.

You can gather rocks,bushes,tree stumps,mushrooms. You can hit barrels with spear or with axe to claim metal frag.And you can chop down trees with axe to claim wood.

You can move items in you inventory by clicking on them. To use a usable item drag it to one of your active inventory slots.

Controls :

WASD - Move

entries.title: Meowlediction
entries.description:
*You wake up and, to your surprised, you lost everything, TRULY everything
You want to get to the bottom of this and understand what happened !*


**A visual novel with reigns-like mechanics.**
You play a cat and choose to swipe right or left to make choices.






**Spoiler-ish territory** (for the first few dialogs but since it's not very long... I still wanted to warn)

You play a cat who is sure that it was once a human being, but does not have any memory of his past life. 
The idea here was to make a character that truly lost everything, obviously all its personal belongings but also his ability to talk, his memory and his human body.
The mechanics of swiping left and right is as minimalist as possible to underline how little actions the character is able to do (originally, it shoudld've only been meowing in 2 different ways but story-wise that seemed like not enough).


*Does not spark joy:*
The original scope was too big (especially since I had some work to do on the weekend) so the VN is shorter than it should be :( . I also did not have time for proof-reading :(( 

*Does spark joy:*
That was a fun experience and definitely one I would love to do again.:) That was my first time making a non-action oriented game and that was quite pleasing :))

I hope you'll have fun ! ^^

entries.title: Island Game
entries.description:
This is my first ever published game and first ever game jam submission. I have not participated in any game jams before, let alone published a game.

In this game, you start in a randomly generated island as a randomly generated character with randomly generated 8x8 textures. I am not a pixel artist, but I found that auto-generating textures leads to a much better aesthetic compared to anything that I could ever achieve manually.

You can walk around with WASD, arrow keys or xbox controller. You can cut down trees, destroy rocks or build a bridge by pressing the action key (space or xbox A button). If you stay in water too long, you will die. There is no goal in this game. Due to lack of ideas and time, this game is very primitive and lacking in many features.

This game was made using Godot engine. It's a wonderful engine that I found recently. I decided that making a game with it for a game jam would be a great way to become more experienced in using this engine. However, please don't take this project as an example of how to make a 2D game. The way I did collisions, among other things, are completely not how you're supposed to do it.

When the next Ludum Dare rolls around, I will be sure to submit something that'll hopefully be more complete and I'll probably work in a team next time, since working alone proved to be a challenge in terms of coming up with ideas for the game.

entries.title: Start with nothing, finish with friends... before war!
entries.description:
## Description
This game is about unity and conflict.  
Start alone, with nothing.  
Recruit allies and lead them into combat.  

## Commands
Use arrows to move your leader.

## Mechanics
Your leader is blue.  
Collide with white to recruit them.  
Your allies follow you.  
Enemy leader is red.  
Move your allies to close of enemy leader to kill him and won game.  
But beware of enemy allies, they can kill you and lose the game.  

## Sorry!
I faced problems with the animations and didn't have time to finish the game... I couldn't even add the win and defeat texts.  
In the final version the game would be more difficult and polished.  
But I will continue to work on it and I have plans to make it a complete and promising game.  

## Thanks for playing

entries.title: Nothing Found a Ludum Dare 45 game
entries.description:
Hi,
This is my first ludum dare and I wanted to use this opportunity to expand my skills. I have been working on some 2D games with unity and this may be the first 3D project for me. It was quite hard and I could not do anything in first 2 days (I was trying to understand 3D physics and colliders). I am happy with the final product with such a low time.

I started my game design as creating my world and gameplay elements from nothingness. First idea was that, every step player took in game will change game world and environment. I dumped that idea almost fully because of lack of models. Final game is a combination of gone home and to the moon. I took mechanics and ideas from both games and implemented as much as I could. You need to explore world and listen story of an architect. Through optaining some memory pieces, player can unlock light sources to progress through game. There is not much mechanic when we think core game mechanics and there is only one simple puzzle. I hope you can enjoy and bare lots of bug.

![Ekran Görüntüsü (2).png](///raw/377/92/z/27a70.png)
![Ekran Görüntüsü (3).png](///raw/377/92/z/27a75.png)
![Ekran Görüntüsü (4).png](///raw/377/92/z/27a7a.png)
![Ekran Görüntüsü (1).png](///raw/377/92/z/27a80.png)

Be aware remaining part is spoiler:
Actually what I tried to do with story is that, this architect is fine at first glance. Everything seems normal and just a little bit sad. But after each progress, mental statue of this architect became much worse. So, I implemented start with nothing as architect starts with no disease but develops some. I think with proper story writing and good object sets, this idea can work as a full game.

entries.description:
Collect all the gems to win. You start with none :) 
This is just a prototype, doesn't have much gameplay or optimisation either which is why its a download exe.
Only works on Windows for now.
This was mainly due to my PC quite literally exploding (like I saw sparks, seriously)
Also the map is quite big...so might take you some time to find the gems. Hint, they are in the houses hidden around the map.

entries.title: Spooky Isekai
entries.description:
Fiddy is stuck in a world where monsters become alive! Help him find the Relic so he can return to his original world!

Control:
- WASD: Movement and Jump
- Shift: Sliding
- E: Use Relic
- Mouse: Aim Flashlight

Your objective is to find the Relic. After you found the Relic, use it to get out of that world!

Credit:
- Programmer:
  - M. Khoirur Rizal [Twitter](https://twitter.com/rizalkhoirur96)
  - Bimaswara Adam Noval [Twitter](https://twitter.com/swaraadam)
- Artist:
  - Ahistya Purbolintang [Twitter](https://twitter.com/AhistyaP)

![cover image.gif](///raw/e87/9/z/28a7a.gif)

entries.title: No Bullet Hell
entries.description:
![26aca.png](///raw/802/2/z/2892a.png)

## Overview
​You are in hostile territory with *no bullets of your own*, yet your enemies are raining bullets down on you! How is that fair?​

Strategically navigate your way to victory! Take cover behind walls and plan your advance. You may not start with any bullets, but you can catch enemy bullets to use as a shield or throw back!

Clear out all the enemies and a boss will appear! Defeat the boss to beat this short game!

Thank you for playing and we appreciate your comments!
## Inspirations
- Hatsune Miku: Project Diva
- Touhou Project
- Superhot

## Credits
@gswong
- Whip cracker
- "Just-frame" junkie

@tehabyss 
- First time game jammer
- Bullet pattern extraordinaire

entries.title: Sounds of Nothingness
entries.description:
In this **platformer** you find yourself stranded in a **hostile abstract world**. You have to fight your way through hellish **monsters** by utilizing the power of **sound** artifacts you can find. You also have to dodge **deadly traps** and make **difficult jumps** to finally find your way out.

![test.gif](///raw/8c0/82/z/27535.gif)
The game delivers a meticulously **handcrafted artstyle** and a beautiful **original soundtrack**.
![Screenshot1.png](///raw/8c0/82/z/274ea.png)

Jump mechanics here have a **lot of momentum and reduced air control** so you need to be careful at which speed you make your jump to **not over- or undershoot** a ledge.

You control the character via "a", "d" and "space" and shoot with "1" and "2".

All the game assets are **made by us**. The game runs on our self-developed [**"RawSalmonEngine"**](https://github.com/AgoutiGames/RawSalmonEngine) written in **C++**.
- Artwork and Music is by @moonlighthiker
- Programming and Level Design is by @vectorwolf

The game currently runs at a **fixed 1920x1080 resolution** with no other options present.

Have fun playing our little game! :smile:

entries.title: Metro Gang
entries.description:
You start alone with $0 and an ambitious goal to control the city.
It is time to gain some respect on the hood!

Travel between metro stations and look for money and respect.

Beat out money from locals and other gangs
and persuade them to join your cause!

![metro-gang (9).gif](///raw/ed9/2/z/297cd.gif)

**[Play Post-Jam Metro Gang](https://ingwar.itch.io/metro-gang-plus)** (wtih gamepad support and updated 'exit-metro' mechanics)

**[Play Original Metro Gang](https://ingwar.itch.io/metro-gang)**


Supports local coop with 2 players! (two parts of a keyboard for now, pads are coming!)


**Controls:**


**1st Gang:**

Cursor keys: movements, jump and block

Left Shift: punch or dash

Hold Left Shift to get out on the nearest metro station


**2nd Gang:**

WASD: movements, jump and block

Right Shift/Space: punch or dash

Hold Right Shift/Space to get out on the nearest metro station




**Tips:**
* Each gang has a different colored train
* The goal of the metro screen is just to hop off the train. The initial battle is just a demo skirmish
* Hold punch to get out on the nearest metro station
* Your train is in the color of your gang
* A station is captured, when your gang has more money then others
* Each captured station gives your gang +1 mob and money
* At first, don't stop at stations occupied by other gangs (they are colored) - wait other mobs to join your gang.
* Move with punch to dash several mobsters at once!

entries.title: A nothing to live for
entries.description:
My brother and I made a game which put Nothing in the center.

![new main menu 2.PNG](///raw/7c1/82/z/28e9b.png)

You are a peaceful sloth living in the forest, making Nothing for a living.
Suddenly - the humans came, along with their machines, to destroy the forest.
Unfortunately - to push the machines away from your home - you will need to sacrifice some of your Nothing by shooting them at the machines - spawning from the top of the screen.

How To Play:

![How To Plau.PNG](///raw/7c1/82/z/29ab7.png)

You start with some Nothings in your bank, and your mission is to keep as many Nothings as you can - so you can live longer.
You generate new Nothing every time the Nothing Bar reaches 0.
When you do something (mooving / shooting) the Nothing Bar will be filled, while he will be unfilled as long as you do NOTHING ;)

![Shooting1.PNG](///raw/7c1/82/z/28e9a.png)


Unfortunately, due to a lack of time, two things aren't finished:

1.Didn't managed to make any music (but there are some funny SFX).
2. The resolution display on the web is not the best... therefore - I will recommend downloading the PC version...

Final note - this is my first ever game jam and my actually first ever game I made (almost) all on my own, so I hope you will enjoy it! I had an AMAZING time to make it :)

Credit:
Idea & Coding & Motivation - Ido Bennoon.
Design, Coding, SFX, VFX (photoshop, drawn using a mouse), packaging - Ori Bennoon.

changelog v1.2:
fixed a bug where sometimes the player won't shoot,
fixed a bug with the High score window at the main menu.
polished the How-To window at the main menu.

entries.title: What the Hell!
entries.description:
What the Hell! is a small top-down game, where an unknown character with a mysterious past and a mushroom haircut wakes up in hell with a gun with him and has to defeat the enemies in the underworld to go back to Earth. Enemies have a chance to drop a key. To proceed with rooms you will need at least 1 key.

I know it's very short as a game, but unfortunately i didn't have all the time to work on it because of school.

I'm also sorry for any bugs that could occur, it's my first game jam.

## Beware!If you're playing the downloaded version, do not run the game on fullscreen,many bugs will happen if you do so, and in the WebGL version the portal doesn't work. I currently don't know why for both things.

Anyways, Enjoy!
![what the hell icon.png](///raw/f4b/72/z/29d20.png)
## ----------Commands---------

WASD / Arrow keys : Move

Left Mouse Click : Shoot

## ---------------------------

![Screenshot (15).png](///raw/f4b/72/z/29d1f.png)

It was a great experience of participating game jam first time ever.

Music was made by him

P.S. It was very hard and stressful some essential features are not completed. Only core gameplay. So I need to explain that **weapons drops only when enemies collides with you** and it has some chance to drop.

P.P.S. Dialogs should exlpain it for you, but it didn't finished. Also like other weapons/enemies and etc...

entries.title: The Void
entries.description:
![SC1.png](///raw/539/8/z/28f2c.png)

You are a newly retired deity looking to start your own little slice of creation so you've picked up a second hand pocket dimension. Program particles, read a whole heap of instructions and relax.

Changelog since deadline:

entries.title: Pelinguin's Strange Journey
entries.description:
​Pelinguin's Strange Journey is a 2D platformer in which you play a half-pelican half-penguin creature who's looking after some scrolls. Starting from nothing, you'll acquire new powers to progress through your adventure. 

How to play:
With Keyboard :
Arrow Keys or WASD to move
E to Interact
(You'll have to find the other controls ;) after all you should start with nothing!)

With a controller :
Left joystick to move
B button to Interact
(You'll have to figure out what the other buttons do ;) after all you should start with nothing!)

If you can't hear the sound from the game, it's not because your speakers are broken. It's because we chose not to put the sound we tried to make since we were not skilled enough to make good sounding music.

People who sweated out the heck of this jam to make this game ;D :
- Altan4444 (https://ldjam.com/users/altan4444/)
- Sacdeneu (https://ldjam.com/users/sacdeneu/)
- Etoile (https://ldjam.com/users/etoile/)
- MarcRobin

You start by losing everything. The clocktower, all you've ever known. All gone in a single misstep. 

Tackle a clockwork demon to steal it's weapon. kill all the remaining demons of that type to remove them, and their chaos, from your psyche. Achieve inner peace.

WASD + Mouse to move and shoot/tackle.

entries.title: THE WALK
entries.description:
The "real" walking simulator.

Life is one long walk to uphill, once you reached to the top of the hill begins a new uphill and so on

How to play: Tap the walking icon to walk.
If you do not tap again before the timer around the tap icon reaches zero, you will die.

You can read messages from other players by tapping the tomb of the cross.



![the_walk01.png](///raw/013/3/z/25cc8.png)![the_walk02.png](///raw/013/3/z/25cc9.png)

entries.title: Stray
entries.description:
Stray - Text-based game about escaping a prison-like district. 
Will you be able to escape with nothing on you?

entries.title: Empty Stomach, Empty Toilet
entries.description:
You begin on an empty stomach. When you eat, you have about a minute to use the (empty) toilet! Eat more food to go faster, but the faster you can go the faster you'll need to go. Your score depends on how much you eat, but make sure not to crap yourself.

![ldcoverimage.png](///raw/05f/82/z/27728.png)

Created with Unity and MS Paint. Contains no sound, so don't worry about your boss hearing generic fart noises.

For all ages (probably). Contains crass humor (obviously).

Submitted as my first game ever (not counting tutorials), and what better way than in a game jam with a bunch of other, better, and worse developers?

Hopefully, this fix remains within the rules of the Jam. If not, I may need to roll it back.__**:smile:
also: How do you highlight or bold portions of the description?

**__:smile: UPDATE: Added a minor bug fix which will HOPEFULLY stop players from moving through walls if moving faster than intended. Unfortunately, I cannot yet prevent some of the players from moving faster than intended.

UPDATE! The Post-Jam Fixybuild is up! Hopefully this resolves the issue of some users moving faster than intended! It will be on the same game page as the other build, somewhere alongside or beneath it. So if you're moving too fast in the 'normal' version, try the Fixybuild!

entries.title: Robogon
entries.description:
![bg.png](///raw/716/22/z/29158.png)

Robogon is a block-based building game, where you build a robot to compete in a robot combat competition.

### Backstory

You have arrived at a robot combat competition, but somehow managed to leave your prized robot at home...

Now, you must gather whatever parts you can find, build a new robot, battle your opponents, and secure your place in the competition!

![Building.png](///raw/716/22/z/2727f.png)

### Controls

* Scroll to zoom camera
* Escape to quit
* **Combat mode:**
 * A/D to move (controls the wheels)
 * Mouse to aim weapons
 * Left-click to fire weapons
* **Build mode:**
 * W/A/S/D to move camera
 * Left-click to select and place blocks
 * Right-click to remove blocks


**Note: The jam version of the game is very buggy, and incomplete due to the time constraints of LD45, so please make sure to also play the updated version.**

entries.title: A Soul Journey
entries.description:
Soul Journey
A game in which your soul has been emailed across the universe and you must find a entity to inhabit, but only one of the 8 avaliable entities are inhabitable. Keep in mind you must have certain items before you can possess different entities, good luck and have fun!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Controls:

Left Click: move

Right Click: Spit (to levelup to be able to kill different creatures)

i: open advancements and goals.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

This was my first ever game and I had no clue how to code in C# before I coded this so yea
P.S. unity crashed a total of 16 times....
My pc is crap...
oh yea about 20 minutes before I had to submit my game I realized that the HP bar was not in the top corner, but it doesn't look that bad so I decided to keep it.
Sadly I ran out of time and did not make a way to end the game so you are stuck in a bossfight with a burger with infinite hp...

entries.title: Melted into Existence

Just like the cave man, you start with nothing but sticks and stones, No knowledge on how to complete the level. Use the items to figure out your way to the end.  

[Fix.1] Hit box is fixed. Spelling errors corrected. 

[Fix.2] Fix not re spawning when you fall off map.

[Fix.3] Fixed wolves getting stuck in walls

Throw rock at log to cross gap.

knife or torch to enter cave.

You can use rocks to distract wolves

entries.title: Dr & Dr
entries.description:
![drndr.png](///raw/af5/61/z/267c5.png)

In ancient times, when dragons were still among us, an forgotten island flourished by the life of the most mystical creatures. The inhabitants lived in peace, never expecting to have to fight for survival with their closest friends. After dragons awoke, all living beings had to build their defenses, alone. 

After fifty years of war, a great meeting of the elves, dwarfs, humans, and pakas agreed upon founding the special guild of the best warriors, hunters, mages, and others - Dragontamers.

After this, dragons had been tamed, but others still felt the smell of the blood. War was not over yet. Some believed in the perceived peace that arose. They were wrong.

Now it's up to you. The destiny of The Forsaken Island is in your hands.

Game Design:
Vojtech Vanek /
Dominik Konecny /
Natalie Sodomkova /
Daniel Jenikovsky /
Lucie Polaskova /
David Holoubec

Art Design:

Dominik Konecny /

Dominik Konecny

entries.title: Grip of Despair
entries.description:
Grip of Despair is a grim rhythm fighting game about an alcoholic, who woke up and decided to change his life. Push button sequences to help Gorton beat the opponents!

I really didn't fit anything theme-related and the game is extremely raw. All I managed to finish is the UI bar which I will end up re-creating again. Still I decided to upload the game here as a reminder to set realistic goals for my next game jam and working with placeholders first instead of polishing the art.

Me (Code&Art): https://twitter.com/Khud0Steam
Lotuscvlt (Musician): https://soundcloud.com/andreywww

Short game demonstration from day 2: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nJTy6wCnUh0

If your game is as unfinished as mine or, generally, you're interested in seeing other people's experience with Ludum Dare, I think that you will like my "postmortem" video about Grip of Despair and 2 other LD entries:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zYieMNKQ8sg

Edit1: Added HTML5 build, not sure if it will run well outside of the fullscreen mode.

entries.title: We Are The N-O-T-H-I-N-G
entries.description:
Background
----------
You awaken in a strange room, confronted by a set of globes spinning around your head. You can make out some kind of glyph inside each globe, but you don't understand what it means.

You remember that your ship was crahing somewhere near the alpha quadrant, and you order everyone to evacuate. You wonder if anyone survided?

You wonder if you will find any of the survivors?

*** Disclaimer ***

More of a prototype, than a game. Still kind of fun, and something I want to explore.

Controls
--------
- w or arrow up       = up
- a or arrow left     = left
- s or arrow down     = down 
- d or arrow right    = right
- left mouse         = shoot

entries.description:

This is a game where you start out as a cube - just a cube. You must go through the map and find more weapons to kill off the enemies trying to hunt you. The objective is to get the key and save the princess. Have fun!

Spacebar - Jump

Left Mouse - Attack


Post-jam updates:

-Fixed bug where player can't always jump.

-Fixed bug where player would get attached to walls.

-Slowed down how fast the enemies hit.

-Added a pixel-perfect art element.

entries.title: 2 Shoes
entries.description:
# 2 Shoes
![2shoes.png](///raw/ee1/7/z/287f2.png)
## Tutorial
When starting a game you are presented with a **blue** and a **red** tile. The blue tile allows the platforms to reappear over time, the red tile lets you stop the dropper from destroying the tiles beneath you.

## Controls
- **A & D** - Left/Right
- **Space** - Jump

## Credits

- Dave - Programming (hc900)
- Lando - Programming (LJFMX)
- Val - Art assets (val-enc)
- Anubis (Wes) - Audio

### Leaderboards

You can view the full leaderboards here or the top 24 in-game http://landonferguson.com/scoreboard.html

### -- WebGL Note --

Leaderboards do not work for the WebGL build due to the HTTP requests being blocked by itchio.

entries.title: SlimeySlime
entries.description:
Team:

DangoGameDev https://twitter.com/DangoGameDev
LewishGameDev https://twitter.com/LewishGameDev

We wanted to enter the Ludum Dare but ended up losing a lot of time due to work, we instead decided to still try to get something out and made this from the remnants of the project that we initially started. 


The game was created in less than 18 hours and we are happy to have made it at the very least. 


Controls:

WASD - Move

Space - Dash (Dodge spikes)

Reach the end of the level and stand on the pedestal to win.

entries.title: The Adventures of Hugh Mahn Through Time
entries.description:
Intro: In a world overtaken by machines, there is but one man who will challenge the destroyer of humanity; Hugh Mahn. 

Instructions: Take control of our hero, Hugh Mahn, as he attempts to go back in time and stop the creation of the weapons of war used by the robotic overlords and face their most powerful termin… I mean assassin, Armless Arnold!

Mechanic: everytime you complete a level you will gain the ability to go back in time and remove a weapon from the robot war machines and start the conflict over. But be careful, removing the weapon from time will also remove it from your own arsenal! The only way to defeat Arnold is to strip time of every weapon made by the robots. Only once you start with nothing can you truly finish your journey and save humanity from the machine menace.

Controls: numpad 1-4 or right click cycles weapons. Each weapon has a ‘reload time’ after use, displayed on screen. Movement with ‘WASD’, look with mouse, shoot with left mouse click.

Have just fixed clone glith and web gun glitch.

entries.title: Barren
entries.description:
![game s1.png](///raw/db6/72/z/29b1f.png)

![s2.png](///raw/db6/72/z/29b20.png)

My attempt at Ludum Dare 45's theme "Start with Nothing". This is my first game jam ever, even though the game is not playable in this state as I haven't implemented a real win condition, I like the idea I had.

I wish I had time to implement more interactions between tiles. Basically the game is about a "golem" god being, that starts in an empty world with seeds in  his body. As he moves through the world, he lays down seeds for various things like water, trees or humans. In this way, he creates new life from the barren world.

I know the game is not finished at all, but I didn't want to quit, so decided to publish it and just face the bad ratings haha.
 But it was a great learning experience, and I can't wait for the next Ludum Dare!

Instructions:
The goal of the game is to develop the barren world in the same way as the overlay map is developed(toggle it with SPACE).

WATER SEED - creates river

FOREST SEED - creates forests

VILLAGE SEED - creates village or city if applied 2 times on same block

MOUNTAIN SEED - creates mountains

MOVE SEED - free move point across the map(you can move without move seeds on the stone edges of the map)


Controls:

- Space: Remove overlay for target map

- Arrow keys: Move on the board

changelog:
- fixed bug with win screen so you can progress to other 2 levels actually now
- added build for windows on itch.io

[itch.io web build]https://dkomnen.itch.io/barren

entries.title: Three Little Pigs
entries.description:
# 3 Little Pigs

We started with the theme's "Start with nothing" - we decided to make a drawing game, so we could start with a blank sheet of paper. Somewhere along the way it morphed into a game about pigs and wolves and blowing on houses, but is still a drawing game.

Instructions - draw houses! The only game mechanic is to draw houses like the example shown. A brief pause and the game scores them. The good ones become houses for piggy.

We'd like to thank Thom Fruewirth, Michael Richter, and Raivo Laanemets, who helped answer various questions.

This game was written in [SWI-Prolog](http://swi-prolog.org/) and the embedded language [CHR](https://dtai.cs.kuleuven.be/CHR/about.shtml). The front end web client is  [Snap!](https://snap.berkeley.edu/)

entries.title: LIFE IS HELL
entries.description:
![cover_500_400.png](///raw/722/f/z/260c9.png)

LIFE IS HELL is a Platformer for Ludum Dare 45.

## CONTROLS

```
ARROW UP / W     = JUMP / DOUBLE JUMP / SPAM JUMP 
ARROW LEFT / A   = RUN LEFT
ARROW RIGHT / D  = RUN RIGHT
F9               = GOD MODE & LEVEL EDITOR ON
F10              = GOD MODE & LEVEL EDITOR OFF
Q/1..9           = LEVEL EDITOR OBJECT SELECTION
```

## HOW DOES IT WORK

Jump around and try to catch blue stars to get a shield which prevents damage from lava and other traps. Explore the 5 Levels to win the game.

## FAQ

### Why no boss like in the cover?

Because we did not have enough time.

### The jump glitches...?

Yeah its the first time we developed a jump like that. We are not game developers but we tried.

### I am stuck in the wall?

Yeah its a bug. Try to jump or use god mode shortly to fix your position.

### Who made this game?

This game is made by 3 people. We do not have experience with game development and tried to start with a jump and run game and it got pretty much to do for us which got us in trouble at the end of the jam. So the game got not finished.

### What did you use to build this game?

Javascript, PhaserJS, MS Paint and some ruby scripts (ImageMagick).

entries.title: Running
entries.description:
# Running
**Running** is an attempt to convert [Speedrunners](https://store.steampowered.com/app/207140/SpeedRunners/)-esque gameplay elements into Unity. I had several aspirations for this project, most of which didn't get done ~~due to Shadowkeep coming out~~. These were:
- Making smooth movements systems that were bug-free and worked flawlessly
- Make a robust online matchmaking service with a crude server-based anti-cheat
- Have a clean aesthetic that complemented Speedrunners original art style
- Have several levels available to be played, either in Singleplayer timed modes/vs bots or online Multiplayer
- Make the input system support controllers, with extensive options menu
- Have catchy music
- Not be jank

And you know what? **I managed to meet almost none of these goals.**

Now introducing the actual features that made it into my game™:
- A movement system that almost makes sense, but lacks the depth and rigidity to make it reliable
- Not multiplayer functionality **at all**
- Not a real objective, other than to beat your own time (which isn't actually tracked by the game)
- The occasional glitch where the player-character can get stuck in the wall for no reason

But I did have fun doing this Ludum Dare. It was my first time using Unity in around nine months. As well, I got to apply math concepts that are taught in high school that you never think you'll actually use in real life (shouts-outs to the Pythagorean Theorum and SOHCAHTOA).

While I did miss the mark of what I wanted to accomplish, this Jam was by no means a waste of my time. I managed to get most of the base elements of the movement system that I wanted built, and with some further time spent on refining them, I believe I could eventually do everything I set out to do at the beginning of this Ludum Dare.

I plan to write a full overview of my process on the creation of this game sometime soon.

# Controls
- WASD to move
- Escape (in game) to exit to main menu | (in main menu) to close game
- R to reset level
- Space to jump
- Note: Does not support controller

# Images
![2019-10-07 02_29_51-LD Jam 45.png](///raw/80f/82/z/26ebe.png)

![2019-10-07 02_30_37-LD Jam 45.png](///raw/80f/82/z/26ec0.png)

entries.title: With Nothing
entries.description:
With Nothing

# [LD45: With Nothing](http://fusionbombsderp.com/ld45)

With Nothing is a 2d rpg that is inspired by the storytelling tabletop role playing game created by team member vulpineblazeyt in the theme of the LD45 challenge " Start with nothing "

Click anywhere on the opening screen to start the game.

To Move: **Arrow keys** and or the  **W A S D** keys.

To Shoot: **Left-Mouse**.

To Swing Sword: **SPACE key**.

Collecting wood for the fire is your first goal, but try to avoid specters they're dangerous. Once complete, you'll have a sword.

You woke up alone… or did you… the Nothing can give you power, but should you use it?
You could just rely on the strength within you, but who are you? You can't seem to remember…
Does the Nothing have answers?
Because all you have is Nothing...


This the first time ShellDragonGirl has taken part in a game challenge and is new to coding and game development. With Nothing will be her first published game ever!

Teammate vulpineblazeyt has already had a few LD challenges under his belt and is showing SDG the ropes.

Together we're happy to share with you With Nothing!
Please enjoy!

 Silver is harder to find than other resources, if you find and refine silver, you will get access to the rest of the parts.
